Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .
Here begin the words of Albucasim.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.
Oh, sons, since I have completed this book for you, which is the last on the science of medicine, for its completion I have achieved its end, and through its explanations and declarations, it seems to me that I should complete it for you with this treatise, which is part of the operation by hand, that is surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.
For the operation by hand is prostrate in our region and in our time totally deprived, so much so that the science of it nearly perished, and its vestiges are removed; and nothing remained of it except some small descriptions in the books of the Ancients, which changed hands and errors and hesitations befell them until its intentions are closed and its strength and art are elongated.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.
And it seems to me that I should revive it with the ordering of this treatise on it according to the way of exposition and declaration and abbreviation; and so that it may come with the forms of cautery instruments and other instruments of the work as it is by addition of the declaration, and by preparation of it, which thing is necessary.

Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.
But the reason why a good practitioner with his hand is not found in our time is because the art of medicine is long, and it is fitting for its practitioner before that to be exercised in the science of anatomy which Galen recounted until he knows the uses of the members and their forms, and their conjunction and separation; and has the knowledge of the bones, nerves and muscles, and their number, and their emergence; and of the pulsating and quiet veins, and the places of their exit.

E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.
And for this Hippocrates says that with a name it is much, but in the work little, and especially in the art of the hand.

Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.
But we have already spoken of that in the introduction of this book; for who is not knowledgeable of what we have said about anatomy, is not exempt from falling into error by which men will die, as I have seen many of those, for some are trained in this science and throw themselves into it without knowledge and without experiment.

Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.
For I saw a foolish and inexperienced doctor incise a scrofulous abscess in the neck of a woman, and he cut some arteries of the neck so that great blood flowed until the woman fell dead between his hands.

E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.
And I saw another doctor who took that he would extract a stone from a man who had advanced in his age, and the stone was large, and he came to him and extracted that stone with a piece of the bladder, for which that man on the third day died.

E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.
And I was already called to extract it, and I saw that because of the size of the stone and the disposition of the patient I knew about him that he would die.

E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.
And I saw another doctor who took a stipend from a duke of our land for surgery, and it happened to a castrated black man who had a fracture in his thigh; and the doctor prepared with his ignorance, extracted the fracture, over the wound, with pillows and splints with strong binding, and did not leave the wound to breathe.

E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.
And afterward he untied it according to his desires, and afterward he retied it, and afterward he left it for some days and ordered that we should not untie the binding; and it stayed thus until the thigh and the foot became abscessed, and it came to ruin.

E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.
And I was called to him, and I prepared to untie the binding, and tranquility was achieved and thus his pains diminished.

Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.
But however corruption was already confirmed in the limb, for which I could not restrain it, and the corruption did not cease to spread in the limb until the patient perished.

E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.
And I saw another doctor who perforated a cancerous abscess, and it was ulcerated after some days, until its malignancy was magnified with its lord.

La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.
Which thing is because the hot cancer is pure of melancholic humor, then it is not fitting that it should be approached with iron at all, unless it be on a member which could suffer to be entirely removed.

E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.
And for this, sons, it is necessary for you that the operation by hand be divided into two divisions: that is, into operations which are associated with health, and into work which is perilous in the major dispositions.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.
And I have already excited this in every place of this book in which came an operation in which there is error and fear; for which it is necessary for you to guard this and leave that, so that fools do not find a way to speak and to dishonor you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.
And thus take your weapons with solicitude and with the protection of God, and your patients with happiness and with firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.
And use the best way by the grace of God leading to health and to praiseworthy succession, and leave the terrible diseases of difficult healing, and remove your weapons from that which makes you fear, so that hesitation in your faith and in your name does not evade you: for more remains to your glory, and higher in the world and lastly to your sanctities.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:
Galen already said in some of his admonitions:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.
"Do not treat bad disease, so that you are not named bad doctors".
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.
And I have already divided this book according to three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.
The division of the book begins, and first of the first part.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.
The first chapter ordered from the head to the feet, on the forms of instruments and on the iron tools of cauteries, and on that which is necessary in the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.
The division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.
The second chapter, on cutting and perforation, and on cupping glasses, and on wounds, and on extraction of arrows and similar to those, all chaptered and ordered on the forms of instruments.

Divisio de la tersa partida.
Division of the third part.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.
The third chapter, on restoration and dislocation, and on curing of torsion and similar to those; chapter ordered from head to feet, and on the forms of instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.
On cautery with fire and with sharp medicine and remembrance of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.
With that begins the treatise of the whole book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.
It is fitting that I say the quality of the benefits of that cautery and of its harms, and in which complexion cautery is prohibited.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.
Thus I say that the discourse on the quality of the benefit of cautery and of its harm is a long and prolix discourse, and subtle by science, and hidden secret; and already a great multitude of wise men have spoken of it, and they have disagreed about it, and for me a little of their discourses suffices, fearing prolongation.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia.
And thus I say that cautery confers to every complexion universally which is with matter or without matter, except two complexions, which are hot complexions without matter.

En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.
In the hot and dry complexion with matter they disagreed; for some said that cautery is beneficial to it, and others said the contrary of that, that cautery is not suitable in disease which is by quality and by dryness, for the nature of fire is quality and dryness, and it is unsuitable that hot and dry disease be healed with that which is hot and dry.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.
And he said who says the contrary of that, that by cautery benefit is made in every hot and dry disease that comes in the bodies of men, for when you compare the body of man and its humidities to the complexion of fire, you find the body of man cold.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.
And I say by the discourse of that, that experiment has already sometimes revealed this to me.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.
But however it is not fitting that he come upon this who is already proven and exercised in the chapter of cautery by last exercise, and has known the diversity of the complexion of men and the disposition of diseases in themselves, and their causes, and their accidents, and the space of time of those.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.
But in the other complexions, there is no fear upon you, and especially in cold and humid diseases, for already all the doctors have agreed upon those, and they have not disagreed on the benefit with cautery in those.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.
And know, sons, that of the secret of curing by cautery with fire and of its goodness, this is above cautery with burning medicine, because the fire is simple, the action of which does not reach except to the member which is cauterized and does not harm another member joined with it except with little harm.

Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.
But the action of burning medicine reaches to that in the members which are distant from it, and very easily brings disease of difficult healing to the member and very easily kills.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.
But fire, by its sublimity and the goodness of its substance, does not do this except that it is superfluous. And it is already known to us by experiment and by length of service of study with the art on the truth of things; and for this I am excused from the length of the discourse. And if it were not that it is not allowed in my book in this I would set down for you a hidden secret with fire, and the quality of its operation in bodies and of its expulsion by which it expels diseases, with demonstrative philosophical discourse, which would be sharpened in your thoughts.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.
And know, sons, that they disagree about the time in which it is suitable to do cautery and they set the best time as spring.

E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.
And I say that cautery is suitable at all times, because the harm by accidental time is submerged in the benefit of that which is attracted by the cautery, and especially if the cautery is for pains or for necessary, strong and fistulous pains, which do not suffer delay because it is feared that malice may come from them, which is greater than the little harm entering through time.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.
And this does not fall in your thoughts, oh sons, this is not estimated except by the vulgar people and foolish doctors, that is that for that disease which is healed by cautery there is not always a return, and they set that consequence.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.
And the cause is not at all as they think for this, because cautery is nothing but in place of medicine which alters the complexion and dries the humidities which are the cause for which the pains come.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.
But however cautery surpasses medicine by the velocity of its validity and virtue of its operation and greatness of its lord.

E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.
And it is possible that his disease returns at some time, according to the complexion of the patient and the location of his disease, and his strength, and that which is prepared in his body from the aggregation of superfluities in him, and that which has come to him in his acquisition in foods and similar things; unless the disease in which cautery is administered is a subtle disease in a member of few superfluities and humidities, such as cautery of tooth for pain and similar to that, it is possible that in him that pain does not return, but this happens in small cases.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.
And more vulgar discourse is that cautery is the last remedy of medicine, and it is righteous discourse, not to that which they understand in it, for they believe that there is no cure that profits with medicine nor with other thing after cautery.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.
And the cause is contrary to that; and the intention that cautery is the last remedy of medicine is only when we administer the manners of cure in some diseases, and those medicines do not confer, and afterward at the end of the matter one administers cautery, and it profits to that.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.
And then from here it falls that cautery is the last remedy of medicine, not according to the intention which the vulgar and many of the foolish doctors understand.

E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.
And the ancients said that cautery with gold is better than cautery with iron, and they said this only because of the equality of gold and the sublimity of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.
And they said that the place of cautery does not make pus, though this is not absolutely true, for I have already proved this and have found that it does not do this except in some bodies without the others, and cautery with that is good and better than with iron as they said; but however when you make cautery with fire with gold, it is not declared to you, for it is ignited according to the quantity that you want by the redness of the gold, and because it prepares to receive cold; and if you add ignition over it, the gold melts by the fire, and some sheets fall in the fire by which the artificer falls by the occupation of that.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.
And for this, cautery is made with iron by us more easily and more proximately to rectitude of operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.
And I have already ordered this chapter on cautery according to chapters, and have ordered those from the head to the feet, so that they lighten the one demanding that which he wants from it.

De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.
On cautery for head pain due to coldness and humidity.
Le capitol primier.
The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.
This cauterization confers to the humidity and coldness over the brain, accident of which are two causes, that is cause of headache and multitude of rheumatic flux, called coryza, flowing from the head to the parts of the eyes and ears, and multitude of sleeping, and of tooth pain and of the throat, and universally of all disease that comes by coldness, such as paralysis, stupor and apoplexy, and similar to those diseases.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.
The form of this cauterization is this, that firstly you command the patient to be evacuated with laxative medicine cleansing the head, for three or four nights, according to what the strength of the patient and his age and his custom require.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.
And afterward command him to shave his head with a razor, and afterward make him sit between your hands on a square bench and that he place his hands on his chest.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.
And afterward place the root of your palm near the pulse over the root of the nose between his eyes.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:
But however, when your middle finger has reached, mark that place with ink, and afterward ignite the olive-shaped cautery of which this is the form:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.
And afterward place that over the place marked with ink, in a manner that descends, with which your hand should be constrained little by little, and you revolve that.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.
And afterward lift your hand lightly and look at the place, and if you see already some quantity of the bone of the head to be uncovered, like the quantity of a grain of vetch, then raise your hand, and if not return your hand with that iron, with another of that, if it is cooled, until that which I have said to you is seen of the bone.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.
And afterward take a little salt and dissolve it over the place and leave it for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.
And afterward place cotton soaked in butter over it and leave that over it until the scab from the fire is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.
And afterward treat the place with tetrapharmacon ointment until it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.
And they already said that when the wound remains open, the better it expels the pus, which is better and more helpful.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.
And some of them said that the skin should be cauterized down to the bone, and the cautery should be held until some part of the bone's surface is burned.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.
And afterwards, what is burned of the bone should be scraped, and then it should be cured.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:
And others said that with the cautery one should reach to the back, until it makes a strong impression on the bone until the bone falls, and this is the form of small alphecati:
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.
And they estimate that vapors from the head expire from that place.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.
And the wound should be kept open for a long time, and afterwards it should be cured until it is consolidated.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.
But I have not seen these two types of cautery at all, except in some men by way of fear; and leave that, in my opinion, it is better with health, when it is; because the head is weakened by the solution of continuity of it as we have testified in other members, and especially when the patient's head is of weak nature.

E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.
And the first type of cautery is safer and better in my opinion; and I use that and work with it safely.

Capitol segon.
Second Chapter.
Del cauteri del cap.
On the cautery of the head.

Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.
When chronic and long-lasting pain occurs in the whole head and this is prolonged in the patient, and he uses jars and beds and head purges and plasters and cats and puppies and hens and similar things, and especially if he has already been cauterized with a cautery which we recount and none of these things benefit him, then consider that if the patient's head is of strong creation in its nature; and it is not weak and finds very great cold, then cauterize that with another cautery below that one a little.

E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.
And afterwards cauterize that over the horn of his head with cautery until the skin is separated.

Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.
Cut the skin and let it be uncovered from the bone the quantity which we have recounted and cauterize that with a cautery in the back part of the head in the place which is called vas, — and that is the place where a cupping glass is placed.

Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.
And ease your hand in this, and do not uncover the bone, because the patient finds very great pain different from the pain of all the other cauteries of the head.

E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.
And I will say this cautery in its place, because it is appropriate that the cautery with which the horns of the head and the occiput are cauterized is a more subtle cautery than that with which the middle place of the head is cauterized; and this is the form of it.

Capitol ters.
Third Chapter.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.
On cauterization of non-chronic migraine.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.
When sudden pain occurs in part of the head, or pain extends to the eye, evacuate the head with purifying medicines, and administer the other cure, which I have described in the division of illnesses; and if all doesn't help, then cauterization is done in two ways: either cauterization with acute burning medicine, or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.
But cautery with burning medicine is that you take a clove of garlic, peel it and cut off its ends on both sides.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.
And then cut the painful area in the temple with a wide lancet until a space is made under the skin, until it is hidden.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.
And then tighten it with a stopper for proper constriction, and leave it for the space of three hours; and then untie it and remove the garlic, and leave the wound for two or three days, and then place cotton soaked in butter until the area forms pus.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.
And then treat it with ointment until it is healed.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.
And if you wish, do this with some burning medicines which I have written about in the twelfth treatise on burning medicines.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:
But cauterization with iron is done in this manner: heat for cautery which has this form:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.
and it is called nail-keys, because its head is in the form of a nail in which there is some curvature, and in the middle of it is a small protrusion.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.
And then place it on the painful area, and hold your hand — so that the artery which is below is not burned — and turn the iron little by little with speed.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.
And if the quantity that is burned through the thickness of the skin is about half of it, raise your hand so that the artery which is below is not burned, so that there is no flow of blood.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.
And then soak cotton in salt water and place it on the area, and leave it for three days; and then place cotton moistened with butter, and then treat with ointment until it is healed.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.
And if you wish, cauterize with the end of the knife-like second cautery, and guard against cutting the artery in this properly non-chronic migraine.

Capitol quart.
Chapter four.

De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.
On cauterization of chronic migraine.

Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.
When you treat migraine with what we have said about the preceding cure, and what we have said in the divisions of diseases, and the cure is not effective, and you see that the disease is not alleviated by what we have said about the first cautery with medicine or cautery with fire, then it is necessary that you heat the knife cautery until it becomes white-hot, then mark the location of the pain with a line half the length of a finger, or thereabouts; and place your hand once and press it until you cut the artery and reach the bone.

Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s'endevengua espasme.
However, it is necessary for you to be careful of the continuation of the jaw, which moves during chewing, and that the muscle is not burned and the nerve which moves it, and that spasm does not occur.

E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.
And if it is about the protection and caution of blood flow from the artery that is cut, because in cutting it there is fear, especially for one who ignores what he does and is not studious and experienced; and leave the operation at the beginning.

E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.
And I will come with a reminder of the management of accidental blood flow from the artery according to its manner, in its place in this book.

E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.
And if you see that this cautery is not sufficient for this disease and you see the patient's body can tolerate it, cauterize it in the middle of the head as we have recounted, and treat the wound until it is healed.

E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.
And if you wish, administer the cautery which we have mentioned in the chapter on constriction of artery with cautery having two knives, and this cauterization is better and more conferring.

Capitol .v.
Chapter 5.

De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.
On cauterization of ear pains.

Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:
When pain comes to the ear from cold and is treated with laxative things and with the other cure which I have said in the division, and the pain is not removed, then heat the cautery, and this is the one which is called "puncta", of which this is the form:

E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.
And after puncturing after the heating, and let it be moved around the entire ear as a wheel is turned, or in the circuit of each together if the pain is in each.

Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.
Extend yourself with the cautery from the root of the ear little by little after you have marked the place with a probe.

E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.
And if the cautery of ten points in the whole ear, and almost that, and afterwards treat the places until they are healed.

Capitol .vi.
Chapter 6

De cauterizacio de turtura.
On the cauterization of torticollis (or facial paralysis).

Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.
Torticollis which is cured by cauterization is only of the types which come from phlegm, as we have said in the divisions of diseases.

Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.
Avoid cauterization of the type that occurs due to dryness or spasm of the nerve.

Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.
When you treat that type of torticollis with jars, head purgatives, and gargles, and your treatment doesn't work, then you should cauterize the patient with three cauterizations: one at the root of the ear, the second a little below the temple, and the third at the junction of the two lips.

E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.
And place your cautery on the opposite side of the sick part, because softening only comes in the part that appears healthy.

E la forma de cauterizacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.
And the form of cauterization is that you cauterize with the cautery at the right of the highest extremity of the ear a little above the corner of the head, and another at the temple, the length of which should be according to the length of the thumb, and apply your hand with the cautery until half the thickness of the skin is burned.

E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.
And this is the form of the cautery, and it is a type of knife-like instrument, the form of which is set before.

Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.
But it is more subtle than that, a little like you see; and it should be a knife in place of excessive thickness a little.

E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.
And afterwards, treat the place with what has been prescribed before until it is healed.

Capitol .vii.
Chapter 7

De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.
On the cauterization of chronic apoplexy.

Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.
When apoplexy is chronic and you treat it with what we have said and your medication doesn't work and the patient doesn't have a fever, then cauterize him with four cauterizations: above all the corners of his head; and with a cautery in the middle of the head, as we have said; and with a cautery at the nape of the neck.

E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.
And the manner of cauterization is done as said above.

E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.
And it is already cauterized above the mouth of the stomach; and it is more behind; and afterwards it should be treated with what follows.

Capitol .viii.
Chapter 8.
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.
On cauterization for forgetfulness caused by phlegm.

 Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.
It is appropriate to give the patient at the beginning large pills that purify the brain.

E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.
And afterwards shave the patient's entire head and place on the back of their head a plaster of cedar described in the treatise on plasters.

E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.
And apply that several times, for that is a manner of cautery.

E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.
And do this according to the same order which I have already mentioned.

E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.
And then if by these he is healed it is good; and if not, then make three cauterizations on the rear part of his head, which should descend from the highest part of the head to the lowest part of the neck.

E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.
And place between each cautery the thickness of a finger, and afterwards treat the cautery with what has proceeded.

Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.
But if you want addition and the patient can tolerate it, then make a cautery in the middle place; and if you want more addition, then cauterize above the two horns.

Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.
Afterwards treat that until it is healed; and let the cautery be olive-shaped according to the form given before.

Capitol .ix.
Chapter 9.
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.
On cauterization for paralysis and softening of the whole body.

Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.
It is appropriate that you proceed in purifying the head with pills and with what we have said; and afterwards shave the patient's head, and afterwards cauterize it with cautery in the middle of the head, and with cautery above all the horns of the head, and with cautery on the rear part of it, and with three cauteries on the vertebrae of the neck.

E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.
And if it is necessary in the illness of softening of the body of many and the patients tolerating and the illness is strong, then cauterize with four cauteries on the vertebrae of the back, and lastly with cautery until much of the skin is burned, and lift your hand.

E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.
And afterwards treat that until it is healed, and this should be an olive-shaped cautery.

Capitol .x.
Chapter 10.
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.
On cauterization for epilepsy.

No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.
The epileptic is not cauterized unless that epilepsy is due to phlegm.

E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.
And so it is appropriate that you purify his brain at the beginning with pills and with the other treatment which we have mentioned in the division when the patient is large and is tolerating the administration of medicines.

E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.
And if it is a child who does not suffer the medicines, then administer gargles and chewing substances that purify the brain, before this for many days, with improvement of the foods.

E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.
And afterwards shave the patient's head, and afterwards cauterize it with one cautery in the middle of the head according to the preceding manner, and with another cautery on the back of his head, and cauterize above each horn of his head.

E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.
And if the patient is strong and is tolerating, then cauterize with the cauteries which I have mentioned, in having paralysis and softening of the body on the vertebrae of the neck and the vertebrae of the back.

E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.
And let the cautery be olive-shaped as preceded.

Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.
But if the patient is a child, then place a subtle cautery according to this manner.

Capitol .xi.
Chapter 11

De cauterizacio de melencolia.
On the cauterization of melancholy.

Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.
When the causes of melancholy are corrupt humors and thick phlegm, then cauterize it with the cautery we mentioned for paralysis.

E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.
And if the cause of melancholy is an excess tending towards melancholy, and the patient's body is humid, then give to drink that which purifies the brain according to what was previously mentioned in the division.

E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.
And then shave the patient's head, and then make a proper circular bandage of linen, and then place it in the middle of the head.

E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.
And the patient should be seated squarely, and be held from all sides.

E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.
And then apply a liniment; and it is best made of old sheep's butter.

E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.
And heat it over the fire for moderate warming, which the aforementioned can tolerate when it is applied to him.

E aprop vuo' aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.
And then pour it in the middle of his head in the circle, and leave it until it has cooled.

E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.
And do this with the patient once every week, with the other good regimen until he is healed; or if you wish, cauterize him making small points according to his condition, unless you hold the hand with a cautery ordered thus: this is a type of cautery which moistens the brain equally.

E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.
And then place cotton soaked in butter or chicken fat.

Capitol .xii.
Chapter 12

De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.
On the cauterization of water descending in the eye.

Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.
When the beginning of water in the eye is declared to you by the signs which I have mentioned in the division, then begin and give the patient to drink that which purifies his head, and protect it from all humidities.

E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.
And make him sweat in a bath for some days.

E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.
And then command him to shave his head, and cauterize it with a cautery in the middle of the head; and then cauterize it with two cauteries over the two temples if it is the beginning of water coming out in both eyes, or on one side if it is the beginning of water in one eye.

Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.
Cut with cautery all the veins and arteries which are under the skin; and let the cauteries be far in the width of the temples.

E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.
And guard against blood flow when it is cauterized; and if you see blood flow from it, stop it with some medicine, which is possible for you.

E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.
And I will come with wisdom which is in the extraction of arteries and with the cutting of those and caution of blood flow.

E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.
And sometimes it is cauterized in the neck under two bones with two cauteries produced at the back.

Capitol .xiii.
Chapter 13

De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.
On cauterization of chronic tears.

Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.
When tears from the eyes are chronic and persistent, and through the veins and arteries which are in the visible part of the head outside, and it is verified that this is cold phlegmatic superfluity, then cauterize it with the cautery which we have described in the chapter on the beginning of water falling in the eyes, and with cautery in the middle of the head and with two cauteries on the neck below the two temples, and with two cauteries on the neck below two bones.

E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.
And if you need additional treatment, then cauterize it on all sides of the corner of the eye above the extremity of the eyebrow with a small cautery.

Capitol .xiiii.
Chapter 14

De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.
On cauterization for foul smell of the nose.

Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.
When you treat it with what we have said in the division and your medication does not help, then prepare and give the patient the cochias to drink for three nights; and after shaving his head, cauterize it with a medium cautery with an olive-shaped cautery.

E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.
And after, cauterize it with a nail-shaped cautery with two cauteries above the two eyebrows below the hair a little.

E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.
And be careful of the artery that you do not cut it.

E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.
And this is the form of the nail-shaped cautery.

Capitol .xv.
Chapter 15

De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.
On cautery for softening of the eyelids.

Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:
When the eyelid is softened by illness or humidity, then cauterize that eyelid with a cautery with this lunar cautery; and this is its form:

E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.
And if you wish, cauterize it above the two eyebrows a little with two cauteries in each part, and let them be distant from the temples.

E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.
And let the length of each cautery be according to the size of the eyebrow.

E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.
And do not press your hand too much with the cautery, but according to the amount that a third part of the eyelid is burned.

Capitol .xvi.
Chapter 16

De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.
On cautery of the eyelid when the hairs are turned inward and prick the eye.

Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.
When the eyelashes are turned inward so that they prick the eye, cautery on them is done in two ways, for cautery is either with iron or with burning medicine.

Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.
If with cautery of it with fire, command the patient before this to leave his hairs as those which clean them, until they are lengthened and evened; and if they prick him towards their growth, then you tighten his eyes with a band so that it is not moved until the hairs have grown.

Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.
Then when they will have grown and evened, then place the patient's head in your lap, and after mark on his eyelid with ink, with a mark which is in the shape of a myrtle leaf, and let the beginning of the mark be near the hairs.

E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.
And after, place cotton soaked in egg white or in mucilage of psyllium on the eye.

E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:
And after, heat the cautery of which this is its form:

E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.
And then cauterize over the figure which you have marked, little by little, many times, until the surface of the skin is burned, which is like a myrtle leaf, all appearing properly.

E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.
And a sign of the health of your work is that you see the eyelid of the eye already contracted and the hairs of it raised towards the puncture of the eye.

E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.
And then raise your hand and leave it for three days, and afterwards place cotton with butter on it until the scab is removed.

E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.
And afterwards treat it with ointment until it is healed.

Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.
But if something returns through the hairs after their growth and the eyelid is softened, then do the cautery again over all of it just as you had done at first.

Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.
But if the hairs are on the lower eyelid, then cauterize it until it is raised to its natural place and is evened out and so that the hairs do not prick the eye.

Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.
But the cautery with burning medicine is this: that you command the patient to leave the hairs until they are prolonged and evened out, and afterwards make the shape of a myrtle leaf from a piece of cloth.

E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. i, o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.
And then take known soap and quicklime, one ounce each, or thereabouts, and then mix these things well, and do this quickly so that it does not cool; and then spread this over the paper which is made in the shape of a myrtle leaf, and place it over one eye or both; and place cotton soaked in egg white under the eye, and let the patient's head be in your lap.

E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.
And place your finger on the medicine and press it a little and do not move it until the patient feels the burning of the medicine, for the burning is in it like fire.

E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.
And so when he perceives that burning sensation, then leave the medicine and move it with your finger; so when the burning stops, then remove the medicine and wash the eye with water; and then consider if you see the eyelid is already raised as it is washed from the constriction with fire or with incision, for then it is good; and if not, return some of the medicine to the place where the medicine has not impressed and does not darken until your operation is evened out and the eye is contracted.

E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.
And afterwards place cotton with butter on it until the skin of the burn is removed, and afterwards treat it with deafinicon ointment or with another until it is healed.

E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.
And it is necessary for you, you must in your operation guard with vigilant diligence that nothing of the medicine falls into the eye, and if the eyelid after some days is softened and something of the hairs pricks the eye, then repeat your medicine on that place of the eyelid which is softened, and properly as you did at the beginning, and afterwards surround it until it is healed.

E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.
And this is the shape of a myrtle leaf.

E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.
And know that the eyes of men are diversified according to their size and smallness, and so according to this your contraction is made.

E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.
And the way of rectitude will not be hidden from the one who studies this art.

Capitol .xvii.
Chapter 17.

De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.
On cauterization of a fistula that is in the tear duct of the eye.

Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.
When you treat a fistula with what we have said in the divisions of diseases and your treatment doesn't work, then it is appropriate that you cauterize it in this manner: command the patient to rest their head on your lap, and have some assistant hold their head between your hands in such a way that it is not moved or shaken with their head.

E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.
And then place cotton soaked in egg white or in psyllium mucilage over their eye.

E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:
And then heat the cautery which has this form:

le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.
Which should be concave, like the shape of a cane or a vulture's feather, from one end with which the cautery is made.

E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.
And if you want, it should be penetrating up to the other end.

E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.
And if you want it to be solid like a probe.

Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.
But however, the one that is concave is better for your work.

E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.
And then press the fistula if it is open, and draw out the pus and dry it.

E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.
And if it is not open, then open it and extract the corruption from it.

E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.
And then place the cautery over it which should be well heated, and hold your hand a little towards the cautery of the eye to the part of the nose, so that your hand does not err or the patient is not disturbed, and then place the cautery in the corner of the eye and destroy it.

E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.
And so if at the beginning of your cautery it reaches to the bone, it is good; and if not, then repeat the cautery once or twice, if necessary; and leave it like this for three days, and then place cotton with butter over it and around it with drying ointment until it is healed.

Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.
But if eleven days have passed and it is not healed, then place sharp corrosive medicine over it until the bone is uncovered and is scraped according to what is appropriate in its chapter.

E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaem subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.
And there is another manner of cautery for fistula which some first said: attend to the place of the fistula and split it and then place in that fissure subtle chamomile of which this is the form: And melt in it the quantity of 1 ounce of melted lead; and hold your hand with the chamomile with good retention, and the patient should not be moved so that the melted lead does not reach their eye; and it is appropriate that you place over the patient's eye cotton soaked in egg white or in water, because lead hardens the place of the fistula and heals it by marvelous healing.

E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.
And if the fistula is healed with what we have said of the cautery and the treatment, it is good; and if not, then it is necessary to administer a hole in the nose and reduce the fistula to the course of the nose according to what will come in its proper place.

Capitol .xviii.
Chapter 18

De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.
On cauterization of lip fissures.

Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.
Many times fissures occur on the lips, especially on the lips of children.

Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s'ensiec:
So when you treat these fissures with what we have said in the divisions and your treatment doesn't work, then heat the small knife-like cautery according to this form that follows:

E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.
And let its concavity be according to the fineness of the blade.

Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.
Then place that heated instrument quickly in those fissures until the cautery reaches the depth of the fissures.

E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.
And then treat it with salves until it is healed.

Capitol .xix.
Chapter 19

De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.
On cauterization of fistula in the mouth.

Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.
When an abscess occurs at the root of the uvula or in the palate or at the roots of the teeth and then forms pus, and then breaks, and then becomes chronic, and pus runs and a fistula is formed, and then you treat it and it doesn't heal, then it's necessary that you heat a cautery according to the size that can be received in the fistula, and then put that heated instrument in the opening of the fistula, and hold your hand until the heated iron reaches its depth, doing this once or twice at the end; and then treat it with what we have said about the cure until it is healed.

E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.
And so if the infection is cut off and it is healed, it is good; and if not, then it is necessary to uncover the place and remove the corrupted bone according to what will come in its chapter.

Capitol .xx.
Chapter 20

De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.
On cauterization of the teeth and softening of the gums.

Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.
When the gums are softened by moisture and the teeth are loose, and you treat them with medicines and it doesn't help, then place the patient's head in your lap, and then heat the cautery whose form will come after this, so that you place the cannula over the tooth and introduce into it the heated cautery quickly, and hold your hand a little until the patient feels the heat of the fire has reached the root of the tooth.

E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.
And then lift your hand, and then repeat the cautery several times as you wish.

E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.
And then the patient should fill their mouth with salt water and hold it for an hour, and then spit it out, because the loose tooth is secured and the softened gum is tightened and the corrupted moisture is dried out.

Capitol .xxi.
Chapter 21.

De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.
On cauterization for tooth pain.

Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.
When tooth pain is due to coldness, or there is cold or worm in it, or treatment with medicine doesn't work, then cauterization is done in two ways: either cauterization with cow dung, or cauterization with fire.

Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.
Cauterization with dung is when you take cow dung and boil it in an iron spoon, then take cotton and wrap it around the end of a probe, then dip it in the boiled dung, and place it quickly on the painful tooth until it cools.

E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.
And then repeat this several times until the power of the heat reaches the root of the tooth.

E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.
And if you wish, submerge wool or cotton in the aforementioned dung, and place it on the aching tooth, and place a heated iron on it until the iron reaches the depth of the tooth's cavity.

Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.
But cauterization with fire is when you use a tube of copper or iron, and there should be some thickness in its core so that the intensity of the fire doesn't reach the patient's mouth.

E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.
And then heat the cautery, the shape of which will come, and place it on the tooth and hold it with your hand until the cautery cools; and do this several times because the pain will be removed either that day or the next.

E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.
And it's appropriate that after the application of this cautery, the patient fills their mouth with good butter and holds it for an hour and then spits it out; and this is the form of the cautery.

E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.
And cauterize with whichever end you wish, as is possible for you.

E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:
And this is the shape of the tube:

Capitol .xxii.
Chapter 22.

De cauterizacio de extrophulos.
On cauterization of scrofula.

Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.
When scrofula is from phlegm and cold humors and doesn't respond to digestion by medicines and you want to digest them easily, then you heat the concave cautery, the shape of which is as follows, having two open ends so that the smoke escapes from the cautery through the other end, and place it heated on that abscess once, and again if you need to, until it reaches the depth of the abscess.

E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.
And if the abscess is small, then place the cautery according to the size of the abscess, and afterwards leave it for three days and place cotton soaked in butter on it until what the fire has burned is removed.

E aprop cura aquel am enguent e tentas e draps entro que sia sanat.
