Therefore I ingeniously had and cauterized its throat, so it stopped from addition; and then I walked around and did not know what God did with that after me.

Capitol .xxxvii.
Chapter 37.

De inscizio de huvela quan es apostemada.
On cutting the uvula when it is swollen.

Quan catarr deysen a la huvula, e es apostemada e es longa, lahoras ela es nompnada perpendicular; e si es en la partida dejos grossa e redonda, e lahoras ela es apelada buba.
When catarrh descends to the uvula, and it is swollen and long, then it is called perpendicular; and if it is thick and round in the lower part, then it is called a bubble.

Mays quan es curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio, e no comfereys la tua curacio, e eyssament ja vezes que apostema caut ja es ostat de lu e es subtil, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquela que es agreguadas redonda; e si es ad aquela longitut, e es sanguina, de fusca color o de negre, e no es a lu centiment, lahoras cove que tu temtes la inscizio de lu, quar en aquela es temor sobre le malaute.
But when it is cured with what we have said in the division, and your cure does not work, and likewise you already see that the hot swelling has already been removed from it and it is subtle, then it is appropriate that you cut that which is gathered round; and if it has that length, and is bloody, of dark color or black, and has no feeling, then it is appropriate that you attempt to cut it, because in that there is fear for the patient.

E quan tu vezes aquela segon la manieyra que yeu he dita de la sua blancor e longuesa, que tu fassas sezer le malaute e premas la lengua de lu am instrument del qual procesic la sua forma e aprop fica le onci en la nuva, e tira aquela en jos e inscideys aquela am un de dos instrumentz les quals e ditz en la inscizio de dos mellas.
And when you see that according to the manner that I have said of its whiteness and length, that you make the patient sit and press his tongue with an instrument whose form proceeded and then stick the nail in the uvula, and pull it down and cut it with one of two instruments which are mentioned in the cutting of two tonsils.

E cove que no inscidas aquela sino aquo que es ajustat sobre le terme natural ses addicio, quar si tu inscides de lu mays, lediyras le sieu parlar.
And it is appropriate that you do not cut it except what is added above the natural term without addition, because if you cut more of it, you will harm his speech.

E aprop la inscizio, usa de aquo le qual havem recomtat en la inscizio de dos mellas, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.
And after the cutting, use what we have recounted in the cutting of two tonsils, and cure it until it is healed.

Mays si era le malaute espaventat per la inscizio de lu, cove que use de engen en la cauterizacio de lu ses temor, e la manieyra del cauteri en lu no es sino am aygua aguda, e es que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop prem la lengua de lu am le instrument le qual havem dit, e aprop pren de l’aygua la qual havem dita en le capitol de cauterizacio, e comfeys am aquela caus viva, e pausa aquela no spessa ni subtil, e de aquela omple la concavitat de l’estrument del qual aquesta es la forma:
But if the patient was frightened by cutting it, it is appropriate to use ingenuity in cauterizing it without fear, and the manner of cautery in it is only with sharp water, and it is that you place the head of the patient in your lap, and then press his tongue with the instrument which we have mentioned, and then take the water which we have mentioned in the chapter on cauterization, and mix quicklime with it, and place it neither thick nor thin, and fill with it the concavity of the instrument of which this is the form:

Sia la extramitat de lu conquavitat en la qual sia pausada la medicina ayssi cum la conquavitat de culher de ray, e pausa le strument am la medicina sobre la vula, e·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu latz per so que corro saliva o musellage de la boca de aquel per la intrinscequa medicina, per so que no deyssenda de aquela deguna causa sobre le golayro de lu e que ledesca aquel.
Let the extremity of it be a concavity in which the medicine is placed just as the concavity of a ray spoon, and place the instrument with the medicine on the uvula, and the patient lies on his side so that saliva or mucus runs from his mouth through the intrinsic medicine, so that nothing of it descends on his throat and harms it.

E aprop te la tua ma am la medicina, e exprem aquela sobre la uvula per l’espazi de miega hora entro que vegas aquela esser denegrada e sedada per la mordicacio de la medicina.
And then hold your hand with the medicine, and press it on the uvula for the space of half an hour until you see it become blackened and sedated by the biting of the medicine.

E si vols, prengues coto e envolopes aquel sobre la extremitat del ray, e submergeys le coto en la medicina, e entrometas le ray am le coto en una canula de sobre entro que·l coto adheresca en aquela canula, e fay aquo tantas vetz entro que consiegues aquo que vols de la cauterizacio de la uva, e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela se seccara e cayra aprop tres dias o quatre.
And if you want, take cotton and wrap it on the extremity of the ray, and submerge the cotton in the medicine, and introduce the ray with the cotton in a cannula from above until the cotton adheres in that cannula, and do this so many times until you achieve what you want of the cauterization of the uvula, and then leave it because it will dry and fall after three or four days.

E si indigeysses que iteras la medicina, itera aquela, e aprop la cauterizacio abstergeys en le circuit de la uva am coto enbegut en boder, e mondifica am aquel aquo que es en le circuit de lu de la medicina, e sia lavat am aygua frega, e sia curat deforo am embrocacio, e dedintz am guarguarismes entro que sia sanat.
And if you need to repeat the medicine, repeat it, and after the cauterization wipe around the uvula with cotton soaked in butter, and clean with it what is around it of the medicine, and let it be washed with cold water, and let it be cured outside with embrocation, and inside with gargles until it is healed.

E aquesta especia de curacio es pus salva que inscizio e pus long de temor.
And this kind of cure is safer than cutting and further from fear.

Alcunas veguadas es curada la uvuola am aquo que es pus subtil que cauteri e inscizio, quar es curat am subfumigacio en aquesta manieyra: recipe calament, ysop, origua, ruda, scicados arabic, camamilla, broyda e semblant ad aquels de las erbas, e ajusta totas aquelas causas, o alcunas de lor, en una ola, e sian submergidas am vi agre, e bulhan; e la ola sia be lutada am lut decentment, e sia en le mieg loc de la ola un trauc, sobre le qual sia pausat un instrument conquau de aram segon aquesta manieyra; sia fayt de argent o de aram.
Sometimes the uvula is cured with something more subtle than cautery and incision, for it is cured with fumigation in this manner: take calament, hyssop, origanum, rue, Arabic sticados, chamomile, bruised and similar to those herbs, and add all these things, or some of them, in a pot, and let them be submerged in vinegar, and boil; and let the pot be well sealed with proper luting, and let there be in the middle of the pot a hole, over which is placed a concave instrument of copper in this manner; let it be made of silver or copper.

E sia entromesa la extremitat en la boca del malaute entro que la vapor poge a la uvula sobre la quanula, entro que la uvula sia mot ofuscada.
And let the extremity be introduced into the mouth of the patient until the vapor rises to the uvula over the cannula, until the uvula is very darkened.

E aprop itera sobre aquela motas veguadas entro qu’es secca, e guarda te que no fassas aquesta curacio al comesament de l’aveniment de apostemas, quar trop ajustaria en le apostema, e no cove que tu fassas aquo, sino deves la declaracio de apostema de lu caut.
And afterwards repeat over it many times until it is dry, and be careful not to do this cure at the beginning of the appearance of abscesses, for it would add too much to the abscess, and it is not appropriate for you to do this, except towards the declaration of the abscess of heat.

Mays si no es a tu present aquest instrument, lahoras pren una cana e compon en la extramitat de lu un clos de huou, per so que la boca del malaute sia comborida, quar le closc del huou prohibeys la vapor comburir la boca.
But if this instrument is not present to you, then take a cane and compose at its extremity an eggshell, so that the mouth of the patient is not burned, for the eggshell prevents the vapor from burning the mouth.

E aquesta curacio es bona am salut.
And this cure is good with health.

Capitol .xxxviii.
Chapter 38.

De extraccio d’espinas e de aquo que adhereys en le golayro e de las autras causas.
Of extraction of thorns and of that which adheres in the throat and of other things.

Motas veguadas adhereys en le guolayro o spina de peys o alcuna autra causa.
Many times there adheres in the throat either a fish bone or some other thing.

Adonc cove que tu extraguas aquo que de aquels es apparent, sobre le qual catz la vista, pus que tu premes la lengua am instrument denant solelh, per so que a tu sia declarat aquo que es en la guola.
Then it is appropriate that you extract that which of those is apparent, upon which falls the sight, after you press the tongue with an instrument before the sun, so that to you is declared that which is in the throat.

E aquo que no apar e es a tu occultat en le guolayro, cove que tu fassas vomir le malaute denant que la vianda sia degerida en l’estomac, quar fort leu la causa annexsa le golayro sira foro-getada per vomit; o que deglusia le malaute una pessa de nap o de razit de laytuga o un boci de pa sec; o prengua una pessa de sponga marina sequa leon, e lia aquela fortment am fiel, e aprop le malaute transglussia aquela, quar cum perve al loc en le qual so spinas e es extrahuda, lahoras so foro-getatz.
And that which does not appear and is hidden to you in the throat, it is appropriate that you make the patient vomit before the food is digested in the stomach, for very easily the thing attached to the throat will be thrown out by vomit; or let the patient swallow a piece of turnip or lettuce root or a piece of dry bread; or take a piece of dry sea sponge, and tie it strongly with thread, and afterwards let the patient swallow it, for when it reaches the place where the thorns are, it is extracted, then they are thrown out.

E mays pren una anguila e be am fiel liada, e sia dedintz mesa e soptament sia extrayta; o pren un porr e soptament le metas e soptament l’en tratz.
And also take an eel and tie it well with thread, and let it be put inside and suddenly extracted; or take a leek and suddenly put it in and suddenly take it out.

Mays si no so foro-getatz am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas, lahoras husa de un instrument de plom segon aquesta forma:
But if they are not thrown out with these things which we have said, then use an instrument of lead according to this form:

E sia pus gros que ray un petit, e en la extramitat de lu sia conquavitat la qual tu entrometas en la sua guola am facilitat.
And let it be a little thicker than a ray, and at its extremity let there be a concavity which you introduce into his throat with ease.

E el aga le sieu cap elevat en sus, e guarda te que·l tocament del sieu os de la gola, per so que endevengua a lu cos e am aquela que enpellesca le os o la spina, o que aquel le metge am la sua ma.
And let him have his head elevated upwards, and be careful of touching his throat bone, so that it reaches the thing and with it that pushes the bone or the thorn, or that the physician does it with his hand.

Mays empero que·l malaute aquel entrometa es miels, per la sua sciencia del loc de la causa annexa e enpellisca en jos, e tira la sua ma am le instrument en sus, tot aquo segon la quantitat la qual es a lu preparada entro que sia foro-getada.
But however that the patient introduces it is better, for his knowledge of the place of the attached thing and pushes downwards, and pulls his hand with the instrument upwards, all this according to the quantity which is prepared for him until it is thrown out.

Capitol .xxxix.
Chapter 39.

De extraccio de sancguisugua annexsa al golayro.
On the extraction of a leech attached to the throat.

Quan es medicada sanguisugua am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la curacio am medicinas e no comfereys, considera lahoras en le guolayro del malaute al solelh, pus que tu aias compremuda la lengua de lu am instrument le qual a tu havem recomtat.
When a leech is treated with what we have said in the division of the cure with medicines and it doesn't work, then examine the patient's throat in the sunlight, after you have compressed their tongue with the instrument we have described to you.

Donc si tu vezes la sancguisugua, extratz aquela am onci petit o am gesti subtils decentment.
Then if you see the leech, extract it with small tweezers or with subtle gestures decently.

E si no es a tu possible estrayre am aquel, lahoras pren una canula concava e entromet aquela en lo guolayro del malaute, e aprop pausa en la concavitat de la canula un ferr ignit, e fay aquo tantas vetz (entro que la sancguisugua sia morta e se osta del guolayro) e abstengua se le malaute tot lo jorn de aygua.
And if it's not possible for you to extract it with that, then take a hollow tube and insert it into the patient's throat, and after that place a hot iron in the cavity of the tube, and do this many times (until the leech is dead and detaches from the throat) and the patient should abstain from water all day.

E aprop prengua una veyria plena de aygua frega, e obra la boca de lu en aquela, e lava la boca am aquela; e no trasglucia de aquela alcuna causa e maugua l’aygua una hora aprop autra am la sua ma, quar la sancguisugua tantost cum sent l’aygua catz.
And afterwards, take a glass full of cold water, and open their mouth in it, and wash the mouth with it; and don't let them swallow any of it and move the water from one hour to the next with their hand, because the leech as soon as it feels the water falls.

Mays si no es foro-getada am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras subfumigua le malaute am cimetz o am assafetida per le instrument le qual havem recomtat en la sufumiguacio de uvula.
But if it is not expelled with what we have described, then fumigate the patient with bugs or with asafoetida through the instrument which we have described for the fumigation of the uvula.

Fay aquo, so en quar cayra.
Do this, because it will fall.

E es un’autra manieyra de operacio en sufumiguacio de aquela, es que tu prenguas una ola en la qual sian carbos ignitz e la ola sia cuberta am una cobertora en le mieg de la qual sia un trauc, e sia compausat en aquel trauc la extremitat del instrument; e aprop dega desus la subfumigacio; e pause le malaute la sua boca en la extremitat de la canula, e claugua la sua boca per que la subfumiguacio no sia foro-getada entro que sapias que la subfumigacio es pervenguda a la sancguisugua, quar la sancguisugua tantost cayra.
And there is another way of operation in fumigation of it, which is that you take a pot in which there are burning coals and the pot is covered with a lid in the middle of which there is a hole, and the end of the instrument is placed in that hole; and after that the fumigation should descend; and the patient should put their mouth on the end of the tube, and close their mouth so that the fumigation is not expelled until you know that the fumigation has reached the leech, because the leech will fall immediately.

E si no catz, lahoras tu itera la subfumiguacio motas vetz, e abstengua le malaute de beure, e mange causas saladas e alhs, e no begua aygua, e ayssi necessari es que am aquest regiment sia fora-getada.
And if it doesn't fall, then you repeat the fumigation many times, and the patient should abstain from drinking, and eat salty things and garlic, and not drink water, and thus it is necessary that with this regimen it be expelled.

E aquesta es la forma del instrument am le qual es trayta sancguisugua del guolayro quan es vista; e es semblant a forceps ayssi cum vezes, sino quar es en lu alcuna curvitat:
And this is the form of the instrument with which the leech is extracted from the throat when it is seen; and it is similar to forceps as you see, except that there is some curvature in it:

le qual sia mesa al guolayro, e la extremitat de lu es semblant a bec de ciconia, que es guanta, en la qual es aspretat de lima, per so quar, quan comprem alcuna causa, aquela no leyssa.
which is put to the throat, and the end of it is similar to a stork's beak, which is wide, in which there is roughness of a file, because, when it compresses something, it doesn't let it go.

Capitol .xl.
Chapter 40.

En le qual es la suma del sermo en apercio de apostemas e en seccio de lor.
In which is the sum of the discourse on the opening of abscesses and on their cutting.

Les apostemas so motas specias, de motas manieyras, segon que ve rememoracio de lor, de quascuna en aquest libre.
Abscesses are of many types, of many kinds, according to what comes to memory of them, of each in this book.

E so diversas en perforacio e seccio de lor per doas manieyras, de las quals la una es per la specia de apostemas en si meteys; e per aquo que comprem de las humiditatz.
And they are diverse in perforation and cutting of them in two ways, of which one is by the type of abscesses in themselves; and by what they contain of humors.

E la segonda manieyra es prop les locs en les quals accideys del cos, quar le apostema accident en le cap es autra de la apostema accident en le cul; e le apostema en le loc carnos accident es autra del apostema accident en junctura; e a quascun de lor es son juguament per operacio.
And the second way is near the places in which they occur in the body, because the abscess occurring in the head is different from the abscess occurring in the buttocks; and the abscess occurring in a fleshy place is different from the abscess occurring in a joint; and each of them has its judgment for operation.

E mays de apostemas so alcunas las quals cove que no sian perforadas sino aprop maturacio de la sania en aquels o compliment de lor.
And more of abscesses are some which should not be perforated except after maturation of the pus in them or their completion.

So autras apostemas les quals cove que sian traucatz quan son cruzes, e no son maturatz segon lor compliment, ayssi cum apostemas que son propdas a las juncturas, quar apostema quan ve prop junctura, lo esser de lu es prolonguat entro que·s poyreys aquo que es en le circuit de lu, e fort leu son corromputz les liamentz o les nervis de aquela junctura, per que es fayta causa de contraccio de aquel membre; o es apostema prop de membre principal, e si tu tardas la perforacio de lu entro sia madurat nosira al membre principal; o es prop le cul, donc perfora aque no-madurat; e no cove que·l perforas cru, de no-complida degestio, sino aquel que es prop del cul, per so que no poyresca le preon de lu e sia elonguat a las partidas dedintz del cul, e sia fayta fistula, o que sia fayt en le terme de lu que no sia sanat.
There are other abscesses which should be pierced when they are raw, and are not matured according to their completion, such as abscesses that are near to the joints, because when an abscess comes near a joint, its being is prolonged until what is in its circuit rots, and very easily the ligaments or the nerves of that joint are corrupted, wherefore it is made a cause of contraction of that member; or it is an abscess near a principal member, and if you delay the perforation of it until it is matured it will harm the principal member; or it is near the buttocks, so perforate it unmatured; and it is not fitting that you perforate it raw, of uncompleted digestion, except that which is near the buttocks, so that the depth of it does not rot and is elongated to the inner parts of the buttocks, and a fistula is made, or that it is made in its end that it is not healed.

Mays cove que tu sapias la hora de la perforacio de la apostema, e aysso es quan es maturat.
It's important that you know the time for perforating the abscess, and this is when it has matured.

E sapias que es madurat quan es la cedacio de la dolor e la cessacio de la febre, e aprop la diminucio de la rogor e de la pulsacio, e la acuitat del cap del apostema, e les autres senhals.
And know that it is mature when there is a cessation of pain and fever, and after a reduction in redness and pulsation, and the sharpness of the head of the abscess, and other signs.

E quar cove que sapias la perforacio cazer en le loc pus dejos del apostema e de pus venient de curacio de la eminencia.
And because it's necessary that you know the perforation should be at the lowest point of the abscess and most conducive to healing of the protrusion.

E perforacio tostemps sia per le lonc de la carn o del cors, si las apostemas son en las partidas de las mas o dels pes, e en loc dels lacertz, de las cordas dels nervis, de las arcerias; e, al derier, en totz locs enguals en les quals no es reflecio; quar en aquels que so reflectitz, usa de perforacio segon aquel membre.
And perforation should always be along the length of the flesh or body, if the abscesses are in parts of the hands or feet, and in place of the muscles, the cords of nerves, of arteries; and, lastly, in all equal places where there is no reflection; because in those that are reflected, use perforation according to that member.

Mays quan le apostema es en loc carnos, lahoras miels es que leysses la perforacio de lu entro que sia confermada la digestio de lu segon compliment, ayssi quo havem dit; quar si tu perforas aquel denant aquo, es prolonguat le cors del poyre de lu e de mota sordicia, e fort leu las labias de lu so enduradas e la profunditat de lu.
But when the abscess is in a fleshy place, then it is better that you leave the perforation of it until the digestion of it is confirmed according to completion, as we have said; because if you perforate it before this, the course of its pus and much filth is prolonged, and very easily its lips and its depth are hardened.

Mays alcus apostemas so perforatz segon la latitut de la carn o del cos deves la necessitat, o segon aquo del qual lo membre indigeys.
But some abscesses are perforated according to the width of the flesh or body towards necessity, or according to what the member requires.

E cove que administres petita perforacio , e·n les apostemas grans gran perforacio e ampla o motas seccios segon la diversitat de la grandesa dels apostemas.
And it is appropriate that you administer small perforation, and in large abscesses large and wide perforation or many incisions according to the diversity of the size of the abscesses.

E autras so dels apostemas en les quals cove que la codena sia conquavada e sia encidida, quan es fayta ayssi quo pan e fayta es en terme que ja stigua, ayssi cum aquel que accideys en trops de dubelec e de bubos.
And others are of the abscesses in which it is appropriate that the skin be hollowed out and incised, when it is made like bread and made at a term that it already remains, as that which occurs in many boils and buboes.

E de aquels so que so insciditz am seccio havent tres angles; e de aquels es en le qual es inscidit ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirtra, ayssi cum las apostemas dels angonars.
And of those that are incised with a section having three angles; and of those is in which it is incised like the shape of a myrtle leaf, as in the abscesses of the groin.

E de lor so en les quals es administrada seccio redonda e seccio lunar, e semblantz ad aquels.
And of them are those in which round incision and lunar incision are administered, and similar to those.

Mays aquel al qual no es cap ayssi cum son apostemas leons superficials, cove que tu perforas aquel am perforacio superficial, o plana tant solament.
But that which does not have a head as are superficial lion-like abscesses, it is appropriate that you perforate it with superficial perforation, or flat only.

E cove quant le apostema es gros e ya ha colligit mota sania, que perfores aquel e no te coytes que extraguas tot le poyre en aquela hora; habantz extratz de aquel una partida, e aprop opila le apostema entro al autre dia, e aprop extratz una partida major, e aprop fa aquo motas veguadas segon graduacio entro que sia foro-getat.
And it is appropriate when the abscess is large and has already collected much pus, that you perforate it and do not hurry to extract all the pus at that time; rather extract a part of it, and then seal the abscess until the next day, and then extract a larger part, and then do this many times gradually until it is expelled.

E majorment si·l malaute es de freol vertut, o femna prens, o enfant petit, o viel en decrepitut, quar l’esperit animal motas vetz es resolvut am la egressio de la sania, e fort leu mor le malaute, e tu operte les.
And especially if the patient is of weak constitution, or a pregnant woman, or small child, or old in decrepitude, because the animal spirit is often dissolved with the egress of the pus, and very easily the patient dies, and you lose them.

Don guarda aquest capitol am gran cautela, e aprop la tua perforacio en la qual perforas aquestz apostemas, cove que abstergescas las plagues e consideras donc si la plagua del apostema es pauca, o es una seccio plana, lahoras tu aministra las qualguas de li o de coto antic; e si le apostema es gran, e las fissuras de la perforacio son motas, lahoras cove que tu pauses meca en quascun trauc entro que pervenguan ensemps.
Therefore guard this chapter with great caution, and after your perforation in which you perforate these abscesses, it is appropriate that you clean the wounds and consider then if the wound of the abscess is small, or is a flat incision, then you administer the lint of flax or old cotton; and if the abscess is large, and the fissures of the perforation are many, then it is appropriate that you place a wick in each hole until they come together.

E si en le apostema es abscindit una partida de la codena o has concavada aquela en le circuit, lahoras cove que tu la complescas de coto viel o de fil fayt de drap de li, ayssi cum quan has traytz pans o razizos, ses humiditat; e strenh aquel entro al tertz dia; e aprop proceseys aquel e cura le am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.
And if in the abscess a part of the skin is cut off or you have hollowed it out in the circuit, then it is appropriate that you fill it with old cotton or thread made of linen cloth, as when you have drawn out bread or roots, without moisture; and tighten it until the third day; and then proceed with it and treat it with what is appropriate of the ointments until it is healed.

Mays si accideys flux de sanc en la hora de la operacio tua, lahoras tu aministra aygua frega e vi agre en les quals mules un drap de li, e pausa aquel sobre le loc del fluxs del sanc motas veguadas.
But if bleeding occurs at the time of your operation, then you administer cold water and vinegar in which you soak a linen cloth, and place it over the site of the blood flow many times.

Mays si persevera le fluxs del sanc, lahoras cove que tu aministres regiment e curacio e polveras las quals he recomtadas en motz locs de aquest nostre libre e de divisio.
But if the blood flow persists, then it is appropriate that you administer treatment and cure and powders which I have recounted in many places of this our book and of division.

Mays si es en temps de hivern, e·l loc de la apostema es loc de motz nervis, lahoras cove que tu enfundas pulvils en vi e oli caut, e pauses aquels sobre les locs.
But if it is in winter time, and the place of the abscess is a place of many nerves, then it is appropriate that you infuse compresses in hot wine and oil, and place these on the areas.

E si es en estiu, e les locs son carnoses, lahoras cove que tu pauses pulvils enbeguts am aygua e oli o am vi e oli, e tot aquo sia freg entro que sia le ters dia, ayssi cum havem dit, e lahoras cove que tu deslies le apostema e abstergescas aquel e aministres en la curacio de lu aquo que a lu conveneys entro que sia sanat.
And if it is in summer, and the areas are fleshy, then it is appropriate that you place compresses soaked with water and oil or with wine and oil, and all this should be cold until the third day, as we have said, and then it is appropriate that you unbind the abscess and clean it and administer in its treatment what is suitable for it until it is healed.

E aysso es aquo que es necessari de la cognicio de la curacio de apostemas universalment, mays segon la via de distinccio ja he dit de tot apostema en qual manieyra es via de la cura de lu per capitols singularment.
And this is what is necessary for the knowledge of the treatment of abscesses universally, but according to the way of distinction I have already spoken of every abscess in what manner is the way of its cure by chapters individually.

Capitol .xli.
Chapter 41.

De seccio de apostemas les quals veno en la codena del cap.
On the incision of abscesses which come in the skin of the head.

En la codena del cap petitz apostemas, e so de specias de nodes les quals conteno tunicas que so a lor factz ; e las specias de lor so motas.
In the skin of the head small abscesses, and they are of species of nodes which contain tunics that are made for them; and their species are many.

E de lor son pingas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditat semblant a lima.
And of them are pingas, and of those are those which contain moisture similar to lima.

E de aquelas so las quals conteno humiditat semblant a pols, et asemblantz a lor; e de aquelas so que son lapideas, durs.
And of those are those which contain moisture similar to dust, and similar to them; and of those are those which are stony, hard.

E en la seccio de totz, e en la extraccio de aquels no es temor, cum deves la exteccio de aquels no fa contrariat arceria.
And in the incision of all, and in their extraction there is no fear, as towards their extraction there is no contrary artery.

E la operacio en seccio de aquels es que tu esproes aquels am instrument la forma del qual ve aprop aysso, le qual es apelat entromes, entro que sapias que contengua.
And the operation in their incision is that you examine them with an instrument the form of which comes after this, which is called entromes, until you know what it contains.

Quar si aquo que conte es humiditat, lahoras scindeys aquel am seccio segon la longitut per seccio superficial segon aquesta forma:
For if what it contains is moisture, then you cut it with an incision according to the length by superficial incision according to this form:

E comensa en la seccio de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G. Donc cum la humiditat es evacuada, lahoras tu excoria aquela pel que conte aquela humiditat, e no leysses de aquela alcuna causa de tot, quar tropas veguadas retorna, si roman de aquela alcuna causa.
And begin in the incision of the line of B until the line of G. Then when the moisture is evacuated, then you excise that skin that contains that moisture, and do not leave any of it at all, for many times it returns, if any of it remains.

E aprop submergeys coto en enguent egipciach, si es present, e sino, en aygua e sal; e umpleys am aquel la plagua e layssa aquel entro ad autra dia, quar am aquo corrodeys tot so que es romas de aquela pellicula.
And after submerge cotton in Egyptian ointment, if it is present, and if not, in water and salt; and fill the wound with it and leave it until another day, for with this it corrodes all that remains of that little skin.

E aprop itera sobre aquel coto am enguent egipciach segondament e tersament si indigeyses de lu, entro que·t comfides que no y haia romas alcuna causa de aquela pellicula; lahoras cura la plagua am enguent entro que sia sanada.
And after iterate over that cotton with Egyptian ointment secondly and thirdly if you need it, until you are confident that no part of that little skin remains; then treat the wound with ointment until it is healed.

E si apostema conte nodi gras, lahoras tu inscideys aquel segon aquesta forma:
And if the abscess contains fatty nodes, then you incise it according to this form:

am seccio havent forma de crotz, e geta oncis entre doas labias de la seccio e scorsa aquel de tota partida, e esforsa la tua vertut en extraccio de la tunica la qual conte aquel.
with an incision having the form of a cross, and put hooks between two lips of the incision and peel it from every part, and exert your strength in extracting the tunic which contains it.

Mays si a tu arceria fa contrarieta, lahoras fay aquo que yeu t’e recontat primieyrament.
But if an artery opposes you, then do what I have recounted to you first.

E semblantment fay en le apostema lapificat de seccio e de curacio segon que a tu havem dit; e seccio sobre apostema lapificat es pus leugiera, quar es de pauc sanc e de pauca humiditat.
And similarly do in the petrified abscess of incision and of treatment according to what we have told you; and incision on a petrified abscess is easier, for it is of little blood and of little moisture.

E alcunas vetz so alcus de aquestz apostemas les quals so en le cap en alcus homes am los quals de tot no es humiditat; la qual causa es quar yeu inscindigui sobre un apostema en le cap de una femna vielha e atrobegui le apostema ayssi cum peyra sorda, aspra, blanqua, la qual no podia esser trinquada, e si a alcu fos am aquela percussit, plaguera aquel.
And sometimes there are some of these abscesses which are in the head in some men with whom there is no moisture at all; which thing is because I incised on an abscess in the head of an old woman and found the abscess like a deaf stone, rough, white, which could not be broken, and if someone were struck with it, it would wound them.

Mays en les autres apostemas accidentz en le cap otra aquest no es aquest capitol, ayssi cum les apostemas que veno als caps dels enfantz e deves las razitz de las aurelhas, mays la seccio de aquestz totz sia seccio superficial.
But in the other abscesses occurring in the head besides this this chapter is not, such as the abscesses that come to the heads of children and towards the roots of the ears, but the incision of all these should be superficial incision.

E pausa la perforacio de aquels de la partida pus bassa de lor per so que sia alleujat le cos de la sania a las partidas pus bassas.
And place their perforation on the lowest part of them so that the body of the pus is relieved to the lower parts.

E aprop cura aquelas am aquo que conveneys ad aquel de curacio.
And after treat those with what is suitable to that of treatment.

Capitol .xlii.
Chapter 42.

De seccio de scrophulas las quals accideyso en le col.
On the cutting of scrofulas which occur in the neck.

Motas veguadas endeveno aquestas apostemas en le colh e en las aysselhas e en les angonars; e alcunas veguadas accideyso en las autras partidas del cos.
Often these abscesses occur in the neck and in the armpits and in the groins; and sometimes they occur in other parts of the body.

E so aquelas que accideysso en le colh, e so motas que so engendradas entre lor, e tota scrofula de aquelas es dintz la sua tunica propria, e ayssi cum en les nodis e apostema del cap, ayssi cum havem recomtat.
And these are those that occur in the neck, and there are many that are generated among them, and every scrofula of these is within its own tunic, and just as in the nodes and abscesses of the head, as we have recounted.

E las specias de aquestas scrophulas son motas, quar de aquelas so alcunas lapideas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditatz, e de aquelas so malignas las quals no obeseysso a curacio.
And the species of these scrofulas are many, for of these some are stony, and of these are those that contain moisture, and of these are malignant ones which do not yield to treatment.

Donc en aquela la qual tu vezes de bona disposicio en le Tocament, de la qual la color de aquo que es manifest es propda a la color de la codena, e es mauguda a tota partida, e no es annexsa am le nervi del colh, ni am las venas, ni am la arceria, e no es preonda, cove que tu inscidiscas aquela am siccio superficial de la partida desus a la partida dejos del cos de la linha de .G. entro la linha de .B., e scorja aquela de tota partida, e exten dos labias de la codena am onci, o am motz oncis si has necessitat de aquels, ayssi cum havem dit en las apostemas del cap, e extratz aquela petit a petit.
Therefore in that which you see of good disposition in the Touch, of which the color of what is manifest is close to the color of the skin, and is moved to all parts, and is not attached to the nerve of the neck, nor to the veins, nor to the artery, and is not deep, it is fitting that you incise it with a superficial cut from the upper part to the lower part of the body from the line of G to the line of B, and flay it from all parts, and extend the two lips of the skin with a hook, or with many hooks if you have need of them, as we have said in the abscesses of the head, and extract it little by little.

E es mays cautela que no sia inscidida la vena o nervi.
And it is more cautious that the vein or nerve not be cut.

E sia le spatum no mot agut, que no ajuste a tu la tua ma am inscizio, o que enquiete le malaute, e que inscidas aquo que no es necessari inscidir; quar si inscideysses vena o arceria e prohibeys tu de la tua operacio, lahoras pausa en la plagua vetriol trissat o autras polveras las quals ostan fluxs de sanc, e estrenh la plagua, e layssa aquel entro que·s repausa la acuitat de la apostema e sia mollificada la plagua e comense esser poyrida.
And let the spatula not be very sharp, lest it join your hand with a cut, or that it disturb the patient, and that you cut what is not necessary to cut; for if you cut a vein or artery and prohibit yourself from your operation, then place crushed vitriol or other powders which stop blood flow in the wound, and tighten the wound, and leave it until the acuteness of the abscess rests and the wound is softened and begins to be putrid.

Quan le sanc es abscindit.
When the blood is stopped.

Donc retorna a la tua operacio entro que l’aias complida.
Then return to your operation until you have completed it.

E aprop inquireys am le tieu dit indic si es romas alcuna causa de las autras petitas scrophulas, donc inscideys aquelas e munda aquelas.
And afterwards inquire with your index finger if any of the other small scrofulas remain, then cut those and clean them.

E si es en la razit de la scrophula gran vena, cove lahoras que no inscidas aquela scrophula de la sua razitz.
And if there is a large vein in the root of the scrofula, it is then fitting that you do not cut that scrofula from its root.

Abantz cove que lies aquela am fiel doblat fort e que leysses aquela entro que caia per si ses nocument.
Rather, it is fitting that you tie it with strong doubled thread and that you leave it until it falls by itself without harm.

E aprop omple la plagua de coto vielh le qual tu has ja submirgit en enguent egipciac, e aprop cura aquel.
And afterwards fill the wound with old cotton which you have already submerged in Egyptian ointment, and afterwards treat it.

E si inscides aquela scrophula tota, lahoras cove que tu ajustes las doas labias de la plagua e cuzas2 tantost pus que no y ha romasa deguna superfluitat.
And if you cut that whole scrofula, then it is fitting that you join the two lips of the wound and sew immediately since no superfluity has remained there.

Mays si tu vezes que haia romasa superfluitat per la grandeza de la scrofula, cove que tu entendas a inscidir la razit de aquela, e astrayra aquela e aministra sutura e aquo que es dit.
But if you see that superfluity has remained due to the size of the scrofula, it is fitting that you intend to cut its root, and extract it and administer suture and what is said.

E aquela de las scrophulas que conteno humiditatz, perfora aquela am perforacio superficial aqui la on appar a tu le loc de maturacio de lu, e pausa perforacio de aquo que siec le pus bas del cos, ayssi cum havem dit.
And that of the scrofulas which contain moisture, perforate it with superficial perforation there where the place of its maturation appears to you, and place perforation of what follows the lowest of the body, as we have said.

E aprop aministra perforacio, calguas am enguent e semblantz ad aquels, per so que corroda aquo que es romas de la corropcio.
And afterwards administer perforation, cauterize with ointment and similar to those, so that it may corrode what remains of the corruption.

E aprop quan tu vezes la plagua ja esser mundada, lahoras tu cura aquela am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanada.
And afterwards when you see the wound already to be cleaned, then you treat it with flesh-generating ointment until it is healed.

Capitol .xliii.
Chapter 43.

De seccio del pilhot del apostema accident dintz le guolayro.
On cutting the growth of an abscess occurring inside the throat.

 Diyssero les antics aquesta seccio en le epilhot, e no vist alcu hom en nostra terra que aquela aia fayta.
The ancients spoke of this incision in the epiglottis, and no one in our land has been seen to have done it.

E aquesta es la inscriptura del sermo de aquels.
And this is the transcription of their discourse.

Mays en les homes haventz esquinencia, cove que sia esquivada la extraccio del epilhot, cum per aquo no sia fayt juvament per so quar totas las venas e las majors del malaute so aqui.
But in men having quinsy, it is fitting that the extraction of the epiglottis be avoided, as it does not provide help because all the veins and major ones of the patient are there.

Mays en aquels que han apostemas cautz en la boca o guolayro o dos aurelhas, quan la malautia no es en la cana, cove husar de la seccio de epilhot a fugir la perdicio la qual es fayta per perfocacio.
But in those who have hot abscesses in the mouth or throat or both ears, when the disease is not in the windpipe, it is fitting to use the cutting of the epiglottis to avoid the loss which is caused by suffocation.

Donc cove quan volem aquo, que inscidam le epilhot dejos tres cercles dels cercles del epilhot, o quatre am petita seccio per la latitut en aquel que es entre dos cercles per quantitat, que la seccio sia en ciphac, no en la cartillage, e aquest loc es convenent a seccio, quar es privat de carn e les vayselhs de sanc de lu son luhen.
Therefore it is fitting when we want this, that we cut the epiglottis below three circles of the circles of the epiglottis, or four with a small incision for the width in that which is between two circles by quantity, so that the cut is in the membrane, not in the cartilage, and this place is suitable for cutting, because it is devoid of flesh and its blood vessels are far away.

E si le metge es pauruc, cove lahoras que extenda la codena del golayro am onci, e aprop fenda la codena entro que pervengua a la canal, mays evite les vaysels de sanc si vetz de aquelas alcuna causa.
And if the physician is fearful, it is fitting then that he stretch the skin of the throat with a hook, and afterwards split the skin until he reaches the canal, but avoid the blood vessels if you see any of them.

E aprop inscida li ciplach segon que havem recomtat; e es significat sobre la seccio de la canal per le flacma le qual es de aquela eyssit am aquo que es de lu disromput e per la abscizio de la votz.
And afterwards cut the membrane as we have recounted; and it is indicated above the cut of the canal by the phlegm which has come out of it with that which is disrupted from it and by the loss of voice.

E layssa la plagua uberta per alcun temps.
And leave the wound open for some time.

Donc cum la hora es remauguda en la qual perforacio es temuda, agregua doas labias de la codena de la plagua, e cus aquela sola ses la cartillage.
Therefore when the time has passed in which perforation is feared, bring together the two lips of the skin of the wound, and sew it alone without the cartilage.

E aprop administra medicinas que fan naysser la carn entro que sia sanat.
And afterwards administer medicines that make flesh grow until it is healed.

 E diyssec Albucasis que la summa del sermo le qual havem recomtat, exposicio no es sino que veias que alcus de aquetz apostemas ja han opilat lo guolayro del malaute, e le malaute es vengut entro a mort, e le ale de lu es entresecat, e alcus van a inscidir le epiglos per so que respire le malaute sobre le loc de la plagua per alcuna respiracio, e sia salvat de mort.
And Albucasis said that the summary of the discourse which we have recounted, the explanation is nothing but that you see that some of these abscesses have already blocked the throat of the patient, and the patient has come to the point of death, and his breath is cut off, and some go to cut the epiglottis so that the patient may breathe over the place of the wound by some respiration, and be saved from death.

E per aquo comandero layssar la plagua uberta entro que sia consumida la malicia de la malautia; e es la malicia de lu per tres dias; e donc lahoras comandero cosi la plagua, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.
And for this they commanded to leave the wound open until the malignancy of the disease is consumed; and its malignancy is for three days; and then they commanded to sew the wound, and cure it until it is healed.

 E aquo que yeu he vist per mi meteys, es que una sirventa pres un cotel e mesec le en le sieu golayro e inscidic am aquel una partida de la cana del pulmo, e yeu fu apelat a la curacio de lu, e atrobegui la mugen ayssi cum es mugit del moridos, e descubrigui la plagua e atrobegui le sanc le qual era yssit de la plagua petit.
And what I have seen for myself, is that a servant took a knife and put it in her throat and cut with it a part of the windpipe, and I was called to the cure of her, and I found the moaning as is the moaning of the dying, and I uncovered the wound and found the blood which had come out of the wound little.

Donc yeu fo confessat que aquela no havia inscidit vena ni guidegi, e le vent yssia de la plagua, e curegui aquela entro que foc sanada.
Therefore I confessed that she had not cut a vein or windpipe, and the air was coming out of the wound, and I cured it until it was healed.

E no accidic a la sirventa si no rauquiera en la votz, e aprop alcus dias retornec ad miloracio de las suas dispozicios.
And nothing happened to the servant except hoarseness in the voice, and after some days she returned to improvement of her conditions.

E ara dic yeu que en la seccio del epilhot no ha temor.
And now I say that in the cutting of the epiglottis there is no fear.

 Capitol .xliv.
Chapter 44.

De seccio sobre apostema le qual accideys en le golayro defora, e es apelat hernia del golayro.
On cutting above an abscess which occurs in the throat outside, and is called hernia of the throat.

 Aquest apostema nompnat hernia del golayro es apostema gran segon la color del cors, e es mot en las femnas.
This abscess named hernia of the throat is a large abscess according to the color of the body, and is common in women.

E es segon dos manieyras, quar o es natural o accidental.
And it is according to two manners, for it is either natural or accidental.

E en le natural no es engen de curar.
And in the natural there is no means of curing.

E l’accidental es segon dos manieyras del qual la un es semblant a nodes grasses, e l’autra manieyra es semblant apostema le qual es fayt per nodacio de arteria, e en aquel es temor.
And the accidental is according to two manners of which one is similar to fatty nodes, and the other manner is similar to an abscess which is made by knotting of an artery, and in that there is fear.

E no cove que·s fassa presumpcio a lu cum ferr sino en aquel que es petit.
And it is not fitting that presumption be made to it with iron except in that which is small.

E tu proha aquel e investigua aquel am le dit, e si atrobas lu semblant a nodi gras, e no es suspendut am alcuna de las venas, lahoras tu inscideys aquel ayssi cum les nodes, e extratz aquel am aquo que conte lu de la pel e bursiclam; e sino, lahoras es perscrutat tot le sieu esser, e aprop cura le loc am aquo que cove de curacio entro que sia sanat.
And you test it and investigate it with the finger, and if you find it similar to a fatty node, and it is not suspended with any of the veins, then you cut it just like the nodes, and extract it with that which contains it of the skin and sac; and if not, then all its being is examined, and afterwards cure the place with that which is fitting for curing until it is healed.

Capitol .xlv.
Chapter 45.

De seccio de las specias de nodes.
On the incision of the types of nodes.

Dels nodes so motas specias e yeu ja he dit totas las specias de lor en la divisio.
There are many types of nodes and I have already mentioned all their types in the division.

E cove que yeu recomte assi la diferencia entre node e exitura cum fassa dubitacio.
And it is appropriate that I recount here the difference between node and exitura as it causes doubt.

Donc yeu dic que am exitura es caliditat e febre e dolors vehementz entro que es sedada la ebullicio de la superfluitat; e es complida putrefaccio que lahora cessa la febre, la dolor e la calor.
So I say that with exitura there is heat and fever and vehement pains until the ebullition of the superfluity is calmed; and putrefaction is complete when the fever, pain and heat cease.

Mays am node no es caliditat ni febre ni dolor, e conte aquel ciphac leon le qual es al u sac propri.
But with a node there is no heat nor fever nor pain, and it contains that ciphac leon which is in its own sac.

E es segon la color del cors, e le comensament de lu es cum un ceze e es fayt ayssi cum vace, sia major o minor, e son segon dos specias, quar o so grassas e conteno humiditat, e las colors de la humiditat son motas, segon que yeu diyssi en la divisio.
And it is according to the color of the body, and its beginning is like a chickpea and it is made thus as it grows, be it major or minor, and they are of two types, for they are either fatty and contain humidity, and the colors of the humidity are many, as I said in the division.

Donc cove, quan pervenas a la curacio de node, que exprohes aquel e inquiras aquel al comensament am sturment le qual es apelat intromes, segon que vindra la sua forma en le capitol le qual es aprop aquest.
So it is appropriate, when you come to the cure of a node, that you examine it and investigate it at the beginning with an instrument which is called intromes, as its form will come in the chapter which is after this one.

E es manieyra de inquisicio de apostemas e de totz nodes, e es que tu prenguas aquest sturment e entromet aquel en le loc pus humit le qual atrobas en le apostema, e tu revolveras les tieus ditz am aquel petit a petit entro que sapias que·l sturment ja ha penetrat la codena.
And it is a manner of investigation of apostemas and of all nodes, and it is that you take this instrument and introduce it in the most humid place which you find in the apostema, and you will revolve your fingers with it little by little until you know that the instrument has already penetrated the skin.

E aprop ultima la tua ma segon la mesura de la grandeza del apostema, e aprop extratz le entromes e considera aquo que es yssit en le vestigi de lu.
And after, move your hand according to the measure of the size of the apostema, and then extract the intromes and consider what has come out in its trace.

E si es fora-getada la humiditat corrent, de qualque color sia, lahoras tu le inscideys am seccio superficial segon que he dit en les autres apostemas.
And if the running humidity is expelled, of whatever color it may be, then you incise it with a superficial incision as I have said in the other apostemas.

E si del vestigi de l’intromes no hieys humiditat, lahoras sapias que es gras.
And if no humidity comes out of the trace of the intromes, then know that it is fatty.

E secca sobre lu am seccio havent forma de crotz segon aquesta forma:
And dry over it with an incision having the form of a cross according to this form:

ayssi cum t’e ensenhat, e suspen aquel am oncis, e excorja la codena de tota part am facilitat, e guarda la pel o sac, si podes, sobre aquel e extraguas aquela sania am le node.
as I have taught you, and suspend it with hooks, and skin the hide from all parts with ease, and keep the skin or sac, if you can, over it and extract that sanies with the node.

Mays si es romput en la operacio, no es possible extrayre aquela sana, e motas veguadas endeve aquo, e lahoras tu la extratz a pessas entro que de lu no romangua denguna causa.
But if it is broken in the operation, it is not possible to extract it healthy, and this happens many times, and then you extract it in pieces until nothing remains of it.

Quar si de lu roman denguna causa, pauc o trop, le node retorne segon le mays.
For if any of it remains, little or much, the node returns according to the greater part.

E si tu vezes que de lu roman alcuna part petita, lahoras comple la plagua de alcunas polveras corrosivas agudas e strenh la plagua, e pausa sobre aquela que sede apostema caut, e cura aquel del autra curacio entro que sia sanat.
And if you see that some small part of it remains, then complete the wound with some sharp corrosive powders and tighten the wound, and place on it what calms a hot apostema, and cure it with the other cure until it is healed.

E si es node gran, lahoras tu cus las doas labias de lu e cura aquel am aquo que encarna.
And if it is a large node, then you sew its two lips and cure it with what incarnates.

Mays si vena pulsatil es a lu contraria, o no-pulsatil, lahoras tu coyta e huemple le loc de zegi trissat que es vetriol e leyssa aquel streyt per dos dias o per tres entro que·s poyresca la plagua e que repause la ebullicio del sanc; e aprop retorna a inscindir aquo que es romas del node.
But if a pulsating vein is contrary to it, or non-pulsating, then you hasten and fill the place with ground vitriol and leave it tight for two days or for three until the wound rots and the ebullition of the blood rests; and after return to incise what remains of the node.

Capitol .xlvi.
Chapter 46.

De las formas del sturmentz necessaris en seccio e perforacio.
On the forms of instruments necessary for cutting and perforating.

De aquels so las formas dels intromesas, e so de tres specias, que de aquels es alcu gran, e de lor es migier, e de lor es petit.
Of these are the forms of instruments, and they are of three types, for some of them are large, some are medium, and some are small.

La forma de intromes gran es aquesta:
The form of the large instrument is this:

La forma de intromes migier es aquesta:
The form of the medium instrument is this:

La forma de intromes petit es aquesta:
The form of the small instrument is this:

Sian faytz de ferr, de alfulud, de extremitatz cayradas decentment, per so que festino le intrament en les apostemas.
Let them be made of iron, of steel, with properly squared ends, so that they may quickly enter the abscesses.

E aquestas so las formas dels experientz, e son nompnatz albered, e un de aquels es apelat berid.
And these are the forms of probes, and they are called albered, and one of them is called berid.

E so de tres especias, quar de lor es gran, migier e pauc.
And they are of three types, for some are large, medium and small.

La forma de experient gran, forma de lu:
The form of the large probe, its shape:

La forma de experient migier, forma de lu:
The form of the medium probe, its shape:

La forma de experient pauc, forma de lu:
The form of the small probe, its shape:

Conveneysso que sian per aquels apostemas e exituras e fistulas e bubos per so que entre aquelas so dels osses e de autras causas.
They are suitable for those abscesses and sores and fistulas and buboes because among them are those of bones and other things.

E so faytz redontz, grosses, leons, ayssi cum grans agulhas am las quals son cosidas las selhas, e son faytas de eram citri, o de eram o de ferr, o de argent, E las milhors so quan so faytas de eram citri.
And they are made round, thick, smooth, like large needles with which saddles are sewn, and they are made of citron brass, or brass or iron, or silver. And the best are when they are made of citron brass.

E son faytz les experient de plum negre, les quals se acordan que per aquels sian ubertas las fistulas en la conquavitat de las quals so reflexios, que sian reflectidas am la sua levitat am aquelas refleccios.
And the probes are made of black lead, which are agreed to be used to open fistulas in the concavity of which there are reflections, that they may be reflected with their lightness with those reflections.

E so de tres specias, quar alcus de lor so loncs, e dels autres migiers, e dels autres breus, segon la quantitat del ample de la fistula e de la strictura de lu.
And they are of three types, for some of them are long, and others medium, and others short, according to the quantity of the width of the fistula and its narrowness.

Forma del experient gran de plom:
Form of the large lead probe:

Forma del experient migier de plom:

Forma del experient petit de plom:

Las formas dels oncis so de motas specias, quar de aquels so alcus simples, als quals es una curvitat solament, e so de tres specias: grans, paucs e migiers.
The forms of hooks are of many types, for some of them are simple, which have only one curve, and they are of three types: large, small and medium.

E de lor so uncis orps, e so de tres specias.
And some of them are blind hooks, and they are of three types.

E de aquels so uncis haventz doas curvaturas, e so de tres specias.
And some of them are hooks having two curves, and they are of three types.

E de lor so haventz tres curvaturas, e so de tres specias.
And some of them have three curves, and they are of three types.

E totz aquetz so necessaris en lor loc.
And all of these are necessary in their place.

Forma de unci simple gran, forma de lu:
Form of large simple hook, its shape:

Forma de unci gran havent dos curvaturas:

Form of large scalpel:

Forma del scapel migier:
Form of medium scalpel:

Las extramitatz de aquels am les quals es fayta seccio so agudas e las autres extramitatz so no-agudas, e no so pausadas en tal manieyra, sino per que sia fayt juvament en la excorjacio dels nodes la temor de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e per aquels sia sanat le malaute e atrobe tranquilitat un petit per la adustio la qual atroba deves la excoriacio del apostema.
The extremities of these with which incision is made are sharp and the other extremities are not sharp, and they are not placed in such a manner, except to provide assistance in the excoriation of nodes, the fear of cutting a vein or nerve, and by these the patient is healed and finds tranquility a little by the cauterization which he finds towards the excoriation of the abscess.

E aquestas son las formas de almagidas, e so de tres specias: gran, migier e pauc, ayssi cum veyras.

Form of small probe:

Sian faytas de eram e so semblantz de ray am le qual e fayt alcofol.
They are made of copper and are similar to the ray with which kohl is applied.

E es en la extramitat lada punctada am spatum occultada e en aquela corr a las partidas dedintz e defora, quan tu vols, ayssi cum veses.
And at the wide extremity it is punctured with a hidden spatula and in that it runs to the parts inside and outside, when you want, as you see.

Las formas de spatimis, les quals so amaguatz entre los ditz deves la perforacio dels apostemas e no les percebo les malautes, e so de tres specias: gran, migier e pauc.
The forms of spatulas, which are hidden between the fingers towards the perforation of abscesses and the patients do not perceive them, and they are of three types: large, medium and small.

The forms of cupping glasses with which blood flow is stopped, and they are of three types; large, medium and small; their forms:

Sian faytas de eram citri, redondas am alcuna longitut , e sian subtils.
They are made of citrus-colored copper, round with some length, and they are thin.

E cove que sian aquestas specias de ventosas deves tu grans, migieras e paucas, per so que per aquelas abscindas flux de sanc am velocitat en necessitat, e lahoras quan a tu primieyrament no es medicina.
And it is appropriate that these types of cupping glasses be large, medium and small for you, so that with them you can stop blood flow quickly in case of necessity, and when you first have no medicine.

Enpero no uses de aquelas ad abscidir sanc en tot loc del cors, e non uses sino en locs carnoses, ayssi cum en les lacertis de las cambas e de las coyssas, e en les lacertz dels brasses, e de las mamillas e del ventre e dels engonars, e semblantz a lor dels lacertz carnoses humitz.
However, do not use them to stop blood in every part of the body, and do not use them except in fleshy places, such as in the muscles of the legs and thighs, and in the muscles of the arms, and of the breasts and of the belly and of the groins, and similar to them of the moist fleshy muscles.

E alcunas veguadas son faytz de aquels strumentz autres petitz semblantz scorsas de fisacs segon aquesta forma; per les quals lo sanc es abscindit quan es fayt per fleubotomia, o deves inscizio de vena o de arceria.
And sometimes other small instruments are made from these resembling fig peels according to this form; by which blood is stopped when it is done by phlebotomy, or towards incision of vein or artery.

E alcunas veguadas son faytas redondas segon aquesta forma:
And sometimes they are made round according to this form:

Capitol .xlvii.
Chapter 47.

De la cura de las mamillas dels homes las quals so asembladas de femnas.
On the treatment of men's breasts which resemble those of women.

Alcunas veguadas so infladas las mamillas de alcus homes deves le compliment del dormir cum comensan esser pellutz, e aprop so infladas las mamillas, e so asembladas las mamillas de las femnas, e romano apostemosas, lejas.
Sometimes the breasts of some men are swollen towards the completion of sleep when they begin to be hairy, and afterwards the breasts are swollen, and the breasts resemble those of women, and remain swollen, ugly.

E ad aquel que avoreys aquo, cove que inscidisca aquelas am seccio lunar segon aquesta forma, de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G., e aprop excorja la groceza tota, e aprop uempla la plagua de medicament encarnatiu, e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am cosidura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.
And for one who dislikes this, it is appropriate to cut them with a lunar incision according to this form, from the line of B to the line of G, and afterwards skin all the thickness, and afterwards fill the wound with incarnative medicine, and afterwards join the two lips of the wound with suture, and treat that until it is healed.

Mays si la mamilla declina a las partidas dejos e es mollificada per la sua magnitut ayssi cum endeve a las femnas, lahoras sia fendut en dos latz sieus pus sobiras, am dos seccios semblantz a figura lunar, de las quals quascuna sia contenguda en l’autra deves la fi de quascuna, entro que sia que la linha major contengua la menor segon aquesta forma de la linha de .B. e la linha de .G. E aprop excorja la codena la qual es entre dos labias de la plagua, e osta la pingueza, e aministra aquo que havem dit de la sutura e de las polveras aquo que es necessari en la curacio entro que sia sanat.
But if the breast declines to the lower parts and is softened by its magnitude as happens to women, then it should be split in its two upper sides, with two incisions resembling a lunar figure, of which each is contained in the other towards the end of each, until the major line contains the minor according to this form from the line of B and the line of G. And afterwards skin the hide which is between two lips of the wound, and remove the fat, and administer what we have said about the suture and the powders that which is necessary in the treatment until it is healed.

E si tu non conpleysses la inscizio de aquo que cove inscidir per la inquietut del malaute, e per flux de sanc, lahoras cove que huemplas la plagua de coto submergit en enguent corrosiu e layssa aquel entro que aquo corroda que es romas de la grayssa, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.
And if you do not complete the incision of what should be cut due to the restlessness of the patient, and due to blood flow, then it is appropriate that you fill the wound with cotton submerged in corrosive ointment and leave that until it corrodes what remains of the fat, and afterwards treat that until it is healed.

Capitol .xlviii.
Chapter 48.

De perforacio de apostemas que veno dejos le titillic.
On the perforation of abscesses that come under the armpit.

Aquetz apostemas que veno dejos le titillic so de las specias de scrophulas, durs, las quals conte una pel que es sac.
These abscesses that come under the armpit are of the species of scrofula, hard, which contain a skin that is like a sac.

E de aquelas so alcunas que conteno humiditatz; e aquelas que conteno humiditatz cove que sian inscididas am seccio lunar segon aquesta figura: de la linha de .G. a la linha de .B. E cum es tot evacuat aquo que es en le apostema de la sania, lahoras tu le comple de coto viel e leysa le entro al autra dia.
And of these, some contain fluids; and those that contain fluids should be incised with a lunar section according to this figure: from line G to line B. And when all that is in the abscess of pus is evacuated, then you fill it with old cotton and leave it until the next day.

E aprop le coto sia ostat e sia curat am enguent convenient ad aquo, entro que sia sanat.
And after the cotton is removed, it should be treated with a suitable ointment for this, until it is healed.

E si le apostema de las specias dels nodes es, e de las scrophulas, lahoras tu scindeys sobre aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la seccio sobre las scrophulas engualment.
And if the abscess is of the species of nodes, and of scrofula, then you cut over it as we have said in the section on scrofula equally.

May si la plagua es extenduda en aysso que yesca poyredura, lahoras administra en lu cauteri segon que en aquo havem denant dit.
But if the wound is extended so that pus comes out, then administer cautery to it as we have said before.

Capitol .xlix.
Chapter 49.

De seccio de apostemas que accideysso per arceria o per vena.
On the incision of abscesses that occur by artery or by vein.

Quan arceria es rompuda, e la codena es consolidada la qual es sobre aquela, lahoras motas veguadas accideys apostema E les senhals per les quals es conoguda que imflamacio e apostema sian per la arteria o per vena: quar quan apostema es per arceria es lonc agreguat en le preon del cors; e que quan inpelleysses le apostema am les tieus ditz, sentes en lu quays sia stridor.
When an artery is ruptured, and the skin is consolidated which is over it, then many times an abscess occurs. And the signs by which it is known that inflammation and abscess are by the artery or by vein: for when the abscess is by artery it is long gathered in the depth of the body; and when you press the abscess with your fingers, you feel in it as if there is a whistle.

E aquel que es per vena es redon al manifest del cors.
And that which is by vein is round to the manifest of the body.

E seccio sobre aquest apostema es error, e majorment en aquel que es dejos las aysselhas, e en les angonars, e en le col, e en motz locs del cors; e es mot gran, donc cove que la sua curacio am ferr sia esquivada, e aquel que es en las extramitatz, o al cap, cove que sia evitat.
And incision on this abscess is an error, and especially in that which is under the armpits, and in the groins, and in the neck, and in many places of the body; and it is very large, so it is appropriate that its cure with iron be avoided, and that which is in the extremities, or in the head, should be avoided.

Mays sobre aquel que es de lor per imflacio de l’orrifici de la arceria, scindeys en la codena seccio en le lonc; e aprop huebre la seccio am uncis e aprop la arceria, e deliura de las tunicas entro que sia descuberta.
But on that which is of them by inflammation of the orifice of the artery, cut in the skin a section in the length; and after open the section with hooks and after the artery, and deliver from the tunics until it is uncovered.

E aprop met sobre aquel agulha e fay aquela penetrar entro al autre latz, e estrenh la arceria am fiel doble en dos locs, — la qual causa yeu a tu eyssenhegui en extraccio de doas arcerias les quals so en les templars.
And after put a needle on it and make it penetrate to the other side, and tighten the artery with double thread in two places, — which thing I taught you in extraction of two arteries which are in the temples.

E aprop punh le loc le qual es entre dos liamentz am spatum entro que yesca le sanc tot que es en lu, e sia dissolvut le apostema.
And after puncture the place which is between two ligaments with a spatula until all the blood that is in it comes out, and the abscess is dissolved.

E aprop administra curacio en la qual es engendrat poyre entro que caian les liamentz; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz convenientz ad aquo entro que sia sanat.
And after administer treatment in which pus is generated until the ligaments fall; and after cure it with ointments suitable for this until it is healed.

E si es apostema per seccio de vena, lahoras cove que tu tenguas am la tua ma aquo que es a tu possible del apostema am la codena, e aprop intromet la agulha dejos le loc le qual tu has tengut dejos la tua ma, e fay aquela penetrar; e sia en aquela fil doble entro que tu extraguas aquel del autre latz, e aprop ligua le apostema am bo liament segon que yeu he dit a tu en le liament de uva4 de doas partz am doas extremitatz del fil.
And if it is an abscess by section of vein, then it is appropriate that you hold with your hand what is possible for you of the abscess with the skin, and after introduce the needle under the place which you have held under your hand, and make it penetrate; and let there be in it double thread until you extract it from the other side, and after tie the abscess with good binding as I have told you in the binding of grape of two parts with two extremities of the thread.

Mays si temes que extraguam le fil, lahoras entromet le fiel am aquela agula dejos tot le apostema deves la inscizio de la agulha primieyra, e strenh les tieus fiels en quatre locs.
But if you fear that we extract the thread, then introduce the thread with that needle under all the abscess towards the incision of the first needle, and tighten your threads in four places.

Aprop secca le apostema en le mieg loc de lu entro que quan es yssit aquo que es en lu, lahoras tu inscideys la superfluitat de la codena, e layssa aquo que de lu es liat.
After dry the abscess in the middle place of it until when what is in it has come out, then you cut the superfluity of the skin, and leave that which of it is bound.

E aprop pausa sobre lu pulvil le qual has submergit en vi e oli, e aprop administra la curacio la qual es fayta am calguas e enguentz entro que sia sanat.
And after place on it a compress which you have submerged in wine and oil, and after administer the treatment which is made with poultices and ointments until it is healed.

Capitol l del apostema le qual accideys per torcio de nervis.
Chapter 50 on the aposteme which occurs due to twisting of nerves.

Ayssi cum accideys apostema en arceria e en vena, e semblantment accideys apostema en les nervis quan accideys en lor percussio o accideys per trebal superfluable, e per semblantz.
Just as aposteme occurs in arteries and veins, similarly aposteme occurs in the nerves when there is percussion or excessive work, and similar causes.

E es fayt le mays de lu en les locs dels adjutoris o del talo, o en tot loc en le qual so maugudas las juncturas.
And it is mostly made in the places of the arms or the heel, or in any place where the joints are moved.

E es apostema greu, e es asemblat a la color del autre cors, e es en las majors de lu disposicios ses de lor e quan es streyt am vehementia, sent en lu le malaute semblant stupor.
And it is a serious aposteme, and it resembles the color of the rest of the body, and in most cases it is without pain and when it is tightly pressed, the patient feels a numbness-like sensation.

E no es apostema agreguat en le preon del cors, e per so es dejos la codena, e el es maugut a tota partida e no va a las partidas denant ni detras.
And the aposteme is not gathered in the depths of the body, so it is under the skin, and it moves to all parts and does not go to the front or back parts.

Donc aquo de aquels que es en las juncturas no cove que sia envasit am ferr, quar fort leu endevenguera contracio.
Therefore, those that are in the joints should not be invaded with iron, because contraction would easily occur.

Mays aquel que es en le cap o en le front fen la codena am spatum.
But that which is on the head or on the forehead, cut the skin with a spatula.

Mays si es apostema pauc, lahoras te aquel am les forfecs e abscindeys aquel de razitz.
But if the aposteme is small, then hold it with forceps and cut it out from the root.

E si es gran, lahoras tu le suspen am unci, e excorja aquel, e aprop osta aquel; e ajusta la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.
And if it is large, then you suspend it with a hook, and flay it, and then remove it; and close the wound with sutures, and treat it until it is healed.

Capitol .li.
Chapter 51.

De seccio de apostema le qual accideys de cheil que accideys al ventre.
On cutting the aposteme which occurs from growths that occur on the belly.

Endeveno ad alcus homes motas veguadas en les ventres de aquels e en las autras partidas del cors de aquels theils les quals son apelatz funguals per similitut de aquels am funges, dels quals la razitz es subtil e·l cap de aquel es gros; e ja las labias de aquels so conversas, e es de aquels que es petit, e es de aquels que es mot magnificat.
It happens to some men many times in their bellies and in other parts of their bodies growths which are called fungal because of their similarity to mushrooms, of which the root is thin and the head is large; and their edges are turned, and some are small, and some are very enlarged.

E yeu ja e vist un, e en le ventre de lu eran dos theils les quals eran mays a funges semblantz, e no era diferencia entre aquels blancs, de menuda razitz.
And I have seen one, and in its belly were two growths which were more like mushrooms, and there was no difference between those white ones, with a small root.

E ja las labias de aquels eran enversadas e se fendian, e humiditat corria de aquel tot temps.
And their edges were inverted and split, and moisture ran from it all the time.

Donc yeu inscidegui aquels e atrobegui en la un en pes quays xviii unc. e l’autre quays vi unc.
So I cut them and found in one a weight of about 18 ounces and the other about 6 ounces.

E la operacio en la inscizio de lor es que consideres lahoras si·l malaute es humit, e la color de atheil es blanca, humit, de subtil razitz; lahoras tu le inscideys am spatum lat, e sian en la presencia tua cauteris en le foc, quar motas veguadas deves la seccio de lu es expellit mot sanc; e si te ventz le sanc, cauteriza aquel.
And the operation in cutting them is that you consider then if the patient is moist, and the color of the growth is white, moist, with a thin root; then you cut it with a broad spatula, and have cauteries in the fire in your presence, because often after cutting it much blood is expelled; and if the blood overcomes you, cauterize it.

E si vezes le malaute pauruc e temeros, guarda te de inscizio am ferr; mays lahoras pren fiel de plom recent fayt, e strenh am aquel atheil, la manieyra del qual es aquela que havem dita; e leyssa aquel per dos dias.
And if you see the patient fearful and timid, beware of cutting with iron; but then take newly made lead wire, and tighten the growth with it, the manner of which is that which we have said; and leave it for two days.

E aprop ajusta en la strictura del fil de plom; donc, no cesses strenher le plom granre devetz en theil, entro que sia abscindit e cayha per se ses trebalh.
And afterwards add to the tightening of the lead wire; so, do not cease to tighten the lead many times on the growth, until it is cut off and falls by itself without effort.

Mays si theil es de grossa razitz, lahoras en la inscizio de lu es alcuna causa de temor e de paor, e majorment en aquel que es en le ventre.
But if the growth has a thick root, then in cutting it there is some cause for concern and fear, especially in that which is on the belly.

Mays possibla es que tu inscindas la maytat de lu , e aprop cauteriza aquel per que no retorne.
But it is possible that you cut half of it, and afterwards cauterize it so that it does not return.

E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanada la plagua.
And afterwards treat it until the wound is healed.

E guarda te que tu no presumas inscidir theil le qual es de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, de leg reguardament, quar aquel es absi cancros.
And beware that you do not presume to cut a growth which is of dark color, of little feeling, of ugly appearance, because that is almost cancerous.

E yeu vindre am rememoracio de cranc aprop aysso.
And I will come with a reminder of cancer after this.

Capitol .lii.
Chapter 52

De curacio de eminencia del umbilic.
On the treatment of swelling of the navel.

Eminencia del umbilic es fayta per motas causas; o per fissuras del ciphac le qual es sobre le ventre, e yeys de lu la tela o budel segon que endeve en las autras rupturas; o per sanc le qual flueys de vena o de arceria segon que es denant dit, o per ventositat coarctada en lu.
Swelling of the navel is caused by many things: by fissures in the abdominal wall, from which the membrane or intestine protrudes as in other ruptures; by blood flowing from a vein or artery as mentioned before, or by trapped gas.

Mays si es per fissura del ciphac e per yssiment de la tela, lahoras la color del apostema es semblant a la color del cors; e es leon ses dolor, e aprop appar de divers situament.
But if it's due to a fissure in the abdominal wall and protrusion of the membrane, then the color of the swelling is similar to the body's color; it's soft without pain, and appears in different positions.

E si es per egressio del budel, lahoras le situament de aquel am lu de aquo que havem recontat, de mays vehement diversitat, e cum tu premes aquel am les tieus ditz es occultat, e aprop retorna; e fort leu es am lu so, e es magnificat mot deves le introt de banh e vehement trebalh.
And if it's due to intestinal protrusion, then its position varies more than what we've described, and when you press it with your fingers it disappears, then returns; it's often accompanied by sound, and is greatly enlarged by bathing and strenuous work.

Mays si per humiditat, lahoras es leon e no es occultat quan premes am la tua ma, ni es constrengut, ni es cregut.
But if it's due to fluid, then it's soft and doesn't disappear when you press with your hand, nor is it constrained or enlarged.

E si es per sanc, lahoras am aquestz senhals apareys le apostema a negror declinant.
And if it's due to blood, then with these signs the swelling appears to be darkening.
