E cum aquela nodacio es antiquada e corr de la humiditat aygosa blanca o poyridura subtil, e alcunas veguadas so de aquestas fistulas alcunas penetrantz.
And when that nodule is old and a white watery fluid or thin pus flows from it, and sometimes some of these fistulas are penetrating.

E aquelas penetrantz so conogudas per aquo que es eyssit de aquelas per la egressio e per ventosetat; e alcunas vetz use le malaute de egressio, e fort leu es eyssit de aquelas verm.
And those penetrating ones are known by what comes out of them through excretion and flatulence; and sometimes the patient experiences excretion, and very easily a worm comes out of them.

E so de aquelas fistulas alcunas veguadas en l’espazi penetrantz entro a la vesica, e entro al meat de la vergua; e so de aquelas penetrantz entro la junctura de la coyssa e entro al notz de la coeta.
And some of these fistulas are sometimes in the space penetrating to the bladder, and to the urethra; and some of them penetrate to the joint of the thigh and to the tailbone.

E aquo en que es conoguda fistula penetrant entro al cul e no-penetrant, es que tu metas le tieu dit endic en le cul, e entrometas tenta subtil de eram o de ferr en la fistula quan no y es turtuositat.
And that by which a fistula penetrating to the anus and a non-penetrating one is known, is that you put your index finger in the anus, and insert a thin probe of copper or iron into the fistula when there is no tortuosity.

Mays si en aquela es turtuositat, lahoras entromet en aquela tenta subtil de plom o de pels de caval entro que tu sentas la tenta o le pel en le tieu dit.
But if there is tortuosity in it, then insert a thin probe of lead or horsehair into it until you feel the probe or the hair with your finger.

E si no sentas aquela de tot ni no procezeys del trauc alcuna causa de egestio ni verm ni ventositat, ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras sapias que es no-penetrant, e lahoras coyta te a la curacio.
And if you don't feel it at all and nothing comes out of the hole like excrement or worm or flatulence, as we have said, then know that it is non-penetrating, and then hasten to the cure.

E quan la fistula es penetrant entro a la vesica o entro al meat de la vergua, lahoras la significacio de lu es eyssiment de urina de aquela e prohibicio de lu ad aysso que·l loc am medicina sia consolidat.
And when the fistula is penetrating to the bladder or to the urethra, then its sign is the exit of urine from it and its prevention from being healed with medicine.

Mays si es penetrant entro la junctura de la coyssa o entro al os e envencio de dolor en le circuit, lahoras senhal de lu es que la tenta perve entro aqui si en lu no es turtuositat entro al os, e envencio de dolor en le circuit de la partida; e que de lu yeys poyredura tostemps; e que no val en aquela medicacio, ni es consolidada am enguent.
But if it is penetrating to the joint of the thigh or to the bone and there is pain around it, then it is a sign that the probe reaches there if there is no twisting to the bone, and there is pain in the area around the part; and that pus always comes out of it; and that medication does not help, nor is it healed with ointment.

E en totas aquelas fistulas penetrant no es curacio de tot, e la curacio de aquelas es trebalh e vanetat dels folyls metges sobre·l qual so fermatz.
And in all these penetrating fistulas there is no complete cure, and the cure of these is the work and vanity of foolish doctors on which they are fixed.

Mays en aquela que no es penetrant e no antiqua, sanacio am ferr es sperada segon que yeu a tu recomtare, e aquo que ja yeu e proat.
But in that which is not penetrating and not old, healing with iron is expected as I will tell you, and that which I have already proven.

E es que le malaute jagua entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos e eleva las cambas de lu entro sus, las coyssas sian enclinadas al ventre de lu, e aprop entromet tenta de plom, o de eram si es en la fistula turtuositat, entro que sapias le loc on perve la tenta.
And it is that the patient lies between your hands on his back and raises his legs up, the thighs are inclined to his belly, and then insert a lead or copper probe if there is twisting in the fistula, until you know the place where the probe reaches.

E si aquela sent le malaute entorn le cuol, lahora cove que tu entrometas le tieu dit endic en le cuol.
And if the patient feels that around the anus, then you should insert your index finger into the anus.

E si sentas en le tieu dit la tenta ja per si meteyssa descuberta penetrar, otra aquo que sentas entre le tieu dit e aquela siphac o carn, lahoras sapias certanament que aquela es penetrant; e adonc no trebalhes en aquela, quar no es en aquela sanacio, ayssi cum havem dit.
And if you feel with your finger the probe already uncovered penetrating by itself, beyond what you feel between your finger and that membrane or flesh, then know for certain that it is penetrating; and then do not work on it, for there is no healing in it, as we have said.

Mays empero diyssero alcus que es sana en alcus homes tart.
But some said that it is rarely healed in some men.

E de la medicacio per la qual es sperat juvament en lu es que tu ignes cauteri subtil segon le ample de la fistula, ayssi cum es precedit, e intrometas aquel ignit en la fistula entro que pervengua entorn le cuol; e aprop itera aquel doas o tres vetz entro que sapias que ja son adhustas totas aquelas carns ajustadas fistuladas que so semblantz a cana de pluma de ausel.
And of the medication by which help is expected in it is that you heat a thin cautery according to the width of the fistula, as has been done before, and insert that heated instrument into the fistula until it reaches around the anus; and then repeat that two or three times until you know that all those joined fistulated flesh that are similar to a bird’s feather quill have already been burned.

E aprop cura aquela am calguas envolopadas en boder entro que en yescan totas aquelas carns que so adhustas, e aprop cura aquela am medicinas la carn engendrantz e consolidantz, e si es sanada, bo es; e sino, lahoras no es sana en degun temps per autra curacio.
And then treat it with poultices wrapped in cloth until all that burned flesh comes out, and then treat it with medicines that generate flesh and consolidate, and if it is healed, good; and if not, then it is not healed at any time by another cure.

E si la tenta intra, e no penetra entro·l tieu dit le qual es en le cul, e entre aquel e la tenta que es velament spes de carn o de ciphac, e vezes la fistula en aquo que siec la superficia de la codena, lahoras secca la codena del comensament de la fistula, e tu ve seccan am la tenta, e sia en la fistula entro que la seccio pervengua al loc en le qual perve la extremitat de la tenta, e per la tenta es liberat e catz.
And if the probe enters, and does not penetrate to your finger which is in the anus, and between that and the probe there is a thick veil of flesh or membrane, and you see the fistula in what follows the surface of the skin, then cut the skin from the beginning of the fistula, and you go cutting with the probe, and let it be in the fistula until the cut reaches the place where the end of the probe reaches, and by the probe it is freed and falls.

E aprop mundifiqua aquelas carns fistuladas las quals so asembladas a canula de pena de ausel e no romangua de aquelas alcuna causa.
And then clean those fistulated flesh which are similar to a bird’s feather quill and let nothing of those remain.

Mays si flux de sanc vezes que vengua entre tu e la tua opperacio quan ensideysses aquelas carns, lahoras le milh que sia e del pus leugier instrument es cauterizar am foc o am medicina acuta, quar cauteri am foc ajusta bonas doas habitutz: so es adhustio de aquelas carns ajustadas, e abscizio del sanc exseccacio de las humiditatz.
But if you see that a flow of blood comes between you and your operation when you cut those flesh, then the best and lightest instrument is to cauterize with fire or with sharp medicine, for cautery with fire adds two good effects: that is burning of those joined flesh, and stopping of the blood and drying of the humidities.

E aprop cura aquela am calguas envolopadas en boder o en caus trissat entro que·l loc geta brac, e aprop lahoras cura la plagua am enguentz carn dura engendran e consolidan.
And then treat it with poultices wrapped in cloth or in crushed lime until the place discharges pus, and then treat the wound with ointments that generate hard flesh and consolidate.

E so medicinas en las quals so stipticitat e exseccio; quan lahoras es restaurada ja es sanada e no temes iteracio.
And these are medicines in which there are astringency and drying; when then it is restored it is already healed and you do not fear repetition.

Mays si la fistula ja perve entro al preon del cul e es elonguada de lu superficia del cos, lahoras entromet le tieu dit en le cul e inquireys am aquel.
But if the fistula already reaches to the depth of the anus and is elongated from the surface of the body, then insert your finger into the anus and investigate with it.

E donc si centes la tenta e entre tu e ela es velament de ciphac o de carn, e es propda a la penetracio, lahora no es operacio en lu sino segon via di fiducia e de speransa.
And then if you feel the probe and between you and it is a veil of membrane or flesh, and it is close to penetration, then there is no operation in it except according to the way of trust and hope.

La qual causa es aministrar en lu una de tres manieyras: o que cauterize aquela ayssi cum havem dit; o que secces aquela entro que consieguas la conquavitat de lu per que sia a tu possible entrometre las qualcas e la curacio propdana; e no procesiscas mot am seccio per so que no inscidas le lacert contenent le cuol, e que accidisque sobre le malaute eyssiment de la egistio ses voluntat; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit quar fort leu sira sanat; o que elongues aquel velament e mondes aquel pus que seccas aquel entro prop le cul, ayssi cum havem dit, o am tenta o am autre instrument de aguda extremitat, e aprop mondifique aquelas carns fistuladas las quals so en la seccio entro la on podes am percrustacio; e aprop esforsa te a far la restauracio de tota la plagua am seccio, e si le orrifici pus desus no es consolidat, e romangua la fistula uberta en la partida del cul, e sira pus leugier per le malaute.
The matter is to administer in one of three ways: either cauterize it as we have said; or cut it until you reach its cavity so that it is possible for you to introduce the instruments and the proper cure; and do not proceed much with cutting so that you do not cut the muscle containing the anus, and that accidental discharge of excrement without will occurs to the patient; and afterwards cure it with what we have said because it will be healed very quickly; or that you elongate that veil and clean it more than you cut it until near the anus, as we have said, or with a probe or with another instrument with a sharp end, and afterwards purify those fistulated flesh which are in the cut up to where you can with encrustation; and afterwards strive to make the restoration of the whole wound with cutting, and if the upper orifice is not consolidated, and the fistula remains open in the part of the anus, it will be easier for the patient.

E alscunas veguadas la fistula es finida segon aquesta manieyra: es quan tu entrometas la tenta en la fistula, e es en le latz del cul entorn la superficia del cos am la codena e en le marge del cul, lahoras pren tenta de perforada extremitat, que es ayssi cum agulha de preparantz les coers segon aquesta forma:
And sometimes the fistula is finished in this way: it is when you introduce the probe into the fistula, and it is on the side of the anus around the surface of the body with the skin and on the edge of the anus, then take a probe with a perforated end, which is like a needle of those who prepare leathers according to this form:

e entromet en aquela fiel envolopat de v fiels o entorn aquels; e aprop entromet tenta am fiel en la fistula entro que consiegua la conquavitat de lu.
and introduce in it a thread wrapped with five threads or around those; and afterwards introduce the probe with thread into the fistula until it reaches its cavity.

Mays si es penetrant en le marge del cul prop dedintz, lahoras tu extratz le fiel de aquel trauc ayssi que tu intrometas le tieu dit en le cul; e extraguas la extremitat del fiel e ajustes las duas extremitatz essemps, e estrenh cascuna, e leyssa aquo per un dia o per dos, e quan mays inscideys le fiel en la carn, estrenh be aquel entro que aquelas carns sian inscididas las quals so entre doas extremitatz del fiel e que cajan.
But if it is penetrating in the edge of the anus near inside, then you extract the thread from that hole so that you introduce your finger into the anus; and extract the end of the thread and join the two ends together, and tighten each one, and leave it for a day or two, and when the thread cuts more into the flesh, tighten it well until those flesh are cut which are between two ends of the thread and that fall.

E aprop cura la plagua entro que sia consolidada e sanada.
And afterwards cure the wound until it is consolidated and healed.

Mays si le orrifici de la fistula no es penetrant, lahoras fay aquel penetrar, en qualque manieyre sia a tu preparat, sino que sia mot en le preon, quar no es a tu que fassas aquo per que no inscidas le lacert; e aprop fay am aquela entro que sia sanada.
But if the orifice of the fistula is not penetrating, then make it penetrate, in whatever way it is prepared for you, unless it is very deep, because it is not for you to do that so that you do not cut the muscle; and afterwards do with it until it is healed.

La forma de spatum spinos am lo qual es fenduda la fistula: la curvitat del qual es mot aguda e l’autra partida es no-aguda, per so que no inscidas aquo que no es necessari, ayssi cum vezes.
The form of the spiny spatula with which the fistula is split: the curvature of which is very sharp and the other part is not sharp, so that you do not cut what is not necessary, as you see.

De sutura de emorroydas en las quals corra sanc en la inscizio de aquelas.
About the suture of hemorrhoids in which blood flows in their incision.

Emorroydas so segon dos manieyras, quar o so entre le cul semblantz aysi que es de carbos, o quays aquelas sian cum a gras de rasim.
Hemorrhoids are of two types, because they are either between the anus resembling as if it were coals, or almost as if they were grape seeds.

E de aquelas so petitas e grans, e que le sanc corr de aquelas tostemps e es una, e so motas, e so fora·l cul, e en las extremitatz de lu.
And of those are small and large, and blood always flows from them and it is one, and they are many, and they are outside the anus, and at its extremities.

Mays empero aquelas que so foro le cul so segon las mes de pauca humiditat, de las quals corr aygua citrina o un petit de sanc am cos continuabla, e so segon la color del cos.
But however those that are outside the anus are usually of little humidity, from which flows citrine water or a little blood with continuous body, and they are according to the color of the body.

E la curacio de aquela que es dedintz le cuol es que comandes al malaute que se assela e que se exprema entro que le cuol yesca e las emoroydas apparescan a tu.
And the cure of that which is inside the anus is that you command the patient to sit and to squeeze until the anus comes out and the hemorrhoids appear to you.

Adonc tu te coyte e suspen am uncis o que tenguas aquelas am la tua ungla, e aprop incideys aquelas deves las suas razitz.
Then you hurry and suspend with hooks or that you hold those with your nail, and afterwards cut those towards their roots.

Mays si les uncis no so tengutz en aquelas per la humiditat de lor e mollificacio de aquelas, lahoras pren aquelas am drap aspre o am coto o am flassada de lana, e extratz aquelas am les tieus ditz, e aprop inscideys aquelas e polveriza sobre lor alcunas polveras caudas aprop la inscizio, per que sian ad aquelas en loc de cauteri; o cauteriza aquelas segon que es precedit en le capitol de cauterizar.
But if the hooks are not held in those because of their humidity and softening of those, then take those with rough cloth or with cotton or with wool blanket, and extract those with your fingers, and afterwards cut those and sprinkle over them some hot powders after the incision, so that they are to those in place of cautery; or cauterize those as it is preceded in the chapter on cauterizing.

E aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.
And afterwards cure those with the other cure until they are healed.

E si le cul no obezeys a egressio, lahoras cristerisa le malaute am cristeri en le qual sia mordicacio petita, e sia lavat am aquel aquo que es en le cuol e que obezesca a egressio leugierament quan le malaute s’esprem.
And if the anus does not obey to excretion, then administer an enema to the patient with a mild irritant, and wash with that what is in the anus so that it obeys to excretion easily when the patient strains.

Mays si las emorroydas so defora le cul, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiera, e es que tu prenguas aquelas am la tua ungla, o que prenguas aquelas am unci, e inscidas aquelas, e aprop cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit entro que sian sanadas.
But if the hemorrhoids are outside the anus, then their cause is easier, and it is that you take them with your nail, or that you take them with a hook, and cut them, and afterwards treat them with what we have said until they are healed.

E aquel que avoreys inscizio, cove que aministres sutura de lor segon aquesta manieyra: pren fiel envolopat e entromet aquel en agulha e aprop extratz las emorroydas a las partidas dessus, e fay aquel penetrar am la agulha en la razit del autra part, e envolveys las doas extramitatz del fiel en la partida pus dejos de la agulha, e so latitudinalment; e estrenh la emorroyda am strectura fort, e aprop noza le fiel e extratz la agulha.
And for those who avoid cutting, it is suitable to administer sutures to them in this manner: take wrapped thread and insert it into a needle and then extract the hemorrhoids to the upper parts, and make it penetrate with the needle into the root of the other part, and wrap the two ends of the thread in the lower part of the needle, and this laterally; and tighten the hemorrhoid with a strong tightening, and afterwards tie the thread and extract the needle.

E fay aquo a totas, e layssa de aquelas una e no la cozes, per so que la superfluitat del sanc corra de aquela.
And do this to all of them, and leave one of them and do not sew it, so that the excess blood flows from it.

E aprop pausa sobre le cul drap enfus en oli rozat o en cerot; e pausa aquel sobre·l cuol e comanda al malaute que·s repause.
And afterwards place on the anus a cloth soaked in rose oil or in wax; and place that on the anus and command the patient to rest.

E aprop layssa aquela entro que caja; e quan es casuda, cura aquelas am enguentz o am autra curacio entro que sia sanat.
And afterwards leave that until it falls; and when it has fallen, treat those with ointments or with other treatment until it is healed.

De curacio de fistulas.
On the treatment of fistulas.

Motas veguadas accideys per exseccacio de fenda o per costriccio de natura.
Many times it happens due to drying of a crack or by constriction of nature.

E cum so antiquadas e no val en aquela medicina, lahoras cove que tu razas aquelas am la puncta de spatum o am la tua ungla entro que sian faytas humidas e sia hostada de aquelas la escorsa pus desus, la qual prohibeys aquelas de consolidacio; e aprop cura aquelas entro que sian consolidadas.
And when they are old and medicine does not work on them, then it is suitable that you scrape them with the point of a spatula or with your nail until they are made moist and the uppermost layer is removed from them, which prevents them from healing; and afterwards treat them until they are healed.

Lahoras tu osta aquelas am razio pus vehement que la primieyra entro que mot sancno e sian excoriadas; e aprop cura aquelas entro que sian sanadas.
Then you remove them with more vehement scraping than the first until they bleed a lot and are excoriated; and afterwards treat them until they are healed.

De curacio de almesamir, so es clau.
On the treatment of almesamir, that is, wart.

Sapias que alamermar, so es clau, e no es si no notz redon segon la color del cors semblant a cap de claviel, e es fayt en tot le cors e majorment en las partidas dejos les pes e als ditz, e endeve per aquels dolor deves le anament.
Know that alamermar, that is wart, and it is nothing but round knots according to the color of the body similar to the head of a nail, and it is made in all the body and mainly in the parts below the feet and on the toes, and it causes pain when walking.

E adonc cove que sia inscidit aquo que es en le circuit del clau, e sia tengut am les forfexs o am unci, e sia eradicat de la sua razit; e aprop cura aquel.
And then it is suitable that what is in the circuit of the wart be cut, and be held with tweezers or with a hook, and be eradicated from its root; and afterwards treat it.

E si vols, cauteriza le segont que es precedit en le sieu capitol.
And if you want, cauterize it according to what is preceded in its chapter.

Mays de veruca es eminencia petita aspre fistulada redonda sobre la superficia del cos, e motas veguadas veno en las mas dels enfantz.
But veruca is a small rough fistulated round prominence on the surface of the body, and many times they come on the hands of children.

E curacio de lu es que estendas e inscidas aquela, o que estrenhas aquela am fiel o am pel entro que caja.
And its treatment is that you stretch and cut it, or that you tighten it with thread or with hair until it falls.

E si vols, cauteriza aquo, segon que havem dit, am foc o am medicina acuta.
And if you want, cauterize it, as we have said, with fire or with sharp medicine.

E ja so eradicadas enversas e no-enversas am le instrument le qual yeu diyre.
And they are already eradicated inverted and non-inverted with the instrument which I will tell.

Mays formica es eminencia petita feutrada o fistulada grossa sobre la superficia del cos anant mot en le preon, e quan le freg atroba aquela es centit en lu semblant de mordificacio de formigua, e es fayta entorn le cos.
But formica is a small felted or fistulated large prominence on the surface of the body going very deep, and when the cold finds it, it is felt in it similar to the bite of an ant, and it is made around the body.

E curacio de lu es que prenguas una canula de pena de auca o de pena de voltor, e sia fort, e pausa aquela sobre la formigua entro que la contengua le cercle de la canula de las partidas de lu; e aprop revolveys la tua ma am la canula entro que inscidas aquo que es en le circuit de la formigua, e pauses aquela en le preon de la carn, e que eradiques la formigua de la sua razit.
And its treatment is that you take a tube of goose feather or of vulture feather, and it should be strong, and place it on the formica until the circle of the tube contains the parts of it; and afterwards revolve your hand with the tube until you cut what is in the circuit of the formica, and place it in the depth of the flesh, and that you eradicate the formica from its root.

E si vols, fay aquo am canula de eram o de ferr segon aquesta forma:
And if you want, do this with a tube of copper or of iron according to this form:

Sia la partida desus de la canulha trahent a subtilitat, sorda (so es no-perforada), envolopada per so que sobre le dit la aprencio de lu sia ablaviada e la revolucio de aquela.
Let the upper part of the tube be drawing to subtlety, deaf (that is, not perforated), wrapped so that on the finger the grasping of it is facilitated and its revolution.

E si vols cauteriza la formiga segon que es denant dit en la cauterizacio de atheyl en le capitol de cauteri.
And if you want cauterize the formica according to what is said before in the cauterization of atheyl in the chapter on cautery.

De forma dels instrumentz que so aministratz a dar cristeri.
On the form of instruments used to administer enemas.

Alcunas veguadas es fayt cristeri de argent o de lato o de eram fondut o malleat; e alcunas veguadas es fayt de aquels instrumentz petit e gran segon aquels als quals so aministratz, quar aquel que es aministrat en la curacio dels petitz enfants sia petit; e de aquel dels quals los culs son freuls o doloyrozes, les cristeris de aquels sian petitz.
Sometimes enemas are made of silver, brass, or melted or hammered copper; and sometimes these instruments are made small and large according to those to whom they are administered, for that which is administered in the treatment of small children should be small; and for those whose bottoms are weak or painful, their enemas should be small.

La forma de cristeri gran e pauc:
The form of large and small enemas:

Le cap de la canula de lu desus en le qual es liada la borsa sia ampla segon aquesta manieyra; e sia a lu distinacio la on la borsa es liada ayssi cum vezes.
The upper head of the cannula to which the bag is tied should be wide in this manner; and there should be a distinction where the bag is tied as you see.

E la extremitat de lu pus dejus, la qual es entromesa en le cul, sia sorda (so es no-uberta) mot leon, atrasent a subtilita; e en la un del latz de lu sian dos traucs, e en l’autre costat un trauc, e sia la amplesa del trauc segon la groseza dels rays e pus gros un petit.
And the lower extremity, which is inserted into the bottom, should be smooth (that is, not open) very slender, tending to fineness; and on one side of it should be two holes, and on the other side one hole, and the width of the hole should be according to the thickness of the rays and a little thicker.

E sia la borsa en la qual sian pausadas las medicinas de vesica de bestia o de pel de ovelha, e la razit de lu sia un palm.
And the bag in which the medicines are placed should be of animal bladder or sheep skin, and its root should be a palm long.

E sia perforada per motz traucs ayssi cum es revolvuda; e si l’espazi le qual es entre les traucs la grossetut del dit.
And it should be perforated by many holes as it is rolled; and if the space between the holes is the thickness of a finger.

E aprop entromet en aquels traucs fiel fort de fiel cru le qual sia de detz fiels, o enviro aquels; e ajusta am aquel la borsa; e quan es pausada en lu la borsa, sia streyt en le cap del cristeri entre dos distingentz am fort costriccio, e aprop cristeriza am aquel quascun trauc: Mays la qualitat de cristerizar am aquel es que tu omples la borsa de la medicina, que sia escalfada segon la quantitat de la tolleransa del malaute; e guarda te que no sia trop cauda ni trop freja.
And then insert into those holes strong thread of raw thread which should be of ten threads, or thereabouts; and join the bag with it; and when the bag is placed in it, tighten it at the head of the enema between two distinctions with strong constriction, and then administer the enema through each hole: But the quality of administering with it is that you fill the bag with medicine, which should be heated according to the amount the patient can tolerate; and be careful that it is not too hot or too cold.

E aprop le malaute sia resupinat sobre le sieu dos, e eleva las suas cambas en sus e pausa dejos lu un cuer sobre le qual ja so les homes o un lansol; e aprop unta la extramitat del cauteri am oli o am album de huou o am mucellage de fenugrec o de semblantz; e aprop entromet aquel en le cul am facilitat, e aprop le ministre prengua la borsa e exprema aquel am doas mas e essemps am vehemencia entro que sia evacuat en le budelh tot aquo que es en le cristeri; e aprop extra le cristeri e le malaute leva las suas cambas a la paret.
And then the patient should lie on his back, and raise his legs up and place underneath him a leather on which men have already lain or a sheet; and then anoint the extremity of the enema with oil or egg white or with mucilage of fenugreek or similar; and then insert it into the bottom with ease, and then the minister should take the bag and squeeze it with both hands and together with force until all that is in the enema is evacuated into the bowel; and then remove the enema and the patient raises his legs to the wall.

E si la medicina forsa aquel a eyssiment, tengua le tant quant poyra; e si dorm am aquel per tota una nueyt, es mays derier en juvament.
And if the medicine forces him to evacuate, let him hold it as long as he can; and if he sleeps with it for a whole night, it is more beneficial.

Mays si tu cristerizas aquel en las malautias de solucio de ventre e l’eyssiment de lu le coyta, lahoras tu itera le cauteri entro que sia sanat.
But if you administer an enema to him for illnesses of looseness of the belly and the evacuation hurries him, then you repeat the enema until he is healed.

E si en le cul so emorroydas o apostemas ledens, lahoras sia le cristeri mot subtil e leon, dels cristeris am les quals les enfantz so criterisatz.
And if in the bottom there are hemorrhoids or painful swellings, then let the enema be very fine and slender, of the enemas with which children are treated.

De curacio de las plaguas.
On the treatment of wounds.

Yeu ja e dit en la divisio de la curacio de las plaguas aquo que convenia al libre, e yeu dic assi la curacio de aquelas am ma e am medicinas segon le conpliment.
I have already said in the division of the treatment of wounds what was appropriate to the book, and I say here the treatment of those by hand and with medicines according to the completion.

Donc dic que las plaguas son diversificadas segon aquo en que son faytas las plaguas e segon le loc sobre le qual cazo las plaquas.
Therefore I say that wounds are diverse according to what the wounds are made in and according to the place on which the wounds fall.

E las causas per que motas vetz son faytas las plaguas so ayssi cum getament de peyra, o inscisio d’espaza o de cotel, o percussio am lansa, o am fustz, o am sageta, o semblantz ad aquels de motas causas.
And the causes by which wounds are often made are such as throwing of stone, or cutting with sword or knife, or striking with lance, or with sticks, or with arrow, or similar to those of many things.

Mays las plaguas que so en les locz del cos so ayssi cum plagua la qual catz sobre le cap, o·l col, o·l pietz, o·l ventre, o·l fitge, e semblantz ad aquels dels membres.
But the wounds that are in the places of the body are such as a wound which falls on the head, or the neck, or the chest, or the belly, or the liver, and similar to those of the limbs.

E yeu so recomtant la curacio de alcunas plaguas per que pauses aquela ratiocinacio e regla sobre las autras plaguas.
And I am recounting the treatment of some wounds so that you may apply that reasoning and rule to other wounds.

E yeu comensare de las plaguas del cap simplas, quar la rememoracio de las compostas vindra al comensament del tertz capitol.
And I will begin with simple wounds of the head, for the remembrance of compound wounds will come at the beginning of the third chapter.

Donc dic que quan accideys en le cap plagua simpla e no es fractura, lahoras considera: si es per getament de peyra o de semblant, e ja ha trinquada la codena tant solament e es gran plagla e temes sobre aquel malaute havinement de apostema caut, lahoras tu te coyta e fleubotoma la cephalica tantost, e no tardas aquo; e extrats ad aquel del sanc segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu si no mes alcuna causa prohibent de fleubotomia, majorment si·l sanc que es eyssit de la plagua es pauc.
So I say that when you encounter a simple wound on the head and there is no fracture, then consider: if it is from a stone throw or similar, and has only broken the skin and is a large wound, and you fear a hot abscess may form on that patient, then you hurry and bleed the cephalic vein immediately, and do not delay this; and extract blood from him according to the strength of his virtue if there is nothing prohibiting bloodletting, especially if the blood that has come out of the wound is little.

E sia la flaubotomia del contrari de la partida plaguada; e guardase le malaute de replecio e de vi e de viandas grossas.
And let the bloodletting be from the opposite side of the wounded part; and let the patient guard against repletion and wine and heavy foods.

Mays si de la minuicio prohibeys alcuna causa, lahoras sia aminorat de la vianda e no apropinque a carn ni a vi.
But if something prohibits the bleeding, then let the food be reduced and do not approach meat or wine.

E pausa sobre la plagua, si a lu accideys apostema caut, coto enfus en oli rozat solet o en vi en le qual es stipticat.
And place on the wound, if a hot abscess occurs, cotton soaked in rose oil alone or in wine in which it is styptic.

Mays si est segur de apostema caut, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua, si es recent am le sieu sanc e le ayre no ha mudat aquela la polvera la qual yeu recomtare aprop petit.
But if you are sure of a hot abscess, then place on the wound, if it is recent with its blood and the air has not changed it, the powder which I will recount shortly.

E si le ayre ja ha mudada aquela, lahoras pausa sobre alscus enguentz entro que sia sanada.
And if the air has already changed it, then place some ointments on it until it is healed.

Mays si la plagua es gran o es per inscizio d’espaza e de semblantz, e no so ajustadas las labias de lu per puvils, lahoras ajusta aquelas am sutura segon que yeu recomtare de la sutura de lor.
But if the wound is large or is from a sword cut and similar, and the lips of it are not joined by small stitches, then join those with sutures according to what I will recount about their suturing.

Mays si la plagua ja es discuberta del os e pen, e no es retencio de lu sino un petit suspensori, lahoras inscideys aquela e aprop cura la plagua am medicinas e restaura la carn aprop en loc de codena, e comanda al malaute que sia pescut de viandas en las quals es groceza: caps e formen coyt e semblantz a lor, entro que sia compost.
But if the wound is already uncovered to the bone and hanging, and there is no retention of it except a small suspensory, then cut it and afterwards cure the wound with medicines and restore the flesh afterwards in place of skin, and command the patient to be fed with foods in which there is thickness: heads and cooked wheat and similar to them, until it is composed.

E si atrobas en la codena putrefaccio e no adhereys al os, lahoras tu inscideys tot aquo poyrit e geta aquo, e aprop cura aquo.
And if you find putrefaction in the skin and it does not adhere to the bone, then you cut all that is rotten and throw it away, and afterwards cure it.

Mays si en aquestas plaguas es arteria o vena de la qual fluxs de sanc pot evenir, e no es abscindida per medicinas, lahoras tu inquier sobre la arteria, e si atrobas aquela no-inscidida, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am spatum, o lia aquela; e si necessitat te provoca que aquo que havem dit no comfereys, lahoras tu cauteriza entro que·l sanc sia abscidit.
But if in these wounds there is an artery or vein from which blood flow can occur, and it is not cut off by medicines, then you inquire about the artery, and if you find it uncut, then you cut it with a spatula, or tie it; and if necessity provokes you that what we have said does not confirm, then you cauterize until the blood is cut off.

E si aquestas plaguas son simplas e petitas, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiere; enayssi que tu polverizas sobre aquelas aquesta polvera, quar consolidada aquela denant que l’ayre mude aquelas.
And if these wounds are simple and small, then their cause is light; so that you powder over them this powder, for it consolidates them before the air changes them.

E la manieyra de la polvera es aquesta: recipe oli de enses partida una, de sanc de drago partida doas, de caus no-extincta partidas tres; sia tot mot trissat e crivellat, e de lu sia la plagua omplida, e sia constrengida per bona constriccio entro que be sobre aquela aderesca, e sia coagulada am le sanc.
And the manner of the powder is this: take one part incense oil, two parts dragon's blood, three parts unslaked lime; let all be very well ground and sifted, and let the wound be filled with it, and be constrained by good constriction until it adheres well to it, and be coagulated with the blood.

E aprop strengeys aquela desus am pulvils e leyssa aquela, e no la deslias mentre esta ayssi que no es apostemada, quar no es eredicada de lu la medicina entro que sia sanada.
And afterwards tighten it above with small cloths and leave it, and do not untie it while it remains so that it is not abscessed, for the medicine is not eradicated from it until it is healed.

E alcuna vetz fa aquo sola cautz, quan no es a tu en present enses e sanc de drago.
And sometimes lime alone does this, when you do not have incense and dragon's blood present.

E ja fa aquesta meteyssa operacio en las grans plaguas quan conveneys que sia pausada sobre aquelas e sian streytas, e so plaguas recentz am le lor sanc, las quals le ayre no ha alteradas.
And this same operation is already done in large wounds when it is convenient that it be placed on them and they are tightened, and they are recent wounds with their blood, which the air has not altered.

E si le ayre las ha alteradas, e majorment quan es en temps d’estiu, lahoras no es entencio a la posicio de aquesta polvera, mays adonc cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit, enayssi que tu pauses sobre aquelas alcus enguents degistius, o que pauses sobre aquelas pols de la farina del ordi am aygua e mel entro que getan poyredura; e aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.
And if the air has altered them, and especially when it is in summertime, then there is no intention to the position of this powder, but then cure them with what we have said, so that you place on them some digestive ointments, or that you place on them powder of barley flour with water and honey until they throw out rottenness; and afterwards cure them with the other cure until they are healed.

Mays si accideys am la plagua fractura en os, e es petita, lahoras tu extratz aquo am gesti.
But if a fracture in the bone occurs with the wound, and it is small, then you extract it with gestures.

E yeu diyre la cura de las fracturas del cap en aquo que es envenidor.
And I will say the cure of the fractures of the head in what is to come.

De las plaguas del col.
Of the wounds of the neck.

Mays si la plagua accideys en le col, lahoras no es en lu differencia en medicacio, e entre la plagua del cap quan es simpla.
But if the wound happens in the neck, then there is no difference in medication, and between the wound of the head when it is simple.

Mays si ja le nervi del col es inscis o arteria, lahoras si es nervi, no es en lu engen sino que sia evitada curacio de lu am aquo que fa vehement stipticitat, ayssi cum ziniar e zegi que es vetriol e semblantz a lor quar nozo als nervis e contrazo aquel.
But if already the nerve of the neck is cut or an artery, then if it is a nerve, there is no remedy except to avoid treating it with that which causes strong stypticity, such as zinc and vitriol which are similar to them because they harm the nerves and contract them.

E no pauses sobre la plagua alcuna causa de tot freja, quar la sustancia dels nervis es freja e la continuacio de lu es am le cervel, le qual es le pus aut de totz les membres.
And do not put on the wound anything completely cold, because the substance of the nerves is cold and their continuation is with the brain, which is the highest of all the members.

E si’ aquo am que es curat de medicinas leugieras, ayssi cum es caus lavada am aygua dousa, alcuna veguada enfusa en oli rozat o no-rozat, e thucia quan es lavada am aygua dousa e las autras peyras minarantz segon aquesta manieyra, e enguentz humitz.
And if it is that which is cured with light medicines, such as lime washed with sweet water, sometimes infused in rose oil or non-rose oil, and tutty when it is washed with sweet water and the other mineral stones according to this manner, and moist ointments.

Mays si la plagua es gran, lahoras aministra sutura, o coarta las labias de lu, e aprop cura aquela am pulvils entro que sia sanada.
But if the wound is large, then administer sutures, or bring together its lips, and afterwards cure it with pledgets until it is healed.

Mays si a la plagua es profunditat o accideys en lu a la pus bassa partida poyredura, lahoras perfora aquela en le loc mays depremegut.
But if the wound has depth or rot happens in it in the lowest part, then perforate it in the most depressed place.

Mays si en la plagua ja es inscisa arteria e es conseguit flux de sanc, lahoras separa o secca aquela, o lia aquela, o cauteriza aquela si necessitat te provoca ad aquo.
But if in the wound an artery is already cut and a flow of blood follows, then separate or dry it, or tie it, or cauterize it if necessity provokes you to do so.

Mays si ja ha insciditz les spondils del golayro o tot, e so salvadas las venas del col, lahoras tu ajusta las labias de la codena am sutura sobre la cana del golayro e no toques aquel; abantz egala aquel e reduzeys aquel sobre la sua figura natural, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent, e leyssa aquela per alcus jorns; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz en les quals es stipticitat e excitacio entro que sia sanat.
But if it has already cut the vertebrae of the throat or all, and the veins of the neck are saved, then you join the lips of the skin with sutures over the throat pipe and do not touch it; instead, equalize it and reduce it to its natural figure, and afterwards tighten it with decent tightness, and leave it for some days; and afterwards cure it with ointments in which there is stypticity and stimulation until it is healed.

Mays si la plagua ja en le os a fayta enprecio, lahoras percuireys aquela, e lahoras si en lu ha fragmentz de hos, extratz totz aquels que podes de lor; e aquo que a tu no es apparelhat, leyssa aquo entro que la plagua se poyrisca, e sia separat e la egrecio de lu sia alleujada.
But if the wound has already made an impression on the bone, then examine it, and then if there are fragments of bone in it, extract all those that you can of them; and that which is not prepared for you, leave it until the wound rots, and be separated and its severity be alleviated.

E si la plagua es recent lahoras polveriza sobre aquela polvera la qual t'e recomtada.
And if the wound is recent then sprinkle over it the powder which I have recounted to you.

Mays si en la plagua es fayta fistula, lahoras cura aquela am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra aprop en le sieu capitol.
But if in the wound a fistula is made, then cure it with that which the remembrance will come after in its chapter.

De las plaguas del col o de semblantz quan fayta entre las spallas e es fayta am spaza o am cotel o am lansa o am semblantz.
Of the wounds of the neck or similar when made between the shoulders and is made with sword or with knife or with lance or with similar.

Si es percussio de lansa o de cotel, e vezes de lu la profunditat, lahoras considera mays si de la plagua yeys ventositat quan le malaute elena; lahoras sapias que la plagua es mortal.
If it is a blow from a lance or knife, and you see its depth, then consider more if from the wound comes windiness when the patient breathes; then know that the wound is mortal.

E si en lu no es profunditat e la plagua es recent am le sieu sanc, lahoras tu pauses en lu de la primieyra horo polvera, e no strenhas aquel per que no sia le sanc retengut en la profunditat de lu e que retorne al cor e que aucigua le malaute, mays pausa en lu enguent atractiu, e deslia aquela doas veguadas le dia.
And if in it there is no depth and the wound is recent with its blood, then you put in it from the first hour powder, and do not tighten it so that the blood is not retained in its depth and that it returns to the heart and kills the patient, but put in it attractive ointment, and untie it twice a day.

E si l’enguent no es a tu present, lahoras tu pausa en le orrifici de la plagua coto viel per que sucque aquo que yeys de las humiditatz; e fay que le malaute dorma sobre la plagua per que corra aquo que es en lu ajustat.
And if the ointment is not present to you, then you put in the orifice of the wound old cotton so that it sucks that which comes out of the humidities; and make the patient sleep on the wound so that runs that which is gathered in it.

Mays si ja de la plagua son passatz tres dias o mays e no accideys al malaute spasme ni tremor de cor mal ni strictura de ale, e vezes las autras dispozicios bonas de lu, lahoras sapias que plagua es salva; e adonc cura aquela am calguas e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanada.
But if already three days or more have passed from the wound and spasm does not happen to the patient nor tremor of bad heart nor tightness of breath, and you see the other good dispositions of it, then know that the wound is safe; and then cure it with poultices and with the other cure until it is healed.

Mays si la sanacio de lu es excusada, e ja tot temps es uberta, lahoras sapias que ja es fayta fistula; cura donc aquela per le sieu capitol.
But if its healing is excused, and it is already always open, then know that a fistula has already been made; cure it then by its chapter.

E si la plagua es per inscisio de spaza o de cotel, e es simpla en la superficia del pietz o del dos, lahoras cura aquela am aquo que es precedit de sutura, si es gran, o am polvera, si es petita.
And if the wound is by incision of sword or knife, and is simple on the surface of the chest or back, then cure it with that which is preceded by suture, if it is large, or with powder, if it is small.

Mays si ja ha fayta enprecio en le os, e so ja de lu inscizas pessas, lahoras tu torqua la plagua e coyta ad extrayre aquelas pessas, si so separadas.
But if it has already made an impression on the bone, and pieces are already cut from it, then you clean the wound and hasten to extract those pieces, if they are separated.

Mays si no so separadas, lahoras leyssa las entro que se poyresca la plagua, que la extraccio de lor es alleujada.
But if they are not separated, then leave them until the wound rots, so that their extraction is alleviated.

E de las autras plaguas accidentz en les autres membres le juvament en curacio es le juvament de aquo que havem dit.
And of the other wounds happening in the other members, the help in curing is the help of that which we have said.

De las plaguas del ventre.
On the wounds of the belly.

L’indisposicio la qual accideys en le ventre es o gran, o pauc, o migiera.
The discomfort which occurs in the belly is either great, or small, or moderate.

De la gran alcunas veguadas yeys le budel o nervi del budel, per que es fayta intromissio de lor e la sutura de lor esser pus vehement e pus subtil.
From the great one, sometimes the intestine or nerve of the intestine comes out, for which their introduction and suturing must be more vigorous and subtle.

E disrupcio petita es fayta dificil per autra manieyra, e siec se que la reduccio de lor es pus dificil, si no te coytes de la intromissio de lor al sieu loc tantost, quar se ubre e es engrossat per que le intrament de lu es fayt difficil.
And a small rupture is made difficult in another way, and it follows that their reduction is more difficult, if you do not hurry to introduce them to their place immediately, because it opens and swells so that its entry becomes difficult.

E donc la milhor disrupcio es migiera, quar en aquela no es dificil la reduccio del budel, ayssi cum es dificil en las doas specias denant ditas.
And so the best rupture is moderate, for in that one the reduction of the intestine is not difficult, as it is difficult in the two species mentioned before.

E sapias que sutura del ventre es segon quatre manieyras, mays doas suturas son comunas que conveneysso en suturas de las autras plaguas del cors.
And know that suturing of the belly is done in four ways, but two sutures are common that are suitable for suturing other wounds of the body.

E duas autras suturas proprias comunican a las autras plaguas, mays empero so mays proprias en la sutura del ventre.
And two other sutures specific to communicating with other wounds, but they are more specific in suturing the belly.

E yeu recomti a tu quascuna am exposicio e declaracio.
And I recount to you each with exposition and declaration.

Donc dic que quan la plagua es petita e es eyssit alcuna causa del budel per aquela, e es fayt dificil a reduzir aquel, lahoras aquo es en una de doas manieyras: o per parvitat de la disrupcio ayssi cum havem dit, o quan al budel es venguda inflacio per la frigiditat de l’ayre.
So I say that when the wound is small and something of the intestine has come out through it, and it is made difficult to reduce it, then it is in one of two ways: either by smallness of the rupture as we have said, or when swelling has come to the intestine due to the coldness of the air.

E donc quan aquo es ayssi, lahora cove que tu scalfes aquel enayssi que tu submerges una sponga ho drap humit en aygua tebeza sola, o que coguas en aygua squinant, e cyperum, e spic, e embroques am aquela le budel entro que la imflacio sia resolvuda.
And so when it is like this, then it is necessary that you warm it so that you submerge a sponge or damp cloth in lukewarm water alone, or that you cook in water squinant, and cyperus, and spike, and you bathe with that the intestine until the swelling is resolved.

E alcunas veguadas fa aquo vi en le qual ha stipticitat, e es milhor que la aygua sola en resolucio de la imflacio.
And sometimes wine does this in which there is astringency, and it is better than water alone in resolving the swelling.

E donc cum tu vezes la imflacio esser resolvuda, lahoras tu humecta le budel am aygua en la qual es coyta altea e malvas, quar per aquo es alleujat le intrament de lu am pauca causa.
And so when you see the swelling being resolved, then you moisten the intestine with water in which althaea and mallows are cooked, for by this its entry is eased with little effort.

Mays si es escusat le intrament de lu aprop aquesta curacio, lahoras scindeys la disrupcio un petit am strument am le qual so inscididas emorroydas.
But if its entry is excused after this treatment, then cut the rupture a little with an instrument with which hemorrhoids are cut.

E la curacio primieyra es milhor, quan es propriada que no es seccio, e no sia occupacio a seccar aprop necessitat e defaliment.
And the first treatment is better, when it is appropriate than cutting is not, and there should not be occupation to dry after necessity and failure.

Del instrument, sec se la forma de lu:
Of the instrument, its form follows:

La una partida de lu torta aguda, e l’autra partida no-acuta, e la extremitat subtil, e no sia am la subtilitat de spatum, abantz sia obtusa un pauc.
One part of it curved and sharp, and the other part not sharp, and the extremity subtle, and not with the subtlety of a spatula, rather it should be a little blunt.

E donc cum la plagua es amplificada e yeys fora le budel, lahoras cove que la sua reduccio sia segon la forma de lu natural, en le sieu loc propri, si es possible sobre aquo, quar milhor es.
And so when the wound is enlarged and the intestine comes out, then it is necessary that its reduction be according to its natural form, in its proper place, if it is possible above this, for it is better.

Mays quan la disrupcio es ampla, e es en la partida pu bassa del ventre, lahoras cove que tu fassas jazer le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa las suas cambas pus autas que·l sieu cap; e si es en la partida pus desus del ventre, lahoras tu pause le cap de lu e·l pietz pus autz que las partidas dejos.
But when the rupture is wide, and is in the lower part of the belly, then it is necessary that you make the patient lie on his back, and place his legs higher than his head; and if it is in the upper part of the belly, then you place his head and chest higher than the lower parts.

E semblantment si la disrupcio es en una de las doas partz del ventre, lahoras pausa la tua entencio e la tua consideracio tostemps en aysso per que la partida en la qual es la plagua sia pus auta que l’autra.
And similarly if the rupture is in one of the two parts of the belly, then place your intention and your consideration always on this so that the part in which the wound is is higher than the other.

E ayssi cove que tu aministres aquo en las plaguas grans e en las plaguas migieras.
And so it is necessary that you administer this in great wounds and in moderate wounds.

E en las plaguas petitas, pausa aquo que es a tu preparat, e aprop fay que·l ministre sia entre las tuas mas pyatados, le qual tengua la disrupcio tota am la sua ma e ajusta las labias de lu, e aprop descuebre de aquela ad aquel que siec la sutura alcuna causa aprop autra.
And in small wounds, place what is prepared for you, and afterwards make the minister be between your hands carefully, who holds the whole rupture with his hand and joins its lips, and afterwards uncover from it to the one who follows the suture something after another.

E aquesta es la manieyra de sutura comuna: una que prenguas la agula, o comte de agula segon la cantitat de la amplitut de la plagua; e aprop layssa de la extremitat de la disrupcio del dit anular, e strenh la agula una, otre que tu no metas fiel en las doas extremitatz de la codena, am doas extremitatz del ciphac que es dejos la codena de las partidas dedintz, entro que fassas aquela penetrar de aquela partida; e tu ja has agreguadas doas extremitatz de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, e so faytas quatre ordes.
And this is the manner of common suture: one where you take the needle, or count of needle according to the quantity of the width of the wound; and after leave from the extremity of the disruption of the ring finger, and tighten the needle one, other that you do not put thread in the two extremities of the skin, with two extremities of the peritoneum which is under the skin of the inner parts, until you make it penetrate from that part; and you have already gathered two extremities of the skin and two extremities of the peritoneum, and so made four orders.

E aprop strenh am fiel doble en le circuit de la agula, e alcunas veguadas de doas partz ensemps, e aprop agregua las doas labias e la plagua per agreguacio decent; e aprop layssa la grossitut del dit e fiqua una autra agulha en aquela, e aprop lia aquela am fiel ayssi cum fiest am la primieyra agulha; e no cesses far aquo si es necessitat am las agulhas entro que ajas complida tota la contriccio de la plagua.
And after tighten with double thread in the circuit of the needle, and sometimes from two parts together, and after gather the two lips and the wound by decent gathering; and after leave the thickness of the finger and stick another needle in it, and after tie it with thread as you did with the first needle; and do not cease to do this if it is necessary with the needles until you have completed all the contraction of the wound.

E sian las agulhas migieras entre groceza e subtilitat, quar las agulhas subtils mot leugierament insciden la carn; e las grossas so de dificil intrament en la codena, e donc per aquo cove que sian migieras en subtilitat e grosseza.
And let the needles be medium between thickness and thinness, for very thin needles easily cut the flesh; and the thick ones are difficult to enter the skin, and therefore for this it is suitable that they be medium in thinness and thickness.

E no cove que la agulha sia ficada en doas extremitatz de la codena propdana mot, per so que la carn no sia inscidida leugierament e que la plagua se huebra devant la sua consolidacio.
And it is not suitable that the needle be stuck in two extremities of the skin very close, so that the flesh is not easily cut and that the wound opens before its consolidation.

E no sian prolonguadas de sutura per que la plagua no sia prohibida de consolidacio.
And they should not be prolonged from suture so that the wound is not prohibited from consolidation.

E aprop inscideys las extremitatz de las agulhas per so que no ledescan le malaute deves le sieu dormier; e pausaras sobre la sutura pulvils expanduts de tota partida, les quals tenguan las extremitatz de las agulhas; e layssa aquelas entro que sapias que la plagua ja es consolidada.
And after cut the extremities of the needles so that they do not hurt the patient towards his sleep; and you will put over the suture expanded pads from all parts, which hold the extremities of the needles; and leave those until you know that the wound is already consolidated.

E aquestas specias de sutura am agulhas en cal manieyra es pus convenient en las plaguas petitas, quar habasta en la sutura de lor una agulha o doas o entorn aquelas.
And these species of suture with needles in which manner is more convenient in small wounds, for it suffices in the suture of them one needle or two or around those.

Mays la segonda sutura es cominal: e es que tu aministres am sutura las quatre extremitatz, de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, en una veguada, am agulha en la qual sia fiel envolopat engual en subtilitat e grosseza.
But the second suture is common: and it is that you administer with suture the four extremities, of the skin and two extremities of the peritoneum, in one time, with needle in which is thread wrapped equal in thinness and thickness.

E aprop quan am la agulha auras penetrat aquestas quatre extremitatz, reduzeys la agulha de aquela meteyssa partida de la qual comensest, per so que le fiel retrayt caja de la pus subirana partida a la plagua, per so que la sutura sia segon sutura de drap am la qual les draps so strengutz.
And after when with the needle you will have penetrated these four extremities, reduce the needle from that same part from which you began, so that the retracted thread falls from the highest part to the wound, so that the suture is according to suture of cloth with which the cloths are tightened.

E pausa entre quascuna sutura la quantitat del gros del dit mendre.
And put between each suture the quantity of the thickness of the little finger.

E aquesta sutura sabo les homes.
And this suture men know.

E am tal sutura yeu cozegui la plagua la qual era accidida a un home en le sieu ventre le qual era stat plaguat am un cotel, e era la disrrumpcio de la plagua major de un palm, e era eyssit dels budels entorn dos palms del budel del mieg loc e era la disrupcio en le mieg del membre; e adonc yeu reduzegui aquel depus que le budel havia stat foro la plagua per xxiiii horas.
And with such suture I sewed the wound which had happened to a man in his belly who had been wounded with a knife, and the disruption of the wound was greater than a palm, and about two palms of the middle intestine had come out and the disruption was in the middle of the member; and then I reduced that after the intestine had been outside the wound for 24 hours.

E la plagua fo consolidada en le spazi de xv dias o entorn, e curegui aquel e es sanat; e aprop aquo visquec per motz ans, e es conversat en las suas disposicios.
And the wound was consolidated in the space of 15 days or around, and I cured that and it is healed; and after that he lived for many years, and is conversed in his dispositions.

E les autres metges havian jutgat que no fora sanat; e per miracle foc, quar yeu no curegui aquel am enguent, quar era en loc en le qual enguent no era atrobat ni deguna medicina, mays pausegui sobre la plagua coto viel dos veguadas lo dia e ablucio assiduo am aygua de mel entro que foc sanat.
And the other doctors had judged that he would not be healed; and by miracle it was, for I did not cure that with ointment, for it was in a place in which ointment was not found nor any medicine, but I put over the wound old cotton twice a day and assiduous ablution with honey water until it was healed.

Mays yeu diyre dos specias de sutura proprias segon narracio de Paraula.
But I will say two species of proper suture according to narration of Word.

E es que tu comenses am sutura de la codena, e entrometas agulha de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz.
And it is that you begin with suture of the skin, and introduce needle from the outside part to the inside part.

E donc cum la agulha penetra en la codena e en aquel meteys lacertz segon rectetut e en longetut de tot le cos, e layssa la extremita del ciphac en le qual has entromesa la agulha; e fay penetrar en la autra extremitat la agulha de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo en l’autra extremitat del mihat.
And so, as the needle penetrates the skin and into the same muscle according to the straightness and length of the whole body, and leaves the extremity of the peritoneum in which you have inserted the needle; and make it penetrate from the inside to the outside at the other extremity of the abdominal wall.

E don cum tu auras fayta aquela penetrar, lahoras tu fay aquela penetrar autra veguada en aquela meteyssa extremitat del mihat de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz; e leyssa la extramitat del ciphac que es en aquest latz, e fay penetrar la agulha en l’autra extremitat de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo.
And when you have made it penetrate, then make it penetrate again at that same extremity of the abdominal wall from the outside to the inside; and leave the extremity of the peritoneum which is on this side, and make the needle penetrate at the other extremity from the inside to the outside.

E fay penetrar am aquela la tua penetracio am la qual fas aquela penetrar en le ciphac en la extremitat del mirat la qual es en la partida de lu entro que tot aquel penetre.
And make it penetrate with your penetration with which you make it penetrate the peritoneum at the extremity of the abdominal wall which is on the side of it until it all penetrates.

E aprop comensa de aquest meteys costat e cus aquel am la extremitat que es del ciphac en l’autra latz, e extratz la agulha de la codena la qual penetrec, e aprop redutz aquela en aquela codena e cos la extremitat del ciphac que es en l’autra costat am aquesta extramitat del mirat; e extratz aquela de la codena la qual es de part de lu.
And afterwards begin from this same side and sew it with the extremity that is of the peritoneum on the other side, and extract the needle from the skin which it penetrated, and afterwards return it to that skin and sew the extremity of the peritoneum which is on the other side with this extremity of the abdominal wall; and extract it from the skin which is on the side of it.

E fay aquo una veguada e autra, e fay aquo una veguada aprop autre veguada entro que tu cozes tot aquo que es deforo segon aquel eysemple.
And do this once and again, and do this once after another time until you sew all that which is outside according to that example.

E la suma de aquesta manieyra de sutura es que tu cozes am sutura de pellicies am la qual cozo las pels, enayssi que tu cozes le ciphac una veguada de la part de la extremitat de la codena, e que leysses aquela autra veguada entro que la ajas complida.
And the sum of this manner of suture is that you sew with a suture of skins with which they sew skins, so that you sew the peritoneum once from the part of the extremity of the skin, and that you leave it another time until you have completed it.

Mays la segonda specia de sutura propria la qual dieys eyssament Gualia , e aquest es de sermo de lu e per lu recomtat, es que tu cozas aquela segon semilitut am la qual alcus medicantz cozo aquela, enayssi que agreguan tota partida a la sua compar partida a lu convenient per natura; e aplican la extremitat de autre de lu e la extremitat del mirat al autra extremitat de lu, e aquo es fayt segon que yeu a tu recomti.
But the second species of proper suture which Galen also said, and this is from his discourse and recounted by him, is that you sew it according to the similarity with which some doctors sew it, so that they aggregate every part to its comparable part convenient to it by nature; and applying the extremity of another to it and the extremity of the abdominal wall to another extremity of it, and this is done according to what I recount to you.

Cove que tu fiques la agulha en la extremitat del mirat a tu propdana de la partida deforo, e fassas aquela penetrar a la partida dedintz en aquel sol, e leysses dos extremitatz del ciphac; e aprop revolveys la agulha e fay aquela penetrar de foro a la dedintz en dos extremitatz del ciphac.
It is appropriate that you fix the needle in the extremity of the abdominal wall closest to you from the outside, and make it penetrate to the inside in that sole, and leave two extremities of the peritoneum; and afterwards turn the needle and make it penetrate from outside to inside in two extremities of the peritoneum.

E aprop revolveys aquelas cascunas, e fay penetrar quascunas de la partida dededintz entro a la partida deforo en dos extremitatz del mirat autras que so en le latz contrari.
And afterwards turn each of those, and make each penetrate from the inside to the outside in two other extremities of the abdominal wall that are on the opposite side.

E aquesta manieyra de sutura es milhor de la sutura comuna leugiera, e es sutura de la qual precedic rememoracio.
And this manner of suture is better than the common light suture, and is a suture of which remembrance preceded.

Aquest es le sermo de Gualia
This is the discourse of Galen

E mays le diyssero alcus, sutura del ventre es rectificada am dos agulhas, so es que tu entrometas en aquestas a quascunas un fiel, e comensa am intromiccio de agulha de aquo que es deves tu, e fay aquela penetrar entro al autra latz segon sutura de aquels les quals cozo les cuers engualment.
And moreover some said, suture of the belly is rectified with two needles, that is that you insert in these to each a thread, and begin with insertion of needle from what is towards you, and make it penetrate until the other side according to suture of those who sew leathers equally.

E sapias que quan disrupcio es en le mieg loc del ventre, lahoras la sutura de lu es pus difficil que dels autres locs del ventre.
And know that when disruption is in the middle place of the belly, then the suture of it is more difficult than of the other places of the belly.

Mays le juguament de medicacio de plagua es jutgament de las autras plaguas.
But the judgment of medication of wound is judgment of the other wounds.

La qual causa es quar quan tu consieguas la plagua recent am le sieu sanc denant que l’ayre altera aquela, e reduses le budel e cozes aquela e aptas aquela decentment, lahoras pausa sobre aquela polvera encarnativa.
Which thing is because when you follow the recent wound with its blood before the air alters it, and reduce the intestine and sew it and fit it decently, then place incarnative powder on it.

E si le ayre ja ha alterada la plagua, lahoras pausa sobre aquela alcus enguentz les quals so a tu presens entro que fassan peyra dura e cajan les fiels, e sian consolidatz ciphac e mirat; e aprop cura aquela ayssi cum es la curacio de las autras plaguas entro que sia sanat.
And if the air has already altered the wound, then place on it some ointments which are present to you until they make a hard stone and the threads fall, and peritoneum and abdominal wall are consolidated; and afterwards cure it as is the cure of other wounds until it is healed.

Mays si a tu no so presens las medicinas, lahoras pausa sobre aquela tantost, pus que comensa a getar brac, coto viel, e permuta aquel dos veguadas le dia, ayssi cum a tu e ensenhat, entro que sia sanat, quar tu no indigeysses de autra medicacio en motas disposicios quan las plaguas so simplas.
But if the medicines are not present for you, then place immediately on it, as soon as it begins to discharge pus, old cotton, and change it twice a day, as has been taught to you, until it is healed, for you do not need other medication in many cases when the wounds are simple.

Mays si tu temes que la plagua comunique en lesio als membres principals, lahoras cove que tu submergas lana leon en oli de trempada qualiditat, o en oli rozat, e pausa aquela en le circuit dels locs que so entre les angonas e dejos las aysselas.
But if you fear that the wound might communicate injury to the main members, then it is appropriate that you submerge sheep's wool in oil of moderate quality, or in rose oil, and place it around the areas that are between the groins and under the armpits.

E si sent dolor o putrefaccio en les sieus budels, quar motas veguadas aquo s’endeve, lahoras cristeriza aquel am vi stiptic negre tebe, e majorment si la poyredura es pervenguda en le budel e es fayta exitura penetrant entro la conquavitat de lu.
And if he feels pain or putrefaction in his bowels, for this happens many times, then give him an enema with lukewarm black astringent wine, especially if the rottenness has reached the intestine and has made a penetrating exit to its cavity.

E sapias que aquela que es del budel gros es de pus leugiera sanacio que aquela que es en les budels subtils.
And know that that which is of the large intestine is of easier healing than that which is in the small intestines.

E es de dificil sanacio quar le budel le qual es apelat “gegunu” no recep sanacio de plagua que caja en lu de tot; e aquo es per la gran multitut de venas que so en lu e per la magnitut de lu que so en aquelas, e per subtilitat del cos de aquel, e per propinquitat de aquel a natura de nervis.
And it is of difficult healing because the intestine which is called "jejunum" does not receive healing of a wound that falls in it at all; and this is because of the great multitude of veins that are in it and because of the magnitude of those that are in them, and because of the subtlety of its body, and because of its proximity to the nature of nerves.

Mays si aquo que procezeys de la plagua es la tela, e conseguas aquela recent, redutz aquela segon la tua rectetut am la qual reduzes les budels engualment.
But if what proceeds from the wound is the membrane, and you catch it fresh, reduce it according to your straightness with which you equally reduce the intestines.

Mays si es passat a lu spazi e ja es feyt vert o negre, lahoras que tu strenguas aquela am fiel sobre le loc que es denigrat de lu, per so que vengua fluxs de sanc, quar en la tela so venas e arterias.
But if it has passed to it space and has already become green or black, then you should tighten it with thread above the place that is blackened of it, so that blood flow comes, for in the membrane there are veins and arteries.

E aprop inscideys aquo que es otra aquel liament, e pausa dos extremitatz del fiel pendentz de la partida dejos de la plagua foro lu, per que sobre tu sia alleujada la atraccio de lu deves le cazement de la tela e emissio del brac de la plagua.
And after, cut what is beyond that binding, and place two ends of the thread hanging from the lower part of the wound outside it, so that the attraction of it towards the falling of the membrane and the emission of pus from the wound may be alleviated for you.

Rememoracio de las plaguas quan accideysso en le budel.
Remembrance of the wounds when they happen in the intestine.

Quan accideys disrupcio en le budel e es petita, lahoras es possibla que sia resteurada en alcus homes, per aysso quar yeu vi aquel le qual era stat plaguat en le sieu ventre am percussio de lansa et era la plagua de la part dreyta del stomac, e la plagua era antiquada e fayta fistula, e eyssic de lu gestio e ventositat.
When disruption occurs in the intestine and it is small, then it is possible that it may be restored in some men, because I saw one who had been wounded in his belly with a blow from a lance and the wound was on the right side of the stomach, and the wound was old and had become a fistula, and discharge and gas came out of it.

Adonc yeu pansegui la curacio de lu ja sia que no era confizat en la sanacio de lu, mays cessegui subtiliar aquel entro que foc sanat e le loc es consolidat.
Then I pursued his cure although I was not confident in his healing, but I continued to treat him subtly until he was healed and the place was consolidated.

E yeu pus que vi le loc ja consolidat, timegui sobre le malaute que endevengues sobre lu accident de mal en le sieu ventre; e no endevenc alcu per aquo mal accident e romas en las suas milhos disposicios mangant e bevent, e aprop entrec en banh e es exercitat en sos ditz.
And I, after I saw the place already consolidated, feared for the patient that a bad accident might happen to him in his belly; and no bad accident happened because of this and he remained in his best dispositions eating and drinking, and afterwards he entered a bath and exercised in his sayings.

E ja diysero alcus experimentados que quan endeve plagua en le budel, e es petita, lahoras cove que sia liada segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas fromiguas de grans caps; e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua e pausa una fromigua de aquelas que aja la boca uberta sobre las doas labias de la plagua; donc quan pren sobre aquelas e strenh la sua boca, abscindeys le cap de lu, quar adhereys e no es dissolvut.
And some experienced ones have already said that when a wound happens in the intestine, and it is small, then it is appropriate that it be bound according to this manner: and it is that you take ants with big heads; and after join the two lips of the wound and place one of those ants that has its mouth open over the two lips of the wound; then when it takes hold of them and tightens its mouth, cut off its head, for it adheres and is not dissolved.

E aprop pausa autra formigua prop la primieyra, e no cesses aquo a far am formiguas una aprop autra segon la quantitat de tota la plagua.
And after place another ant near the first, and do not cease to do this with ants one after another according to the quantity of the whole wound.

E aprop reduzeys aquela e cos la plagua; e romanguan aquels caps annexces en le budel entro que·l budel sia sanat; e no accideys al malaute degun nocument.
And after reduce it and sew the wound; and let those heads remain attached to the intestine until the intestine is healed; and no harm happens to the patient.

E ja es possible que·l budel sia liat am fiel subtil lo qual es fayt del budel de bestia annexs am lu, pus que es mes en agulha; e es que tu prenguas la extremitat de aquestz fiels de budel, e sia mot descarnat, e aprop lia la extremitat de lu am fiel de li, envolopat, e aprop entromet aquel fiel en agulhas e cos am aquel le budel, e areduzeys aquel en la disrupcio.
And it is already possible that the intestine be tied with subtle thread which is made from the intestine of an animal attached to it, after it is put in a needle; and it is that you take the end of these intestinal threads, and let it be very lean, and after tie its end with flax thread, wrapped, and after introduce that thread into needles and sew with it the intestine, and reduce it in the disruption.

E aquesta manieyra de sutura am formiguas no es sino segon via de fiducia e d’esperansa.
And this manner of suture with ants is only according to the way of trust and hope.

Mays si la plagua es gran e ampla, majorment si es en un dels budels subtils, quar lahoras no es engen sino subtiliacio, e no es sanacio de lu de tot.
But if the wound is large and wide, especially if it is in one of the small intestines, for then there is no device except subtlety, and there is no healing of it at all.

De curacio de zuchem e fistula.
On the treatment of abscesses and fistulas.

Sapias que tota plagua e apostema quan se envilheseys e se Antiqua, e es fayt ulcus, e no es consolidat e geta braç tot temps e no es abscindit, lahoras, en qualque membre sia, universalment es nompnada fistula e nos la apelam aquela azukem.
Know that every wound and abscess, when it becomes old and chronic, and turns into an ulcer, and is not healed and constantly discharges pus and is not cut out, then, in whatever part it may be, is universally called a fistula and we call it a zukem.

E fistula segon veritat es nodacio feutrada, dura, blanqua am la qual no es dolor e a la qual es conquavitat ayssi cum es conquavitat de pena de ausel; e per aysso nompnat aquela alcus rizatz, id est pena.
And a fistula, in truth, is a hard, white, felted knot which is not painful and which has a cavity like the hollow of a bird’s feather; and for this reason some call it rizatz, that is, a feather.

E es en alcus homes humida, la qual geta brac; e fort leu la humiditat es abscidida en alcunas horas.
And in some people it is moist, discharging pus; and very easily the moisture is cut off at certain times.

E alcunas veguadas aquesta humiditat es mota, e es pauca, e es grossa, e es subtil.
And sometimes this moisture is abundant, and it is scarce, and it is thick, and it is thin.

E yeu ja he denant dit en la divisio, lahoras cum yeu diyssi las plaguas, que tot ulcus que no es sanat ni no es en lu nuda carn, no es aquo sino per una de ix causas: de las quals la una es o per pauquesa de sanc en le cos; o per malicia de lu; o quar entre lu e las labias es carn dura prohibent nativitat de carn; o quar es de mota legesa; o quar aquel ulcus en si meteys es poyrit e la materia que es a lu tramesa es de mala qualitat; o quar la medicina es enconvenient en la curacio de lu; o quan corrupcio catz en la regio, e es pestilencia; o per proprietat de regio ayssi cum endeve a Saragossa , en la qual es fayta difficil degestio de las malautias, e es tardada en aquela sanacio de apostema per natura; o quar en lu es os un, o motz osses.
And I have already said before in the division, when I spoke of wounds, that every ulcer that is not healed and is not in bare flesh, is only so for one of nine reasons: of which one is either due to scarcity of blood in the body; or due to malice of it; or because between it and the lips there is hard flesh preventing the growth of flesh; or because it is very ugly; or because that ulcer itself is putrid and the matter sent to it is of bad quality; or because the medicine is unsuitable for curing it; or when corruption falls in the region, and there is pestilence; or due to the property of the region as happens in Saragossa, where digestion of diseases is made difficult, and healing of abscesses is delayed there by nature; or because in it there is one bone, or many bones.

Ja e mostrat totas aquelas causas, e·ls senhals de aquelas e la curacio de lor am medicinas en la divisio.
I have already shown all these causes, and their signs and their cure with medicines in the division.

E cove assi que yeu fassa a tu saber la curacio de fistula la qual es fayta per via de operacio am ma.
And it is appropriate here that I make known to you the cure of fistula which is done by way of operation with the hand.

E sapias que fistula accideys en totz les membres del cos; quar de aquelas son fistulas que perveno a las venas grantz e arterias, o als nervis, o al ciphac, o al budel, o a la vesica, o ad alcuna de las costas, o ad alcu dels spondils del dos, o ad alcuna de las juncturas compostas per composicio ayssi quo de la ma e del pe; e de aquelas so que dan a lu propinquitat del membre principal e de semblantz.
