And know that fistula occurs in all the parts of the body; for of these are fistulas that reach to the great veins and arteries, or to the nerves, or to the peritoneum, or to the intestine, or to the bladder, or to one of the ribs, or to one of the vertebrae of the back, or to one of the joints composed by composition such as of the hand and of the foot; and of these are those that give to it proximity of the principal member and of similar ones.

E donc aquela de aquestas fistulas que es segon aquesta manieyra es de las malautias de dificil sanacio, e no recep curacio, e occupacio am aquela es trebalh e ignorancia.
And therefore that of these fistulas which is according to this manner is of the diseases of difficult healing, and does not receive cure, and occupation with it is labor and ignorance.

E si es de las fistulas alcuna la profunditat de la qual no perve ad aquestz locs que e dit, e esperas e confizas en la curacio de lu, e vols pervenir a cognicio de lu, lahoras pren tenta de eram o de ferr, e si la fistula va segon rectetut, e perquireys aquela am lu.
And if there is of the fistulas one the depth of which does not reach to these places that I have said, and you hope and trust in the cure of it, and you want to come to knowledge of it, then take a probe of copper or of iron, and if the fistula goes according to straightness, and you investigate it with it.

Mays si la fistula es tortuissitat, lahoras investigua aquela am tenta de plom subtil, quar plom am la levitat del sieu cors es alleujat e curvat deves la tortuositat.
But if the fistula is tortuosity, then investigate it with a probe of subtle lead, for lead with the lightness of its body is lightened and curved towards the tortuosity.

E si la fistula es havent motz horrificis, no es a tu possible que signifiques sobre lu am tenta.
And if the fistula is having many orifices, it is not possible for you that you signify upon it with a probe.

Adonc cristeriza le orrifici per sos orrificis, quar la humiditat per la qual clisterizas aquela va deves las autras orrificis e corr de lor.
Then irrigate the orifice through its orifices, for the moisture with which you irrigate it goes towards the other orifices and flows from them.

E aprop inquier exquisitament, segon qual manieyra a tu es possible que conoguas si aqui has os o nervi, e es la conquavitat de la fistula longinqua o propdana, o es una fistula a la qual so motz orrificis e esta sobre aquo tot am la suma de la tua fortaleza, am la tua enterroguacio, am la qual enterroguas le malaute, e la invencio de la dolor deves la tua compressio am la ma sobre le loc, e semblantz de las significacios e de las causas accidentz al apostema.
And afterwards inquire exquisitely, according to which manner it is possible for you that you know if there you have bone or nerve, and if the cavity of the fistula is far or near, or if it is one fistula to which there are many orifices and it stands upon this all with the sum of your strength, with your interrogation, with which you interrogate the patient, and the invention of the pain towards your compression with the hand upon the place, and similar of the significations and of the causes happening to the abscess.

E cum tu auras stat sobre totas aquelas causas am stacio veraya, lahoras ve a la curacio segon confidencia: e es que tu consideras lahoras si es fistula apparent propinqua o en loc sal, longinqua de junctura, o de nervi, o de arteria, o de vena, o de un dels locs les quals yeu a tu e ditz.
And when you will have stood upon all these causes with true standing, then go to the cure according to confidence: and it is that you consider then if it is an apparent fistula near or in a safe place, far from a joint, or from a nerve, or from an artery, or from a vein, or from one of the places which I have told you.

Lahoras tu secca la fistula segon que denant es dit de la naracio de lu, e osta aquo que es en aquela filtracio e de carns corrumpudas, e aquo que es nascut en le orrifici de la carn, o de theil e de semblantz, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.
Then you dry the fistula according to what is said before of the narration of it, and remove that which is in that filtration and of corrupted flesh, and that which is born in the orifice of the flesh, or of skin and of similar things, and cure it until it is healed.

Mays si la fistula es de longinqua profunditat, e es segon rectetut, lahoras cove que inscidas aquela en le preon atant quant a tu sira possible, e aprop mondifica aquela de totas las suas carns corrompudas; e aprop administra calguas envolopadas en medicinas acutas, e intromet aquelas entro a la conquavitat de la fistula, la qual has conprenduda am ferr.
But if the fistula is of great depth, and is straight, then it is necessary that you cut it as deep as possible, and afterwards clean it of all its corrupted flesh; and then administer some wrappings with strong medicines, and insert them into the cavity of the fistula, which you have probed with iron.

E fay aquo am aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la medicina acuta corroda tot aquo que es romas en la conquavitat de la fistula de la corrupcio.
And do this with it several times until the strong medicine corrodes all that remains of the corruption in the cavity of the fistula.

E aprop restaura aquela am enguentz les quals engendran carn sana entro que sia sanada.
And afterwards restore it with ointments which generate healthy flesh until it is healed.

Mays si no es sanada per aquo, lahoras tu cauteriza aquela segon que havem recomtat.
But if it is not healed by this, then you cauterize it as we have described.

Mays si la causa de fistula es os e es deves tu certificat aquo, lahoras tu inquireys aquela e secca aquela segon que havem recomtat, si tu no prohibeys alcuna causa de vena o de nervi o de membre principal ayssi cum havem dit.
But if the cause of the fistula is bone and you have confirmed this, then you investigate it and dry it as we have described, if you do not prohibit any cause of vein or nerve or principal member as we have said.

Mays si le os es a tu descubert e es en lu alcuna corrupcio e negror, lahoras tu ratz aquel entro que la corrupcio sia hostada tota; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que lu encarne entro que sia sanat.
But if the bone is exposed to you and there is some corruption and blackness in it, then you scrape it until all the corruption is removed; and afterwards treat it with that which makes it flesh until it is healed.

E si no es sana e gieta brac ayssi cum fazia, lahoras sapias que tu no est pervengut a la eradicacio tota de la corrupcio; e adonc tu descuebre sobre lu segondanament e exquisitament fay la razio de lu e la mundificacio de lu am la deriera fortalasa tieua, e aprop restaura aquel.
And if it is not healthy and discharges pus as it did before, then know that you have not achieved the complete eradication of the corruption; and then you uncover it again and carefully perform the scraping and cleansing of it with your utmost strength, and afterwards restore it.

E donc si es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras sapias que aquela corrupcio es en la profunditat longinqua del cors, la qual no ha conseguida, e adonc a tu en aquel no es engen sino laysar aquela.
And so if it is healed, it is good; and if not, then know that this corruption is in the deep recesses of the body, which has not been reached, and then for you in that case there is no solution but to leave it.

E si le os corromput es petit, o es a tu possible atirar aquel, lahora tu le atira am forceps subtils las quals conveno ad aquo.
And if the corrupted bone is small, or it is possible for you to extract it, then you extract it with fine forceps which are suitable for this.

E si so motz osses, lahoras exquisitament fay la extraccio de totz aquels, e de aquels no laysses denguna causa am la tua fortaleza.
And if there are many bones, then carefully perform the extraction of all of them, and of those do not leave any with your strength.

Mays si a tu fa contrarietat alcuna causa de las humiditatz, e en lor inscizio no ha temor ni error, lahoras inscideys aquelas liaments o carns si so aqui, e deliura les osses.
But if any cause of moisture creates a problem for you, and in their incision there is no fear or error, then cut those ligaments or flesh if they are there, and free the bones.

Mays si a tu no es preparacio de ostar les osses de la tua hora, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua aquo que poyresca la plagua aquela, e layssa aquela entro que aquo es al enviro de aquels osses de carns e de liamentz, e guarda la plagua que no sia consolidada, e sia constrengida la seccio la qual tu has inscidida en la tua operacio.
But if you are not prepared to remove the bones at this time, then place on the wound that which will rot that wound, and leave it until that is around those bones of flesh and ligaments, and guard the wound so that it is not consolidated, and let the section which you have cut in your operation be constricted.

Habantz, si temes, pausa sobre lu coto submers en sopre trissat am oli, o coto submers en anguent egipciac, o en alcu dels enguentz vertz, quar quan poyriran aquelas liaments, e les osses son de lor seperatz la ablacio, e de aquels atraccio es alleujada.
Before, if you fear, place on it cotton soaked in sulfur ground with oil, or cotton soaked in Egyptian ointment, or in one of the green ointments, because when those ligaments rot, and the bones are separated from them by removal, and their extraction is eased.

Mays si es un gran os ayssi cum le os de camba o de coyssa o semblantz ad aquels, e aquo que de lu es corromput es la facia de lu tant solament, lahoras ratz aquela am resio tant solament derriera entro que sia ostada aquela negror e corrupcio, e aprop restaura la plagua.
But if it is a large bone such as the bone of the leg or thigh or similar to those, and that which is corrupted of it is only its surface, then scrape it with only the last scraping until that blackness and corruption is removed, and afterwards restore the wound.

Mays si aquo que de lu es corrumpyt es gran partida, e la corrupcio ja ha conseguida la medulla del os, lahoras es causa necessaria cerrar aquel e aquel tot inscidir entro al loc on es pervenguda la corrupcio, e lahoras cura aquel entro que sia consolidada.
But if that which is corrupted of it is a large part, and the corruption has already reached the marrow of the bone, then it is necessary to enclose it and cut it all until the place where the corruption has reached, and then treat it until it is consolidated.

E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc ad un home en la sua coyssa per que pausez aquela a eyssempli e adjutori sobre la tua operacio.
And I tell you that which happened to a man in his thigh so that you may use it as an example and aid in your operation.

Foc un home jove per etat entorn xxx ans, al qual accideys dolor en la sua cueyssa, e de las partidas dedintz mauguda es sobre la materia dedintz le cors entro que la materia es pervenguda a la cueyssa, e es materia de apostema am gran apostema, e no foc a lu causa extrinseca.
There was a young man about 30 years old, who experienced pain in his thigh, and from the inner parts it moved over the matter inside the body until the matter reached the thigh, and it is the matter of an abscess with a large swelling, and it was not caused by something external.

E adonc foc extendut le temps am aquela per la error dels metges entro que l’apostema es hubert, e acorrero de lu materias motas, e la sua curacio foc aprop pausada entro que la camba foc fistulada, e faytz son en lu motz orrificis les quals totz getavan poyredura e las humiditatz del cos.
And then the time was extended with that due to the error of the doctors until the abscess opened, and many materials flowed from it, and its cure was postponed until the leg became fistulated, and many orifices were made in it which all discharged pus and bodily fluids.

E adonc le curec multitut de metges entorn dos ans, e no foc en aquels savia ma en la art, entro que yeu fu appelat.
And then a multitude of doctors treated him for about two years, and there was no wise hand in the art among them, until I was called.

E vi la camba de lu e las materias que corrian de lu aquels orrificis per gran cors; e ja le cos de aquel home era tot stabozit e la color de lu era citrina.
And I saw his leg and the materials that were flowing from those orifices in great quantity; and already the body of that man was all emaciated and his color was yellow.

E adonc yeu intromesi la tenta ad un de aquels orrificis e pervenguec la tenta al os.
And then I inserted the probe into one of those orifices and the probe reached the bone.

E aprop yeu e perscrutat tostz les orrificis e trobegui aquels pervenir a lor de totas partidas de la camba.
And afterwards I examined all the orifices and found that they reached their destination from all parts of the leg.

E adonc yeu me coytegui e inscidegui sobre un dels orrificis aquels entro que descrobegui una partida del os, e atrobegui aquel corromput, e ja era terros e corrumput e denigrat; e era ja corrumpuda una partida de la camba entro que havia penetrat entro a la mezola.
And then I hurried and cut over one of those orifices until I uncovered a part of the bone, and I found it corrupted, and it was already earthy and corrupted and blackened; and a part of the leg was already corrupted until it had penetrated to the marrow.

E adon yeu serregui aquo que a mi era discubert e preparat del os descubert.
And then I sawed what was uncovered and prepared of the exposed bone.

E yeu cujegui que no fos en le os sino aquela corrupcio la qual abscidigui e serregui, e yeu ja havia derraziguada.
And I thought that there was nothing in the bone but that corruption which I had cut away and sawed, and I had already uprooted it.

E aprop pausegui la restauracio de la plagua am medicina consolidativas per lonc temps, e no es consolidada.
And afterwards I applied the restoration of the wound with consolidating medicine for a long time, and it did not heal.

E aprop yeu iteregui e descubregui sobre le os segondament sobre le descubriment primier, e atrobegui continua corrupcio am le os.
And afterwards I repeated and uncovered the bone a second time over the first uncovering, and I found continuous corruption with the bone.

E serregui aquo que a mi apares de aquela corrupcio, e aprop yeu fo perforsat fayre la curacio de lu e restauracio, e no es restaurat.
And I sawed what appeared to me of that corruption, and afterwards I was forced to make the cure and restoration of it, and it was not restored.

E adonc yeu descubri sobre lu autra veguada e no cessegui inscidir le os petit a petit particuladament e perforsa la restauracio de lu, e no es restaurat entro que inscidigui entorn un palm de lu, e aquel extraxi am la medula sua, e aprop restauregui aquel am medicinas, e es consolidat leugierament e sanat.
And then I uncovered it again and did not cease to cut the bone little by little, bit by bit, and forced its restoration, and it was not restored until I cut about a palm's length of it, and extracted it with its marrow, and afterwards I restored it with medicines, and it healed easily and was cured.

E no es necessaria iteracio en la operacio de lu e seccio de lu sino per la disposicio de la freulesa de lu e per la paucitat de la tollerancia de lu e paor de lu de mort, quar a lu accidia en totas horas per superfluitat de evacuacio sincopi mala.
And repetition in its operation and cutting was not necessary except for the disposition of his weakness and for the scarcity of his tolerance and his fear of death, for he would faint at all hours due to excessive evacuation.

E donc sanat es per sanacio entiera, e nada es en loc de os carn dura; e es fayta bona la disposicio de lu en le sieu cors e retornec la vertut de lu; e es conversat en las suas disposicios e no fec a lu contrarietat en ambulacio ni nocument en denguna causa.
And thus he is healed by complete healing, and hard flesh was born in place of the bone; and his disposition in his body was made good and his strength returned; and he went about his affairs and it did not cause him any difficulty in walking or harm in any way.

Mays si es os eminent en loc del cors ja trauquat, lahoras cove que tu secces aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas liament e strenh aquel en la extremitat de aquel os eminent, e comanda ad alcu que extenda aquel en sus; e pausa aquel liament de lana pus gros del primier liament; e aprop lia aquel sobre la carn que es dejos le os, e exten la extramitat de lu per que atires la carn a las partidas dejos, e tu descuebras la carn sobre le loc le qual voles serrar per que la serra no leda la carn.
But if there is a protruding bone in a place of the body already pierced, then you should cut it in this manner: take a binding and tighten it at the end of that protruding bone, and command someone to extend it upwards; and place that binding of wool thicker than the first binding; and afterwards tie it over the flesh that is below the bone, and extend its extremity so that you draw the flesh to the lower parts, and you uncover the flesh over the place which you want to saw so that the saw does not harm the flesh.

E pausa fust o taula dejos le os decentment, quar quan tu fas aquo no es prohibida la serra que no secce la carn corrumpuda.
And place wood or a board below the bone decently, for when you do this the saw is not prevented from cutting the corrupted flesh.

E cove que sia la serradura sobre le loc corrumput petit a petit, quar si es en la concavitat del os corrupcio e no appar en la sua apparicio al sentiment, e forssa a serratura de lu autra veguada.
And the sawing should be done over the corrupted place little by little, for if there is corruption in the concavity of the bone and it does not appear in its appearance to the senses, it forces another sawing of it.

E si le os es corrumput e no-eminent, abantz es la una partida continuada am la autra, e la corrupcio es al mieg loc o en partida de lu, lahoras tu descuebre la carn de totas partz tota; e aprop pausa fust dejos, e aprop serra aquel de la primiera partida la on es la corrupcio entro que sia continuada la serratura del autra partida.
If the bone is corrupted and not prominent, before one part is continuous with the other, and the corruption is in the middle or in part of it, then you uncover all the flesh from all parts; and afterwards place wood underneath, and then saw that from the first part where the corruption is until the cut is continuous with the other part.

E sia la serradura segon le loc de la corrupcio un petit, segon que havem dit.
And let the cut be according to the location of the corruption a little, as we have said.

E si la corrupcio es en la junctura, inscideys aquela junctura corrumpuda, e serra le os la on es continuat del autra part.
And if the corruption is in the joint, cut that corrupted joint, and saw the bone where it is continuous with the other part.

E si de la corrupcio es en la continuacio de doas juncturas, lahoras no es en lu razio sino engen.
And if the corruption is in the continuation of two joints, then there is no reason in it except ingenuity.

E si la corrupcio es en le pecte de la ma o del pe, es mot dificil; empero cove que tu inquieras la corrupcio en qual manieyra appareys a tu, e que abradas aquela, e mondes aquela segon quascuna disposicio la qual es a tu possibla, e am cascum engen sia rectificat a tu, quan no fa a tu contrarietat vena o nervi.
And if the corruption is in the chest of the hand or foot, it is very difficult; however, it is necessary that you investigate the corruption in whatever manner it appears to you, and that you abrade it, and clean it according to each disposition which is possible for you, and with each ingenious method it is rectified for you, when vein or nerve does not pose a challenge to you.

E sapias qual es inscididors e las serras a inscidir aquestz osses son motz segon le situament dels osses, e la preparacio de aquels, e la grosseza de aquels, e la subtilitat e la grandeza e la parvitat de aquels, e la duricia e la lor raritat; per que cove que tu prepares a tota specia de operacio estrument convenient ad aquela opperacio.
And know that the cutters and saws to cut these bones are many according to the situation of the bones, and their preparation, and their thickness, and their subtlety and their size and their smallness, and their hardness and their rarity; therefore it is necessary that you prepare for every kind of operation an instrument suitable for that operation.

E sapias que aquela operacio significa a tu sobre la specia del strument del qual indigeysses; quan am tu es gran studi e lonc e conoyssensa de las manieyras de aquesta art, e testimoni de manieyras de malautias, quar lahoras ja tu las avias per tu meteys aquo que es convenient a lu dels sturmentz a tota malautia.
And know that this operation indicates to you about the kind of instrument which you need; when you have great study and long and knowledge of the manners of this art, and testimony of manners of illnesses, for then you already have for yourself what is suitable of instruments for every illness.

E yeu so a tu formant en la fi de aquest capitol le nombre dels instrumentz les quals pausaras cum eyssimples am les quals proceziras a la tua prohibicio la qual experimentaras sobre las autras.
And I am forming for you at the end of this chapter the number of instruments which you will place as examples with which you will proceed to your prohibition which you will experiment on others.

Let the head of this file be according to the shape of a star-shaped nail head, and its points be according to the shape of the points of alstefegi.

E no conveneys sino que am aquel sian confricadatz les caps de las juncturas quan so corrumpudas, o es la boca gran ampla.

Shape of file which is suitable for filing of that which is perforated of bones:

E la extremitat de lu es triangulada e de aguda extremitat.
And its extremity is triangular and with a sharp end.

E es fayt de ferr de India , e semblantment cove que totas las causas que havem ditas de rasoris e de inscissoris e de serras.
And it is made of Indian iron, and similarly it is necessary that all the things that we have said of razors and cutters and saws.

De inscizio extremitatz e de la serratura dels osses.
On the incision of extremities and the sawing of bones.
Las extremitatz se poyresso o per causa intrinseca o per causa extrinseca, o cum tu auras medicat aquela corrupcio per curacio de aquelas medicinas e la curacio no comfereys, o vezes la corrupcio anar deves le membre la qual no percuteys denguna causa, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel membre entro aquo la hon acossec la corrupcio, per que le malaute evasesca per aquo de mort o de malicia que es major defeliment del membre.
The extremities rot either due to internal or external causes, or when you have treated that corruption with the cure of those medicines and the cure does not work, or you see the corruption spreading to the limb which you did not strike for any reason, then it is necessary that you cut that limb up to where the corruption has reached, so that the patient may escape death or malice which is a greater weakness of the limb.
E le senhal de aquel al qual accideys, es que·l membre es fayt negre entro que sia cujat que foc la ja comburit, o se poyreys aprop la negror entro que la poyredura aquela ane entro aquel membre que siec lu e que prengua tot le cors; e donc coyta te am inscizio de aquel.
And the sign of that which happens is that the limb becomes black until it seems that it was already burned, or it rots after the blackness until that rot spreads to the limb that follows it and takes over the whole body; and then hurry with the incision of that.
E semblantment si es causa de la corrupcio percussio de alcunas causas venenosas ayssi cum de scorpio mari o de vupera o de rutela e de semblantz.
And similarly if the cause of the corruption is the strike of some venomous things such as sea scorpion or viper or spider and similar ones.
E si la corrupcio o la percussio es en la extremitat del dit, lahoras tu inscideys le dit e no dones spazi a la corrupcio per que ane entro a la ma.
And if the corruption or the strike is at the extremity of the finger, then you cut the finger and do not give space to the corruption to spread to the hand.
E semblantment si accedeys a la ma, lahoras tu inscideys aquela de la razit del focil, e no dones spazi a la corrupcio entro que prengua en le focil del bras.
And similarly if it reaches the hand, then you cut it from the root of the forearm, and do not give space to the corruption until it takes over the bone of the arm.
E si envezeys aquel, lahoras inscideys le bras entro al coyde en la junctura.
And if it invades that, then cut the arm up to the elbow at the joint.
E si passa otra la corrupcio e la vezes enviro le coyde, lahoras en aquel es la mort del malaute; e aministrar autra causa otra aquo en curacio es quantitat de vertut.
And if the corruption passes beyond and you see it around the elbow, then in that is the death of the patient; and administering anything else for cure is a matter of virtue.
E semblantment fay del pe quan corrupcio envezeys le dit del pe, lahoras tu inscideys aquel entro ad un dels nozes.
And similarly do with the foot when corruption invades the toe, then you cut it up to one of the knuckles.
E si pren en la pente del pe, lahoras tu inscideys tot le pe.
And if it takes over the instep of the foot, then you cut the whole foot.
Mays si pueja entro al denol, lahoras tu inscideys la camba entro a la junctura del denol.
But if it rises up to the knee, then you cut the leg up to the knee joint.
E si la corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denol, lahoras en lu no es engen sino dimissio, e layssar le malaute a la mort.
And if the corruption has already reached above the knee, then there is no solution but dismissal, and leaving the patient to death.
E la manieyra de inscidir le membre o de serrar lu es que tu strenhas le liament en la partida pus dejos la qual voles inscidir, e strenh autre liament sobre le loc; e extenda le ministre un liament a las partidas dejos, e extenda le ministra autra liament en sus; e tu separa la carn la qual es entre dos liamentz ain spatum lat entro que sia descuberta tota la carn; e aprop sia inscidit o serrat.
The manner of cutting the limb or sawing it is that you tighten the binding in the lowest part where you want to cut, and tighten another binding above the place; and the minister extends a binding to the parts below, and the minister extends another binding above; and you separate the flesh which is between two bindings with a wide spatula until all the flesh is uncovered; and afterwards it is cut or sawed.

E cove que sia pausat drap de li de totas partidas per so que no toque le loc sa, e que vengua al malaute lesio ajustada e apostema caut.
And it is necessary that a linen cloth be placed on all sides so that it does not touch the healthy place, and that no added injury and hot swelling come to the patient.

Mays si accideys flux de sanc quan obras, lahoras tu cauteriza le loc coytadament, o pausa sus lu alcunas polveras restrenhentz le sanc; e aprop retorna a la tua medicacio entro que sia complida.
But if blood flow occurs when you work, then you cauterize the place quickly, or place on it some powders that restrict the blood; and afterwards return to your medication until it is complete.

E aprop lia le membre plaguat am liament al u convenient, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.
And afterwards bind the wounded limb with a suitable binding, and treat it until it is healed.

E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc a un home en le sieu pe, aquest meteys accident le qual yeu e a tu recomtat, le qual es quar accidic a lu negror en le sieu pe am adustio que era asemblada a combustio de foc.
And I tell you what happened to a man in his foot, this same accident which I have told you about, which is that blackness occurred in his foot with a burning that resembled a fire burn.

E aquela corrupcio accidic primierament en le sieu dit entro que tendec tot le pe.
And that corruption occurred first in his toe until it spread to the whole foot.

E adonc aquel home preparec per si meteys pus que vic la curacio anar al membre am la vehemencia de lu que atrobec de dolor e de adustrio de lu, e el inscidic aquel pe entro a la junctura, e foc sanat.
And then that man prepared himself, as he saw the treatment going to the limb with the vehemence of what he found of pain and burning of it, and he cut that foot up to the joint, and was healed.

Lonc temps accidic a lu aquela meteyssa corrupcio en le dit de la ma indic.
A long time later, that same corruption occurred in the index finger of his hand.

E adonc venc a mi, e so me perforsat repercutir aquela superfluitat am aquo que pausegui sobre la ma de las medicinas, aprop la mundificacio del cos de lu; e no es repercussa la superfluitat e comensec anar al autra dit entro que comensec en la ma.
And then he came to me, and I tried to repel that excess with what I placed on the hand of medicines, after the purification of his body; and the excess is not repelled and began to go to another finger until it began in the hand.

E el apelec me a inscidir la ma de lu, e yeu no volgui far aquo sperant sobre la repercussio de aquela superfluitat, e mays que temegui deves la inscizio de la ma de lu mort, quar la vertut del malaute era sobre cazement.
And he called me to cut his hand, and I did not want to do that hoping for the repulsion of that excess, and more that I feared towards the cutting of his hand death, because the strength of the patient was declining.

E pus que el se desperec de mi, es retornat en la sua terra e pervenguec a mi que aquel home preparec e inscidic la sua ma tota, e es sanat.
And after he despaired of me, he returned to his land and it came to me that that man prepared and cut his whole hand, and is healed.

E no he adhuzida aquesta narracio sino per que sia adjutori sobre aquo que catz de aquesta malautia, e que sia significacio per la qual sia significada e segon la qual sia obrat.
And I have not brought this narration except that it be help on what falls from this disease, and that it be a sign by which it is signified and according to which it is worked.

De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.
On the cure of sinuses and the quality of clysterization with medicines.

Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula.
When a swelling occurs in some fleshy members and the space of the swelling is prolonged until it makes a collection of pus, and afterwards it is broken and perforated, and the pus has come out of it, and the place remains empty as if it were a vessel, and the skin that is above it as if a thin cloth, and has not reached to the last corruption, and does not impress on the bone or on nerve or on ligament, it is called a sinus, and is not named fistula.

Mays empero si le spazi es prolonguat entro que la corrupcio enprema en alcun membre, lahoras es appelada fistula e no zukem.
But however if the space is prolonged until the corruption impresses on some member, then it is called fistula and not sinus.

E la cura de lu es que inscidas aquela codena tota ayssi cum es revolvut, e majorment quan es subtiliada e es fayta cum drap, e comfizas que no adhereys al loc per la sua corrupcio.
And the cure of it is that you cut all that skin just as it is revolved, and especially when it is thinned and is made like cloth, and you trust that it does not adhere to the place by its corruption.

Mays si tu speras que la codena adheresca e que aquela corrupcio no aja conseguit per deriera consecucio, e en la codena ha spassitut de cara, lahoras tu cura aquel am clisteri.
But if you hope that the skin adheres and that that corruption has not achieved by last achievement, and in the skin there is thickness of face, then you cure that with clyster.

E es que consideras al sinu, e lahoras si es gran, e·l brac que yeys es de fetent odor, lahoras clisteriza aquel am medicament egipciac le qual es de oli e vi agre e ziniar recebent partidas enguals, e sian ajustadas en un vayssel, e sian coytas sobre le foc entro que’l medicament se fassa rog e pervengua a specitut de mel.
And it is that you consider the sinus, and then if it is large, and the pus that comes out is of fetid odor, then clysterize that with Egyptian medication which is of oil and vinegar and ziniar receiving equal parts, and let them be added in one vessel, and let them be cooked over the fire until the medication becomes red and reaches the thickness of honey.

E aprop tu pren de lu aquo que es necessari e dissolveys lu am aygua e mel; e clisteriza am aquel le sinu, e strenh le orrifici de lu, e layssa la medicina en lu per la quantitat de doas horas.
And afterwards you take from it what is necessary and dissolve it with water and honey; and clysterize with that the sinus, and tighten the orifice of it, and leave the medicine in it for the quantity of two hours.

E aprop extratz aquela am sprecio; e fay aquo per tantz dias entro que sia mundificat le sinu e sia remauguda la pudor.
And then extract that with a probe; and do this for so many days until the sinus is cleaned and the odor is removed.

E alcunas veguadas es clisterizat am aygua de cendre, quan no es a tu prezent aquest medicament; e es que tu prenguas la cendra de vitz, e met sobre lu aygua; e aprop cola aquela e clisteriza aquel am ela entro que te confizes que·l sinu lahoras es ostat.
And sometimes it is cleansed with ash water, when this medicine is not available to you; and it is that you take vine ash, and put it on water; and then strain it and cleanse it with it until you are confident that the sinus is then removed.

E si le malaute no ha tollerancia sobre le medicament egipciac ni l’aygua de la cendre, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aygua e mel e quays sia mesclat ziniar trissat, e clisteriza aquel am vi e mel mesclat, quar de proprietat de mel es que mondifique e lave, e le vi fa adherir le sinu, e majorment quan en le vi ha superfluitat de stipticitat e de siccitat.
And if the patient cannot tolerate the Egyptian medicine nor the ash water, then cleanse it with water and honey and as if mixed with ground ginger, and cleanse it with wine and mixed honey, for it is the property of honey to cleanse and wash, and the wine makes the sinus adhere, and especially when the wine has an excess of astringency and dryness.

E cum tu fas aquo alcunas veguadas e te comfizes que·l sinu ja es remaugut, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aquo que fa naysser la carn en lu.
And when you do this sometimes and you are confident that the sinus is already removed, then cleanse it with that which makes flesh grow in it.

E es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e dissolveys aquel am oli rozat e vi stiptic; o que clisterizas aquel am alcunas medicinas e enguentz autres que hajan las proprietatz les quals ja he yeu scritz en le tractat dels enguents.
And it is that you take diaphoenicon ointment and dissolve it with rose oil and astringent wine; or that you cleanse it with some other medicines and ointments that have the properties which I have already written in the treatise on ointments.

E si le orrifici del sinu es streyt en le qual no es recebuda la canula del clisteri, lahoras tu le amplifique aquel am ferr petit a petit, e pausa en lu calgua envolopada en enguent egipciac o en enguent basilicon entro que sia amplificat.
And if the orifice of the sinus is narrow in which the cannula of the enema is not received, then you widen it little by little with iron, and put in it something wrapped in Egyptian ointment or basilicon ointment until it is widened.

E semblantment si le orrifici es ample, lahoras tu agregua las labias de lu am sutura e layssa de lu quantitat en la qual intre le clisteri ses addicio.
And similarly if the orifice is wide, then you bring together its lips with suture and leave of it a quantity in which the enema enters without addition.

E si le orrifici de lu del qual corr le brac es elevat a las partidas desus, lahoras secca aquel en le pus bas loc que es en lu per que le brac corra entro dejos, quar quan le brac es coartat en la preondeza de sinu la carn esser en lu engendrada.
And if the orifice of it from which the pus flows is elevated to the upper parts, then dry it in the lowest place that is in it so that the pus flows down to the bottom, for when the pus is confined in the depth of the sinus the flesh is generated in it.

E si no es a tu possible seccar le sinu entro al enviro del os pus bas segon que voles, lahoras te perforssa que prepares le membre am preparacio per la qual corr de lu le brac leugierament segon que es a tu apparelhat e que no sia en lu retengut alcuna causa del brac.
And if it is not possible for you to dry the sinus to around the lowest bone as you wish, then force yourself to prepare the member with a preparation by which the pus flows from it easily as is prepared for you and that nothing of the pus is retained in it.

E pren medicinas consolidativas que sian pausadas sobre le sinu convenientz ad aquo que vols exxten aquelas sobre drap de li.
And take consolidative medicines that are placed on the sinus suitable for what you want to extend those on linen cloth.

E le drap sia de tan gran quantitat cum fa la comunicacio de tot le sinu; e aprop inscidey am las forfexs en le dreyt del orrifici del sinu un trauc pus ample un pauc que l’orrifici del sinu; e aprop exten sobre autre drap de li dels enguentz leons segon la quantitat del trauc, e pausa le sobre aquel per posicio longinqua del orrifici del sinu per que sia aleujat le eyssiment del brac de lu e no ostes le drap gran sino aprop alcus dyas una veguada.
And the cloth should be of as large a quantity as the communication of the whole sinus makes; and then cut with scissors in the right of the orifice of the sinus a hole a little wider than the orifice of the sinus; and then extend on another linen cloth of the lion ointments according to the quantity of the hole, and place it over that by long position from the orifice of the sinus so that the exit of the pus from it is eased and do not remove the large cloth except after some days once.

Mays aquel que es sobre le orrifici del sinu, le qual remauguas en tota hora per so que yesca aquo que es ajust en lu del brac.
But that which is over the orifice of the sinus, which you remove every time so that what is gathered in it of the pus comes out.

E per que sapias si aquo que corr de lu del brac es mot o pauc, o es digest, o es no-digest.
And so that you know if what flows from it of the pus is much or little, or is digested, or is undigested.

E am aysso tu considera le loc de aquel sinu, si en lu sent le pacient dolor o no, e si es en lu apostema.
And with this you consider the place of that sinus, if the patient feels pain in it or not, and if there is an abscess in it.

E cum la tua medicacio es prolonguada en la tal manieyra, e vesas la matiera que es gitada sobre le orrifici del sinu ja adhereys, o se apropria adherencia, lahoras le mayti tu le deslia o le tertz dia, e quan deslias la plagua, lahoras muda le drap per autre e renova le enguent.
And when your medication is prolonged in such a manner, and you see the matter that is thrown on the orifice of the sinus already adhering, or is approaching adherence, then in the morning you unbind it or on the third day, and when you unbind the wound, then change the cloth for another and renew the ointment.

Mays si del sinu aprop lon spazi yeys virus subtil, lahoras no te desperes de la adherencia de li, quar la sanacio de lu se apropria, quar so alcus homes en les quals tarda generacio de carn en las lors plaguas, e de aquels so en les quals es fayt le contrari de lu.
But if from the sinus after a long space thin virus comes out, then do not despair of its adherence, for its healing is approaching, for there are some men in whom the generation of flesh in their wounds is delayed, and of those there are in whom the contrary of it is done.

E si del sinu aprop motz dias es yssit brac indigest, lahoras sapias que·l sinu no adhereys; e si es tardada la adherencia del sinu e es la causa prolonguada, lahoras tu ajusta en exsiccacio de las medicinas, e si las medicinas so humidas en lor substancia e en la sua vertut, son seccas ayssi cum enguent dyafinicon, quan es en lu ajustada superfluitat de addicio de zegi.
And if from the sinus after many days undigested pus comes out, then know that the sinus does not adhere; and if the adherence of the sinus is delayed and the cause is prolonged, then you add in drying of the medicines, and if the medicines are moist in their substance and in their virtue, they are dry like dyafinicon ointment, when there is added to it excess addition of zinc.

E le mays derier am le qual es curat, es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e sia dissout en oli rozat, e sia sobre lu vojat vi antic engual en la sua substancia, e aprop comfeys aquel am lu, e usa de aquel.
And the last way with which it is cured, is that you take dyafinicon ointment and it is dissolved in rose oil, and old wine equal in its substance is poured over it, and afterwards mix that with it, and use that.

E ja fa semblant en aquela accio, quan no y a brac, enguent dyafinicon, mel quan es coyt entro que sia engrossat, e usa de lu; o que prenguas mirra e aloen e enses, e trissa tot e polveriza sobre le mel quan es sus le foc, e aprop lineys aquo sobre drap e strenh aquel sobre le sinu; e lineys aquel am le mel le qual has cuoyt entro que es engrossat, e polveriza sobre drap e strenh aquel.
And it already makes similar in that action, when there is no pus, dyafinicon ointment, honey when it is cooked until it is thickened, and use it; or that you take myrrh and aloe and incense, and grind all and pulverize over the honey when it is on the fire, and afterwards spread that on a cloth and tighten it over the sinus; and spread that with the honey which you have cooked until it is thickened, and pulverize on cloth and tighten it.

E alcunas veguadas so administratz am lu aristologia longua e razitz de lili celesti (e es lili celesti) e farina de errs e centaurea, e usa de aquels simples o ajustatz, trissa aquels e cribela e polveriza sobre le mel le qual he recomtat; e husa de lu.
And sometimes they are administered with it long aristolochia and root of celestial lily (and it is celestial lily) and flour of vetch and centaury, and use those simples or combined, grind those and sift and pulverize over the honey which I have recounted; and use it.

E si es prolonguat le sinu, e no es sanat per aquesta curacio, lahoras sapias que la corrupcio es en le preon de lu, e ja fa enquisicio en les osses o en les autres membres durs o als liaments; lahoras tu le cura am curacio fistular, ayssi cum desus es dit.
And if the sinus is prolonged, and is not healed by this cure, then know that the corruption is in the depth of it, and already makes inquiry in the bones or in the other hard members or to the ligaments; then you cure it with fistular cure, as is said above.

De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione.
On the cure of whitlow and bruised nail and incision of added finger and section.

Panarici es apostema le qual nays dejos la ungla del dit pous de la ma o del pe, e fort leu nays en les autres ditz, e cum es prolonguat e la sua curacio es mens prezada, o es apostemat de apostema caut, o es corrumput, e gieta brac entro que corrodeys la razitz de la ungla, e fort leu corromp aquela tota, e fort leu perve la sua corrupcio al os entro que es a lu odor fetent, e es fayta la extremitat del dit lada, e la color de lu es fayta fusca.
Whitlow is an abscess which is born under the nail of the thumb of the hand or of the foot, and very easily born in the other fingers, and when it is prolonged and its cure is less prized, or it is abscessed from hot abscess, or it is corrupted, and throws pus until it corrodes the root of the nail, and very easily corrupts all of it, and very easily its corruption reaches the bone until it has a fetid odor, and the extremity of the finger is made wide, and its color is made dark.

E donc quan tu auras aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas am ferr tota la superfluitat que es romasa de la ungla e aprop cauteriza la plagla aprop aquo, quar cauteri mot es juvatiu en aysso.
And so when you will have that with what we have said in the division and you do not complete your cure, then it is fitting that you cut with iron all the superfluity that is remaining of the nail and afterwards cauterize the wound after that, for cautery is very helpful in this.

Mays si le os es sa e la ungla es sana, e las addicios de la ungla vuoydas ja compremen las carns a las partidas dedintz, e comensan lu punger e ledeysso aquela, lahoras cove que tu pauses ray subtil dejos le angle de la ungla que pungeys la carn, e impelleys aquela sus e inscideys aquela carn am facilitat, e pausa sobre aquo que roman de la carn de las medicinas comburentz corrosivas entro que sia tot remaugut; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.
But if the bone is sound and the nail is healthy, and the empty additions of the nail already compress the flesh to the parts within, and begin to prick it and injure it, then it is fitting that you place a subtle ray under the angle of the nail that pricks the flesh, and push it up and cut that flesh with ease, and place over that which remains of the flesh burning corrosive medicines until it is all removed; and afterwards cure that with ointments until it is healed.

Mays si la corrupcio ja enprem en le os, lahoras cove que tu inscidas le os aquel e le extraguas, car nul temps no es sanat que sia en lu le os corrumput.
But if the corruption already impresses on the bone, then it is fitting that you cut that bone and extract it, for at no time is it healed that the corrupted bone be in it.

E si vezes la corrozio e la corupcio anar en le dit, lahoras tu inscideys aquel en un dels nozes segons que es premesa la sua rememoracio, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.
And if you see the corrosion and the corruption going into the finger, then you cut it at one of the knuckles according to what is promised its remembrance, and afterwards cure that until it is healed.

Mays si a la ungla endeve percussio o atricio, e endeve en aquela dolor vehement, lahoras cove que tu al comensament fleubotomes le malaute, e aprop secca la ungla am spatum agut am seccio transversa desus en jus, e guarda te que la seccio no pervengua entro a la carn que es dejos la ungla, quar tu faras accidir al malaute dolor vehement, e sira causa a nativitat de la carn ajustada superflua en le loc; e aprop cura aquel loc am aquo que ceda dolor.
But if to the nail happens percussion or attrition, and happens in it vehement pain, then it is fitting that you at the beginning bleed the patient, and afterwards dry the nail with sharp spatula with transverse section from above downwards, and guard yourself that the section does not reach to the flesh that is under the nail, for you will make happen to the patient vehement pain, and it will be cause to birth of superfluous flesh added in the place; and afterwards cure that place with that which yields pain.

Mays dit ajustat, le qual es nat en las mas de alcus homes, fort leu es carnos tot, e fort leu so en lu osses, o fort leu es en lu ungla.
But it is said together, which is born in the hands of some men, very easily it becomes all fleshy, and very easily there are bones in it, or very easily it is in the nail.

E alcus de lu son natz en la razit de la junctura, o es la nativitat de lu en alcus nozes dels ditz.
And some of them are born in the root of the joint, or their birth is in some knuckles of the fingers.

Mays aquel que es nat en alcus nozes del dit no se mau, e aquest que es nat en las juncturas fort leu es maugut.
But that which is born in some knuckles of the finger does not move, and this which is born in the joints very easily is moved.

E de aquels que son natz carnoses, la seccio es leugiera, e es que tu inscidas aquel deves la sua razitz am spatum lat.
And of those that are born fleshy, the cutting is easy, and it is that you cut that towards its root with a wide spatula.

Mays de aquel que es nat en la razitz de la junctura, la curacio es dificil; e donc guarda te de la abscizio de lu.
But of that which is born in the root of the joint, the cure is difficult; and therefore beware of cutting it off.

Mays en aquel que es nat en dit deves les nozes, cove que tu inscidas al comensament la carn de lu am inscizio redonda entro al os, e aprop serra am una de aquelas serras convenientz ad aquo, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.
But in that which is born in the finger towards the knuckles, it is fitting that you cut at the beginning its flesh with a round incision up to the bone, and afterwards saw with one of those saws suitable for this, and afterwards cure it until it is healed.

Mays consolidacio la qual accideys als ditz entre lor motas veguadas o per nativitat del home que nays enayssi, o per consolidacio de plagua o per combustio de foc, o per semblantz, adonc cove que secces aquela consolidacio entro que les ditz retorno a la sua forma natural.
But consolidation which happens to the fingers among themselves many times either by birth of the man who is born thus, or by consolidation of a wound or by burning of fire, or by similar things, then it is fitting that you cut that consolidation until the fingers return to their natural form.

E aprop pausa entre lor draps de li enfuzes en oli rozat per que no sian consolidatz leugierament, e separa entre aquels, o pausa entre aquels una lamina de plom subtil entro que sia consolidat segon que cove.
And afterwards place between them linen cloths soaked in rose oil so that they are not easily consolidated, and separate between them, or place between them a thin lead plate until it is consolidated as it should be.

E semblantment si accideys consolidacio en alcus ditz am la palma, lahoras tu secca aquela consolidacio segon que es preparada e conveneys a la figura del membre.
And similarly if consolidation happens in some fingers with the palm, then you dry that consolidation according to what is prepared and suitable to the shape of the member.

De inscizio de vices, so son varicas.
On the incision of varicose veins.

Vices so son varicas, e so venas envolutas grossas plenas de superfluitatz melencolicas las quals veno en motz dels membres del cors, e le major adveniment de lor en las cambas, e majorment en las cambas dels itinerantz e dels laborantz e dels portantz.
Varicose veins are swollen and twisted veins full of melancholic superfluities which come to many parts of the body, and most commonly occur in the legs, especially in the legs of travelers, laborers, and porters.

Adonc cove que tu administres purguacio del cors de colera negra alcunas veguadas am expulcio fort, e aprop sangna le pacient de la vena basilica.
Thus it is appropriate that you administer a purging of the body of black bile sometimes with strong expulsion, and afterwards bleed the patient from the basilic vein.

Mays la curacio de lor am ferr es segon dos manieyras: la una es que sia inscizas e sia atirat aquel sanc negre, e l’autra manieyra es que sia elevada la vena e sia extrayta tota.
But their cure with iron is according to two methods: one is that they be incised and that black blood be drawn out, and the other method is that the vein be elevated and extracted entirely.

La seccio de lu es segon aquesta manieyra: embroca al comensament la camba am aygua cauda mot entro que le sanc gros sia resolvut, que es feculent de la camba, e aprop strenh la camba del malaute a la partida pus sobirana de la coyssa entro a la partida dejos del denol am una benda, e aprop secca la vena en un loc, o en dos, o en tres am seccio ampla, e aprop eleva le sanc negra am la tieua ma de la partida dejos de la camba entro en sus, e desus en jus, entro que del sanc sia yssida la quantitat que voles e que vezes habastar, e la qual tollera la vertut del malaute.
The section of it is according to this method: first bathe the leg with very hot water until the thick blood is dissolved, which is the impurity of the leg, and then tighten the patient's leg from the uppermost part of the thigh to the part below the knee with a bandage, and then cut the vein in one place, or in two, or in three with a wide incision, and then elevate the black blood with your hand from the lower part of the leg up to the top, and from top to bottom, until the amount of blood you want has come out and that you see is sufficient, and which the patient's strength can tolerate.

E aprop lia aquela, e comanda a lu que abstengua de las viandas colera negra engendrantz.
And then bind it, and command him to abstain from foods that generate black bile.

E itera la curacio per fleubotomia quan las venas so umplidas e aquo notz al malaute.
And repeat the cure by phlebotomy when the veins are filled and this harms the patient.

Mays la elevacio de lor es segon aquesta manieyra: tu que razas la camba del malaute, si en lu so motz pels, e aprop met le en banh e embroca la camba de lu am aygua cauda entro que s’enrogesesca e las venas sian exuberadas; o que sia exercitat per exercici fort, si banh no es a tu present, entro que·l membre sia scalfat.
But the elevation of them is according to this method: you who shave the patient's leg, if there are many hairs on it, and then put him in a bath and bathe his leg with hot water until it reddens and the veins are swollen; or let him be exercised by strong exercise, if a bath is not available to you, until the limb is heated.

E aprop secsa la codena en le dreyt de la vena per seccio en le lonc o en le derier de lu deves le denol, o en le pus bas de lu deves lo talo.
And then cut the skin in line with the vein by an incision lengthwise or behind it towards the knee, or in the lowest part of it towards the heel.

E aprop uobre la codena am uncis e excorja la vena de tota part entro que appara al sentiment, e es deves la appericio de lu que vezes aquela roga declinant a negror.
And then open the skin with hooks and flay the vein from all sides until it appears to the touch, and it is towards its appearance that you see it red inclining to black.

E donc cum evazeys e de la codena tu vezes aquela blanca quays sia corda.
And then as you remove it and see it from the skin, you see it white almost like a cord.

E aprop tu met dejos aquela le ray entro que sia elevada e sia gitada de la codena, e sospen aquela am onci orp leon.
And then you put the probe under it until it is elevated and thrown out of the skin, and suspend it with a blunt hook.

E aprop secsa autra seccio aprop aquela seccio per tres ditz, e aprop excorja la codena de la partida desus de la vena entro que apparia.
And then make another incision after that incision by three fingers, and then flay the skin from the upper part of the vein until it appears.

E aprop eleva aquela e inscideys aquela en deriera seccio deves le talo, e aprop extratz aquela e eleva aquela entro que sia yssida per la seccio segonda, e aprop extratz aquela de la seccio que es sobre aquela.
And then elevate it and cut it in the last incision towards the heel, and then extract it and elevate it until it has come out through the second incision, and then extract it from the incision that is above that.

E fay aquo entro que extraguas aquela de la seccio que es pus sobirana o pus auta de totas las seccios, entro que tota es yssida; e lahoras inscideys aquela.
And do this until you extract it from the incision that is highest or uppermost of all the incisions, until it is all out; and then cut it.

E si no obezeys a tu ad extrayre e elevar, lahoras intromet una agulha am fiel fort doble e ligua aquela e extratz la, o intromet dejos lu le ray e revolveys la tua ma a tota part entro qu’en sia getada.
And if it does not obey you to extract and elevate, then insert a needle with strong double thread and tie it and extract it, or insert the probe under it and turn your hand in all directions until it is thrown out.

E guarda te que no sia inscidida; quar si es trencada, es fayt a tu dificil elevar aquela mot e es vengut sobre le malaute per aquela nocument.
And be careful that it is not cut; for if it is broken, it becomes very difficult for you to elevate it and harm has come upon the patient because of it.

E cum aquela tota auras fora-gitada, lahoras pausa sobre le loc de la plagua lana submerssa en vi e oli rozat e oli no-rozat, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.
And when you have thrown it all out, then place over the site of the wound wool soaked in wine and rose oil and non-rose oil, and treat it until it is healed.

E si la vit es contrayta havent tortuositat a la qual sia envolucio a las partidas, e no es segon rectitut segon que havem dit, lahoras cove que tu fendas sobre aquela a tota partida de tortuositat de lu e als locs de envolucio de lu, e aprop suspen aquela am uncis entro que eleves aquela tota.
And if the vein is contracted having tortuosity to which there is convolution to the parts, and is not straight as we have said, then it is appropriate that you split it over all parts of its tortuosity and at the places of its convolution, and then suspend it with hooks until you elevate all of it.

E guarda te deves la tua seccio que no inscidas la vena e que no plagues aquela, quar dificil sira a tu elevar aquela; e serva la tua prudencia en aquela.
And be careful in your incision that you do not cut the vein and that you do not wound it, for it will be difficult for you to elevate it; and maintain your prudence in this.

Forma del inscident am le qual es seccada vit:
Form of the cutting instrument with which the vein is cut:

Forma de unci orp:
Form of a blunt hook:

No es a lu accuitat ayssi cum als uncis ni es de aguda extremitat per so que no plague la vena; e es de grossa flexibilitat leon, quar si era subtil, inscidira la vena per la sua subtilitat; habantz es en lu superflua grosseza ayssi cum havem dit.
It does not have sharpness like the hooks nor is it of sharp extremity so that it does not wound the vein; and it is of thick flexibility, for if it were thin, it would cut the vein by its thinness; rather it has excessive thickness as we have said.

De extraccio venae cruris.
On extracting a vein from the leg.

Aquesta vena es engendrada en las cambas en terras caudas ayssi cum al- Ategi en terra de Arabics e en las terras de India caudas e aridas de pauca teneritat e en las quals no nays erba ni aybre.
This vein is formed in the legs in hot lands such as in Ategi in the land of the Arabs and in the hot and arid lands of India with little tenderness and where no grass or trees grow.

E fort leu es engendrada en autres locs del cors otra las cambas.
And it is easily formed in other parts of the body besides the legs.

E la gestacio de lu es de putrefaccio que ve dejos la codena ayssi cum venen dedintz le cors serpentz e vermps e scarides e verms engendrantz entre la codena e la carn.
And its gestation is from putrefaction that comes under the skin just as serpents and worms and mites and worms are generated inside the body between the skin and the flesh.

E senhal de la suscepcio de l’adveniment de lu es de aquesta vena que accideys en la camba enflammacio vehement; e aprop le loc es vesicat; e aprop comensa la vena yssir del loc de aquela vesicacio quays sembla razit de planta.
And a sign of the onset of its coming is that this vein causes severe inflammation in the leg; and then the area becomes blistered; and then the vein begins to emerge from the site of that blister almost like the root of a plant.

E adonc cum appar de lu la extremitat, lahoras cove que tu envolvas sobre aquela una pessa de plom del qual sia le pes de una drac. entro a ii drac., e noza aquela e layssa le plom suspendut de la camba.
And then when its extremity appears, it is fitting that you wrap over it a piece of lead weighing from one to two drachms, and tie it and leave the lead suspended from the leg.

E tantas veguadas cum yeys de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, envolveys aquo em plom e noza aquel.
And as many times as something of it comes out to the outer parts, wrap it in lead and tie it.

E si mot es prolonguat, lahoras tu inscideys una partida de lu e envolopa le romanent; e no inscidas aquela de razit entro que sia fora yssida, quar si inscideys aquela es contrayta e intra en la carn e fa accidir apostema e poyredura en le loc e ulceracio mala.
And if it is much prolonged, then you cut a part of it and wrap the remainder; and do not cut it from the root until it has come out completely, because if you cut it, it contracts and enters the flesh and causes an abscess and rotting in the place and bad ulceration.

Per que cove que sia tractada suaument e sia extrayta petit a petit, entro que sia fora-gitada del derier de lu e no remangua de lu alcuna causa en le cors.
Therefore it is fitting that it be treated gently and be extracted little by little, until the last of it is thrown out and nothing of it remains in the body.

E de aquesta vena es yssit en alcus homes que es en la sua longitut de v palms e de detz e ja es pervengut a mi que yssic un de xx palms.
And from this vein has come out in some men that which is in its length of 5 palms and ten, and it has even come to me that one came out of 20 palms.

E si es inscidida en la hora de la sua medicacio, lahoras intromet lo ray en le trauc de lu e perfora aquela am lonc trauc am le cors, entro que sia evacuat tot aquo que es en la materia, e administra putrefaccio del loc per alcus dias am medicinas; e aprop cura aquela per la curacio de apostemas.
And if it is cut at the time of its medication, then introduce the probe into its hole and perforate it with a long hole with the body, until all that is in the matter is evacuated, and administer putrefaction of the place for some days with medicines; and afterwards cure it by the cure of abscesses.

E aquesta vena alcunas veguadas ha motz ramps, e majorment quan apar a la junctura del pe o en le pe, e veno a lu motz orrificis, e es yssit de quascu orrifici ram.
And this vein sometimes has many branches, and especially when it appears at the joint of the foot or in the foot, and many orifices come to it, and a branch has come out of each orifice.

E donc cura aquela ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio e am aquo que es desus dit.
And then cure it as we have said in the division and with what is said above.

De sectione super vermes generatos sub cute et dicitur aegritudo bovina.
On cutting over worms generated under the skin and called bovine disease.

Aquesta malautia es nompnada en alcuna terra deves nos malautia bovina per so quar motas veguadas endeve als bious e es verm pauc un le qual es nat entre la codena e la carn, e va en tot le cos pujan e devalan, e es mostrat al sentiment deves le sieu anament de membre en membre entro que disromp la codena e yeys fora.
This disease is named in some land near us bovine disease because it often happens to cattle and it is a small worm which is born between the skin and the flesh, and it goes throughout the whole body rising and descending, and it is shown to the senses by its movement from member to member until it breaks the skin and comes out.

E la generacio de lu es per putrefaccio de alcunas humors ayssi cum accideysso verms e serpentz e lombrics e ascaridas en le ventre.
And its generation is by putrefaction of some humors just as worms and serpents and roundworms and mites happen in the belly.

E es temut per la malicia de lu, quar quan el va en le cors e es elevat al cap, e es pervengut al huel, lahoras fort leu uebre en lu e intra e destruzeys le huel, e aquo endeve motas veguadas.
And it is feared for its malice, because when it goes in the body and is elevated to the head, and has reached the eye, then it very easily opens into it and enters and destroys the eye, and this happens many times.

E donc quan tu voles curar aquel e extraire lu, lahoras no se fa si no deves la sieua ambulacio e apparacio de lu al sentiment, e adonc cove que tu strenhas aquo que es sobre lu e aquo que es dejos lu am liament e constriccio fort, e aprop secca sobre lu e extratz aquel.
And so when you want to cure it and extract it, then it is not done except towards its movement and appearance to the senses, and then it is fitting that you tighten what is above it and what is below it with a binding and strong constriction, and afterwards cut over it and extract it.

E si es preondat en la carn e no le atrobes, lahoras tu pausa cauteri am foc sobre le loc entro que mora, e la major causa que es temuda es corrupcio de lu am la qual corrump le loc ayssi cum havem dit.
And if it is deep in the flesh and you do not find it, then you place a cautery with fire over the place until it dies, and the main thing that is feared is its corruption with which it corrupts the place as we have said.

May si tu vezes aquel esser pervengut al cap prop del huel, lahoras strenh sobre le sobrecil am fort strictura, e aprop secsa sobre lu, e extratz aquel; e cove que·l malaute use de mondificacio del sieu cors am medicinas evacuantz humors putridas malas, e guarda se de viandas generantz putrefaccio.
But if you see that it has reached the head near the eye, then tighten over the eyebrow with strong constriction, and afterwards cut over it, and extract it; and it is fitting that the patient use cleansing of his body with medicines evacuating putrid bad humors, and guard himself from foods generating putrefaction.

De sectione super aegritudinem nafir.
On the treatment of the illness called nafir.

Aquesta malautia es nompnada en nostra terra nafir, e es dolor la qual ve en alcus membres, e aprop es permudada de membre en membre.
This illness is called nafir in our land, and it is a pain which comes in some body parts, and then moves from one part to another.

E yeu ja e vista aquela segon que yeu te recomtare.
And I have seen it as I will tell you.

Yeu fu apelat a una femna malauta ad una vila, e descubric le sieu bras e vi una imflacio petita en la vena funis del bras, e pus que fu romas per una hora, vi aquela imflacio anar ayssi cum va verm pujan ad aquest, mays pus leugierament que esser por, ayssi cum si fos argent viu quan corr de loc en loc.
I was called to a sick woman in a village, and uncovered her arm and saw a small swelling in the main vein of the arm, and after an hour, I saw that swelling move like a worm climbing up it, but more lightly than can be, as if it were quicksilver running from place to place.

E adonc anet s'en la dolor de aquel loc e fiquet se en le muscle, e aprop aqui stec per una hora.
And then the pain left that place and settled in the muscle, and stayed there for an hour.

E aprop correc en l’autre cors entro que pervenc al autre bras.
And then it ran through the other body until it reached the other arm.

E aprop recomtec a mi que revolvia se per tot le cors sieu segon que yeu vi; e fo trop meravelat de la permutacio de lu e de la velocitat de membre en membre.
And then she told me that it moved all over her body as I saw; and I was very amazed at its movement and the speed from one part to another.

E yeu ja havia vist denant aquo en les mieus huels segon aquela manieyra, empero yeu he vistz motz les quals atroban dolor esser permutada de membra a membre.
And I had seen this before with my own eyes in this manner, however I have seen many who find pain moving from one part to another.

Mays no vi aquo am les huels ayssi cum en la femna.
But I did not see it with my eyes as I did in this woman.

E yeu no cogiti esser aquo sino que es per aquo quar la femna era de viela, on so de secs cors e de venas descubertas, e en aquesta apparec al sentiment aquela ventositat permutada.
And I do not think this is except because the woman was old, where there are dry bodies and exposed veins, and in her this moving wind appeared to the senses.

E es necessari que no apparesca segon aquesta retro-curacio en aquels que son delicioses e am cors humitz de venas ameguadas.
And it is necessary that this does not appear according to this backward-running in those who are delicate and with moist bodies of hidden veins.

E cum tu voles la curacio de lu, e le pacient sent aquela dolor, lahoras no es a tu aparent al huel ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras tu strenh sobre aquel e dejos lu leugierament e secse sobre aquel entro que sia yssida aquela ventositat coartada, e cauterize le loc.
And when you want to cure it, and the patient feels that pain, then it is not apparent to your eye as we have said, then you press on it and below it lightly and dry it until that constrained wind has come out, and cauterize the place.

Mays si tu no la vezes am los tieus huels, alhoras tu cura aquel am excussio del cors e am aquo que expelleys ventositatz, e carmina aquelas am pillulas fetidas e am pillulas de serapi e semblantz.
But if you do not see it with your eyes, then you cure it with shaking of the body and with that which expels winds, and treat those with fetid pills and with pills of serapium and similar things.

De extraccio de sagetas.
On the extraction of arrows.

Sagetas son diversificadas segon las specias, e segon les locs dels cors en les quals cazo, quar la lor diversitat es que de aquellas so que han grans puntas, e petitas, e concavas, e sordas, so es solidas; e de lor so que han tres angles, e de aquelas a las quals so que han lenguas; e de aquelas a las quals so astelas.
Arrows are diverse according to their types, and according to the places of the body where they fall, for their diversity is that some have large points, and small, and hollow, and solid ones; and some that have three angles, and some that have barbs; and some that have splinters.

E aquela que es segon les membres e las pessas en las quals cazo es segon dos manieyras: quar les membres o so membres principals concaus, ayssi cum le cervel, le cor, e·l fitge, e le pulmo, e les ronhos, e les budels, e la vezica, e a lor semblantz; e donc quan catz en alcu de aquestz membres e aparo a tu senhals de mort, la qual causa yeu recomtare aprop, lahoras cove que tu evites extraccio de aquela sageta en aquels quar la mort siec aquel en le qual en las majors disposicios, e quan a tu no appareysso aquestz mals senhals, e la sageta no es amaguada en la profunditat del membre, lahoras tu extratz aquela e cura la plagua.
And that which is according to the members and parts in which they fall is in two ways: for the members are either principal hollow members, such as the brain, the heart, and the liver, and the lung, and the kidneys, and the intestines, and the bladder, and similar to them; and so when it falls in any of these members and signs of death appear to you, which I will recount after, then it is appropriate that you avoid extraction of that arrow in those for death follows that in which in the major dispositions, and when these bad signs do not appear to you, and the arrow is not hidden in the depth of the member, then you extract it and cure the wound.

E dels senhals del servel es quan catz en lu sageta, e trespassa le os, e es yssit del cyphac le qual es sobre le cervel, quar accideys per lu soda vehement, e scotomia, e vertige, e rogor en les huels, e imflamacio e rogor de la lengua, e spasme e permixtio de entendament e vomi de colera, e fort leu es abscindida la paraula e es destruida la votz, e es yssit del loc de la plagua humiditat blanca semblant a pols, e yeys de lu semblant ad aquositat de la carn.
And of the signs of the brain is when an arrow falls in it, and passes through the bone, and has come out of the membrane which is over the brain, for it causes by it violent headache, and dizziness, and vertigo, and redness in the eyes, and inflammation and redness of the tongue, and spasm and confusion of understanding and vomiting of bile, and very easily the speech is cut off and the voice is destroyed, and white moisture like dust comes out of the place of the wound, and something like watery flesh comes out of it.

E donc si appareyso a tu aquestz senhals, lahoras tu abste de la curacio e de la extraccio de la sageta, si non es fora.
And so if these signs appear to you, then you abstain from the cure and from the extraction of the arrow, if it is not outside.

Mays les senhals de la sageta quan catz en le cor, so que ela es prop de la mamila senestra, e sent am aquela quays sia ficada en causa dura, e no es causa vueda; e fort leu le movement de la sageta es semblant a movement del pols, e corr de la plagua sanc negra, e siec aquel fregiditat de las extremitatz, e suzor freja, e sincopi; e donc sapias que la mort descen ses tot dopte.
But the signs of the arrow when it falls in the heart, are that it is near the left breast, and one feels as if it is fixed in a hard thing, and it is not an empty thing; and very soon the movement of the arrow is similar to the movement of the pulse, and black blood runs from the wound, and that follows coldness of the extremities, and cold sweat, and fainting; and then know that death descends without any doubt.

E les senhals quan la sageta ha plaglat le pulmo so eyssiment de sanc spumos de la plagua, e les vayssels que so prop del col so apostematz, e es mudada la color del malaute, e expira sperit gran aut, e demanda atraccio de ayre freg.
And the signs when the arrow has wounded the lung are the exit of foamy blood from the wound, and the vessels that are near the neck are swollen, and the color of the patient is changed, and he exhales great high spirit, and demands attraction of cold air.

E si catz la sageta en le velament le qual es en le pietz, e la dolor lahoras es prop de las costas petitas, e es fayt le ale gran am vehement dolor e am sospir, e no so maugutz totz les membres dels muscles.
And if the arrow falls in the membrane which is in the chest, and the pain then is near the small ribs, and the breath is made great with vehement pain and with sigh, and not all the members of the muscles are moved.

E si catz la sageta en le stomac, lahoras fort leu yeys de la plagua vianda alcuna indigesta.
And if the arrow falls in the stomach, then very soon some undigested food comes out of the wound.

E si catz la sageta en le ventre, e es ficada en lu, yeys alcuna fenda de la plagua, o la tela, o budel le qual es disromput, e no es speransa en la curacio de lu extraccio de la sageta.
And if the arrow falls in the belly, and is fixed in it, some crack comes out of the wound, or the skin, or bowel which is broken, and there is no hope in the cure of extracting the arrow.

E si la sageta catz en la vesica, e es yssida defora urina, e procesesca de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, e fort leu es dolor sobre le malaute, lahoras sapias que es mortal.
And if the arrow falls in the bladder, and urine has come out, and some thing proceeds from it to the outer parts, and very soon there is pain over the patient, then know that it is mortal.

Mays les autres membres ayssi cum es la cara, le col, e·l golayro, e las spallas e le adjutori, e les spondils del dos, e la furcula, e la coysa, e la camba e a lor semblantz dels membres, son salvatz segon las majors disposicios quan la sageta no atroba vena ni arteria e no es sageta venenosa.
But the other members such as the face, the neck, and the throat, and the shoulders and the upper arm, and the vertebrae of the back, and the collarbone, and the thigh, and the leg and their similar members, are saved according to the major dispositions when the arrow does not find vein or artery and is not a poisonous arrow.

E yeu recomtare aquo a tu que he vist del esser de aquestas sagetas, per que signifiques per aquo sobre la curacio tieua.
And I will recount to you what I have seen of the being of these arrows, so that you signify by this about your cure.

La qual causa es, quar en un home cazec sageta en le lacrimal del huel de lu en la razitz del nas, e yeu extrayssi aquela a lu del autra partida, dejos le grays de l’aurelha de lu, e es sanat, e no accidic en le huel de lu nocument.
Which thing is, that in a man an arrow fell in the tear duct of his eye in the root of the nose, and I extracted it from him from the other part, below the fat of his ear, and he is healed, and no harm occurred in his eye.

E extrayssi autra sageta a un Juzeu la qual cazec en lu en lo grays del sieu huel, dejos la palpebra pus dejos, e la sageta ja era occultada e no so conseguit de aquela sino una petita extremitat am la qual adhereys al sieu fust, e era gran sageta de las sagetas agudas dels Turcs , am ferr leon en la qual no havia aurelhas.
And I extracted another arrow from a Jew which fell in him in the fat of his eye, below the lower eyelid, and the arrow was already hidden and nothing was achieved of it except a small extremity with which it adheres to its shaft, and it was a great arrow of the sharp arrows of the Turks, with lion iron in which there were no ears.

E senat es le Juzieu , e no accidic en le sieu huel mal accident.
And the Jew is healed, and no bad accident occurred in his eye.

E extrayssi una autra sageta a un home Crestia la qual era cazuta en le golayro, e era sageta arabica, e es aquela a la qual so aurelhas; e adonc yeu inscidegui sobre aquela entre doas guidegi, e ja era submersa en le golayro de lu; e adonc yeu so subtiliat am aquela, e aprop extraxi aquela, e es sanat le Crestia .
And I extracted another arrow from a Christian man which had fallen in the throat, and it was an Arabic arrow, and it is that to which there are ears; and then I cut over it between two guides, and it was already submerged in his throat; and then I was subtle with it, and afterwards extracted it, and the Christian is healed.

E extraxi autra sageta a un home la qual era cazuta en le sieu ventre, e cogitegui que moris per aquela; e donc, pus que foro passatz xxx dias e no es mudat sobre lu alcuna causa de las suas disposicios, inscidegui sobre la sageta e engenagui sobre aquela, e es sanat, e no accidic a lu accident mal.
And I extracted another arrow from a man which had fallen in his belly, and I thought that he would die from it; and then, after thirty days had passed and nothing had changed over him of his dispositions, I cut over the arrow and contrived over it, and he is healed, and no bad accident occurred to him.

E vi mays un home en le qual cazec una sageta en le dos de lu, e consolidada es la plagua sobre lu, e pus que foc aprop set ans, yssic la sageta en la razitz de la coyssa.
And I saw more a man in whom an arrow fell in his back, and the wound is consolidated over him, and after it was seven years later, the arrow came out in the root of the thigh.

E vi una femna a la qual cazec sageta en le sieu ventre, e la plagua es consolidada dedintz lu, e no es mudada en las suas disposicios en re, e la femna no atrobec nocument en alcunas de las suas opperacios naturals.
And I saw a woman to whom an arrow fell in her belly, and the wound is consolidated inside her, and nothing is changed in her dispositions at all, and the woman found no harm in any of her natural operations.
