E vi un autre home al qual cazec sageta en la sua cara e consolidada es la plagua e romas la sageta, no atrobant aqui mota dolor, e motz semblantz ad aquestz.
And I saw another man to whom an arrow fell in his face and the wound is consolidated and the arrow remained, not finding much pain there, and many similar to these.

E extrayssi la sageta del home dels princeps del rey que era cazuda en le mieg loc del nas sieu e ja havia declinat a la partida dreyta un petit, e occultada era tota la sageta.
And I extracted the arrow from the man of the princes of the king that had fallen in the middle place of his nose and had already declined to the right side a little, and the whole arrow was hidden.

E yeu fu appelat a la curacio de lu aprop le cazement de la sageta entro a tres dias.
And I was called to treat him after the arrow's fall for up to three days.

E adonc yeu atrobegui la plagua de la sageta mot streyta; e adonc yeu inquirigui aquela am tenta subtil, e no sentigui aquela; mays el la sentia puncio dejos la aurelha dreyta, e adonc speregui que aquela punccio era per la extremitat de la sageta.
And then I found the arrow wound very narrow; and then I probed it with a subtle probe, and did not feel it; but he felt a prick below the right ear, and then I hoped that this prick was from the tip of the arrow.

E amplastregui le loc am emplaustre en le qual es vertut atrectiva e digestiva, confizant de mi que·l loc se apostemes per que appares a mi le loc de la sageta, per que secces sobre aquela.
And I applied a plaster to the place with a plaster in which there is attractive and digestive virtue, trusting that the place would become inflamed so that the location of the arrow would appear to me, so that I could cut above it.

E no accidic en le loc accident significant que la sageta hagues conseguit aquel loc; e yeu continuegui am le emplaustre sobre lu per motz dias e no accidic accident; e consolidada es la plagua entretant, e romas le malaute de la extreccio de lu per spazi de motz dias entro que un jorn sentic la sageta dintz le sieu nas e recontec aquo a mi.
And no accident occurred in the place indicating that the arrow had reached that place; and I continued with the plaster on him for many days and no accident occurred; and the wound healed meanwhile, and the patient remained without the extraction of it for the space of many days until one day he felt the arrow inside his nose and reported this to me.

E adonc yeu pausegui sobre la plagua medicina acuta corrosiva per motz dias entro que foc ubert, e am la tenta yeu assagegui aquel, e atrobegui la extremitat de la sageta subtil, la qual adhereys al fust.
And then I applied a sharp corrosive medicine to the wound for many days until it was opened, and with the probe I tested it, and found the subtle tip of the arrow, which adhered to the shaft.

E aprop yeu ajustegui en la apersio de la plagua per aquela medicina acuta entro que apparec a mi visiblament la extremitat de la sageta, e passec a mi temps am aquo per le spazi de temps entro quatre meses.
And afterwards I enlarged the opening of the wound with that sharp medicine until the tip of the arrow appeared visibly to me, and time passed with this for the space of time up to four months.

E aprop pus que la plagua foc amplificada, e foc a mi possible entrometre las forfexs en lu, e remaure aquela, e no obezic ad eyssiment, lahoras yeu no cessegui subtiliar e ingeniar sobre aquela am manieyras de engen, entro que comensegui un dia sobre aquela am manieyras de engens pendre lu am forceps descentment faytas, segon que vindra la forma de aquelas en la fi del capitol, entro que extraxi aquela; e aprop restauregui aquela plagua.
And after the wound was enlarged, and it was possible for me to insert the forceps into it, and remove it, and it did not yield to exit, then I did not cease to refine and devise upon it with ingenious ways, until I began one day upon it with ways of devices to take it with properly made forceps, according to the form of those that will come at the end of the chapter, until I extracted it; and afterwards I restored that wound.

E alcus metges jutgavan que la cartillage del nas no es restaurada, e yeu restauregui aquela e la plagua es consolidada, e sanat es le malaute per sanetat entiera, e no noguec en lu en deguna causa.
And some doctors judged that the cartilage of the nose is not restored, and I restored it and the wound is healed, and the patient is healed with complete health, and it did not harm him in any way.

E yeu recomti a tu la qualitat de extraccio de alcunas sagetas per que pauses aquo regla e significacio sobre aquo que no he dit, quar las partidas de aquesta art e las difinicios de aquela no so conprehendudas am narracio ni no comprehen aquelas le libre.
And I recount to you the quality of extraction of some arrows so that you may set this as a rule and indication about what I have not said, for the parts of this art and its definitions are not comprehended with narration nor does the book comprehend them.

E le artifexs savi compara am pauc sobre mot; e am aquo que es present sobre aquo que es absent; e atroba operacio novela e instrument novel deves le descendement de las causas extranhas del art quan accideysso.
And the wise craftsman compares with little over much; and with what is present over what is absent; and finds new operation and new instrument towards the descent of strange causes of the art when they occur.

E donc yeu dic que sagetas no son fora-gitadas dels membres en les quals son ficadas sino segon dos manieyras: o per atraccio del loc en le qual intrec; o per le contrari de la autra partida.
And so I say that arrows are not cast out of the members in which they are fixed except according to two ways: either by attraction of the place in which it entered; or by the contrary of the other part.

E aquela que es gitada per le loc don es intrada, o es sageta procedent en loc carnos, e es atirada e fora-gitada.
And that which is cast by the place where it entered, either is an arrow proceeding in a fleshy place, and is drawn and cast out.

E si no obezeys a eyssiment de la hora en la qual catz, lahoras cove que tu la laysses per alcus dias entro que poyresca la carn que es al enviro de lu, e sia alleujada l‘atraccio de lu e la sua egressio.
And if it does not yield to exit at the time in which it falls, then it is fitting that you leave it for some days until the flesh that is around it rots, and its attraction and its egress is eased.

E semblantment si es ficada en os e no obezeys a tu a eyssiment, lahoras layssa aquela per alcus dias e itera aquela am atraccio e mocio en quascun dia, e ja es fora-gitada.
And similarly if it is fixed in bone and does not yield to you to exit, then leave it for some days and repeat that with attraction and motion each day, and it is already cast out.

E si no obezeys a tu eyssiment aprop alcus dias, lahoras cove que tu perforas en le circuit de la sageta en aquel os de tota partida am taravel subtil entro que·l loc sia amplificat de la sageta, e aprop extratz aquela.
And if it does not yield to you exit after some days, then it is fitting that you perforate in the circuit of the arrow in that bone from every part with a subtle auger until the place of the arrow is enlarged, and afterwards extract it.

E si la sageta es ficada en le os del cap e ja ha procezit en un dels ventres del cervel, e apparo en le malaute alcus de aquels accidentz les quals yeu e ditz, lahoras abste de la extraccio de la sageta e layssa aquela entro que·l sieu esser sia equat aprop alcus dias; quar si la sageta perve al ciphac, lahoras la mort no es a lu prolonguada.
And if the arrow is lodged in the bone of the head and has already penetrated into one of the ventricles of the brain, and some of those symptoms which I have mentioned appear in the patient, then refrain from extracting the arrow and leave it until its presence is stabilized after a few days; for if the arrow reaches the peritoneum, then death will not be prolonged for him.

E si la sageta no es ficada sino en le cors del os tant solament e no passa entro al ciphac, e roman le malaute per alcus dias, e no accideys a lu denguna causa de aquels accidentz, lahoras tu engenia en la atraccio de la sageta e en la atraccio de lu.
And if the arrow is only lodged in the body of the bone and does not pass through to the peritoneum, and the patient remains for a few days, and none of those symptoms occur to him, then you should attempt to extract the arrow and remove it.

Mays si es mot ficada e no obezeys a tu a extraccio, lahoras tu aministra taravels en le circuit de la sageta ayssi cum havem recomtat, e aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.
But if it is very firmly lodged and does not yield to your extraction, then you should use drills around the arrow as we have described, and afterwards treat the area until it is healed.

Mays si la sageta ja es amaguada en le loc del cors, e es amaguada del sentiment, lahoras tu inquireys aquela am tenta, e si tu sentas aquela, lahoras atira aquela am alcus sturmentz les quals so convenientz a la atraccio de lu.
But if the arrow is already hidden in the body, and is hidden from sensation, then you should probe for it with a probe, and if you feel it, then pull it out with some instruments which are suitable for its extraction.

E si no podes sobre lu per la constriccio de la plagua e per la longitut del preon, e aqui no es os ni nervi ni vena, lahoras tu fen sobre la plagua entro que sia amplificada e que sia possible extrayre la sageta.
And if you cannot reach it due to the constriction of the wound and the depth of penetration, and there is no bone or nerve or vein there, then you should cut open the wound until it is widened and it becomes possible to extract the arrow.

E si so a lu aurelhas am las quals sia tenguda, lahoras tu deliura la carn en la qual es ficada de tota partida am tot le engen que poyras far; e ingenia sobre aquo, si no podes sobre la evasio de la carn en la fractura de las aurelhas e en torssio de aquelas entro que obezesca.
And if it has barbs with which it is held, then you should free the flesh in which it is lodged from all sides with all the skill you can muster; and if you cannot manage the removal of the flesh, attempt to break or twist the barbs until it yields.

E quan tu administras la extraccio de la sageta en quascun loc on sia, lahoras tu usa am torcio de la tua ma am forceps a totas partidas entro que fassa aquela obezir; e subtilia am deriera subtilitat que la sageta no sia trencada e que sia fayta a tu dificil atraccio de lu e de aquela extraccio.
And when you administer the extraction of the arrow in whatever place it may be, then you should use a twisting motion of your hand with forceps on all sides until you make it yield; and be extremely careful that the arrow is not broken and that its extraction does not become difficult for you.

E si no podes sobre aquela de la tua hora, lahoras tu layssa per alcus dias entro que se poyrescan las partidas que so en le circuit de lu, e aprop itera aquela quar lahoras es alleujada.
And if you cannot manage it at that time, then you should leave it for a few days until the parts around it begin to rot, and then try again for then it is loosened.

Mays si a tu fa contrarietat flux de sanc, lahoras tu administra aquo que havem dit de curacio en le sieu capitol.
But if you are faced with the problem of blood flow, then you should administer what we have said about treatment in its chapter.

E guarda la tua vertut de inscizio de vena o de nervi, o de corda, e aministra engen en tota manieyra a tu possibla de la evasio de la sageta; e fay aquo am facilitat e tranquillitat e tarditat e fermetat ayssi cum yeu e a tu recomtat.
And guard your skill from cutting a vein or nerve, or cord, and use all possible means to remove the arrow; and do this with ease and tranquility and slowness and firmness as I have described to you.

E donc que fassas contrayre la sageta per so que·l malaute sia segon la figura segon la qual foc deves le cazement de la sageta en lu, quar es mays juvatiu.
And therefore make the arrow retract so that the patient is in the same position as when the arrow fell into him, for this is more helpful.

Mays si aquo no es a tu possible, lahoras tu aministra aquo que es a tu possible per las figuras.
But if this is not possible for you, then you should do what is possible for you according to the circumstances.

Mays las sagetas que son fora-gitadas per le contrari del autra partida, o que ja de lu procezeys alcuna partida a las partidas de fora, o fa gilbositat la extramitat de la sageta per sentiment de la partida pus desus de la codena propdana e vezes aquela eminent; adonc tu secsa sobre aquela; e sia la seccio segon la quantitat en la qual prenguan las forceps; e aprop atira aquela, quar ela es fayta leugiera a eyssiment.
But for arrows that are ejected from the opposite side, or from which some part already protrudes to the outside, or if the tip of the arrow causes a bump that can be felt just under the nearby skin and you see it protruding; then you should cut above it; and let the cut be according to the size that the forceps can grasp; and then pull it out, for it is made easy to remove.

Mays si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu tortz lama segon contrarietat entro que la sageta enprema en le os, e amplifique a si meteys, e aprop extratz aquela.
But if it is retained in the bone, then you should twist the blade in the opposite direction until the arrow makes an impression in the bone, and widens itself, and then extract it.

E sino, layssa aquela per alcus dias, e aprop itera aquela entro qu’en yesca.
If not, leave it for a few days, and then try again until it comes out.

E si le fust de la sageta es en aquela, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am lu.
And if the shaft of the arrow is still attached, then you should push it out with it.

Mays si le fust es cazut e voles aministrar inpulsio, lahoras tu intromet e aquela, si es sorda, sturment concau per so que intre la concavitat de lu en la coa de la sageta e aprop impelleys aquela am lu.
But if the shaft has fallen off and you want to push it out, then you should insert into it, if it is solid, a hollow instrument so that its cavity enters the tail of the arrow and then push it out with it.

Mays si la sageta es concava, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am sturment fort intrant en aquela, quar la sageta es alleujada per aquela.
But if the arrow is hollow, then you push it with a strong instrument entering into it, because the arrow is lightened by it.

E si la sageta es entoxiguada, lahoras cove que tu concaves tota la carn en la qual es le vere, si es a tu possible aquo, e aprop cura aquela am aquo que si conveneys.
And if the arrow is poisoned, then it is necessary that you hollow out all the flesh in which the poison is, if it is possible for you to do so, and afterward cure it with what is appropriate.

E si la sageta catz en le pietz, o en le ventre, o en la vesica, o en le costat, e es propinqua per so que tu tocas aquela am la tenta, e es a tu possible secsar sobre aquela, lahoras secsa sobre aquela e guarda te de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e extratz aquela, e aprop cos la plagua si indigeys, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.
And if the arrow falls in the chest, or in the belly, or in the bladder, or in the side, and is close so that you touch it with the probe, and it is possible for you to cut above it, then cut above it and be careful of cutting a vein or nerve, and extract it, and afterward sew the wound if needed, and cure it until it is healed.

Forma de forceps am las quals so atiradas las sagetas:
Form of forceps with which arrows are drawn:

Sian las extremitatz de lor cum a bec de ausel que son faytas cum serra quan prendon sobre la sageta per so que no la layssen.
Let their extremities be like a bird’s beak that are made like a saw when they grip the arrow so that they don't let it go.

E de aquelas son faytas motas specias, grans, paucas e migieras, segon la quantitat de la grandeza de la sageta e de la sieua pauqueza, e de la amplitud de la plagua, e de la constriccio de lu.
And of these are made many types, large, small and medium, according to the quantity of the size of the arrow and its smallness, and the width of the wound, and the constriction of it.

Forma de impellent concau de aquesta extremitat conquava ayssi cum pena de ausel per so que sia alleujat le intrament de la sageta en lu, e impulcio de aquela sorda:
Form of a hollow pusher with this hollow extremity like a bird’s feather so that the entry of the arrow into it is lightened, and its pushing is muffled:

Forma de impellent de sorda extremitat:
Form of a pusher with a muffled extremity:

ayssi cum ray per so que sia alleujat le intrament de lu en la sageta concava e es impellida am aquel.
like a ray so that the entry of it into the hollow arrow is lightened and it is pushed with that.

De fleubotomia de las venas.
On bloodletting of the veins.

Las venas de fleubotomia de las quals corr costuma de fleubotomar so xxx, de las quals so en le cap xvi, so es doas venas pulsatils las quals so aprop las aurelhas, dic alhasisain; doas herbas que so en les dos templars apparentz; e doas venas que so en dos lacrimals de dos huels que son appeladas aspicientz; e la vena preparada en le mieg loc del front, e la vena que es en la extremitat del nas; e doas guidegi que so al col; e doas venas que so en la labia desus; e doas venas que so en la labia dejos; e — aquestas so las venas que so appeladas algelic —; e so doas venas que so dejos la lengua.
The veins for bloodletting from which it is customary to draw blood are 30, of which 16 are in the head, that is two pulsating veins which are near the ears, called alhasisain; two herbs that are in the two visible temples; and two veins that are in two tear ducts of two eyes that are called looking; and the vein prepared in the middle of the forehead, and the vein that is at the tip of the nose; and two guidegi that are on the neck; and two veins that are in the upper lip; and two veins that are in the lower lip; and — these are the veins that are called algelic —; and there are two veins that are under the tongue.

Mays las venas que so fleubotomadas en les brasses so v; quar de aquelas es una cephalica, e es deves le latz silvestre; e le poble appela “la vena del cap”, e sorda, e es vena migiera, e es composta de un ram de la basilica, e de autre ram de la cephalica; e nomna aquela le poble “vena de tot le cors”, e basilica es vena la qual es pausada en le latz domestic, e es nomnada “citillar”, e nompnan aquela les vulguars “vena del ventre”; e funis del bras, e es pausada sobre le focil, e es aquela en la qual es fleubotomat, e es aquela que appar sobre le poutz per apparicio manifesta; e salvatella, e es la vena que es entre lo dit auricular e·l pus petit dit, e so en lu dos ramps.
But the veins that are bled in the arms are 5; for of these one is cephalic, and is towards the wild side; and the people call it "the vein of the head", and muffled, and it is the middle vein, and is composed of a branch of the basilic, and of another branch of the cephalic; and the people name it "vein of all the body", and basilic is a vein which is placed on the domestic side, and is named "citillar", and the common people name it "vein of the belly"; and funis of the arm, and it is placed on the forearm, and it is that in which is bled, and it is that which appears on the wrist by manifest appearance; and salvatella, and it is the vein that is between the ring finger and the smallest finger, and there are two branches in it.

E en le pe e la camba so tres venas; la una de aquelas es que es dejos la curvatura del denolh del latz silvestre; e la segonda es sophena, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz domestic; e la vena sciatica, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz silvestre; e en la camba son autras venas semblantz ad aquelas.
And in the foot and the leg there are three veins; one of these is that which is below the curve of the knee on the wild side; and the second is sophena, and its place is below the leg on the domestic side; and the sciatic vein, and its place is below the leg on the wild side; and in the leg are other veins similar to these.

Le juvament de las venas que so aprop las aurelhas es a cataris antics e emigranea e sahafati e ulceracios del cap malas antiquas.
The benefit of the veins that are near the ears is for ancient catarrhs and migraine and sahafati and bad ancient ulcerations of the head.

E la qualitat de sagnar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: es que sia ras le cap del malaute, e sia freguat le cap del malaute en le occipiti en le loc de amdoas las venas am drap ample am bona fricacio; aprop strenha le malaute le sieu col am una benda entro que apparan las doas e les locs de lor so aprop las aurelhas en dos locs depremegutz del cap; e quereys aquela am le tieu dit, e si tu sentes le pols de aquelas am le dit tieu, aqui senha am tenta.
And the quality of bleeding those is as I tell you: the patient's head should be shaved, and the patient's head should be rubbed at the occiput in the place of both veins with a wide cloth with good friction; afterwards, the patient should tighten their neck with a band until both appear and their places are after the ears in two depressed places of the head; and seek that with your finger, and if you feel the pulse of those with your finger, mark there with ink.

Aprop tu pren la lancea cutellar, e es aquela que es inscident, e aprop tu intromet aquel dejos la vena en la codena entro que·l fleubotomi vengua al os.
Afterwards, take the knife-like lance, which is the cutting one, and then insert it under the vein in the skin until the lancet reaches the bone.

E aprop eleva la tua ma am la vena e la codena a las partidas desus e inscideys la vena am inscizio inscident.
And then raise your hand with the vein and the skin to the upper parts and cut the vein with an incising cut.

E sia la longitut de la inscizio la quantitat de dos ditz ajustatz o entorn de aquo; e fay yssir del sanc atant quant voles.
And let the length of the incision be the quantity of two joined fingers or thereabouts; and let out as much blood as you want.

E aprop strenh am pulvils e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.
And afterwards, tighten with compresses and leave it until it is healed.

E ja e precedit en le comensament del libre la inscizio de aquelas e de lor la cauterizacio.
And I have already preceded in the beginning of the book the incision of those and their cauterization.

Mays de las doas venas arterias que so als templars le juvament de la fleubotomia es a emigranea antiqua e sode malvada e obtalmia assidua e cors de superfluitatz acutas effusas als huels.
But of the two arterial veins that are at the temples, the benefit of bloodletting is for ancient migraine and sudden evil and persistent eye inflammation and flow of acute superfluities poured into the eyes.

E la qualitat de fleubotomar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: constrengua le malaute le sieu col mot entro que apparan las doas venas al sentiment per appericio manifesta e sia demonstrat le pols de lor dejos le tieu dit; e lahoras tu senha am tenta.
And the quality of bleeding those is as I tell you: let the patient tighten their neck very much until the two veins appear to the touch by clear appearance and let their pulse be demonstrated under your finger; and then you mark with ink.

E aprop tu eleva la codena desobre la vena a las partidas desus am le tieu dit indic, e intromet le fleubotomi inscident dejos, e eleva la vena en sus; e inscidey aquela ayssi cum has fayt en las doas venas autras; e fay correr del sanc segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.
And afterwards, you raise the skin above the vein to the upper parts with your index finger, and insert the cutting lancet underneath, and raise the vein upwards; and cut it as you have done in the other two veins; and let the blood run according to the quantity of your need.

E aprop deslia la coartacio del malaute, e pausa le tieu dit sobre la vena per una hora, e aprop pausa sobre aquela coto e pulvils e strenh aquela desus am fort constriccio, e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.
And afterwards, untie the patient's constriction, and place your finger over the vein for an hour, and afterwards place cotton and compresses on it and tighten it above with strong constriction, and leave it until it is healed.

E ja es precedida la rememoracio de lor, e de aquelas la inscizio, e la atraccio en le comensament del libre.
And the remembrance of them has already preceded, and of those the incision, and the attraction at the beginning of the book.

E donc le juvament de fleubotomia de la vena del front es aprop la fleubotomia de la cephalica a las malautias antiquas de la cara e a emigranea e rogor e ulceracios fetidas.
And so the benefit of bloodletting from the vein of the forehead is after the bloodletting of the cephalic for ancient diseases of the face and for migraine and redness and fetid ulcerations.

E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es segon que yeu recomti a tu; so es que·l malaute strenha le sieu col am una benda entro que apparesca la vena; e aprop pren le insturment le qual es nompnat fossori del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:
And the quality of the bloodletting of it is as I tell you; that is, that the patient tightens their neck with a band until the vein appears; and afterwards take the instrument which is called a fossori of which this is its form:

Pausa la puncta eminent la qual es al cap del fossori sobre aquela vena e percuteys sobre lu am penche o am autre causa en la manieyra de lu, e layssa lo sanc correr segon la quantitat la qual voles; e aprop deslia la perforacio del malaute e strenh aquela entro que sia sanada.
Place the prominent point which is at the head of the fossori on that vein and strike it with a comb or with another thing in its manner, and let the blood run according to the quantity which you want; and afterwards untie the patient's perforation and tighten it until it is healed.

E alcunas veguadas es uberta am fleubotomi lat, empero no cove que·l fleubotomi sia de acuta extremitat ayssi cum les autres fleubotomis, abantz sia de lada extremitat, e fleubotoma aquela segon le tranvers, quar le os es propda e fort leu trencaria en lu le fleubotomi quan es subtil.
And sometimes it is opened with a wide lancet, however it is not suitable that the lancet be of sharp extremity as the other lancets, rather it should be of wide extremity, and bleed it according to the transverse, because the bone is near and the lancet would very easily break in it when it is thin.

Mays le juvament de las duas venas que so als lacrimals de dos huels per scabia del huels per rogor e sebol en les huels, e a las malautias de la cara.
But the benefit of the two veins that are at the tear ducts of both eyes is for scabies of the eyes, for redness and onion in the eyes, and for diseases of the face.

E la qualitat de la fleubotomia es que·l malaute strenha le col sieu am una benda, e aprop fleubotoma aquelas, e tu sias stant sobre le cap de lu.
And the quality of the bloodletting is that the patient tightens their neck with a band, and afterwards bleed those, and you should be standing over their head.

E sia fayta la fleubotomia segon le transvers a longitut un pauc am fleubotomi pauc, quar en le loc no es carn; e si le fleubotomi es subtil, fort leu la extremitat de lu es trencada.
And let the bloodletting be done according to the transverse to a little length with a small lancet, because in the place there is no flesh; and if the lancet is thin, its extremity is very easily broken.

E aprop fay correr del sanc atant quant es a tu necessari, e pausa sobre aquelas coto, e strenh aquelas per una nueyt, e aprop deslia aquelas.
And afterwards let the blood run as much as is necessary for you, and place cotton on those, and tighten those for one night, and afterwards untie those.

Mays le fleubotomi de la vena del nas es conferent a febre acuta e a soda vehement, e a las malautias de la cara e emigranea e rogor que accideys en la cara, e majorment quan es antiqua.
But the bloodletting from the vein of the nose is beneficial for acute fever and severe headache, and for diseases of the face and migraine and redness that occurs in the face, and especially when it is chronic.

E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute strenha le sieu col e aprop te le sieu nas am la tua ma sinistra, e pren le fleubotomi subtil lonc e fica aquela en le mieg loc del cap del nas segon rectitut, quar la vena no appar al sentiment aqui, e quar le sanc comensa a fluir tantost.
And the method of bloodletting from it is that the patient tightens his neck and then you hold his nose with your left hand, and take the long, thin lancet and insert it in the middle of the tip of the nose in a straight line, for the vein does not appear to the touch there, and because the blood begins to flow immediately.

Cove que tu ultimes la tua ma am le fleubotomi petit a petit e fassas correr del sanc segon la tua necessitat; e aprop lia aquela per una nuoyt, quar aquela es restaurada leugierament.
It is necessary that you guide your hand with the lancet little by little and make the blood flow according to your need; and afterwards bind it for a night, for it is easily restored.

Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de las doas guidegui a constriccio de ale e a comensament de lepra e a motas malautias e inpetige e malas ulceracios corrosivas ayssi cum herpotromeno.
But the benefit of bloodletting from the two guidegui [possibly jugular veins] is for constriction of breath and for the beginning of leprosy and for many diseases and impetigo and bad corrosive ulcerations such as herpotromeno [possibly herpes].

E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que el malaute strenha dejos quascuna en le sieu col am liament; e estia le artifexs sobre le cap del malaute, e le malaute sia sezent sobre una sezela.
And the method of bloodletting from these is that the patient tightens below each one on his neck with a binding; and the practitioner stands over the head of the patient, and the patient is sitting on a chair.

E aprop fleubotoma la vena al lonc am fleubotomi ample petit a petit; e aprop extratz de sanc segon temprada quantitat o segon aquo que vezes de necessitat que es ad aquo; e aprop fay semblant del autra vena.
And then bleed the vein lengthwise with a wide lancet little by little; and then extract blood according to a moderate quantity or according to what you see is necessary for this; and then do the same for the other vein.

E aprop deslia le liament e strenh las doas venas am strictura migiera per so que·l malaute no sia prefocat, e laysa entro al mati quar la plagua es sanada.
And then untie the binding and tighten the two veins with moderate pressure so that the patient is not suffocated, and leave until morning for the wound is healed.

E le juvament de la fleubotomia de las venas algerich, comfereys a petitas apostemas e pustulas de la boca e corrupcio de las gengivas e malas ulceracios e fissuras, e a malas ulceracios que so en le nas e en le circuit de lu.
And the benefit of bloodletting from the algerich veins [possibly sublingual veins] is beneficial for small abscesses and pustules of the mouth and corruption of the gums and bad ulcerations and fissures, and for bad ulcerations that are in the nose and in its surroundings.

E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que fases cezer le malaute denant tu, e strenh le col de lu am una benda, e aprop revolveys las labias de lu e reguarda a doas venas de las quals la una es de la dextra de la labia e la segonda de la senestra; e la demonstracio de quascuna es per la negror de quascuna de amdos, e aquo mays es quar en le circuit de aquelas so venas menudas negras; e adonc inscideys cascuna per inscizio inscident.
And the method of bloodletting from these is that you make the patient sit before you, and tighten his neck with a band, and then roll back his lips and look at two veins of which one is on the right of the lip and the second on the left; and the indication of each is by the blackness of each of both, and it is more so because in their surroundings are small black veins; and then incise each with an incising incision.

Mays si dubitacio es dejos tu, e no sabes qual es de aquelas, lahoras tu enten a inscisio de la major de aquelas, e de la pus manifesta de aquelas.
But if there is doubt under you, and you don't know which of these it is, then you intend to incise the larger of these, and the more visible of these.

E fay le semblant de las doas venas que so en las labias desus.
And do the same for the two veins that are in the upper lips.

Mays costuma corr mays a inscidir las doas venas que so en la labia dejos.
But custom runs more to incising the two veins that are in the lower lip.

Mays de doas venas que so dejos la lengua le juvament es aprop la fleubotomia de la cephalica a prefocacios que so en le guolayro, a la malautia de la uvula, e a malautias de la boca.
But of two veins that are under the tongue, the benefit is after the bloodletting of the cephalic for suffocations that are in the throat, for the disease of the uvula, and for diseases of the mouth.

E la qualitat de fleubotomar aquelas es que segue le malaute entre las tuas mas denant le solel, e eleva la lengua de lu, e reguarda dejos la lengua, de la un latz de lu vena e del autre latz vena, e la color de quascuna es declinant a negror.
And the method of bloodletting these is that the patient follows between your hands before the sun, and elevate his tongue, and look under the tongue, on one side of it a vein and on the other side a vein, and the color of each is tending to blackness.

E adonc fleubotoma quascuna; e guarda te que no ultimes la tua ma en fleubotoman aquelas, quar dejos aquelas so arterias.
And then bleed each; and be careful that you don't extend your hand in bleeding these, for under these are arteries.

E las tuas venas que so fleubotomadas en le coyde so en las quals corr costuma en totz les homes, e la fleubotomia de lor es fayta segon dos manieyras, o pongen am le fleubotomi mirtilat o olivar a subtilitat declinant; o secsar am fleubotomi cutellar, e apelha si alnessil, e aquesta es la forma de lu:
And your veins that are bled in the elbow are those in which custom runs in all men, and their bloodletting is done according to two ways, either puncturing with the myrtle-shaped or olive-shaped lancet tending to subtlety; or cutting with a knife-like lancet, and it is called alnessil, and this is its form:

E aquest alnessil es que conveneys a seccio e de aquels so specias latz e subtils segon la amplitut de las venas e segon la strictura de aquelas.
And this alnessil is that which is suitable for cutting and of these are wide and thin types according to the width of the veins and according to their narrowness.

Forma de fleubotomi mirti:
Form of myrtle-shaped lancet:

sia le latz de lu ayssi cum vezes, e conveneys a obrir las venas concavas plenas procedentz apparentz grossas, e ad aquelas que conteno sanc gros torbat.
let its side be as you see, and it is suitable to open the hollow full veins proceeding apparent thick, and for those that contain thick turbid blood.

E aquesta es la forma de fleubotomi olivar:
And this is the form of olive-shaped lancet:

E aquest fleubotomi es de menor latitut e de pus subtil extremitat, e conveneys a fleubotomia de venas subtils que conteno sanc subtil citri.
And this lancet is of lesser width and of more subtle extremity, and is suitable for bloodletting of subtle veins that contain thin citrine blood.

Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena basilica la qual es una de tres venas: quar extratz le sanc de las malautias que so dejos le guolayro e·l col, e de aquo que siec le pietz e·l ventre.
But the benefit of bloodletting from the basilic vein which is one of three veins: for it extracts the blood from the diseases that are below the throat and neck, and from what follows the chest and the belly.

E conveneys al fleubotomador, quan fleubotomia aquela, que guarde be aquela e sia sobre-temor en aquela, quar dejos lu ha arteria, e si erra e ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi, inscidira aquela arteria e accidira fluxs de sanc, per so que cove que no fleubotomes aquela am fleubotomi pungent, abantz sia sectant cum alnessil.
And it is advised for the phlebotomist, when performing phlebotomy on it, to watch it carefully and be very cautious with it, because below it there is an artery, and if he errs and hits it with the puncture of the lancet, he will cut that artery and cause a flow of blood, so it is better not to perform phlebotomy on it with a puncturing lancet, but rather with a cutting one like an alnessil.

E si no appar la basilica per apparicio manifesta, lahoras cove que tu laysses aquela e que tu mudes a la autre, o que cerques alcun ram sieu; o que fleubotomes en loc de lu finis del bras, quar aquela es manifesta; e secsa aquela am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit.
And if the basilic vein does not appear clearly visible, then it is better that you leave it and move to the other one, or that you look for one of its branches; or that you perform phlebotomy at the end of the arm, because that one is visible; and cut it with an alnessil lancet as we have said.

Mays si tu voles la fleubotomia de lu meteyssa, lahoras cove denant la strictura del bras que toques le loc entro que conogues le loc dels pols, e aprop senha sobre lu am tencha; e aprop lia le bras e secsa la vena am seccio concava am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit; e guarda te que caja la percussio per alcu spazi del loc de la arteria.
But if you want to perform phlebotomy on the same one, then it is necessary before tightening the arm to touch the area until you recognize the location of the pulse, and then mark it with ink; and after that tie the arm and cut the vein with a concave cut using an alnessil lancet as we have said; and be careful that the puncture falls some distance from the location of the artery.

E quan tu vezes, cum strenhes le liament, imflacio en le loc que has senhat am tencha, lahoras aquela inflacio es inflacio de la arteria, e donc squiva aquela.
And when you see, as you tighten the ligature, a swelling in the place that you have marked with ink, then that swelling is the swelling of the artery, and therefore avoid it.

E si vezes le sanc fluir en la fleubotomia ayssi cum aurina de enfant, e·l sanc es subtil rog, lahoras sapias que es del sanc de la arteria; e lahoras tu coyta e pausa le tieu dit sobre aquel per lonc spazi; e aprop osta le tieu dit, e si lo sanc es abscindit, quar motas veguadas es abscindit, lahoras tu strenh le bras e layssa aquel.
And if you see the blood flowing in the phlebotomy like the urine of a child, and the blood is thin and red, then know that it is blood from the artery; and then hurry and place your finger over it for a long time; and after removing your finger, if the blood has stopped, because many times it stops, then you tighten the arm and leave it.

E guardes le malaute de la moccio de lu, e sia sobre-temor de lu e no maugua aquel per alcus dias entro que sia sanat.
And guard the patient from moving it, and be very cautious with it and do not move it for some days until it is healed.

Mays si le sanc no es abscindit, e vezes que deves tu no es present medicina ad aquo, lahoras tu inscideys la arteria, si appar a tu; quar la extremitat de lu es contrayta, e es abscindit le sanc; o que prenguas scorsa de fistic, e fen aquela, e pren la una maytat e strenh aquela sobre le loc de la vena am strictura descent am liament e am pulvils entro al autra dia.
But if the blood does not stop, and you see that you do not have medicine present for this, then you cut the artery, if it appears to you; because its extremity is contracted, and the blood is stopped; or take bark of pistachio, and split it, and take one half and tighten it over the location of the vein with a descending tightness with a bandage and with compresses until the next day.

E lahoras si le sanc es abscindit, bo es; e sino, lahoras cura aquel am aquo del qual es precedit a la rememoracio del loc de las polveras abscindentz flux de sanc.
And then if the blood has stopped, it is good; and if not, then treat it with that which has been mentioned before in the section on powders that stop the flow of blood.

E la abscizio del sanc de lu es dificil en motas disposicios per le loc petit de la plagua e la possibilitat del liament del bras.
And the stopping of blood from it is difficult in many situations because of the small size of the wound and the possibility of tying the arm.

Mays de la vena fusca la fleubotomia es juvament que extratz lo sanc de la partida subirana del cap e a la partida dejos del cors; per aquo quar es composta de ram de la basilica e de ram de cephalica, ayssi cum havem dit.
But for the dark vein, the phlebotomy is beneficial as it extracts blood from the upper part of the head and the lower part of the body; because it is composed of a branch of the basilic and a branch of the cephalic, as we have said.

E cove al fleubotomant aquela que sia sobre-temor en la fleubotomia de lu, quar dejos aquela es un nervi; e adonc si ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi e atroba le nervi, accidira a lu stupor, e es difficil la sanacio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot, E aquest nervi motas veguadas apar al sentiment; e si es ocultat ad alcus homes e es subtil e no es monstrat, lahoras cove que tu pauses le fleubotomi am le qual tu fleubotomas am seccio de alnessil, e evita le nervi am la tua fortalesa.
And it is necessary for the one performing phlebotomy on it to be very cautious in the phlebotomy of it, because below it there is a nerve; and if he hits it with the puncture of the lancet and finds the nerve, it will cause numbness, and its healing is difficult, and very often it is not healed completely, And this nerve many times appears to the touch; and if it is hidden to some men and is subtle and not shown, then it is necessary that you place the lancet with which you perform phlebotomy with an alnessil cut, and avoid the nerve with your strength.

E si la vena es entre dos nervis, lahoras tu fen la vena en la longitut.
And if the vein is between two nerves, then you split the vein lengthwise.

Le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena cephalica es que atratz le sanc del cap e comfereys a las malautias dels huels.
The benefit of phlebotomy of the cephalic vein is that it draws blood from the head and is beneficial for diseases of the eyes.

E cove en aquest propriament, si vols que la fleubotomes pungen am fleubotomi olivar o am fleubotomi mirti; quar es la pus salva de totas las venas, quar no es dejos lu arteria ni nervi.
And it is necessary in this specifically, if you want to perform phlebotomy by puncturing with an olive-shaped lancet or with a myrtle-shaped lancet; because it is the safest of all the veins, as there is no artery or nerve below it.

Mays empero conveneys a tu deves la fleubotomia que guardes que am le fleubotomi no punguas le cap del lacert tant solament, e cerques le loc pus leugier, e no notz a lu, si no es atrobat am la percussio primieyra que sia sobre aquela am fleubotomia alcunas veguadas.
But nevertheless it is advised that you, regarding the phlebotomy, be careful that with the lancet you do not puncture the head of the muscle only, and look for the easiest place, and do not harm it, if it is not found with the first puncture that is above it with phlebotomy sometimes.

Mays empero fort leu es apostemat en alcus homes, quan no es fleubotomat en la primieyra percussio, mays no notz en re aquel apostema.
However, it is very easily infected in some men, when it is not bled in the first strike, but that infection does not harm anything.

Mays la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquela e les accidentz de lu so motz, en les quals te cove cogitar en lor rectificacio.
But the quality of the bleeding of that and its side effects are many, in which you should think about their correction.

Le primier de lu es del qual cove que sapias que fleubotomia no es aministrada sino en conservacio de sanetat e per speransa de lu e cautela de aveniment de malautias, e que sia fayta fleubotomia en la una de las venas que so en le coyde, so es: cephalica, fusca e basilica; e que sia fayta fleubotomia al comensament de primaveyra, sobre dejun en primaviera e autunppne, e en invern aprop la comestio, quan apparo significacios de replecio.
The first of them is that you should know that bleeding is not administered except for the preservation of health and for the hope of it and caution of the occurrence of diseases, and that bleeding should be done in one of the veins that are in the elbow, that is: cephalic, fuscous and basilic; and that bleeding should be done at the beginning of spring, on an empty stomach in spring and autumn, and in winter after eating, when signs of repletion appear.

E sia fayta fleubotomia e le tertz dia o al primier pus que del jorn siran passadas tres horas.
And bleeding should be done on the third day or on the first after three hours have passed from the day.

Mays fleubotomia que es aministrada, mays quan provoca convenencia e necessitat ad aquo, o de nuoyt o de dia, en tota hora e en tot temps.
But bleeding that is administered, but when it provokes convenience and necessity for this, either by night or by day, at all hours and at all times.

E cove que efant no sia fleubotomat entro que aja xiiii ans, e femna que sia prenhs no sia fleubotomada sino del quart mes entro al sete, e les viels no sian fleubotomatz les quals ja han passatz lx ans.
And it is appropriate that a child should not be bled until he is 14 years old, and a woman who is pregnant should not be bled except from the fourth month until the seventh, and the old should not be bled who have already passed 60 years.

E cum alcu vol esser fleubotomat per qualque manieyra sia, cove que mondifique les sieus budels denant la fleubotomia am clisteri leon, si en aquels ha mota fenda retenguda, per so que las venas no atiro las superfluitatz en la fleubotomia dels budels, que son puridas, e que no noguan als membres principals.
And when someone wants to be bled in whatever manner, it is appropriate that he clean his bowels before the bleeding with a gentle enema, if there is much retained waste in them, so that the veins do not draw the superfluities in the bleeding from the bowels, which are putrid, and that they do not harm the principal members.

E no sian fleubotomatz les pascientz naucea sacertiva e crapula, ni evasent de malautia ni de ebretat entro que aquo sia remaugut aquo de lor, ni malaute de ydropici, e mays que fleubotomia sia temuda aprop colica passio e aprop vomit, e aprop cos de ventre, e aprop multiplicacio de coyt e de trebal e de exercici de dejunis o de vigilias e de tota causa que dissolveys la vertut, o sia corpore28 o animal.
And patients with nausea and indigestion should not be bled, nor those recovering from illness or drunkenness until that is removed from them, nor those sick with dropsy, and moreover bleeding should be feared after colic passion and after vomiting, and after bowel movement, and after multiplication of coitus and of work and of exercise of fasting or of vigils and of any cause that dissolves the virtue, whether it be corporal or animal.

E aprop considera en subtiliacio de humos denant aquo si le sanc es gros, am viandas e beures, e am medicinas si aquo es a lu possible ad aquo.
And afterwards consider in the thinning of humors before this if the blood is thick, with foods and drinks, and with medicines if this is possible for him to do.

E aprop intre en banh si alcuna causa no prohibeys, o sia excersitat per alcun exercici per so que·l sanc sia subtiliat.
And afterwards enter into a bath if nothing prohibits it, or be exercised by some exercise so that the blood may be thinned.

E pausa la fleubotomia de lu en le pietz del dia, so es enviro la hora de tercia, ayssi cum havem dit.
And place his bleeding in the best part of the day, that is around the hour of terce, as we have said.

E perforsa te que·l pietz de aquel sia guardat en aquel dia de totz mals accidentz animals, ayssi cum es angustia, ira, temor, e de totz accidentz corporals, ayssi cum es trebal e pena superflua e coyt e semblantz a lor.
And strive that his chest be guarded on that day from all evil animal accidents, such as anguish, anger, fear, and from all corporal accidents, such as excessive work and pain and coitus and similar to them.

E a la sua sezelha fassa esser presentz las causas en le us de la qual corr costuma dels homes am aromaticitat e odorament e am bals e semblantz ad aquels segon la cantitat de possibilitat.
And at his session let there be present the things in the use of which runs the custom of men with aromaticity and odor and with balsams and similar to those according to the quantity of possibility.

E segua le fleubotomador sobre un coyssi que sia pus aut que·l coyssi de aquel que deu esser fleubotomat.
And let the phlebotomist sit on a cushion that is higher than the cushion of the one who is to be bled.

E aprop extragua le sieu bras, e fregue aquel am la sua ma le fleubotomador doas o tres veguadas; e aprop strenha le liament am correia e involva aquel doas veguadas.
And afterwards let him extend his arm, and let the phlebotomist rub it with his hand two or three times; and afterwards tighten the binding with a strap and wrap it twice.

E sia la strictura temprada, quar la strictura quant no es engual, o la strictura es am superfluitat, lahoras prohibeys de fluxs del sanc; o es am mollificacio, e lahoras prohibeys le cors del sanc eyssament.
And let the tightness be tempered, for when the tightness is not equal, or the tightness is with superfluity, then it prohibits the flow of blood; or it is with softening, and then it prohibits the course of blood likewise.

E aprop la strictura, cove que aquel que deu esser fleubotomat fregue las suas mas ensemps entre lor entro que las venas sian imfladas, e sian declaradas al sentiment.
And after the tightening, it is appropriate that the one who is to be bled rub his hands together between them until the veins are swollen, and are declared to the feeling.

E aprop le fleubotomador unte le sieu fleubotomi am un pauc de oli antic propriament; e aprop pausa le sieu di indic de la ma senestra sobre aquela vena, dejos le loc del qual vol la fleubotomia, per que la vena fuja un pauc, e la percussio sia sessada quar de las venas es la qual atrobas ayssi cum corda fugent deves la fleubotomia, e de aquelas es que es plena de ventositat e quan pauses le fleubotomi sobre aquela es contrayta deves le fleubotomi, e es desceubut le fleubotomador; e le fleubotomi no uobre la vena, e si uobre, aquela es streyta.
And afterwards let the phlebotomist anoint his lancet with a little old oil properly; and afterwards place his index finger of the left hand on that vein, below the place from which he wants the bleeding, so that the vein may flee a little, and the percussion may be ceased for of the veins is that which you find thus as a cord fleeing towards the bleeding, and of those it is that is full of windiness and when you place the lancet on that it is contracted towards the lancet, and the phlebotomist is deceived; and the lancet does not open the vein, and if it opens, that is narrow.

E donc, per aquo cove que·l fleubotomador sia fermat e sia sollicit en totas aquestas causas.
And so, for this reason it is appropriate that the phlebotomist be steady and be careful in all these things.

E aprop depause le fleubotomi, mays si la vena es huberta en una veguada, lahoras bo es; e sino, tu itera aquo autra vaguada dejos aquel loc un pauc, o sobre lu am festinacio, si le loc no es apostemat.
And after that, perform the phlebotomy, but if the vein is opened in one go, then it is good; and if not, you repeat this again a little below that place, or above it with haste, if the place is not swollen.

Et si le loc es apostemat, o le malaute se spauresca, lahoras tu le layssa per un dia o per dos, e no strenha le liament, quar fort leu atirara apostema caut, ni no intre en banh.
And if the place is swollen, or the patient is frightened, then you leave it for a day or two, and do not tighten the bandage, because it will quickly attract hot swelling, nor should he enter a bath.

E aprop itera la fleubotomia si la ama.
And afterwards repeat the phlebotomy if it is necessary.

E si la apercio es petita e corr sanc subtilment, e temes que non yesca sanc la cantitat que voles, lahoras tu itera le fleubotomi en aquel trauc segon rectitut e ajusta en la appercio un pauc, e fay aquo am festinacio denant que·l loc sia apostemat, quar le loc es apostemat en motz homes deves pauca apercio.
And if the opening is small and blood flows thinly, and you fear that the amount of blood you want will not come out, then you repeat the phlebotomy in that hole in the same direction and enlarge the opening a little, and do this quickly before the place becomes swollen, because the place becomes swollen in many men from a small opening.

Mays si vezes aquel ja apostemat, lahoras no iteres sobre lu, quar no escusa a tu alcuna causa; e pausa sobre aquel alcuna partida de la fenda de oli, quar alleuja le cors del sanc.
But if you see it already swollen, then do not repeat it there, because nothing excuses you; and put on it some part of the oil compress, because it eases the flow of blood.

E es milhor en aquest loc que oli e que les autres olis.
And it is better in this place than oil and other oils.

E semblantment aministra fenda de oli en tota fleubotomia am la qual fleubotomes las venas deves la prohibicio de cors de sanc, e fan aquo tyriaca alfadoc e sagzenea quan es pausat de la una de aquelas sobre le loc, quar le sanc es subtiliat e es revolvut quan es gros.
And similarly administer an oil compress in every phlebotomy with which you bleed the veins to stop the flow of blood, and they do this with theriac alfadoc and sagzenea when one of these is placed on the spot, because the blood is thinned and is revolved when it is thick.

E si en le loc de la fleubotomia es engendrat gran apostema, quar motas veguadas accideys, e majorment ad aquel que no es stat sangnat sino aquela veguada, o en la apercio de la vena pauca, e lahoras tu coyta, e pausa sobre le loc sponja infuza en aygua e sal, un pauc scalfada, e strenh aquela per una hora, quar es dissolvut.
And if in the place of the phlebotomy a large swelling is formed, because it often happens, and especially to one who has not been bled except that time, or in the small opening of the vein, and then you hurry, and put on the place a sponge soaked in water and salt, a little heated, and tighten it for an hour, because it is dissolved.

E cove que fassa aquo aprop le yssiment del sanc de aquela vena am compliment de lu o de autra vena.
And it is appropriate to do this after the blood comes out of that vein completely or from another vein.

E si roman en le loc per alcus dias alcuna negror o viriditat, no notz aquo; e si voles, pausa sobre aquel alcuna causa de aloen e de mirra dissolvut, o alcuna causa de suc de mentastre o de calament o semblant de lu.
And if some blackness or greenness remains in the place for some days, it does not harm; and if you want, put on it something of aloe and myrrh dissolved, or something of the juice of wild mint or calamint or similar to it.

E motas veguadas accideysso apostemas e eminencias deves fleubotomia de la basilica.
And often swellings and protrusions occur from phlebotomy of the basilic vein.

E donc pausa la tua ma sobre aquela, e si lahoras tu atrobas mollicia deves la tua compressio sobre aquela, lahoras aquela eminencia es malvada e mala; e adonc guarda te que pauses sobre aquela alcuna causa de aquo que havem dit, quar fort leu fluira de la arteria sanc.
And so put your hand on it, and if then you find softness from your compression on it, then that protrusion is malignant and bad; and then be careful that you put on it any of what we have said, because blood will flow very quickly from the artery.

E fay emplaustre am aquo en que es stipticitat, per que le loc sia endurat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.
And make a plaster with something that has astringency, so that the place becomes hardened, and afterwards treat it with the other treatment until it is healed.

E cove que extraguas del sanc a tot hom segon la quantitat de la sua vertut e segon la color vencent sobrc le sanc segon que appar.
And it is appropriate that you extract blood from every man according to the quantity of his strength and according to the color prevailing in the blood as it appears.

Quar si le sanc es negre, lahoras tu le layssa yssir entro que sia rog; e semblantment si tu le vezes gros, lahoras tu le layssa yssir entro que sia subtiliat; e semblantment si es agut, entro que sia ostada la acuitat de lu.
Because if the blood is black, then you let it come out until it is red; and similarly if you see it thick, then you let it come out until it is thinned; and similarly if it is sharp, until its sharpness is removed.

E cove ad aquel que es ple e fort e ha necessitat de extraccio de sanc en una veguada, que sia amplificada la fleubotomia de la vena e le fleubotomi sia lat.
And it is appropriate for one who is full and strong and needs blood extraction in one go, that the phlebotomy of the vein be enlarged and the phlebotomist be wide.

E en aquel que es freul, sia fayt le contrari de aquel, e cove que extragua aquel en tropas veguadas, e que le trauc sia streyt.
And in one who is weak, the opposite of that should be done, and it is appropriate that he extract that in many times, and that the hole be narrow.

E le milhor que es administrat en fleubotomia de vena es que sia la seccio transversa, no punctura.
And the best that is administered in phlebotomy of a vein is that the cut be transverse, not a puncture.

E aquesta manieyra de fleubotomia es salva de flux de sanc e de inscizio de nervi, e es pus lausabla e pus salva que fleubotomia segon latitut e longitut.
And this manner of phlebotomy is safe from blood flow and nerve incision, and is more praiseworthy and safer than phlebotomy according to width and length.

E a la qual es acostumat sobrevenir sincopi deves la fleubotomia, e cove que tu cures aquel denant la fleubotomia am un petit de pa infus en vi de milgranas o de oximel simple scalfat; e extratz a l u del sanc en tres veguadas o quatre.
And for the one who is accustomed to fainting from phlebotomy, it is appropriate that you treat him before the phlebotomy with a little bread soaked in pomegranate wine or simple oxymel heated; and extract blood from him in three or four times.

E si es enfregiditat de compleccio, lahoras prengua denant la fleubotomia pa infus en eyssarop de mirra o en eyssarop de mel aromatizat am specias ayssi cum am pebre, canela, gingiebre e semblantz, o en eyssarop aromatizat e mot odorant.
And if there is a coldness of complexion, then take before the bloodletting bread soaked in myrrh syrup or in honey syrup flavored with spices such as pepper, cinnamon, ginger and similar, or in aromatic and very fragrant syrup.

E si accideys sincopi deves la fleubotomia, e es causa de lu issiment de mot sanc, lahoras cove que prengua en beure aygua de carn e eyssarop mot odorant subtil; e use de aromaticitat am algualea, e sia linit le sieu pietz am aquela.
And if fainting occurs during the bloodletting, and it is caused by too much blood loss, then it is advisable to drink meat broth and very fragrant, subtle syrup; and use aromatics with algalia, and anoint his chest with it.

E usa de las autras causas que havem ditas en la divisio en le capitol de sincopi per evacuacio.
And use the other things that we have mentioned in the division in the chapter on fainting due to evacuation.

E qui vol eventar le sieu bras e dissolver le sieu sanc segonda veguada, cove a lu del qual la fleubotomia es per mota evacuacio, e la vertut de lu es freol, que evacue le sanc petit a petit, so es segon la quantitat de la vertut en les dias continuables.
And who wants to ventilate his arm and dissolve his blood a second time, it is advisable for him whose bloodletting is for much evacuation, and whose strength is weak, to evacuate the blood little by little, that is according to the quantity of strength in the continuous days.

Mays qui vol eventar le sieu bras, e gitar lo sieu sanc segonda vetz, e le sieu cors es fort, lahoras fassa aquo aprop vii horas o ix de la primieyra fleubotomia.
But who wants to ventilate his arm, and remove his blood a second time, and his body is strong, then do this after 7 or 9 hours from the first bloodletting.

Mays qui vol atirar le sanc del cors sieu al contrari de la partida a la qual declina, cove que sia eventat en le segon dia o le tertz.
But who wants to draw blood from his body to the opposite of the part to which it inclines, it is advisable that it be ventilated on the second or third day.

Mays aquel cors en le qual es mot sanc ja scalfat e es acuit e fa accidir febre, cove que sia gitat de lu sanc en una veguada e sia de lu gitada gran cantitat e sia amplificada la apercio entro que accidesca sincopi, pus que tu auras conservadas totas las condicios de fleubotomia; e que pauses la tua ma sobre le pols de lu deves le cors del sanc, per que no endevengua mort en loc de sincopi, quar motas veguadas endeve aquo quan le fleubotomador es ignorant e negligent.
But that body in which there is much blood already heated and is acute and causes fever to occur, it is advisable that blood be removed from it in one go and a large quantity be removed from it and the opening be widened until fainting occurs, after you have observed all the conditions of bloodletting; and that you place your hand on his pulse towards the body of blood, so that death does not occur instead of fainting, for this often happens when the bloodletter is ignorant and negligent.

E no cove quan tu voles desliar le bras e evacua le sanc segonda veguada, cum ja sia claus le orrifici de la vena e sia fayt difficil issiment del sanc, que tu premas subre aquel am vehemencia e encurvat sia extendut leugierament, quar aquo es trop mal.
And it is not advisable when you want to untie the arm and evacuate the blood a second time, when the orifice of the vein is already closed and the exit of blood has become difficult, that you press on it with vehemence and bend it to be extended lightly, for this is very bad.

Habantz le layssa entro que sia fleubotomat segondament; o remau aquo am la acuitat del fleubotomi que es coagulat del sanc en le orrifici de la vena; o pausa sobre aquel de tyriaca alfarach, o de sagzenea, e comprem aquel am compressio leugiera entro que·l sanc sia fora yssit.
Rather, leave it until it is bled secondarily; or remove that with the sharpness of the lancet that is coagulated from the blood in the orifice of the vein; or place on it some theriac alfarach, or sagzenea, and compress it with light compression until the blood has come out.

E si la vena es apostemada, lahoras layssa aquela e no la toques entro que·l apostema sia sedat.
And if the vein is swollen, then leave it and do not touch it until the swelling has subsided.

E si necessitat te provoca a evacuar le sanc segondament, e no es excusacio, lahoras tu sagna aquel sobre aquel loc o en l’autre bras en autra vena.
And if necessity compels you to evacuate the blood secondarily, and there is no excuse, then you bleed him above that place or in the other arm in another vein.

E la vena apelada “funis del bras” es fleubotomada en loc de la fusca o de la basilica, quan no so atrobadas o so amaguadas, quar es composta de aquelas.
And the vein called "rope of the arm" is bled in place of the dark one or the basilic, when they are not found or are hidden, for it is composed of those.

E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intrometa la sua ma en aygua cauda entro que·l focil se enrogezesca e que la vena apparia manifestament.
And the quality of its bloodletting is that the patient puts his hand in hot water until the forearm reddens and the vein appears clearly.

E aprop sia strengut sobre aquel am liament am strictura migana; e aprop fleubotoma segon le tranvers petit, no latitudinalment ni segon la longitut.
And afterwards it should be tightened above it with a binding with medium stricture; and afterwards bleed according to the small transverse, not latitudinally nor according to the length.

E sia la apercio ampla e sia la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas aquela sobre la junctura de la ma un petit.
And let the opening be wide and let your bloodletting with which you bleed it be above the joint of the hand a little.

E si es prohibit le fluxs del sanc, lahoras tu itera la ma en l’aygua cauda e layssa le sanc correr en la aygua entro que consieguas la tua necessitat.
And if the flow of blood is prohibited, then you repeat the hand in the hot water and let the blood run in the water until you achieve your necessity.

Mays si tu eras en les dias d’estiu, lahoras tu yest excusat de la iteracio de la ma en l’aygua cauda, e le mes es pausat le cors del sanc en aygua cauda en temps de yvern.
But if you were in the summer days, then you are excused from the repetition of the hand in hot water, and the month is set the course of blood in hot water in winter time.

E la fleubotomia de aquesta vena es pus salva que de totas las autras venas, quar dejos lu no ha vena pulsatil, ni nervi.
And the bloodletting of this vein is safer than all the other veins, for below it there is no pulsatile vein, nor nerve.

E la fleubotomia de la savatella de la ma dreyta es conferent a las malautias del fetge.
And the bloodletting of the cephalic vein of the right hand is beneficial for liver diseases.

E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que tu strenguas la ma am liament o am la tua ma, pus que tu l’as mesa en ayga cauda, entro que la vena sia imflada e sia be demostrada al vezement; e aprop fleubotoma aquela transversan; e si inscidas aquela de tot no nozera aquo en re.
And the quality of its bloodletting is that you tighten the hand with a binding or with your hand, after you have put it in hot water, until the vein is swollen and is well demonstrated to sight; and afterwards bleed it transversely; and if you cut it completely it will not harm anything.

E conserve que no ultimes la tua ma am la fleubotomi, quar dejos lu so les nervis dels ditz denudatz de carn.
And be careful not to open your hand with the phlebotomy, because below it are the nerves of the fingers exposed without flesh.

E aprop itera la ma en l’aygua cauda e laysse correr le sanc en aquela, quar si tu no iteras aquela en l’aygua cauda, le sanc sira coagulat en lo orrifici de la vena, e es prohibit de flux.
And afterwards put the hand in warm water and let the blood flow into it, because if you don't put it in warm water, the blood will coagulate in the orifice of the vein, and the flow is blocked.

E cum es extrayt le sanc segon la quantitat de necessitat, lahoras tu pausa sobre la vena oli e sal, per que no sia consolidada coytadament; e semblantment cove que tu fassas en tot ram streyt.
And when the blood is extracted according to the necessary quantity, then you put oil and salt on the vein, so that it doesn't heal too quickly; and similarly you should do this for any narrow branch.

Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de aquela de la ma senestra, es que es conferent a las malautias de la melsa.
But the benefit of phlebotomy on the left hand is that it is helpful for diseases of the spleen.

E fay semblantment en la fleubotomia de lu ayssi cum has fayt en l’autra.
And do similarly in the phlebotomy of it as you have done in the other.

E le juvament de la vena sephena de la fleubotomia es a las malautias que so en la partida dejos del cos, ayssi cum so malautias de la mayre, e a retencio de mestruas, et a las malautias dels ronhos e ulceracios de coyssas e de cambas antiquas, e a lor semblantz de las malautias.
And the benefit of phlebotomy of the saphenous vein is for diseases that are in the lower part of the body, such as diseases of the womb, and for retention of menses, and for diseases of the kidneys and old ulcers of the thighs and legs, and for similar diseases.

E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute entrometa lo sieu pe en aygua cauda e fassa sobre aquel fricacio entro que be apparen las venas; e lia sobre la junctura del pe am correia; e le loc de la vena le talo apparent deves le dit pous, e de aquela so ramificatz en la facia del pe motz ramps.
And the method of phlebotomy of it is that the patient puts his foot in warm water and rubs it until the veins appear well; and tie above the joint of the foot with a strap; and the place of the vein is the apparent heel towards the thumb, and from it are branched many branches on the face of the foot.

E donc fleubotoma le pus ample ram o dejos la camba deves le talo deves la agreguacio de lu, quar es milhor e pus sal.
Therefore, perform phlebotomy on the widest branch or below the leg towards the heel towards its aggregation, because it is better and safer.

E si fleubotomas aquela en la facia del pe, lahoras tu te guarda dels nervis que so dejos aquela sobre la facia del pe, e pausa la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas per le travers, quays cum si tu la volias inscidir.
And if you perform phlebotomy on it on the face of the foot, then be careful of the nerves that are below it on the face of the foot, and place your phlebotomy with which you perform phlebotomy across, as if you wanted to cut it.

E sia le fleubotomi vosil.
And let the phlebotomy be careful.

Mays si es prohibit le issiment del sanc; lahoras tu itera le pe de lu en l’aygua cauda e layssa correr le sanc en aquela entro que sia evacuat.
But if the blood flow is blocked; then you put his foot back in the warm water and let the blood run into it until it is evacuated.

E si le fleubotomador erra en la primieyra veguada, lahoras itera am le fleubotomi en sus un pauc, quar le loc es sal; e no temes de lu malician, mays que te guardes dels nervis ayssi cum havem dit.
And if the person performing phlebotomy errs on the first try, then repeat with the phlebotomy a little higher up, because the place is safe; and don't fear harming it, but be careful of the nerves as we have said.

E semblantment fay de la sophena del autre pe engualment.
And similarly do the same for the saphenous vein of the other foot equally.

E de la vena sciatica, le loc ayssi cum havem dit es deves le talo dejos la cavilha de la partida silvestra.
And for the sciatic vein, the place as we have said is towards the heel below the ankle on the outer side.

E le juvament de la fleubotomia de lu es a dolo de anca quan es per sanc caut.
And the benefit of phlebotomy of it is for hip pain when it is due to hot blood.

E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intre en banh, e festine e strenha la cueyssa de lu del latz de la ancha entro desus le talo desus quatre ditz an una benda longua subtil, quar no appar sino per aquo.
And the method of phlebotomy of it is that the patient enters a bath, and hurries and tightens his thigh on the side of the hip down to above the heel above four fingers with a long thin bandage, because it doesn't appear except by this.

E donc quan appar, lahoras tu fleubotoma aquela segon cascun engen que es a tu possible e segon le tranvers, e es milhor; o inscidas aquela per inscizio o secces aquela per seccio, quar le loc de lu es sal.
And so when it appears, then you perform phlebotomy on it according to each method that is possible for you and across, and it is better; or cut it by incision or section it by section, because its location is safe.

E ela es en motz homes mot ameguada; e si atrobas aquela, e no appar al sentiment de tot, lahoras fleubotoma alcun ram de lu, e es aquel que appar en le dos del pe enves le dit auricular e le anular.
And it is very hidden in many men; and if you find it, and it doesn't appear to the touch at all, then perform phlebotomy on some branch of it, and it is the one that appears on the back of the foot towards the little finger and the ring finger.

E guarda te dels nervis, e fay correr del sanc la quantitat que voles.
And be careful of the nerves, and let the quantity of blood you want flow.

E aprop deslia la strictura e pausa sobre le loc de la fleubotomia coto e strenh le loc, quar leugierament es sanat.
And afterwards untie the stricture and place cotton on the site of the phlebotomy and tighten the place, because it heals easily.

De ventozacio e de las qualitatz de uzar de aquelas.
On ventilation and the qualities of using them.

Ventozas so de corns, o de eram, o de veyre.
Ventouses are made of horns, or brass, or glass.

E ventozacio es fayta segon doas manieyras: la una de lor es am scarificacio e extracio de sanc, e l’autra es ventozacio ses scarificacio.
And ventilation is done in two ways: one of them is with scarification and extraction of blood, and the other is ventilation without scarification.

E aquesta ventozacio que es ses scarificacio es segon doas manieyras, quar o es am foc o ses foc.
And this ventilation without scarification is done in two ways, for it is either with fire or without fire.

E a las ventozas que so administradas am scarificacio e extraccio de sanc son xiiii locs del cors, dels quals la un en lo qual so pausadas ventozas es alnocrati, e es la deriera partida del cap; e le mieg loc d’el de doas partz del col ensemp; e ventozas del mento dejos la mandibula pus dejos de la boca; e ventozas de doas spatulas; e ventozas de alohoster, e es sobre la fi de la coeta; e ventozas de dos focils, e so de dos brasses; e ventozas de doas cavilhas; e ventozas de doas cuoyssas.
And for the ventouses that are administered with scarification and extraction of blood, there are fourteen places on the body, of which one where ventouses are placed is the occiput, and it is the back part of the head; and the middle place of it on both sides of the neck together; and ventouses of the chin below the jaw lower than the mouth; and ventouses of two shoulder blades; and ventouses of the coccyx, which is above the end of the tail; and ventouses of two forearms, which are of two arms; and ventouses of two ankles; and ventouses of two thighs.

E ventozacio no extratz le sanc sino de las venas menudas sparssas en la carn, e per aquo no catz la vertut per aquelas, ayssi cum es cazement per fleubotomia; ni no cove que ventozacio sia fayta am foc o ses foc en alcuna malautia fayta per replecio entro que le cors tot sia evacuat.
And ventilation does not extract blood except from the small veins scattered in the flesh, and for this reason virtue does not fall through them, as it does through phlebotomy; nor should ventilation be done with fire or without fire in any illness caused by repletion until the whole body is evacuated.

Mays si necessitat provoca a ventozacio per malautia o per continua, aministrem aquela en tota hora al comensament del mes e en la fi de lu, e en le mieg loc de lu e en qualque temps sia.
But if necessity calls for ventilation due to illness or continuity, we administer it at any time at the beginning of the month and at the end of it, and in the middle of it and at whatever time it may be.

La qual causa es quar dels homes es en les quals es sanc multiplicat entro que indigeys de extraccio de lu per ventozacio e atroba en le sieu cap graveza e soda; e de aquels es que atroba replecio e rogor en la sua cara e en le sieu cap, e en le sieu col; e de aquels es que atroba pruziment en la sua cara e en le sieu front e tenebrositat e hebetut en les sieus huels; e de aquels que gieta le loc de la sua ventozacio; e de aquels es que le lor ris es multiplicat; e de aquels es que atroba gustament de sanc en la sua boca, o que la lengua es apostemada e escup sanc; e de aquels es que lor dormir es multiplicat, e de aquels que vetz sanc en lo dormir rogor e antics e plaguas e autras causas a lor semblantz.
Which is because there are men in whom blood is multiplied until it needs extraction from them by ventilation and finds heaviness and buzzing in their head; and of those who find repletion and redness in their face and in their head, and in their neck; and of those who find itching in their face and in their forehead and darkness and dullness in their eyes; and of those who remove the place of their ventilation; and of those whose laughter is multiplied; and of those who find a taste of blood in their mouth, or whose tongue is swollen and spits blood; and of those whose sleep is multiplied, and of those who see blood in their sleep, redness and old wounds and other things similar to them.

E donc quan vezes en alcuna causa de aquelas, e propriament si es en le tertz o miga del mes, lahoras comandam ventozacio esser fayta pus que so passadas del dia dos o tres horas.
And so when you see any of these things, and especially if it is in the third or middle of the month, then we command ventilation to be done after two or three hours of the day have passed.

E juvament de ventozacio de la nuca es que quan aquela confereys a gravitat en le cap e ad aquo que es efondit als huels; mays cove que aquo sia aprop evacuacio de tot le cors.
And the benefit of ventilation of the nape is that when it helps with heaviness in the head and with what is poured into the eyes; but it should be done after evacuation of the whole body.

E aquesta ventoza es en le loc de fleubotomia de la cephalica.
And this ventouse is in place of phlebotomy of the cephalic vein.

E no es legut que use de lu aquel que es de frega complecio, o en le qual es catarr, quar dona ad aquel gran nocument.
And it is not allowed to use it on one who is of cold complexion, or in whom there is catarrh, for it gives them great harm.

E per aquo no cove que uso de aquela les vielhs, e en les caps dels quals so malautias frejas.
And for this reason it is not suitable for the elderly to use it, and in those whose heads have cold illnesses.

Mays ad aquel que sobre aquela es continuant sobre lu es fayta oblivio; e per aquo cove que tu comandes al ventozador que depause la sua ma un petit am la ventosa a las partidas dejos, temen de la generacio de oblivio.
But for one who continues it over time, forgetfulness is caused; and for this reason you should command the ventilator to place his hand a little with the ventouse to the lower parts, fearing the generation of forgetfulness.

Mays ventozacio de alkehel es en loc de fleubotomia de la vena fusca e de la basilica: e per aquo confereys a asma, e a la constriccio de ale e a la scissura del sturment de ale, e a tos, e a replecio.
But ventilation of the back is in place of phlebotomy of the dark vein and the basilic vein: and for this reason it helps with asthma, and with constriction of breath and with tearing of the breathing instrument, and with cough, and with repletion.

E cove que sia enpellida la ventoza alkehel un petit, quar si es pausada dejos, engendra debilitat en le cors e en le stomac.
And the ventouse should be pushed a little on the back, for if it is placed below, it generates weakness in the body and in the stomach.

E la ventozacio de alhagdahan confereys a las dolors accident en le cap e a obtalmia, e emigranea, e prefocacio, e a dolors en las razitz de las dentz; e es en loc de fleubotomia de la basiliqua.
