And the ventilation of the temples helps with pains occurring in the head and with eye inflammation, and migraine, and suffocation, and with pains in the roots of the teeth; and it is in place of phlebotomy of the basilic vein.

E cove que comandes al ventozador que no prema la sua ma am scarificacio per que no inscida la arteria e accida fluxs de sanc.
It is advisable to instruct the cupper not to press his hand with scarification so as not to cut the artery and cause blood flow.

E ventozacio dejos le mento comfereys a alcola en la boca, e a corrupcio de la gingiva, e a semblantz a lor de las malautias que so en la boca, e stan en loc de fleubotomia de aliheric que so en las doas labias.
And cupping below the chin helps with throat ailments in the mouth, and with corruption of the gums, and similar diseases that are in the mouth, and stands in place of phlebotomy of the lips that are in the two lips.

Mays la ventozacio que es fayta sobre las doas spatulas confereys a caphatan, le qual es fayt per replecio de caliditat.
But the cupping that is done on the two shoulders helps with headaches, which is caused by excess heat.

E la ventosacio de las doas partidas dedintz dels focils confereys juvament de la fleubotomia de tres venas, so es de la basilica, fusca e cephalica, quar aquela atratz le sanc de totas aquelas venas pus manudas que so en la carn, e aquelas venas menudas de las autras venas pus grossas entro que pervengua la atraccio a las tres venas.
And the cupping of the two inner parts of the arms helps in place of phlebotomy of three veins, that is the basilic, median, and cephalic, because it draws blood from all those smaller veins that are in the flesh, and those small veins from the other larger veins until the attraction reaches the three veins.

E comanda al ventozador que trop no procezesca en scarificacio, quar le loc es denudat de carn, e dejos lu so nervis e arterias.
And instruct the cupper not to proceed too much with scarification, because the place is devoid of flesh, and below it are nerves and arteries.

E es una ventoza am la qual es ventozat sobre alshosses e confereys a las emorroydas del cul e a las ulceracios pus dejos.
And there is a cup with which one cups over the bones and it helps with hemorrhoids of the anus and ulcerations below.

E cove que comandes al ventozador que sia gran ventoza, e que sia de eram, quar le loc indigeys de fort seccio; e fort leu so traucadas ventozas subtils e sia scarificat am scarificacio.
And it is advisable that you instruct the cupper to use a large cup, and that it be made of copper, because the place needs strong suction; and very light cups are easily pierced and should be scarified with scarification.

Mays ventozas de las cambas minueysso per minuicio manifesta, quar atiran le sanc de tot le cors, e comfereysso a dolors antiquas dels ronhos e de la mayre, e de la vesica; e provocan las mestruas, e comfereysso a bothor e ademil; e stan en loc de fleubotomia de doas sophenas, e alahorcoben, e de doas cavilhas.
But cups on the legs reduce by manifest reduction, because they draw blood from the whole body, and help with old pains of the kidneys and of the womb, and of the bladder; and provoke menstruation, and help with boils and swellings; and stand in place of phlebotomy of two saphenous veins, and the sciatic nerve, and of two ankles.

Enpero mot debelitan tot le cors e fan accidir sincopi en motz homes.
However, they greatly weaken the whole body and cause fainting in many men.

E de las ventozas alahorcoben le juvament es propda al juvament a las ventozas de doas cambas.
And of the cups on the sciatic nerve, the benefit is close to the benefit of the cups on the two legs.

E la qualitat de la posicio de las ventozas es que pauses la ventoza al comensament vueda e sucguas per succio temprada, e no prolongues la posicio de las ventozas, mays pausa aquelas leugierament, e reman aquelas coytadament, e que las humors venguan al loc per adveniment engual.
And the quality of the positioning of the cups is that you place the cup at the beginning empty and suck with moderate suction, and do not prolong the positioning of the cups, but place them lightly, and remove them quickly, so that the humors come to the place by equal arrival.

E no cesses iterar aquo e continuar entro que veja le loc ja enrojezir e inflar e que appara la rogor del sanc.
And do not cease to repeat this and continue until you see the place already reddening and swelling and the redness of the blood appears.

E lahoras tu scarifiqua e itera la succio pauc a pauc, e aprop considera en la dispozicio dels cors.
And then you scarify and repeat the suction little by little, and afterwards consider the disposition of the body.

Quar aquel home que es de tendra carn de rars pors, cove que tu le scarifiques una veguada e no pus, per que le loc no sia ulcerat.
For that man who is of tender flesh with rare pores, it is advisable that you scarify him once and no more, so that the place is not ulcerated.

E comanda al ventozador que amplifique la scarificacio e pronde un pauc, e atempre la succio am facilitat.
And instruct the cupper to amplify the scarification and deepen a little, and temper the suction with ease.

E si en le sanc es grossitut, lahoras cove que scarifiques doas veguadas, quar en la primieyra veguada es uberta la via de subtiliacio al sanc e a la aquositat de lu.
And if in the blood there is thickness, then it is advisable to scarify twice, because in the first time the way of subtlety to the blood and its wateriness is opened.

Mays en la segunda a la perscrutacio aquisida de la extraccio del sanc gros.
But in the second to the acquired scrutiny of the extraction of thick blood.

E si le sanc es mot feculent, lahoras sia fayta scarificacio la tersa veguada per que consiegua le derier.
And if the blood is very feculent, then scarification should be done a third time to achieve the last.

E derierament, quan volem extrayre le sanc pauc a pauc o un petit, abasta a nos una scarificacio.
And lastly, when we want to extract the blood little by little or a small amount, one scarification is enough for us.

E si volem extraccio de mot sanc, scarificam am mota scarificacio; e si nos conoyssem que·l sanc es gros, lahoras cove que scarifiquem per scarificacio preonda.
And if we want extraction of much blood, we scarify with much scarification; and if we know that the blood is thick, then it is advisable that we scarify with deep scarification.

E le terme de scarificacio en la qual es la profunditat de la codena tant solament.
And the term of scarification in which is the depth of the skin only.

E si aquel del qual la codena es grossa, dura, fusca, e les sieus pors so streytz, cove que les locs de las ventosas sian untatz lenitius, apertius resolutius; si es en temps d’estiu, ayssi cum es oli de aloen o oli de violat, o oli de amellas dossas, o oli de cemensa de coja; e si es en temps ivern, lahoras oli narci, o oli de liri, o oli de camamilla, o de sanc, e ad aquels semblantz.
And if the one whose skin is thick, hard, dark, and whose pores are narrow, it is advisable that the places of the cups be anointed with lenitive, aperient, resolvent ointments; if it is in summer time, such as aloe oil or violet oil, or sweet almond oil, or pumpkin seed oil; and if it is in winter time, then narcissus oil, or lily oil, or chamomile oil, or blood oil, and those similar to them.

E si la superfluitat es grossa, freja, lahoras le oli sia amaranti, o oli de balsamita, o oli de aloen, o oli aneti, e a lor semblantz.
And if the superfluity is thick, cold, then the oil should be amaranth, or costmary oil, or aloe oil, or dill oil, and similar to them.

Mays si le ventozador es de amples pors de tendra carn, lahoras cove que sia prohibit de oli, e cove que ad aquest les locs de ventozas de lor aprop la ventozacio sian lavatz am ayguaros o am aygua freja de solatrum, o am aygua de coja, o am aygua de bordolaguas, e semblantz ad aquelas.
But if the cupping area has wide pores of tender flesh, then it should be prohibited from oil, and it is necessary that for this the cupping sites be washed with rosewater or with cold water of nightshade, or with water of gourd, or with water of purslane, and similar to these.

E aquel del qual le sanc es de mota humiditat, lava las suas ventozas am vi agre, o am aygua de mirt e sumac e semblant ad aquels.
And for the one whose blood has much humidity, wash their cupping sites with vinegar, or with water of myrtle and sumac and similar to those.

E de aquel del qual las superfluitatz son grossas, lava las suas ventozas am vi antic, o am aygua de sansuc, que es majorana, o de decoccio de anet, o de camamilla, e a lor semblantz.
And for the one whose superfluities are thick, wash their cupping sites with old wine, or with water of marjoram, which is majorana, or with a decoction of dill, or of chamomile, and similar to those.

E cove que la ventozacio sia guardada denant de banh; habantz cove que sia aministrada aprop issiment del banh per una hora o per doas, e cove que dorma aprop la ventozacio.
And it is necessary that the cupping be guarded before bathing; it is better that it be administered after leaving the bath for an hour or two, and it is necessary to sleep after the cupping.

Quid est quo oportet ut regatur ventosandus aus phlebotomatus ante ventosationem.
What is it that one must govern the cupped or bled person before cupping.

Cove que consideras al comensament: lahoras si le ventozador o aquel que·s deu fleubotomar es coleric e ventz sobre lu sanc agut e imflamacio, lahoras cove que prengua causas infrigidantz, ayssi cum milgranas acetosas, e endivia an vi agre e laytuguas, e secanabin, e julep, e a lor semblantz.
It is necessary to consider at the beginning: then if the cupped one or the one who must be bled is choleric and wind overcomes the acute blood and inflammation, then it is necessary that they take cooling things, such as sour pomegranates, and endive with vinegar and lettuce, and secanabin, and julep, and similar to them.

E pausa a lor viandas ayssi cum poletz, e carns de auzels serbiges, e viandas conditas am agras, e a lu semblantz.
And give them foods such as chickens, and meats of wild birds, and foods seasoned with verjuice, and similar to them.

E de aquel del qual la compleccio es freja, cove que prengua en beure eyssarop almiva, o eyssarop de alsecanabin de semensas, e sumac, e vi mot odorant migier entre viel et noel; e que a lu sia comendat que use de paucitat de beure e de mangar, e pausa las viandas de lu poletz e canabir e pissers e petitz auzels e colombat.
And for the one whose complexion is cold, it is necessary that they drink syrup of almonds, or syrup of alsecanabin seeds, and sumac, and very fragrant wine between old and new; and that they be commanded to use little drink and food, and give them foods of chicken and hemp and fish and small birds and young pigeons.

E cove que en lo dia de ventozacio e de fleubotomia le beure sia major que la vianda.
And it is necessary that on the day of cupping and bleeding, the drink be more than the food.

E cove que sia donat en beure en alcunas horas ad alcus homes tyriaca alpharac, o medicamentz de musc, so es muscada, o alcelita denant la ventozacio o denant fleubotomia o aprop, per so que·ls membres principals sian confortatz e que·l sanc sia subtiliat; e no cove que prenguan aquela scalfatz.
And it is necessary that at certain times some men be given to drink theriac alpharac, or musk medicine, that is nutmeg, or alcelita before cupping or before bleeding or after, so that the principal members are comforted and the blood is thinned; and it is not necessary that they take this heated.

Mays las ventozas que so ses scarificacio sian ventozas que so pausadas sus le fetge, e sobre la melsa e podagra, e sobre le umbelic, en les locs dels jonolhs, e la pixida del ancha, quar aquestz membres no suffertan scarificacio sobre si.
But the cups that are without scarification are cups that are placed on the liver, and on the spleen and gout, and on the navel, in the places of the knees, and the hip joint, for these members do not suffer scarification on themselves.

E no es querit per aquelas sino atraccio de sanc de membre, ayssi cum pausam ventosa sobre mamilha en malautia de flux de sanc del sanc de las nars; e usam de aquela per que sia dissolvuda ventositat freja inviscade del membre, ayssi cum pausam sobre le ventre e l’umbelic; quar aquela rarifique le membre e scalfa lu e ramau la dolor quar resolveys ventositat.
And it is not sought by these except the attraction of blood from a member, as we place a cup on the breast in illness of blood flux from the nostrils; and we use it to dissolve cold viscosity from the member, as we place on the belly and navel; for that rarefies the member and warms it and removes the pain because it resolves windiness.

E ja es pausada sobre les ronhos quan accideys en lor opilacio o poyra, quar per vertut de atraccio fort leu huobre opilacio e erradica le poyra de son loc.
And it has already been placed on the kidneys when obstruction or stone occurs in them, for by virtue of strong attraction it soon opens obstruction and eradicates the stone from its place.

E semblantment fa quan es pausada sobre le fetge e la melsa deves ventositat en aquels enclausa.
And similarly it does when it is placed on the liver and spleen towards windiness enclosed in them.

E aquestas ventozas so administradas vuedas amb succio tant solament; e alcunas veguadas so administradas am foc.
And these cups are administered empty with suction only; and sometimes they are administered with fire.

E alcunas veguadas so administradas plenas de aygua tebeza en las malautias de la melsa.
And sometimes they are administered full of lukewarm water in illnesses of the spleen.

E aquo es per que la ventoza sia umplida e sia pus gran, so es aygua cauda sola o aygua en la qual sian cuytas herbas ad aquo convenientz.
And this is so that the cup may be filled and be larger, that is hot water alone or water in which herbs suitable for this have been cooked.

Forma de ventoza aministrada am foc: sia la amplitud del orrifici de dos ditz, segon que nos la havem formada; e la quantitat del preon sia la maytat de un palm; e sia en lo latz de lu, en le loc que es en le circuit, la maytat de lu, le trauc sia petit segon la quantitat que intre en lu una agulha.
Form of cup administered with fire: let the width of the orifice be two fingers, according to how we have formed it; and the quantity of the depth be half a palm; and let there be on its side, in the place that is in the circuit, half of it, let the hole be small according to the quantity that enters in it a needle.

Sia fayta de eram rog o citri, de grosses marges, leon, enguals e terses per so que no leda le membre deves la sua posicio sobre lu.
Let it be made of red or citrine copper, with thick margins, smooth, equal and polished so that it does not harm the member towards its position on it.

E sia al mieg de lu vergua transversa de eram o de ferr, on es pausada candela am lo foc.
And there should be in the middle of it a transverse rod of copper or iron, where a candle with fire is placed.

E ja sia aquesta ventoza gran major de aquela la qual havem recomtat; e la pauca mendre de aquela segon las malautias e la etat de aquel que usa de aquela.
And although this cupping glass is much larger than the one we have described; and the small one is smaller than that, according to the illnesses and the age of the one who uses it.

E las ventosas dels efantz e extenuatz so autres que las ventozas dels joves e de grosses corssas.
And the cupping glasses for children and the emaciated are different from those for young people and those with robust bodies.

E la qualitat de pausar aquesta ventoza am foc sobre le membre es que extenda la meca am foc de lenha decentment denant una pauca candela de cera, e pausa aquela sobre le mieg de la vergua transversa en le mieg loc de la ventoza, per que le foc sia accendut enviro la partida dejos per que no sia comburit le cors del malaute.
And the method of placing this cupping glass with fire on the limb is to extend the wick with wood fire decently before a small wax candle, and place it on the middle of the transverse rod in the middle of the cupping glass, so that the fire is lit around the lower part so that the body of the patient is not burned.

E aprop sia pausada sobre le membre del malaute, e le dit sia sobre le trauc que havem dit, entro que quan tenem las ventozas e non indigem que osten le dit e que yesca la vapor sobre aquel trauc, lahoras la ventoza sira tantost dissolvuda.
And after it is placed on the limb of the patient, and the finger is on the hole we have mentioned, until when we hold the cupping glasses and we do not need to remove the finger and let the vapor escape through that hole, then the cupping glass will be quickly dissolved.

E prop igneys la meca segon la sua manieyra, e itera aquela si indigeyssas de aquela.
And then ignite the wick according to its manner, and repeat it if you need it.

Mays en ventosa que es aministrada en la malautia de plauressi, am aygua, en la qual no ha vergua transversa ni trauc, e no es aministrada sino que sia umplida de aygua, e es pausada sobre le membre tant solament.
But in a cupping glass that is administered in the illness of pleurisy, with water, in which there is no transverse rod or hole, and is not administered unless it is filled with water, and is placed on the limb only.

E aquesta es la forma de lu: E aquesta ventoza quant plus es gran, tant es milhor, per que puya recebre gran quantitat de aygua.
And this is its shape: And this cupping glass, the larger it is, the better, so that it can receive a large quantity of water.

Capitol .xcvii.
Chapter 97.

Sanguissuguas no so administradas en motz membres sino en les membres en les quals non es possible posicio de ventosas, per la parvitat de aquels, ayssi cum le pot e gingiva e semblantz a lor; o en membre denudat de carn, ayssi cum le dit e·l nas e lors semblantz.
Leeches are not administered on many limbs except on those limbs where the placement of cupping glasses is not possible, due to their small size, such as the lip and gum and similar to them; or on a limb stripped of flesh, such as the finger and the nose and similar to them.

E la qualitat de usar de aquelas que si has trobadas sanguisugas que so en las ayguas dossas de poyredura mundas.
And the method of using them is that if you have found leeches that are in fresh waters clean of putrefaction.

E aprop sian layssadas le dia e la nueyt en aygua dossa entro que sian famolentas, e que no romangua alcuna causa en le ventre de aquelas; e aprop sia evacuat le cors en le comensament am fleubotomia e am ventozas; e aprop fregua le membre del malaute entro que s’enrojezesca; e aprop sian pausadas sobre lu.
And afterwards they should be left for a day and a night in fresh water until they are hungry, and nothing remains in their bellies; and afterwards the body should be evacuated at the beginning with phlebotomy and with cupping glasses; and afterwards rub the limb of the patient until it reddens; and afterwards they should be placed on it.

E cum son umplidas e caso.
And when they are full and fall off.

E si es possible succio del loc am ventoza, es mays derier en juvament.
And if suction of the place with a cupping glass is possible, it is more beneficial afterwards.

E sino, lahoras lava le loc am vi agre e aprop am mota aygua; e sia freguat e expremut.
And if not, then wash the place with vinegar and afterwards with much water; and it should be rubbed and squeezed.

E si es prolonguat le cors del sanc aprop le cazement de las sanguissuguas, e es aquo resudan, lahoras tu enfon un drap de li en aygua freja, e pausa aquel de sobre entro que sia abdida la resudacio.
And if the flow of blood is prolonged after the falling of the leeches, and this is oozing, then you soak a linen cloth in cold water, and place it on top until the oozing is stopped.

E si le sanc es multiplicat, lahoras polveriza sobre lu vitriol trissat, o guallas e semblantz a lor de las causas stipticas, entro que·l sanc sia abscidit; o sian pausadas sobre le loc las maytatz de favas excocicadas, e sian layssadas entro que las favas aderescan al loc, e es le sanc abscidit.
And if the blood is multiplied, then sprinkle crushed vitriol on it, or galls and similar astringent substances, until the blood is stopped; or place halves of peeled beans on the place, and leave them until the beans adhere to the place, and the blood is stopped.

E cove, si es necessaria, iteracio de sanguissuguas, quan es possible mudar aquelas.
And it is appropriate, if necessary, to repeat the leeches, when it is possible to change them.

E si las sanguissuguas son prohibidas de suspenssio, lahoras sia freguat le loc am sanc recent o fique una agulha en les locs entro que yesca sanc; e aprop sian pausadas, quar aquelas quan sento alcun sanc tantost adarysso.
And if the leeches are prevented from attaching, then rub the place with fresh blood or prick a needle in the places until blood comes out; and afterwards place them, for when they feel any blood they quickly attach.

E quan voles que cajan, polveriza sobre aquelas un pauc de aloen trissat, o sal, o cendre, e cazo tantost.
And when you want them to fall off, sprinkle a little crushed aloe on them, or salt, or ash, and they fall off immediately.

Ayssi comensa lo prolec de la tersa partida: de restauracio.
Here begins the prologue of the third part: on restoration.

Aquest capitol es motas veguadas necessari en la art de medicina; e es restauracio de fractura e de dislocacio accident en les osses.
This chapter is often necessary in the art of medicine; it is about the restoration of fractures and dislocations occurring in bones.

O, filh, sapiatz que jactan se de aquest capitol les fols metges e les vulguars e aquels que degun temps no reguardero les libres dels Antics ni legiro de aquels una letra.
Oh, son, know that foolish doctors and common people boast about this chapter, and those who have never looked at the books of the Ancients nor read a letter from them.

E per aquesta causa es fayt que aquesta manieyra dels scients in terra nostra es privat; e yeu no ho e obliat en aquo degun temps be de tot; e no he adhibit aquo que apres, sino per longitut de lectio dels libres dels Antics e studi sobre le entendement de aquels, entro que extrayssi la sciencia de aquels.
And for this reason, this manner of knowledge in our land is private; and I have not forgotten anything about it at any time; and I have not added what I learned, except through long reading of the books of the Ancients and study of their understanding, until I extracted their knowledge.

E aprop adirigui a experiment e studi en la longitut de la mieua vida.
And afterwards I directed myself to experiment and study throughout my life.

E yeu ja he de aquo descrit en aquest capitol tot aquo que conte la mieua sciencia e sobre le qual es passat lo mieu experiment; pus que agui abreujat aquo a vos autres e deliuregui aquo de occupacio de elonguacio; e abreujegui aquo en la fi de abreujacio; et e monstrat aquo en la fi de declaracio; e formegui en aquo motas formas dels sturmentz que so administratz en aquel, cum es fayt per addicio de declaracio, ayssi cum he fayt en dos capitols precedentz.
And I have already described in this chapter all that my knowledge contains and on which my experiment has passed; since I had abbreviated it for you others and delivered it from the occupation of elongation; and I abbreviated it in the end of abbreviation; and I showed it in the end of declaration; and I formed in it many forms of instruments that are administered in it, as is done by addition of declaration, as I have done in two preceding chapters.

Capitol primier.
First Chapter.

Summae et collectiones ex esse fracturae ossium, ex eis quarum praemissio necessaria est, antequam incipiamus rememorationem membrorum fraftorum et diversorum si uniuscuiusque.
Summaries and collections from the essence of bone fractures, from those whose introduction is necessary, before we begin the recollection of broken limbs and the different ones if of each one.

Cove donc que diguam en le prohemi de aquest capitol las summas del sermo; e les capitols al entendament dels quals en le comensament es forsat le artifexs e a stacio sobre la veritat de aquels; so es vos e aquels que so promptz que sapian o aprenguan aquesta art nobla autres de vos.
It is appropriate then that we say in the preface of this chapter the summaries of the discourse; and the chapters to the understanding of which at the beginning the craftsman is forced and to station over the truth of those; that is you and those who are ready to know or learn this noble art from you.

E donc dic que quan accideys a alcu fractura o dislocacio o torcio o cazement, lahoras cove que tu te coytes al comensament am fleubotomia o aleyar aquel, o quascu ensemps, si no prohibeys alcuna causa, ayssi cum debelitat de vertut, o es aquel al qual accideys effant, o viel en decrepitat, o es temps de vehement calor, o de vehement freg.
And so I say that when someone suffers a fracture or dislocation or sprain or fall, then it is appropriate that you hasten at the beginning with bloodletting or to relieve him, or both together, if nothing prohibits it, such as weakness of virtue, or if the one to whom it happens is a child, or old in decrepitude, or it is a time of vehement heat, or of vehement cold.

E aprop sia content en vianda sieua de erbas frejas e de carns de auzels e de crabotz; e prohibem carns grossas e umplir si de viandas e de tota vianda que umple las venas de sanc, entro que siras segurat de apostema caut, e si no temes efusio de materia al membre.
And afterwards be content in his food with cold herbs and meats of birds and goats; and we prohibit fatty meats and filling oneself with foods and any food that fills the veins with blood, until you are assured against hot apostema, and if you do not fear effusion of matter to the limb.

E lahoras retorne le malaute al sieu regiment primier am le qual corr costuma de lu.
And then let the patient return to his first regimen with which he usually runs.

E donc cum le os trencat comensa esser restaurat, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia pascut de viandas nutritivas de nutriment mot e gros e greu en les quals sia viscositat, ayssi cum so viandas faytas de froment cueyt am aygua, e ris, e caps, e pes, e ventres de vacas, e huous, e peys fresc, e vi gros e semblants ad aquels, e am aquest regiment es fayta coagulacio de fractura pus leugierament e miels.
And so when the broken bone begins to be restored, then it is appropriate that the patient be fed with nutritious foods of much and thick and heavy nourishment in which there is viscosity, such as foods made of wheat cooked with water, and rice, and heads, and feet, and cow bellies, and eggs, and fresh fish, and thick wine and similar to those, and with this regimen the coagulation of the fracture is made more easily and better.

E sapias que les osses trinquatz quan so en les homes que so en la primiera vilura e en los decrepitz, no es possible que sian continuatz e sian consolidatz segon lur natura per la exsiccacio dels membres de lor.
And know that broken bones when they are in men who are in the first old age and in the decrepit, it is not possible that they be continued and be consolidated according to their nature because of the drying out of their limbs.

E son consolidatz e continuatz segon lor natura tot temps per la exsiccacio de aquels membres, e so continuatz e consolidatz aquels que so de lor en la fi de la lenitat, ayssi cum les osses dels petitz effantz.
And they are consolidated and continued according to their nature all the time because of the drying out of those limbs, and those of them that are at the end of softness are continued and consolidated, such as the bones of little children.

Mays empero natura ajusta e amnecteys sobre le os trencat de tota partida alcuna causa semblant a glut en le qual es grossitut que adhereys e strenh aquel entro que so ensemps conglutinatz e liatz ensemps, entro que venen la fi de fortitut e de fermesa, ayssi cum foc al comensament, entro que denguna causa no prohibeys aquel de las suas obres.
But however, nature adds and connects over the broken bone from every part something similar to glue in which there is thickness that adheres and tightens it until they are together conglutinated and bound together, until they come to the end of strength and firmness, as it was at the beginning, until nothing prohibits it from its works.

E per aquesta causa es necessari que pauses las viandas del malaute, viandas en las quals so gravitat e viscozitat e grosseza, ayssi cum havem dit.
And for this reason it is necessary that you set aside the foods of the sick, foods in which there is heaviness and viscosity and thickness, as we have said.

Mota diversitat de fractura segon diversitat del membre.
Many different types of fractures according to the diversity of the limb.

E sapias que las specias de fractura son diversas segon la diversitat dels membres, quar fractura del os de la camba es diversa de la fractura del os del cap; e la fractura del os del pietz es divers de la fractura del os del dos; e semblantment totz les autres membres son diverses entre lor.
And know that the types of fractures are diverse according to the diversity of the limbs, for a fracture of the leg bone is different from a fracture of the head bone; and a fracture of the chest bone is different from a fracture of the back bone; and similarly all the other limbs are different from each other.

E yeu venc am rememoracio de tota specia de fractura, expausada en le sieu capitol distincta del autre.
And I come with remembrance of every type of fracture, explained in its distinct chapter from the others.

Mota diversitat de fractura en si meteyssa.
Many different types of fractures in themselves.

E son diversificadas las specias de fractura del os en lor meteyssas; quar es fayta fractura arcuada otra aquo que accidan en lu stellas; e alcunas veguadas es fayta fractura segon la longitut del os: e so las fracturas de lu satagia e astelhas e addicios procedentz e no-procedentz, ayssi cum es fayt en la pena quan es preparada a escriure, e es fractura am plagua e disrupcio en le cap, e es fractura fissura petita.
And the types of bone fractures are diversified in themselves; for an arched fracture is made beyond what happens in the stars; and sometimes a fracture is made along the length of the bone: and these are fractures of splinters and chips and protrusions proceeding and not proceeding, as is done in the pen when it is prepared to write, and it is a fracture with a wound and disruption in the head, and it is a small fissure fracture.

E a tota specia es engen o turment propri en restauracio de lu segon que vindra rememoracio de lu distincta en les sieus locs.
And for every type there is a proper device or treatment in restoration of them according to what will come to memory of them distinctly in their places.

Mota senhal de fractura del os.
Many signs of bone fracture.

E per aquo es conoguda fractura del os: es tortuositat de lu, e de aquel eminencia e appericio de lu al sentiment, e so de lu quan compremes aquel am la tua ma.
And by this a bone fracture is known: it is the tortuosity of it, and its prominence and appearance to the touch, and its sound when you compress it with your hand.

E donc quan no es en le loc tortuositat apparent ni so no es feyt deves le tieu tocament quan toques le os am agitacio e le malaute no atroba gran dolor, lahoras no es aqui fractura.
And so when there is no apparent tortuosity in the place nor is sound made towards your touch when you touch the bone with agitation and the patient does not find great pain, then there is no fracture there.

Habantz es possible que sia tortuositat o petita fissura, adon no cove que tu mauguas aquel am la tua ma e am compressio de tot; habantz pausa sobre lu de las medicinas de las quals ve rememoracio aprop aquel moment le qual conveneys al loc; e aprop sia streyt per strictura subtil.
Rather it is possible that there is tortuosity or a small fissure, then it is not appropriate that you move it with your hand and with compression of all; rather place on it the medicines of which remembrance comes after that moment which is suitable for the place; and afterwards let it be tightened by subtle tightening.

E sapias que·l loc quan es arcuat e no es scindit en dos o otra aquo que no accidan en lu satagie, cum es remauguda tota partida de la sua compar, lahoras cove que comenses de la tua hora a rectificacio de lu habantz que a lu accida apostema caut.
And know that when the place is arched and is not split in two or beyond what happens in splinters, when every part is removed from its companion, then it is appropriate that you begin from your hour to rectify it before a hot swelling occurs to it.

E si a lu accida apostema caut, lahoras layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que cesse le apostema; e aprop engualha aquel segon quascuna manieyra que podes de levitat e de engen.
And if a hot swelling occurs to it, then leave it for some days until the swelling ceases; and afterwards straighten it according to each manner that you can with lightness and skill.

E sapias que restauracio de lu e agulacio de lu es pus leugiera que del os en le qual accideysso sathagie.
And know that its restoration and joining is easier than of the bone in which splinters occur.

E aprop strenh aquel segon que vindra la rememoracio de lu.
And afterwards tighten it according to what will come to memory of it.

Mays si en le os so satagias, lahoras es necessaria extencio de aquest membre trencat de doas partz, si es la ma o le pe; o am la tua ma si le membre es petit; o am doas cordas o am una corda e la ma.
But if there are splinters in the bone, then extension of this broken limb is necessary from two parts, if it is the hand or the foot; or with your hand if the limb is small; or with two ropes or with one rope and the hand.

E sia la tua posicio am la qual pauses le membre loc engual segon la sua figura natural, mentre que las partidas so extandudas del membre trenquat, lahoras te perforsa que fassas retornar aquelas addicios am engen e segon quascuna manieyra que poyras en lor locs.
And let your position with which you place the limb be an equal place according to its natural figure, while the parts of the broken limb are extended, then strive to make those protrusions return with skill and according to each manner that you can to their places.

E guarda te segon la tua forssa que no accida sobre le malaute per la tua operacio delor ni lesio; e perforsa te segon le tieu poder que tu appliques la un os am l’autre son companho segon lors milhors formas.
And guard yourself according to your strength that pain or injury does not occur to the patient by your operation; and strive according to your power that you apply one bone with its companion according to their best forms.

E cove que en aquela hora aprofitablament tu toques am la tua ma aquel, e si vezes aqui alcuna causa diversa, rectifiqua aquel e enguala aquel per la quantitat de la tua vertut.
And it is appropriate that in that hour you profitably touch it with your hand, and if you see anything diverse there, rectify it and straighten it according to the quantity of your virtue.

E exquiva vehement extenssio e compressio, ayssi cum fan mots fols metges que motas veguadas fan accidir apostema caut per la sua operacio, o fan accidir contraccio en le membre ayssi cum havem vist aquo per la operacio de lor motas veguadas.
And avoid vehement extension and compression, as many foolish doctors do who many times cause hot swelling to occur by their operation, or cause contraction to occur in the limb as we have seen this by their operation many times.

E aprop annecteys, aprop equacio e decent operacio e strictura de aquel membre, e repaus e tranquilitat; amoneste le malaute sobre aquo e fay le squivar que no maugua aquel en la hora de las suas vigilias e del sieu dormir, e ves la sua revolucio e agitacio, e deves la sua egestio, e deves totz les sieus movementz am tota la sua vertut; e aguarda se que la posicio del membre sia posicio am la qual sia asegurada la dolor, la qual causa es quar quan sent en la disposicio de la posicio del membre delor o lesio; lahoras cove que permutes aquel ad autra disposicio de aquela am la qual non senta dolor; e guarda am aquo que la posicio de lu aquela sia dreyta e engual, per so que al membre non accida tortuositat quan es restaurat.
And after connection, after equation and decent operation and tightening of that limb, and rest and tranquility; advise the patient about this and make him avoid moving it during his waking hours and his sleep, and towards his revolution and agitation, and towards his excretion, and towards all his movements with all his strength; and watch that the position of the limb is a position which secures the pain, which is because when he feels pain or injury in the disposition of the limb's position; then it is necessary to change it to another disposition with which he doesn't feel pain; and watch with this that its position is straight and even, so that the limb doesn't become twisted when it is restored.

E la qualitat de la strictura del membre tranquat es aquela que yeu recomti; per que sapias que·ls membres trencatz so diversificatz en lor parvitat e en lor grandeza e en la forma de aquels.
And the quality of the tightening of the broken limb is that which I recount; so that you know that broken limbs are diverse in their smallness and in their greatness and in their form.

E de aquels que son petits ayssi cum le bras e·l dit e·l focil e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras cove que la envolucio sia de drap mol subtil.
And of those that are small such as the arm and the finger and the forearm and similar to those, then it is necessary that the wrapping be of soft, thin cloth.

Mays aquels que so grosses ayssi cum la cuoyssa o la camba, cove que en aquels sia envolucio lada e dura, quar la liadura lada connecteys le membre gran e strenh aquel de tota part am strictura engual, enayssi que en lu no intre macula.
But those that are large such as the thigh or the leg, it is necessary that for those there be a wide and hard wrapping, because the wide binding connects the large limb and tightens it from all sides with equal tightness, so that no blemish enters it.

E aprop comensa, aprop la tua evacuacio de equacio, pausar liament convenient ad aquo, sobre le loc de aquela fractura am tres envolucios o quatre segon que·l membre mereys; e strenh la tua ma un petit am le liament.
And after beginning, after your evacuation of equation, place a binding suitable for this, over the place of that fracture with three or four wrappings according to what the limb deserves; and tighten your hand a little with the binding.

E aprop ve am aquel a la partida pus sobirana del loc de la fractura, e strenh mens que no foc la tua strictura am la qual has strengut le loc de la fractura.
And after go with that to the uppermost part of the fracture site, and tighten less than your tightening with which you have tightened the fracture site.

E aprop elongua te am envolucio del loc de la fractura un pauc, e mollifiqua la strictura petit a petit, entro que prenguas del loc sa una gran partida.
And after elongate yourself with wrapping from the fracture site a little, and soften the tightness little by little, until you take a large part from the healthy site.

E aprop pren una autra benda e envolveys aquela autra veguada sobre le loc trenquat am envolucio, e aprop ve am las envolucios a la partida pus dejos de la fractura; e sia la tua operacio en la strictura de la envolucio e en mollificacio de aquela segon que havem dit en la envolucio primieyra desus.
And after take another bandage and wrap it again over the broken place with wrapping, and after go with the wrappings to the lower part of the fracture; and let your operation in the tightening of the wrapping and in softening of it be according to what we have said in the first wrapping above.

E aprop pausa entre las volucios de stopa leon o drap am le qual sia engualada la tortuositat de la fractura, si en lu es tortuositat; e sino, no pauses en lu alcuna causa.
And after place between the windings of tow lion or cloth with which the tortuosity of the fracture is evened out, if there is tortuosity in it; and if not, do not place anything in it.

E aprop pausa sobre lu autra benda, e aprop enguala sobre aquestas envolucios stelhas decentment faytas tantost, si en le loc no es imflacio o apostema caut, e lahoras pausa sobre lu aquo que sede le apostema aquel e que oste la imflacio; e layssa aquela per alcus jorns; e lahoras tu strenh sobre lu las stelhas.
And after place another bandage over it, and after even out over these wrappings stars decently made immediately, if there is no swelling or hot abscess in the place, and then place over it that which calms that abscess and removes the swelling; and leave that for some days; and then you tighten the stars over it.

E sian las stelhas de la maytat de canna lada raza, e be formada saviament; o sian de fust de pi; o de ramps de palma ; e sia le ample de quascuna stelha segon aquesta forma e aquesta figura:
And let the stars be of the half of a wide, smooth cane, and well formed wisely; or let them be of pine wood; or of palm branches; and let the width of each star be according to this form and this figure:

Empero cove que la astelha que es pausada sobre aquela fractura sia pus grossa e pus lada un petit que las autras astelhas, e la longitut de la stela segon qu’es legut al membre en magnitut e parvitat; e aprop strenh sobre las astelhas am autra benda segon la tua primieyra strictura; e aprop lia desus am fiel decentment segon que havem dit de strictura, e es que sia la tua strictura segon le loc de la fractura mes, e quant mes es alonguat de la fractura, es mendre la strictura.
However, it is necessary that the splint that is placed over that fracture be a little thicker and wider than the other splints, and the length of the splint according to what is allowed to the limb in magnitude and smallness; and after tighten over the splints with another bandage according to your first tightening; and after tie above with thread decently according to what we have said about tightening, and it is that your tightening should be according to the fracture site more, and the further it is elongated from the fracture, the lesser the tightening.

E cove que les fils sian migiers en grossesa e subtilitat, e sian de li mol; e si les fils so grosses, ayssi cum yeu he vist per la operacio de alcus fols pausantz les lors fils de cordas de li tort, e es error gran, quan catz la strictura fora equalitat.
And it is necessary that the threads be medium in thickness and thinness, and be of soft linen; and if the threads are thick, as I have seen by the operation of some fools placing their threads of twisted linen ropes, and it is a great error, when the tightening falls outside equality.

E eyssament fils subtils no so convenientz, quar tu no consaguiras per strictura am aquels aquo que voles, e no cove que entre astela e astela haja mens de un dit.
And likewise thin threads are not suitable, because you will not achieve by tightening with those what you want, and it is not appropriate that between splint and splint there be less than one finger.

E si le malaute es ledit per las extremitatz de las stelas aprop la strictura en les locs sas, lahoras pausa dejos aquelas de stopa leon o lana carmenada entro que aquo no li fassa lesio.
And if the patient is injured in the extremities of the splints near the constriction in healthy places, then place beneath them oakum or carded wool until it does not cause him injury.

Alcunas veguadas fractura es am plagua, e accideys disrupcio en la codena, e yeu vindre am rememoracio en aquela en le capitol segon singularitat.
Sometimes a fracture is with a wound, and a disruption occurs in the skin, and I will come with a reminder of that in the following chapter specifically.

E sapias que ges tot membre trencat no es streyt am stelhas al primier dia; la qual causa es quar le membre, quan es gran, no cove que pauses sobre lu stelhas sino aprop v dias o vii o mays, segon la tua seguratat de adveniment de apostema caut.
And know that not every broken limb is tightened with splints on the first day; which is because the limb, when it is large, should not be placed on splints except after 5 days or 7 or more, according to your certainty of the onset of hot swelling.

E aquesta es la manieyra dels emplaustres am les quals les Antics restauravan, les quals so pausatz sobre fractura e dislocacio e torcio.
And this is the manner of plasters with which the Ancients restored, which are placed on fractures and dislocations and sprains.

Manieyra de emplaustra comu abruejat de restaurament de fractura, convenient a motas compleccios e majorment a las femnas e als efantz, quar es de aquo sobre le qual no ventz calor ni freg: e es que prenguas de polvera de moli, e es la medula de la farina que pen deves le movement de la mola en las paretz del moli.
Method of common abridged plaster for restoring fractures, suitable for many complexions and especially for women and children, for it is of that upon which neither heat nor cold prevails: and it is that you take mill powder, and it is the core of the flour that hangs towards the movement of the millstone on the walls of the mill.

E comfeys aquel ayssi cum es, sino que cribelles aquel am album de huou, e pausa la comfeccio de lu no-spessa ni subtil; e aprop usa de aquela.
And prepare it as it is, except that you sieve it with egg white, and place the preparation of it neither thick nor thin; and afterwards use it.

Autra manieyra de emplaustre restaurant fractura e dislocacio e torcio: recipe de assafetida, de lapdanum, de acacia, de enula, e migrach, que es razit de milgraner salvage, de totz ana drac. x; de mirra e aloen ana drac. v; alochil ana drac. xx; totz sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian mesclatz am aygua alichil o am album de huou si la compleccio del malaute es scalfada; e aprop usa de aquest emplaustre, quar es de bona composicio e restaura les osses trencatz leugierament, e confereys a motz homes.
Another method of plaster restoring fracture and dislocation and sprain: take asafoetida, labdanum, acacia, elecampane, and migrach, which is wild pomegranate root, of all 10 drachms each; of myrrh and aloe 5 drachms each; alochil 20 drachms; let all be ground and sieved and mixed with alochil water or with egg white if the patient's complexion is heated; and afterwards use this plaster, for it is of good composition and restores broken bones easily, and is beneficial to many men.

Autra manieyra de emplaustre le qual comfereys a fractura e torcio: recipe migrach e met de altea blanca ana drac. x; de mirra e de aloen ana drac v; de acacia drac. vi; de bol armenic drac. .xx.
Another method of plaster which is beneficial for fracture and sprain: take migrach and put white marshmallow 10 drachms each; of myrrh and aloe 5 drachms each; of acacia 6 drachms; of Armenian bole 20 drachms.

Totz sian trissatz en mortier am mota contricio, e sian cribellatz, e sian comfitz am aygua o am album de huou e sia administrat.
Let all be ground in a mortar with much crushing, and be sieved, and be prepared with water or egg white and be administered.

Manieyra de emplaustre a juncturas e osses separatz de lors locs, e seda dolor accident en aquels e a fissuras e fractaduras: sia presa lana sutza e sia submersa en vi agre e oli cuyt e sia pausat sobre le loc.
Method of plaster for joints and bones separated from their places, and it soothes pain occurring in them and for fissures and fractures: let unwashed wool be taken and be submerged in vinegar and cooked oil and be placed on the spot.

Mays en aquest emplastre no es vertut de restauracio, de apostema caut e expelleys dolors propriament.
But in this plaster there is no virtue of restoration, of hot swelling and it expels pains specifically.

Autra manieyra de emplastre que restaura os trancat: pren fuelas de figuier sort e fuelas de papaver salvatge; contereys tot e fay emplastre de lor.
Another method of plaster that restores broken bone: take leaves of deaf fig and leaves of wild poppy; crush all and make a plaster of them.

Manieyra de emplastre abreujat aministrat deves la restauracio de fractura de os e quan tu voles resolucio del romanent de apostema: recipe razitz de altea, de camamilla e flors de violes, de farina de ers, de totz ana partida i; sian totz trissatz e sian cofitz am vi, si·l membre no es scalfat.
Method of abridged plaster administered for the restoration of bone fracture and when you want resolution of the remnant of swelling: take roots of marshmallow, of chamomile and violet flowers, of vetch flour, of all 1 part each; let all be crushed and be prepared with wine, if the limb is not heated.

Mays si es scalfat, lahoras comfeys aquel am aygua de coliandre humit o am aygua e usa de lu.
But if it is heated, then prepare it with water of moist coriander or with water and use it.

Autra manieyra de emplastra pus fort en resolucio que aquest primier, quan accideys apostema dur deves la restauracio del membre: recipe de razitz de altea e de semensa de li, e de balaustia, e mellilot, majorana, flors de viol, de camamilla, de totz ana partida i engual; totz sian trissatz e sian cofitz am aygua de sauze o am aygua dousa o am vi, tot aquo segon la qualitat del membre e le repaus de la color de lu.
Another manner of plaster stronger in resolution than this first one, when a hard abscess occurs near the restoration of the limb: take root of marshmallow and flaxseed, and pomegranate flower, and melilot, marjoram, violet flowers, chamomile, of all equal parts; let all be ground and mixed with willow water or fresh water or wine, all this according to the quality of the limb and the rest of its color.

Mays Ypocras no diyssec en le sieu libre que sia pausat sobre le membre trenquat deves la restauracio de lu sino cerot fayt de cera e de oli e no autre causa; e recomtec que sia migier entre grossitut e subtilitat.
But Hippocrates did not say in his book that anything should be placed on the broken limb for its restoration except a ceruse made of wax and oil and nothing else; and he recounted that it should be between thickness and subtlety.

Mays a Gualia es vist que sian pausatz sobre le membre trencat deves la restauracio de lu e las causas en las quals es exsiccacio am petit de caliditat so ayssi cum mirra, enses e semblantz a lor de aquelas causas que havem recomtadas.
But in Gaul it is seen that they place on the broken limb for its restoration things in which there is drying with a little heat such as myrrh, incense and similar things to those that we have recounted.

Manieyra de emplastre que comfereys a lesio e dolor: recipe migat, de cezes, de pels de home inscizes o pena de auzel, e de altea, e sal, partidas enguals; sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian cofitz, e sia fayt emplastre.
Manner of plaster that confers to lesion and pain: take crumb, chickpeas, cut human hair or bird feather, and marshmallow, and salt, equal parts; let them be ground and sifted and mixed, and let a plaster be made.

Mays la quantitat segon la qual cove que romangua la liadura e aprop sia disliada, es que consideres si no es accidit dolor ni pruziment ni le os es trencat no es maugut de son loc, lahoras tu no deslies de motz jorns.
But the quantity according to which it is convenient that the bandage remain and afterwards be untied, is that you consider if there is no pain or itching and the broken bone has not moved from its place, then you do not untie for many days.

E si accideys al loc dolor vehement o prusiment o imflacio, lahoras tu te coyte o deslie aquel en la hora, e osta le emplastre de lu.
And if there occurs at the place vehement pain or itching or swelling, then you hasten or untie that at the hour, and remove the plaster from it.

E pren drap de li e spongia marina leon humida, e submergeys aquela en aygua tebeza, e am aquela lava le loc entro que cesse aquel pruziment e la dolor sia sedada; e aprop layssa repausar le membre per una hora; e aprop pausa sobre lu lana sutza submersa en vi agre e oli o oli rozat, e lia sobre lu per una nuoyt entro que sias segur de apostema caut, e que repause la imflacio del membre, e sia remauguda la dolor de lu.
And take linen cloth and soft wet sea sponge, and submerge that in lukewarm water, and with that wash the place until that itching ceases and the pain is sedated; and afterwards let the limb rest for an hour; and afterwards place on it unwashed wool submerged in vinegar and oil or rose oil, and bind it for a night until you are sure of hot abscess, and that the swelling of the limb rests, and its pain is removed.

E aprop itera aquela strictura subtil e emplastre petit e no·l strenhas per la tua constriccio primieyra, e subtilia am aquel entro que sia sanat.
And afterwards repeat that subtle constriction and small plaster and do not tighten it with your first constriction, and refine with that until it is healed.

E si vezes que le apostema e la rogor e la dolor e la imflacio e tots les accidentz ja so remaugutz de tot, e indigeysses de emplastre e de strictura, lahoras tu itera aquel ayssi cum has fayt al comensant engualment.
And if you see that the abscess and the redness and the pain and the swelling and all the accidents are already removed completely, and you need plaster and constriction, then you repeat that as you have done at the beginning equally.

E si no accideys al membre alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no deslies aquel sino aprop tres dias o quatre o v o vii; e alcunas veguadas tot aquo es layssat per xx dias segon que a tu appar per la desliadura del membre, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que la fractura adhereys, e se acosta a la coagulacio de la carn sobre aquel.
And if there does not occur to the limb any of those things that we have said, then do not untie that except after three days or four or five or seven; and sometimes all this is left for twenty days according to what appears to you by the untying of the limb, as we have said, until the fracture adheres, and approaches the coagulation of the flesh over it.

E lahoras ajusta en la strictura mays que en la tua strictura primieyra tota, e ayusta en la engrossacio de la vianda del malaute, segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu.
And then increase the constriction more than in your first entire constriction, and increase in the thickening of the patient's food, according to what is preceded by the remembrance of it.

Mays si tu vezes le loc de la fractura ja desiccar e extenuar mays que no cove, lahoras sapias que·l nutriment es prohibit pervenir ad aquel; e donc embroca aquel am aygua tebeza deves tota veguada que delias aquel; e sia aquo en totz tres dias; e alleuja la strictura un petit, e per aquesta operacio corr al membre le nutriment, e es sanat leugierament.
But if you see the place of the fracture already drying and thinning more than is convenient, then know that nourishment is prohibited from reaching it; and then bathe that with lukewarm water every time that you untie it; and let this be in all three days; and lighten the constriction a little, and by this operation nourishment runs to the limb, and it is healed easily.

Mays aquo que fan les fols restauradors de la fractura del membre autra veguada quan no es restaurat al comensament, segon que cove, e es restaurat segon tortuositat, es error segon la operacio de lor, e temor gran, e si fos dreyturier aquo agrandit les Antics en lors libres e agueran am aquo obrat.
But what the foolish restorers of the fracture of the limb do another time when it is not restored at the beginning, as is convenient, and is restored according to tortuosity, is error according to their operation, and great fear, and if it were righteous this the Ancients would have enlarged in their books and would have worked with this.

E yeu no he vist ad alcu de lor aquo far, per que es pus razonable que aquo no fassa.
And I have not seen any of them do this, wherefore it is more reasonable that this not be done.

Capitol segon: De fractura quan accideys en le cap.
Chapter Two: On fracture when it occurs in the head.

Las specias de fracturas son motas, e las figuras de lor son diversas, e las causas son distinctas, quar de fracturas alcuna es fayta per percussio de spaza, e la percussio osta tot le os entro al ciphac, le qual es dejos le os, ayssi cum fay ayssa en le fust, e per aquo aquesta specia es nompnada ascial; o la spaza inscideys alcuna partida del os, e inscideys la carn de lu e no passa la inscizio entro al derier de lu; e aquesta specia de fractura es nompnada levatio absoluta.
There are many types of fractures, and their shapes are diverse, and the causes are distinct, for some fractures are made by the blow of a sword, and the blow removes all the bone down to the membrane, which is below the bone, as an axe does in wood, and for this reason this type is called axial; or the sword cuts a part of the bone, and cuts the flesh of it but does not pass through to the back of it; and this type of fracture is called absolute elevation.

E la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca, e de fractura que es contricio o atricio; e causa de lu es percussio am poyra o cazement sobre peyra, e a lor semblantz.
And the wound of these two fractures is either large or small, and of fracture that is crushing or bruising; and its cause is impact with a stone or falling on a stone, and similar things.

E aquesta fractura o es penetrant que ja apropinqua al pannicol le qual es dejos le os; o es en la facia del os, e la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca.
And this fracture is either penetrating that already approaches the membrane which is below the bone; or it is on the face of the bone, and the wound of these two fractures is either large or small.

E de fractura es que es ameguada en le os, en la subtilitat del cabel petita, e per aquo es nompnada aquesta specia fractura capillar.
And of fracture there is one that is diminished in the bone, in the fineness of a small hair, and for this reason this type is called capillary fracture.

E es fractura que es fayta o per cazement o per percussio de peyra e a lu semblantz, que fa intrar alcuna lamina del os a las partidas dedintz, e es fayta en le loc concavitat ayssi cum accideys als payroles de eram quan accideys a lor percussio e es partida de lor intrada a las partidas dedintz.
And there is a fracture that is made either by falling or by impact of stone and similar things, which causes some layer of the bone to enter the inner parts, and a concavity is made in the place as happens to copper cauldrons when they suffer an impact and part of them is pushed inwards.

E majorment es fayt aquo en les cors de osses humitz, ayssi cum so caps de efantz.
And this mainly happens in bodies with moist bones, such as the heads of infants.

E so a totas aquestas specias fracturas satagias, so son pessas ayssi cum stelhas separadas.
And to all these types of fractures are attached fragments, that is pieces like splinters separated.

E yeu vindre am reremoracio de tot aquo en son loc.
And I will come with a reminder of all this in its place.

E conoyssem totas aquestas specias de fractura per deteccio sobre aquelas e per inquisicio de lor am tentas e ostament de carn corrumpuda que es sobre lor.
And we know all these types of fracture by detection upon them and by investigation of them with probes and removal of corrupted flesh that is over them.

E specia capillar es conoguda per aysso que es descubert sobre le os, e es abstergit, e linit sobre lu am tentha, quar la fractura appar negra.
And the capillary type is known by this that is uncovered over the bone, and is cleaned, and smeared over it with ink, for the fracture appears black.

Mays en la curacio de fractura considera al comensament les accidentz del malaute, e lahoras si tu vezes per los accidentz que signifique per significacio manifesta sobre paor, ayssi cum es vomit de colera, e extencio, e perdement de entendament, e abscizio de votz, e sincopi, e febre acuta, e eyssiment dels huels e rogor de aquels, e semblantz a lor dels accidentz en las majors disposicios, ses dopte no es sanat.
But in the cure of fracture consider at the beginning the symptoms of the patient, and then if you see by the symptoms that indicate by clear indication about fear, such as vomiting of bile, and extension, and loss of understanding, and loss of voice, and fainting, and acute fever, and protrusion of the eyes and redness of them, and similar to them of the symptoms in the major dispositions, without doubt he is not healed.

E si vezes accidentz no-correntz tu speras salut, lahoras tu comensa la curacio de lu.
And if you see non-recurring symptoms you hope for health, then you begin the cure of him.

La qual causa es quar si es vengut a tu le plaguat en le comensament cum es plaguat e aquo es en les dias de ivern, lahoras cove que tu studias en le ostament del os denant le dia xiiii segon tota disposicio.
Which thing is that if the wounded has come to you at the beginning when he is wounded and this is in the days of winter, then it is fitting that you strive in the removal of the bone before the 14th day according to every disposition.

E si es en les dias d’estiu, lahoras cove que te coytes ostar le os denant le vii dia, habantz que aquo que es dejos le os sia corromput del pannicol, e que accidescan les accidentz que havem recomtatz.
And if it is in the days of summer, then it is fitting that you hasten to remove the bone before the 7th day, before that which is below the bone is corrupted from the membrane, and that the symptoms occur that we have recounted.

E si la fractura ja es pervenguda al pannicol cubrent le cervel, e es am partidas menudas e atricio, lahoras cove que inscidas la partida conminuta e atrita, segon que yeu recomtare a tu.
And if the fracture has already reached the membrane covering the brain, and is with minute parts and bruising, then it is fitting that you cut the comminuted and bruised part, according to what I will recount to you.

E es que tu razas le cap del malaute plaguat, e descuebres sobre le os segon costuma e manieyra a tu possible segon la figura de la plagua, e que sia leugier sobre le malaute.
And it is that you shave the head of the wounded patient, and uncover over the bone according to custom and manner possible to you according to the shape of the wound, and that it be light on the patient.

E si accideys a tu deves la deteccio del os, fluxs de sanc o apostema caut, lahora tu te oppausa a lu am aquo que cove, e es que huemplas le loc de draps infuzes en vi e oli rozat, e fassa repausar la plagua entro que sia sedat le apostema, e sies segur de fluxs del sanc; e aprop comensa en la circuicio del os e en la ablatio de lu.
And if it happens to you towards the detection of the bone, flux of blood or hot abscess, then you oppose it with what is fitting, and it is that you fill the place with cloths soaked in wine and rose oil, and make the wound rest until the abscess is settled, and you are sure of the flux of blood; and afterwards begin in the circumference of the bone and in the removal of it.

E aquo sia segon una de dos manieyras de operacio.
And this be according to one of two manners of operation.

E la una manieyra es que tu inscidas le os am inscisori de streyt tal, e aquesta es la forma de lu: E aprop administra un autre inscissori aquest, un pauc pus lat que aquel; e aquesta es la forma de lu:
And one method is that you cut the bone with a narrow chisel, and this is its form: And then use another chisel, a little wider than that one; and this is its form:

E aprop administra mays le inscissori pus lat que·l segon.
And then use a chisel wider than the second one.

E cove que sia deves tu nombre de inscissoris diverses, dels quals alcus so pus latz que alcus autres; e alcus de lor so pus breus que·ls autres e sian en le derier de acuitat de las suas extremitatz, e sian de ferr indi o felod.
It's advisable that you have a number of different chisels, some of which are wider than others; and some of them are shorter than others and are very sharp at their ends, and are made of Indian or Damascus steel.

E usa de lor am facilitat en percussio sobre le inscissori per so que no concutesca le cap e leda aquel.
Use them with care in striking the chisel so that you don't shake the head and harm it.

E si le os es fort, dur, lahoras cove que perfores en le circuit de lu denant que tu administres los inscissoris am les taravels, les quals so nomnatz taravels no-profundantz.
If the bone is very hard, then it's advisable to drill around its circumference before you use the chisels, with drills that are called non-penetrating drills.

E no so nomnatz ayssi sino quar aquels no pausan le terme de l’os del test ad aquo que es aprop lu, per so quar al taravel es redonda extremitat o marge sobre aquel que es dejos le cap de lu agut semblant a marge o a cercle petit, le qual prohibeys esser submergit e passar la spissitut del os.
They are called this because they don't pass through the entire thickness of the skull bone, because the drill has a round end or edge above the sharp part, like a small circle, which prevents it from submerging and passing through the thickness of the bone.

E es convenient que tu prenguas de aquestz taravels gran nombre dels quals quascu convenesca a la spicitut de quascun os, entro que sia a tu present en tottz testz del cervel la extremitat del qual sia aguda, la quantitat en longitut e brevitat sia segon la quantitat de spicitut de aquest test.
It's advisable that you have a large number of these drills, each suitable for the thickness of each bone, so that you have one for all skull bones, the end of which should be sharp, the length according to the thickness of this skull.

E aquesta es la forma de tres specias de teravels: La qualitat de perforar en le circuit del os trencat es que pauses le teravel sobre le os e revolvas aquel am les tieus ditz entro que sapias que l’os ja es penetrat; e aprop permuda le terevel ad autre loc, e pausa aquo que es entre tot trauc la quantitat de la grosseza del ray o enviro aquo.
And this is the form of three types of drills: The method of drilling around the broken bone is that you place the drill on the bone and rotate it with your fingers until you know that the bone has been penetrated; and then move the drill to another spot, and place it between each hole at a distance of about the thickness of a needle.

E aprop inscideys am inscissoris aquo que es entre quascun trauc del os, e fay aquel pus subtil que podes sobre aquo en fi de levitat, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que erradiques le os, o am la tua ma, o am alcuna autra causa per alcus sturmentz les quals auras apparelhatz ad aquo, ayssi cum tanalhas e forceps subtils.
And then cut with chisels what is between each hole in the bone, and make it as thin as you can with great care, as we have said, until you remove the bone, either with your hand or with some other tools which you have prepared for this, such as pliers and fine forceps.

E cove que tu guardes am tota cautela que l’inscissori no toque alcuna causa del ciphac.
It's important that you take great care that the chisel doesn't touch any part of the dura mater.

E donc cum auras circuit le os perforan, e sira separat del ciphac si es continuat am lu, e auras aquel extrayt, cove que razas e enguales aquel en la asperitat de lu de aquo que es en le os am autra sturment semblant a inscissori, mays empero cove que sia pus teon e pus subtil que les autres inscissoris.
And when you have drilled around the bone, and it is separated from the dura mater if it was attached to it, and you have extracted it, you should scrape and smooth its rough edges with another tool similar to a chisel, but it should be thinner and finer than the other chisels.

E si roman alcuna partida dels osses petitz e satagias, lahoras pren aquela am facilitat am aquo que es deves tu dels sturmentz; e aprop aquo cura la plagua am lichinis e enguentz les quals havem ditz.
If any small pieces of bone remain and are stuck, then remove them carefully with the tools you have; and after that, treat the wound with lint and the ointments we have mentioned.

E l’autra manieyra de operacio es leugiera, longinqua de paor, la qual diyssec Gualia e la lauzec per gran lausor; e aquest es le sermo de lu: necessari es a tu en le comensament que comenses descobrir la partida del os del loc en le qual es la fractura pus vehement e pus manifesta, entro que quan auras descubert aquela partida e auras pausat dejos lu la extremitat de aquest inscissori lent e alegre del qual aquesta es la forma:
And the other method of operation is easier, less frightening, which Galen described and praised highly; and this is his description: it is necessary for you at the beginning to start uncovering the part of the bone where the fracture is most severe and most visible, until when you have uncovered that part and have placed under it the end of this gentle and pleasant chisel, of which this is the form:

E es que la partida lenticular es leon e no inscideys alcuna causa, e la partida aguda es de lu en dos latz avantz en longitut, ayssi cum vezes; que la partida lenticular sia ajustada al ciphac am la facia de lu inscident aguda en le os.
And it is that the lenticular part is smooth and doesn't cut anything, and the sharp part of it is on two sides extending in length, as you see; that the lenticular part should be placed against the dura mater with its sharp cutting face on the bone.

E aprop percuteys sobre le inscissori de una partida am un petit malhet entro que inscidas tot le os am facilitat ayssi cum es revolvut, e tu sias segur del pannicol que no accida en lu accident que temas en denguna manieyra, e si le medicant14 era le pus fol de totz les homes e le mays ignorant de lor; certament, e si era dorment.
And then strike the chisel on one side with a small mallet until you cut through the entire bone easily as it is turned, and you can be sure that no accident will happen to the membrane that you might fear in any way, even if the physician was the most foolish of all men and the most ignorant of them; indeed, even if he were sleeping.

Lahoras si romania alcuna causa annexa al os del pannicol en alcus locs de os, inscidira aquel de lu am la extremitat del inscissori aquel lenticular, e deliuraria aquel de lu am facilitat, quar es deliurat de lu ses nocument e ses paor.
Then if something remains attached to the bone of the membrane in some places of the bone, cut it from it with the extremity of that lenticular incision tool, and free it from it with ease, for it is freed from it without harm and without fear.

E si fractura del os no penetra entro al pannicol, e aquo que es abscidit o es ostat del os es la facia de lu, e roman en lu asperitat e satagias subtils, lahoras cove que razas aquela asperitat e erradiques aquelas satagias am razoris subtils per les quals tu has preparat le nombre, de diversas quantitatz per que sia a tu possible administrar de aquels en tot loc les pus convenientz de lor e le pus dreyt de aquels segon aquo en que te perduzeys la tua operacio aquel os trencat e la figura de lu.
And if the fracture of the bone does not penetrate to the membrane, and what is cut or removed from the bone is its face, and roughness and subtle fragments remain in it, then it is necessary that you scrape that roughness and eradicate those fragments with subtle razors for which you have prepared a number, of diverse quantities so that it is possible for you to administer from them in every place the most convenient of them and the most direct of them according to what your operation leads you to that broken bone and its shape.

E cove que administres en la tua razio am la qual razes le os al comensament le pus lat de aquels razoris, e aprop usa aprop lu del pus subtil de lu, e no cesses far aquo segon continuitat entro que pervenguas ad aministrar le pus teon e·l pus subtil de totz aquels.
And it is necessary that you administer in your scraping with which you scrape the bone at the beginning the widest of those razors, and afterwards use after it the most subtle of it, and do not cease doing this continuously until you come to administer the thinnest and most subtle of all those.

Mays en quascuna de las autras fracturas petitas capillars e fractura subtil, cove que administres cura segon aquo que perduseys ad rectificacio de lu.
But in each of the other small capillary fractures and subtle fracture, it is necessary that you administer care according to what leads to its rectification.

E es causa que no es ameguada sobre totz les quals han studi en aquela art.
And it is a matter that is not diminished over all those who have studied in that art.

E stec sobre aquo que nos scriut havem mostrat en grans fracturas.
And I stood on what we have written shown in great fractures.

E si le pannicol es retangut quan tu erradiques le os, lahoras cove que prenguas drap de li segon la quantitat de la plagua, e submergeys aquel en oli rozat, e pausa aquel sobre le orrifici de la plagua; e aprop pren autre drap doblat o triplicat e submergeys lu en vi e oli rozat e pausa aquel sobre drap prim e fay aquo al pus leugierament que podes sobre aquel, que no graves le ciphac; e aprop administra sobre aquel liament lat, e no strenhas aquel sino per quantitat que tengua la plagua tant solament.
And if the membrane is retained when you eradicate the bone, then it is necessary that you take linen cloth according to the quantity of the wound, and submerge that in rose oil, and place that over the orifice of the wound; and afterwards take another cloth doubled or tripled and submerge it in wine and rose oil and place that over the thin cloth and do this as lightly as you can over that, that you do not burden the brain; and afterwards administer over that wide bandage, and do not tighten it except by the quantity that holds the wound only.

E layssa aquel am aquesta cura per un dia o per dos entro que sias segur de apostema caut; e aprop deslia aquel e aprop aministra medicinas am las quals es superflua siccitat, ayssi cum razitz de lin e farina de errs, e polvera de enses e de aristologia, e de semblantz ad aquels.
And leave that with this care for a day or for two until you are sure of hot apostema; and afterwards untie that and afterwards administer medicines with which there is superfluous dryness, such as flax root and vetch flour, and powder of incense and birthwort, and similar to those.

E es que tu fassas de aquestas medicinas polvera que sia pulverizada sobre la plagua, ayssi cum son secas; e universalment, administra en aquel tota medicina de proprietat de la qual es que abstergesca e no mordique.
And it is that you make of these medicines powder that is pulverized over the wound, as they are dry; and universally, administer in that every medicine of property of which is that it cleanses and does not bite.

E guarda te segon la tua vertut que la plagua en la tua curacio sia neta; e no sia en lu surdicia de enguent ni autra; ni no layssas agreguar virulencia en lu; quar quan es ajustada sobre le pannicol del cervel, corromp aquel e poyreys aquel, e accideys sobre le malaute aprop aquo malicia maligna.
And guard yourself according to your virtue that the wound in your cure be clean; and let there not be in it filth of ointment or other; nor do not let virulence aggregate in it; for when it is gathered over the membrane of the brain, it corrupts that and rots that, and befalls the patient after that evil malignancy.

E accideys en le ciphac del cap, cum de lu es mondificat le os e majorment quan es menspresada la cura de lu, e es negror en la superficia de lu; e donc considera lahoras si accideys al malaute les accidentz que havem ditz, sapias que es parnicios ses tot dopte.
And it befalls in the brain of the head, when of it the bone is cleansed and especially when the care of it is despised, and there is blackness in the surface of it; and then consider then if there befall the patient the accidents that we have said, know that it is pernicious without any doubt.

E si no accideys negror sino de la medicina que es pausada desus, e es en vertut de aquela medicina que fassa aquela negror, lahoras cove que tu prenguas de mel una partida e de oli rozat partidas iii, e am aquels linieys un drap, e aprop pausa aquel sobre le ciphac; e aprop cura aquel am las specias de curacio que conveneys entro que sia sanat.
And if blackness does not befall except from the medicine that is placed above, and it is in virtue of that medicine that it makes that blackness, then it is necessary that you take of honey one part and of rose oil three parts, and with those anoint a cloth, and afterwards place that over the brain; and afterwards cure that with the species of cure that is convenient until it be healed.

Capitol .iii.
Chapter 3

De restauracio del nas quan es trincat.
On the restoration of the nose when it is broken.

Sapias que no es trencat del nas sino doas partidas ensemps pus sobiranas, o una de aquelas alcunas veguadas, per so quar en lu has dos osses, quar la partida dejos es cartillaginosa, e no es trencada e no accideys a lu sino atricio e tortuositat e sinuitat.
Know that only two parts of the nose are broken together at the top, or sometimes one of them, because in it there are two bones, as the lower part is cartilaginous, and is not broken and does not suffer anything but abrasion and twisting and bending.

Mays si es trencada la una de las doas partidas de lu, lahoras cove que tu intrometas le dit petit en le sieu nas, e que engualhas aquela fractura dedintz am le tieu dit indic, e am le dit pous defora, entro que retorne le nas segon la sua figura natural.
But if one of the two parts of it is broken, then you should insert the little finger into his nose, and straighten that fracture inside with your index finger, and with the thumb outside, until the nose returns to its natural shape.

E sia fayt aquo per tu am facilitat, e guarda te que no caja per aquela tua operacio sobre le malaute delor.
And let this be done by you with ease, and be careful that no pain falls upon the patient through your operation.

E si la fractura es en la pus sobirana partida del nas, e le dit no perve ad aquela, lahoras cove que sia equat am la extremitat del ray en le qual sia petita grossitut.
And if the fracture is in the uppermost part of the nose, and the finger does not reach it, then it should be evened out with the end of a stick which has a small thickness.

E si la fractura es en doas partidas, lahoras tu fay le semblant de aquo.
And if the fracture is in two parts, then you do the same as this.

E coyta te am restauracio de lu en le primier dia de la fractura, si es possible; e sino, lahoras aprop le vii o·l x deves le repaus del apostema caut.
And hasten with its restoration on the first day of the fracture, if possible; and if not, then after the 7th or 10th day you should rest the hot swelling.

E aprop entromet en la extremitat del nas una meca de drap de li, si la fractura es en una partida, o metz doas calguas, si la fractura es en doas partidas, e sia en la calgua grossitut de tanta quantitat que umpla le trauc del nas.
