E si la plagua eflueys sanc, lahoras cove que tu te coytes a la retencio de lu enayssi que tu polverizes sobre lu zegi trissat, si a tu autra causa no es present.
And if the wound bleeds, then it is necessary that you hurry to retain it so that you powder over it crushed zinc, if you have nothing else present.

E aprop comensa restaurar la fractura en aquel meteys dia, e no prolongues aquo, si no accideys apostema.
And after begin to restore the fracture on that same day, and do not prolong it, unless an abscess occurs.

Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras tu layssa la restauracio de lu entro al ix dia, entro que sia cedat le apostema, e no apropinques a lu en le tertz dia e·l iiii de tot, quar tu faras accidir mals accidentz.
But if a hot abscess occurs, then you leave the restoration of it until the ninth day, until the abscess has subsided, and do not approach it on the third and fourth day at all, for you will cause bad accidents to happen.

Mays si le os trencat es eminent sobre la codena descubert, lahoras cove que te perforses reduzir aquel e engualar aquel am las tuas mas am facilitat e am pauca extencio.
But if the broken bone is prominent above the skin uncovered, then it is necessary that you strive to reduce it and equalize it with your hands with ease and with little extension.

Mays si extencio no es a tu preparada e la equacio de lu am las tieuas mas, lahoras tu reduzeys aquel am las tuas mas am aquest sturment; e es sturment le qual es fayt de ferr, la longitut del qual es de vii ditz o de viii e la latitut del qual es segon la quantitat de la plagua; e per aquo es necessari al metge que prengua de aquels tres o quatre segon la quantitat que indigeys ad aquo en la curacio en tota specia de fractura.
But if extension is not prepared for you and the equation of it with your hands, then you reduce it with your hands with this instrument; and it is an instrument which is made of iron, the length of which is seven or eight fingers and the width of which is according to the size of the wound; and for this it is necessary for the doctor to take three or four of these according to the quantity that is needed for this in the cure in every kind of fracture.

E sia redon, e sia en lu pauca groceza per so que no sia doblat deves la comprecio sobre aquel en la hora de la operacio.
And let it be round, and let there be little thickness in it so that it is not doubled towards the compression on it at the time of the operation.

E sia de aguda extremitat al qual sia marge en las sieuas extremitatz; e sia le desus de lu a grossetut tendent, e de la maytat de lu entro a las partidas.
And let it be of sharp extremity to which there is a margin at its extremities; and let the top of it tend to thickness, and from the middle of it to the parts.

E aquesta es la forma de lu:
And this is the form of it:

E es nompnat en grec “labre volentz atelarem”, so es paleta pauca.
And it is called in Greek "labre volentz atelarem", that is a small spatula.

Per que cove que sia pausada la extremitat de lu acuda elevada sobre la extremitat del os eminent.
Therefore it is necessary that the sharp raised extremity of it be placed on the extremity of the prominent bone.

E inpelleys aquel en una veguada entro que retorne le os, e sia engualat am alcuna equacio.
And push it at once until the bone returns, and is equalized with some equation.

E donc esforsa te engualar las extremitatz de la fractura entre lor, e si la extremitat de lu trencada es subtil, e no pren aquela le sturment per bona axcepcio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas la extremitat de aquel os entro que l’insturment haja poder de aquo.
And then strive to equalize the extremities of the fracture between them, and if the extremity of the broken one is subtle, and the instrument does not take it by good acceptance, then it is necessary that you cut the extremity of that bone until the instrument has power over it.

Mays si no podes reduzir le os de tot am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras enscideys aquel am aquo que coveneys a lu dels inscizoris les quals havem ditz; o serra aquel am una de las serras en qualque manieyra sia a tu possible.
But if you cannot reduce the bone at all with what we have recounted, then cut it with what is convenient to it of the cutting instruments which we have mentioned; or saw it with one of the saws in whatever manner is possible for you.

E aprop ratz aquel que roman en le os de asperitat e de scorsas menudas.
And after, scrape what remains in the bone of roughness and small scales.

E cum le os es reduzit, e aprop la reduccio le malaute atroba dolor vehement ledent, lahoras sapias que le os no es retornat al sieu loc natural; e adonc fay aquo quar tu confereyses al malaute gran juvament.
And when the bone is reduced, and after the reduction the patient finds vehement pain hurting, then know that the bone has not returned to its natural place; and then do this for you will confer great help to the patient.

Cum es complida la tua restauracio la qual fas al os, e lahoras submergeys drap en vi stiptic negre, e propriament si es en estiu, e no pauses sobre la plagua cerot ni autre causa en la qual sia oli, per so que no fassa en lu accidir poyredura e corropcio.
When your restoration which you do to the bone is completed, then submerge a cloth in styptic black wine, and properly if it is in summer, and do not put on the wound wax or other thing in which there is oil, so that it does not make putrefaction and corruption occur in it.

E aprop aministra stelas en la hora del tieu compliment de la restauracio de l’os, e layssa la plagua descuberta enayssi que inscidas le trauc am forfexs e uses de envolucios segon la quantitat de la plagua.
And after administer splints at the time of your completion of the restoration of the bone, and leave the wound uncovered so that you cut the hole with scissors and use wrappings according to the size of the wound.

E guarda te am tota cautela que no strenhas la plagua am la fractura, quar motas veguadas an fayt aquo les fols metges, e fero accidir sobre les sieus malautes mort o malautia corrodent o zuthement, so es sania.
And guard yourself with all caution that you do not tighten the wound with the fracture, for many times foolish doctors have done this, and caused death or corroding disease or suppuration, that is sanies, to happen to their patients.

E si la tieua strictura leugiera, molli, diversa de la strictura de las autras fracturas.
And if your tightening is light, soft, different from the tightening of other fractures.

E si la plagua es gran o es plagua mala, e temes sobre aquel alcus accidentz mals les quals havem recomtatz, e atrobas dolor en le loc, lahoras no cove que pauses sobre aquel astelas, mays fay ad aquel envolucio de draps durs en loc de stelas e strenh lu am aquelas.
And if the wound is large or is a bad wound, and you fear over it some bad accidents which we have recounted, and you find pain in the place, then it is not convenient that you put splints on it, but make for it a wrapping of hard cloths in place of splints and tighten it with those.

E cum aprop un dia o dos vezes ja la plagua comensar, que en lu sia engendrat brac, lahoras tu osta desus le drap le qual havias pausat sobre aquel am vi, e aprop aministra calguas, enguentz am les quals de nostra constuma es que mediquem las plaguas, ayssi cum enguentz tetrafarmacon e semblantz ad aquel.
And when after a day or two you see the wound beginning to form pus, then remove the cloth which you had placed over it with wine, and afterwards apply poultices, ointments with which we customarily treat wounds, such as tetrapharmacon ointment and similar ones.

E conveneys a tu que deslias le liament e considera la plagua en quascun dia mati e vespre entro que sia consolidada e fermada, e cove que·l membre sia preparat en tal manieyra que la poyredura corra de lu a las partidas dejos am facilitat.
And it is advisable that you unbind the bandage and examine the wound each day morning and evening until it is consolidated and firm, and it is appropriate that the limb be positioned in such a way that the pus flows from it to the lower parts with ease.

si a la plagua passan motz dias, e no es consolidada ni es abscindit de lu le brac, lahoras sapias que aqui so satagias de las petitas per que cove enquieras la plagua am tenta.
If many days pass and the wound is not consolidated nor is the pus removed from it, then know that there are small fragments there, so it is necessary to probe the wound with a probe.

E de aquelas satagias aquelas que so separadas remau e extratz, aquelas que de lor no so separadas e pongen le membre e fan accidir dolor, perforsa te a inscidir aquelas segon que a tu aquo es possibla.
And of those fragments, those that are separated remove and extract, those that are not separated on their own and are pricking the limb and causing pain, force yourself to cut those out as much as possible for you.

E si accideys a la plagua zuchem o eluchen, so es stiomenios, o autra specia de corrupcio e de putrefaccio, lahoras cove que pauses a quada un de aquels am aquo que conveneys a lu de la curacio del qual es precedida narracio en le sieu capitol.
And if the wound develops gangrene or necrosis, that is, tissue death, or another type of corruption and putrefaction, then it is necessary that you apply to each of these what is appropriate for its treatment, of which an account has been given in its chapter.

E de aquo en le qual cove que stia lo mieu sermo e tu fassas present la tua pessa: quan os gros es trincat, emineys sobre le membre ayssi cum le os de la coyssa e del ajutori e semblantz ad aquels dels membres grans, e que no presumas atraccio de lu, ni la extraccio de lu quar motas veguadas accideys per aquo la mort; habantz layssa aquel entro que poyresca, quar fort leu cayra per si aprop xx dias o xxx; e lahoras cura la plagua si a tu es vist, e si no layssa aquela.
And in this it is appropriate that my discourse remains and you keep your mind present: when a large bone is broken, protruding over the limb such as the thighbone and the humerus and similar ones of the large limbs, and that you do not attempt to pull it or extract it because many times death occurs because of this; rather, leave it until it rots, for it will fall off by itself after 20 or 30 days; and then treat the wound if it seems right to you, and if not, leave it.

Capitol .xx.
Chapter 20.

De la curacio de nodacio que accideys en le vestigi de alcuna fractura.
On the treatment of nodules that occur in the site of some fractures.

Motas veguadas accideys aquesta nodacio en le vestigi de sanacio de fractura, e majorment que es prop de las juncturas, e es orrasada per lu la figura del membre; e fort leu prohibeys le membre de la sua operacio natural.
Many times this nodule occurs in the site of healing of a fracture, and mainly near the joints, and the shape of the limb is disfigured by it; and it easily prevents the limb from its natural operation.

Adonc considera si la nodacio es recent e aministra en aquela medicinas que han stipticat ayssi co es aloen, e enses, e mira, e sercacollo, e acrassia, e semblantz ad aquels; enayssi que prenguas de aquela alcunas o totas, e comfesiys aquelas am vi stiptic, o am album de huou, o am vi agre, e pausa aquela sobre la nodacio en estopa, e constringeys aquelas sobre lu per bona constriccio.
Then consider if the nodule is recent and apply to it medicines that have astringent properties such as aloe, incense, myrrh, sarcocolla, acacia, and similar ones; so that you take some or all of these, and mix them with astringent wine, or with egg white, or with vinegar, and place this on the nodule in tow, and bind these over it with good pressure.

E leyssa extrictura que no deslies aquela per motz dias; e aprop deslia aquela e itera autra, entro que sia remauguda la nodacio; o strenh sobre aquela lamina de plom descentment, quar plom ha proprietat de remaure tot aquo que es imflat en les membres.
And leave the bandage so that you do not unbind it for many days; and afterwards unbind it and repeat another, until the nodule is removed; or tighten over it a lead plate decently, because lead has the property of removing all that is swollen in the limbs.

Mays si nodacio ja es en peyra convertida e streyta es e nessessitat provoca a ostar aquela coytadament, e lahoras scindeys aquela per la partida pus sobirana de lu, e inscideys la superfluitat e eminent, o ratz aquela am alcus rezoris entro que sia remauguda; e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.
But if the nodule has already turned to stone and is tight and necessity urges to remove it quickly, then cut it at the highest part of it, and cut away the excess and protrusion, or scrape it with some razors until it is removed; and treat it until it is healed.

Capitol .xxi.
Chapter 21.

De restauracio de fractura quan es restaurada e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul no segon la sieua natura.
On the restoration of a fracture when it is restored and afterwards the limb remains thin and weak not according to its nature.

Quan fractura de os es restaurada, e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul, lahoras aquo no es fayt sino per motas causas: de las quals la una es multitut de solucio del liament e de la liguacio de lu fayta no segon que cove; o per superfluitat de strictura dels liamentz entro que·l nutriment sia prohibit correr al membre; o per multitut de embrocaccio superflua; o per movement superfluent no en la sua hora; o per pauquesa de sanc en le cors del malaute e per debelitat de lu.
When a bone fracture is restored, and afterwards the limb remains thin and weak, then this is not done except for many reasons: of which one is the multitude of loosening of the bandage and of its binding not done as it should be; or by excess tightness of the bandages until the nourishment is prevented from flowing to the limb; or by excessive fomentation; or by excessive movement not at the right time; or by scarcity of blood in the body of the patient and by his weakness.

E curacio de aquo es dar a mengar al malaute e far le cor de lu tendre entro que·l sanc sia multiplicat en lu; e aministra banh; e entromet gaug e leticia sobre lu.
And the treatment for this is to give food to the patient and make his heart tender until the blood is multiplied in him; and administer baths; and introduce joy and happiness to him.

E aprop pausa pegua sobre le membre, per so que la pegua atire a lu mot nutriment, o continua embrocacio de lu am aygua tebeza, entro que·l nutriment corr e retorne a la sua figura natural.
And afterwards place pitch on the limb, so that the pitch draws much nourishment to it, or continue fomentation of it with lukewarm water, until the nourishment flows and returns to its natural shape.

Capitol .xxii.
Chapter 22.

De curacio dels osses trincatz quan so restauratz tortuozament e prohibeys la operacio de lor de aquo que cove.
On the treatment of broken bones when they have healed crookedly and prevent their proper function.

Quan accideys al membre ja restaurat aprop la sanacio de lu de tortuositat e eminencia al os trincat e nodacio, e es per aquo fededa de forma del membre, mays empero le membre no es prohibit de la sieua operacio natural, lahora no cove que tu recipias la paraula de aquel que exsistima aquel membre sia de novel trincat.
When it happens to a member already healed after its recovery from crookedness and protrusion of the broken bone and swelling, and because of this the shape of the member is deformed, but the member is not prevented from its natural function, then you should not accept the word of one who thinks that member is newly broken.

Mays ja so statz motz fols metges e restauradors les quals han fayt aquo en nostra tera; e aquesta operacio es mot vituperable perduzent a gran temor le senhal de la qual es mortal.
But there have already been many foolish doctors and healers who have done this in our land; and this operation is very blameworthy, leading to great fear, the sign of which is deadly.

Mays si claudicacio e nodacio son recentz, lahoras cove que sian enbrocatz am aygua tebeza en la qual so coytas erbas mollificantz, ayssi cum son fuelas de altea e razitz de lu, e mellilot, e semblantz ad aquels; e sia fayt a lu emplastre am emplastre mollificatio ayssi cum dyallaquilon ben fayt; o que sia preza mucillage de razit de altea e sia contucida am gray de gualina o am oli de cirami, e sia emplastrat am aquel; o que sian prezes figuas grassas e sian trissadas am fems de colom, e semblantz ad aquels de las medicinas que son nompnadas amermans consolidacio.
But if lameness and swelling are recent, then they should be fomented with lukewarm water in which softening herbs have been cooked, such as marshmallow leaves and roots, and melilot, and similar ones; and a softening plaster should be made for it such as well-made diachylon; or mucilage of marshmallow root should be taken and mixed with chicken fat or sesame oil, and plastered with that; or fat figs should be taken and crushed with pigeon droppings, and similar ones of the medicines that are named to reduce consolidation.

E alcunas vetz es dissolvuda am assidua fricacio leugiera que sia am las mas humidas, e sia administrat movement del membre a tota partida en totas horas.
And sometimes it is dissolved with constant gentle friction with moist hands, and movement of the member should be administered to every part at all hours.

Mays si tortuositat ja es anada denant e es fayta fort e convertida es en peyra e provocada es necessitat a curacio de lu am ferr, lahoras cove que sia le pus desus cecsat e la continuacio del os sia dissolvut, e sia inscidit aquo que superflueys de nodacio de aquel meteys am le os am inscissoris subtils, e sia aministrada facilitat en aquel am sollicitut e studi.
But if the crookedness has already gone before and has become strong and turned to stone and the need for its treatment with iron has arisen, then the uppermost should be cut and the continuity of the bone should be dissolved, and what is superfluous of its swelling should be cut away with the bone using subtle incisions, and ease should be administered to it with care and study.

Capitol .xxiii.
Chapter 23.

De sermo en dislocacio.
On the discourse of dislocation.

Dislocacio es eyssiment de alcuna de las juncturas del sieu loc, per que es prohibida de movement, e es orrezada la figura del membre, e fa venir sobre le malaute dolors e lesios grans.
Dislocation is the exit of one of the joints from its place, whereby it is prevented from movement, and the shape of the member is deformed, and it causes great pains and injuries to come upon the patient.

Donc quan accideys ad alcu dislocacio, lahoras cove tantost perforsar que sia reduzit, e no tarde aquela reduzir, quar si es tardada, le loc es apostemat e fort leu am aquo es fayta dificil la reduccio de dislocaccio.
So when dislocation happens to someone, then one should strive immediately to reduce it, and not delay that reduction, because if it is delayed, the place becomes swollen and very easily with this the reduction of dislocation becomes difficult.

E per aysso no cove que sia maugut ni stendut en la hora de la apostemacio, quar motas veguadas fa venir spasme e dolors ledentz.
And therefore it should not be moved or stretched at the time of swelling, because many times it causes spasm and harmful pains.

Mays quan aquo accideys, lahoras cove que tu te coytes a la flaubotomia del malaute, e aprop sia layssat entro que repause le apostema; e aprop le membre sia embrocat am aygua cauda e oli, e aprop sia reduzit am facilitat.
But when this happens, then you should hasten to bleed the patient, and afterwards let it be until the swelling rests; and afterwards the member should be fomented with hot water and oil, and afterwards reduced with ease.

E tot membre sia curat am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra en son loc.
And every member should be treated with that which remembrance will come in its place.

E yeu ja e ordenatz les capitols de dislocacio segon que es precedit en fractura; de la partida del cos pus sobirana entro a la partida pus dejos.
And I have already ordered the chapters of dislocation according to what is preceded in fracture; from the uppermost part of the body to the lowest part.

Capitol .xxiiii.
Chapter 24.

De curacio de dislocacio de la mandibula dejos.
On the treatment of dislocation of the lower jaw.

So dislocadas las doas mandibulas si no tart; e la dislocacio de amdos es fayta segon una de dos manieyras: que o son remaugudas de lurs locs per pauca remocio, e so mollificadas un petit; o so dislocadas per entiera dislocacio e complida, entro que sian mollificadas a la partida de la junctura entro que corro saliva del malaute e que no puesca tenir aquela ni puesca claure la sua boca, e la lengua de lu sia envolopada en sa paraula.
Both jaws are rarely dislocated; and the dislocation of both happens in one of two ways: either they are slightly moved from their places, and are a little softened; or they are dislocated by a complete dislocation, until they are softened at the joint area until saliva runs from the patient and he cannot hold it nor can he close his mouth, and his tongue is impaired in his speech.

Mays quan la dislocacio de lu es pauca, lahoras en las majors disposicios retorna per si an pauca causa.
But when the dislocation is small, then in most cases it returns by itself with little effort.

Mays si la dislocacio es entiera e complida, lahoras cove que sia administrada reduccio de lu leugierament, e no sia tardada de tot.
But if the dislocation is complete, then it is necessary that reduction be administered gently, and not delayed at all.

E es que·l ministre tengua le cap del malaute, e entrometa lo metge le dit pous de la una sieua ma en la razit de la dislocacio de la mandibula dedintz la boca de lu, si la dislocacio es de la una part; o que entrometa les sieus dos pouzes ensemps, si la dislocacio es de doas partz, e les autres ditz de las mas de lu sian defora am les quals enguale; e comanda al malaute que cesse las suas mandibulas e absolva aquelas anar de quascuna partida; e le metge engualhe la mandibula e enpellisca la mandibula entro que retorne al sieu loc.
And it is that the assistant should hold the patient's head, and the physician should insert the thumb of one of his hands into the root of the jaw dislocation inside his mouth, if the dislocation is on one side; or he should insert both his thumbs together, if the dislocation is on both sides, and the other fingers of his hands should be outside with which he aligns; and he commands the patient to relax his jaws and let them go on each side; and the physician aligns the jaw and pushes the jaw until it returns to its place.

E si dificil es la reducio de lu, e majorment si amdos las mandibulas so essemps dislocadas, lahoras aministra evoporacio am aygua cauda e oli, entro que sia fayta leugiera la reduccio de amdos e no tardes la reduccio de amdos de tot, ayssi quo havem dit.
And if the reduction is difficult, and especially if both jaws are dislocated together, then administer evaporation with hot water and oil, until the reduction of both is made easy and do not delay the reduction of both at all, as we have said.

E donc cum retornam e so engualadas, e es clausa la boca del malaute e no es mollificada, lahoras pausa sobre aquelas polvils de drap am cerot, e sia fayt de cera e oli rozat; e aprop sia liat am facilitat am liamens mols.
And then when we return and they are aligned, and the patient's mouth is closed and not softened, then place cloth powders with cerate on them, and let it be made of wax and rose oil; and afterwards tie it gently with soft bandages.

E sia le dormir del malaute sobre le sieu dos, e·l cap de lu sia stant entre dos aurelhes, per so que no maugue aquel a la partida dreyta ni a la sinistra; e no li fassas per forsa masteguar alcuna causa; habans la sieua vianda sia forbicio leon, entro que quan las dolors sian remaugudas e las mandibulas so nozadas, lahoras maugue aquo que vol.
And let the patient sleep on his back, and let his head be between two pillows, so that it does not move to the right side or to the left; and do not force him to chew anything; rather let his food be light broth, until when the pains are removed and the jaws are joined, then he may move what he wants.

E aquo sia aministrat am facilita, e no trebalhe sobre la apercio de la boca deves la comestio e beure e ocitatio, entro que la mandibula sia nozada e sanada.
And let this be administered with ease, and do not labor over the opening of the mouth towards eating and drinking and yawning, until the jaw is joined and healed.

E si es dificil la reduccio de duas mandibulas quan so dislocadas en alcuna hora e no so convertidas als lors locs, lahoras motas veguadas accideysso febres e soda assidua, e fort leu es alerguat le ventre del malaute, e fort leu e vomeys colera pura.
And if the reduction of two jaws is difficult when they are dislocated at some time and are not converted to their places, then many times fevers and persistent headaches occur, and very soon the patient's belly is loosened, and very soon he vomits pure bile.

E quan tu vezes aquo, lahoras sapias que es perdicio; e motas veguadas mor aquel al qual accideys aquo en x dias.
And when you see this, then know that it is perdition; and many times he to whom this happens dies in 10 days.

Capitol .xxv.
Chapter 25.

De reduccio de la dislocacio de la furcula e de la extremitat del muscle.
On the reduction of dislocation of the clavicle and the extremity of the shoulder.

Furcula no es dislocada del latz dedintz per la sua continuacio am le pietz; e alcunas veguadas es dislocada a la partida defora, e aquo es declarat al sentiment.
The clavicle is not dislocated on the inside due to its continuity with the chest; and sometimes it is dislocated to the outside part, and this is evident to the touch.

E la restauracio de lu es que·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu dos e extenda les sieus brasses.
And its restoration is that the patient should lie on his back and extend his arms.

E aprop coarta le loc am la tua palma am fort coartacio, quar ela retornara.
And afterwards constrict the place with your palm with strong constriction, for it will return.

E aprop pausa sobre aquela emplastre e pulvils e strenh aquela.
And afterwards place a plaster and powders on it and tighten it.

Mays la extremitat de aquel que siec le coyde e·s continuat am aquel, no es dislocada en alcun dia; lahoras cove que sia reduzida e engualhada segon que havem dit e segon que es a tu aparelhat.
But the extremity of that which follows the elbow and is continuous with it, is not dislocated in any day; then it is necessary that it be reduced and aligned as we have said and as is prepared for you.

E aprop pausa sobre aquela emplastre, e pulvils, e extrictura, e comanda al malaute adherir a trenquilitat e a repaus entro que sia sanat.
And afterwards place a plaster on it, and powders, and a bandage, and command the patient to adhere to tranquility and rest until he is healed.

E am aquesta meteyssa curacio es reduzida la extremita del muscle quan es separada del sieu loc.
And with this same treatment, the extremity of the shoulder is reduced when it is separated from its place.

Capitol .xxvi.
Chapter 26.

De la reduccio de la dislocacio del muscle.
On the reduction of muscle dislocation.

Sapias que·l muscle no es dislocat sino segon tres manieras, de las quals es la una que sia dislocat a la partida del titillic a la partida dejos.
Know that the muscle is only dislocated in three ways, of which one is that it is dislocated from the armpit area to the lower part.

E la segonda es que sia dislocat a la partida desus del muscle, e aquo es fayt tart; e no es dislocat a las partidas detras per la spalla; e no es dislocat a las partidas denant per les nervis.
And the second is that it is dislocated to the upper part of the muscle, and this happens rarely; and it is not dislocated to the back parts because of the shoulder; and it is not dislocated to the front parts because of the nerves.

E majorment es dislocat e defora eyssit a las partidas dejos deves le titillic, e majorment en aquels dels quals las carns son paucas, leugierament es dislocat; mays en aquels en les quals so motas carns, es eyssit fora am dificultat.
And it is mainly dislocated and comes out towards the lower parts near the armpit, and especially in those who have little flesh, it is easily dislocated; but in those who have much flesh, it comes out with difficulty.

E fort leu accideys ad alcus homes percussio o cazement, e le muscle de lu es apostemat de apostema caut, e es cujat per aquo que ja sia dislocat.
And very easily it happens to some men by a blow or a fall, and their muscle becomes inflamed with a hot swelling, and it is thought because of this that it is already dislocated.

Adonc cove que tu sproes aquo entro que estias sobre-sertetut de lu, e lahoras procesiscas en la curacio de lu.
Then it is necessary that you examine this until you are certain of it, and then proceed with its treatment.

E es conoguda la dislocacio de lu quan es a las partidas dejos deves le titillic; per so que distingescas entre le muscle dislocat e·l muscle sa, quar tu atrobas entre aquels diversitat manifesta; e atrobas en le cap del muscle concavitat e dejos le titillic deves le tocament del cap del muscle ayssi quo un huou, e al malaute no pot redusir la sua ma a la sieua aurelha, ni maure aquela per totz movementz.
And the dislocation is known when it is in the lower parts near the armpit; so that you distinguish between the dislocated muscle and the healthy muscle, for you find between them a manifest difference; and you find in the head of the muscle a concavity and below the armpit towards the touch of the muscle head as if an egg, and the patient cannot bring his hand to his ear, nor move it in all directions.

Si es dislocat deves le pietz o ensus, e tu lahoras atrobas manifest tocament, e no es amaguat.
If it is dislocated towards the chest or upwards, and you then find a manifest touch, and it is not hidden.

E de aquesta dislocacio es fayta leugiera reduccio quan es fresca e le malaute es enfant.
And from this dislocation, an easy reduction is made when it is fresh and the patient is a child.

E la reduccio de lu es que·l ministre eleva la ma de lu a las partidas desus; e aprop pause les tieus pouses dejos le titillic de lu, e eleva la junctura am fortaleza en sus al sieu loc, e·l ministre eleva la ma de lu, e extenda aquela en sus; e aprop pausa aquela dejos quar ela retorna leugierament.
And its reduction is that the assistant raises his hand to the upper parts; and then place your thumbs below his armpit, and raise the joint with strength upwards to its place, and the assistant raises his hand, and extends it upwards; and then place it below for it returns easily.

Mays si per aquo que havem dit no retorna, e so del comensament que accidic la dislocacio, motz dias, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia banhat en aygua cauda e sia aministrada enbrocacio que mollifique e liniesca ayssi cum si so coytz razitz de altea, e fenugrec, e melillot en aygua, e sia administrada.
But if by what we have said it does not return, and it is from the beginning when the dislocation occurred, many days, then it is necessary that the patient be bathed in hot water and an embrocation be administered that softens and soothes as if roots of marshmallow, and fenugreek, and melilot are cooked in water, and be administered.

E aprop le malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu dos e sia pausat dejos le titillic de lu espera de lana que sia engual entre levitat e strictura, e aprop le metge pause le sieu talo sobre la spera, e eleva le cap del muscle am vertut, e atire la ma del malaute per que no sia mauguda a las partidas dejos, e autre ministre tengua le cap del malaute, que no sia maugut a las partidas dejos, quar aquela tantost retorna al sieu loc.
And then the patient should lie on his back and a sphere of wool should be placed below his armpit that is equal between lightness and tightness, and then the doctor should place his heel on the sphere, and raise the head of the muscle with strength, and pull the patient's hand so that it is not moved to the lower parts, and another assistant should hold the patient's head, so that it is not moved to the lower parts, for it then returns to its place.

E si voles, reduzeys aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu fassas esser prezent un home le qual sia pus lonc que·l malaute, e estia de la part de aquel latz, e entrometa le sieu muscle dejos le titillic del malaute e eleve le titillic de lu a las partidas desus entro que·l malaute sia suspendut en ayre, e autre ministre tire la ma del malaute de las partidas dejos del sieu ventre.
And if you want, reduce it according to this manner: and it is that you have present a man who is taller than the patient, and he stands on the side of that side, and puts his muscle under the patient's armpit and raises his armpit to the upper parts until the patient is suspended in the air, and another assistant pulls the patient's hand from the lower parts of his belly.

Mays si le malaute es leugier, lahoras cove que am lu que autre causa sia suspenduda, per so que grave aquel, quar la dislocacio retorna tantost.
But if the patient is light, then it is necessary that with him another thing be suspended, so that it weighs him down, for the dislocation returns immediately.

E es reduzit eysament segon autra manieyra: e es que sia ficat en terra un fust lonc le cap del qual sia redon de figura, ayssi cum pilo de mortier, que no sia gros ni subtil, e aprop sia pausat dejos le malaute; pus que so pausatz sobre·l cap del fust draps leons, e·l malaute sia stant segon la longitut del fust, e aprop sia extenduda la ma de lu a las partidas dejos del autra part; e sia extendut le cos de lu del autre part am fortaleza, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.
And it is reduced also in another way: and it is that a long piece of wood is fixed in the ground the head of which is round in shape, like a mortar pestle, that is neither thick nor thin, and then it is placed under the patient; after soft cloths are placed on the head of the wood, and the patient is standing according to the length of the wood, and then his hand is extended to the lower parts of the other side; and his body is extended on the other side with strength, for the joint returns to its place with speed.

E si es dificil reduccio de lu per totas las causas que havem ditas, lahoras usa de aquesta cura: e es que tu prenguas un fust la quantitat del qual sia en le lonc de dos brasses, e latitut de aquel sia de quatre ditz, e la grossetut de lu sia aleujat en le preon del tittilic segon aquesta forma:
And if it is difficult to reduce it for all the reasons we have mentioned, then use this cure: take a piece of wood whose length is two arms' length, and whose width is four fingers, and whose thickness is reduced at the depth of the armpit according to this shape:

E aprop sobre le cap redon sian liatz drap leons per so que·l fust no ledesca le malaute.
And then on the round end, let lion-colored cloth be tied so that the wood does not harm the patient.

E aprop sia pausat dejos le titillic del malaute, e sia extenduda la ma o le bras sobre·l fust entro a las partidas dejos, e sia liat le fust sobre le adjutori e le bras e la extremitat de la ma.
And then let it be placed under the patient's armpit, and let the hand or arm be extended over the wood up to the lower parts, and let the wood be tied over the upper arm and the arm and the extremity of the hand.

Aprop sia pausat le bras sobre un scalo de scala segon la latitut, e la ma sia extenduda a las partidas dejos, e l’autre cos sia suspendut de l’autre part, quar la junctura intra tantost.
Then let the arm be placed on a step of a ladder according to its width, and let the hand be extended to the lower parts, and let the other body be suspended on the other side, for the joint will enter soon.

E cum le intrament de lu es complit segon quascuna maniera que es a tu possibla, e lahoras cove que tu pauses dejos le titillic spera de lana de engual quantitat; e aprop pauza emplastre perparat de polvera de moli am enses e album de huou sobre tot le muscle, ayssi quo es revolvut desus, e aprop strenh dejos le titillic am strictura decent; e le liament sia revolvut sobre le emplastre, e la ma de lu sia annectida al col de lu, e sia leyssat, e no sia mauguda la ma de lu per vii dias.
And when its entry is completed in whatever way is possible for you, then it is fitting that you place under the armpit a sphere of wool of equal quantity; and then place a plaster prepared from mill dust with incense and egg white over the entire muscle, as is wrapped above, and then tighten under the armpit with a proper binding; and let the bandage be wrapped over the plaster, and let his hand be attached to his neck, and let it be left, and let his hand not be moved for 7 days.

E cove que sia pausada la vianda del malaute pauca, entro que·l membre sia confortat, quar es pus leugier a la sanacio de lu.
And it is fitting that the patient's food be small, until the limb is strengthened, for it is easier for its healing.

E aprop la vianda sia donada major aprop vii o v e sia exercitat un movement; e donc si es fermat e no es mollificat, lahoras ja es sanat.
And after the food should be given in greater quantity after 7 or 5 [days] and let it be exercised with a movement; and then if it is fixed and not softened, then it is already healed.

Mays si la junctura es dislocada motas veguadas per humiditat que accideys a lu o per autra causa, lahoras cove que en aquela sia administrat cauteri am tres traucs, segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri.
But if the joint is dislocated many times due to humidity that befalls it or for another reason, then it is fitting that in that case cautery be administered with three holes, as is said before in the chapter on cautery.

E si tot aysso es fayt e aprop vii dias es desliat le liament e la junctura no es fermada, e le emplastre e la strictura son reduzitz sobre lu alcunas veguadas, e no es fermada e catz e no pot elevar aquel bras a las partidas desus, lahoras sapias que·ls nervis de lu, les quals so al cap del muscle, ja so inscizes o extendutz o mollificatz, e sapia que la junctura nul temps no sira ficada en loc sieu.
And if all this is done and after 7 days the bandage is untied and the joint is not fixed, and the plaster and the binding are reapplied to it several times, and it is not fixed and falls and cannot raise that arm to the upper parts, then know that its nerves, which are at the head of the muscle, are already cut or extended or softened, and know that the joint will never be fixed in its place.

De la dislocacio de aquela qu’es fayta deves le pietz e la mamilha o las partidas detras, la reduccio es fayta am impulcio e extencio am las mas, entro que retorne.
For the dislocation of that which is made towards the chest and the breast or the back parts, the reduction is made with pushing and extension with the hands, until it returns.

E sia administrada en aquela l’autra strictura, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.
And let the other binding be administered to it, and cure it until it is healed.

E si accideys aprop la sanacio gravitat en le membre e tarditat en le movement de lu, lahoras le malaute uze de banh motas veguadas entro que aquela gravitat sia alleujada e que retorne a la natura de lu primiera.
And if after the healing, heaviness occurs in the limb and slowness in its movement, then let the patient use baths many times until that heaviness is alleviated and it returns to its original nature.

Capitol .xxvii.
Chapter 27.

De curacio de dislocacio del coyde.
On the treatment of dislocation of the elbow.

Sapias que la junctura del coyde es dislocada am difficultat e semblantment retorna am difficultat; e aquela es dislocada a totas partidas, e majorment a la partida denant a la partida detras, e la dislocacio de lu no es amaguada a tu quar es cazent dejos le vezement o dejos le tocament segon qualque figura sia dislocat, e quan ajustes le coyde disloguat am le sa, aquo es a tu declarat manifestament, quar la junctura es concavada e no pot doblar le bras, ni tocar am aquel le sieu muscle.
Know that the elbow joint is dislocated with difficulty and similarly returns with difficulty; and it can be dislocated in all directions, mainly to the front and back, and its dislocation is not hidden from you because it falls under sight or touch depending on how it is dislocated, and when you compare the dislocated elbow with the healthy one, it is clearly evident to you, because the joint is concave and cannot bend the arm, nor touch its muscle with it.

E cove que·t coytes, e reduzescas la dislocacio tantost denant que vengua a lu apostema caut, quar si ve a lu apostema caut, dificil es la reduccio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot; e majorment quan es a las partidas detras, quar pus mala es de totas las autras specias de dislocacio, e de major dolor, e motas veguadas deyssen am aquela la mort.
And it is necessary that you hurry, and reduce the dislocation immediately before a hot swelling comes to it, because if a hot swelling comes to it, its reduction is difficult, and it may not heal completely; and especially when it is in the back parts, because it is worse than all other types of dislocation, and of greater pain, and many times death descends with it.

E la restauracio de lu, quan es aquela que es possibla reduzir, es que la ma de lu sia extenduda am doas mas, e le bras de lu sia expandut, e las mas del metge sian sobre le coyde e dejos lu, e el empellisca la junctura am les pouzes de las suas mas ensemps, o am la razit de la sua palma entro que torne en son loc.
And its restoration, when it is possible to reduce it, is that his hand should be extended with both hands, and his arm should be expanded, and the doctor's hands should be above and below the elbow, and he should push the joint with the thumbs of his hands together, or with the base of his palm until it returns to its place.

Mays si la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras retorna ayssi que dobla la ma am la sua ma, entro que percuta le coyde am la razit de la sua palma.
But if the dislocation is in the front parts, then return it so that he doubles the hand with his hand, until he strikes the elbow with the base of his palm.

E si la dislocacio no obezeys a la reduccio, lahoras aministra vehement extencio e mot fort.
And if the dislocation does not obey the reduction, then administer vehement and very strong extension.

E es que dos ministres extendan le bras, e tenguan aquel eyssament dos ministres per so que no sia remaugut deves la extencio.
And it is that two assistants extend the arm, and two assistants also hold it so that it is not moved away from the extension.

E aprop sia revolvut le bras deves tota part, pus que es envolopat drap doblat lonc sobre la ma de lu, o liament.
And afterwards, the arm should be rotated in all directions, after a long doubled cloth is wrapped over his hand, or a bandage.

E quant le metge toca la junctura am la sua ma, unte aquela am alcun oli per so que aquo sia aquelas causas las quals ajudan en lubricitat de la junctura am facilitat; e aprop empellesca la junctura am empulcio vehement entro que retorne.
And when the doctor touches the joint with his hand, anoint it with some oil so that these are the things which help in lubricating the joint with ease; and afterwards push the joint with vehement force until it returns.

E aprop la reduccio de lu cove que sia pausat sobre aquela empastre en le qual sia stipticitat e excequacio am album de huou, e sia extrenhut am strictura descent, e·l bras sia suspendut del col, e sia layssat per alcus dias.
And after its reduction, it is necessary that a plaster be placed on it in which there is astringency and drying with egg white, and it should be tightened with a descending stricture, and the arm should be suspended from the neck, and left for some days.

E aprop sia desliat; e donc si la junctura es formada en le sieu loc, lahoras tu deslia le liament de lu e layssa aquela.
And afterwards it should be untied; and then if the joint is formed in its place, then you untie its bandage and leave it.

E si vezas la junctura no be strenher, lahoras tu itera le emplastre e·l liament, e layssa aquela per alcus dias entro que sia extrenhuda; e aprop deslia aquela.
And if you see the joint not tightening well, then you repeat the plaster and the bandage, and leave it for some days until it is tightened; and afterwards untie it.

Mays si accideys a lu gravitat aprop la reduccio de la junctura, e la disposicio de lu es en movement, lahoras aministra humectacio en banh e fricacio subtil, e comprecio, entro que sia aleujat; o pausa sobre la junctura aleliati, so es coyssa de moto grassa; e aprop sia liada, e layssa aquela sobre le os le dia e la nueyt.
But if heaviness occurs to it after the reduction of the joint, and its disposition is in movement, then administer moistening in a bath and subtle friction, and compression, until it is relieved; or place on the joint "aleliati", that is, fat mutton thigh; and afterwards let it be bound, and leave it on the bone day and night.

E aprop osta aquela, e met aquel en banh; e quan suza, lahoras tu fregua la junctura am fricacio temprada, e aprop itera sobre aquela aleliati, so es ronhonal de moto, una veguada, e la segonda, e la .iii.a.,
And afterwards remove it, and put it in a bath; and when it sweats, then you rub the joint with moderate friction, and afterwards repeat on it "aleliati", that is, mutton kidney, once, and a second time, and a third,

corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denolam intrament de banh, entro que sia linit.
corruption has already come upon the... entry of bath, until it is smoothed.

E si voles, pausa sobre aquela fenda de vaca humida e scalfada am boder e stren sobre aquel; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas, quar aquela es humida e reduzeys a la sua disposicio.
And if you want, place on it a moist cow's split warmed with butter and tighten over it; and do this several times, because it is moist and reduces to its disposition.

Capitol .xxviii.
Chapter 28.

De curacio de dislocacio de malassen, so es de la junctura que es entre·l bras e la ma.
On the treatment of dislocation of the wrist, which is the joint between the arm and the hand.

Malassen de la ma alcunas vetz es deslocada, e la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es leugiera, e·l contrari es de las autras juncturas, mays empero cove que sia velocitat en la reduccio de lu en la hora en la qual es deslocada, denant que le loc sia apostemat o que accida en lu apostema caut.
The wrist is sometimes dislocated, and the reduction of its dislocation is easy, contrary to other joints, but it is necessary to act quickly in reducing it at the time it is dislocated, before the area becomes swollen or a hot abscess develops.

E la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es que tu pauses la junctura de la ma del malaute sobre una taula e le ministre extenda la ma de aquel, e le metge pause la sua ma o o la sua palma sobre la iminencia de la junctura, e empellisca aquela entro que retorne al sieu loc.
And the reduction of its dislocation is that you place the patient's wrist on a table and the assistant extends their hand, and the physician places his hand or palm over the prominence of the joint, and pushes it until it returns to its place.

Mays empero cove que sia considerat si la palma ja es ostada al ventre de la ma, lahoras le malaute pause le dos de la sua ma sobre una taula deves la extencio e la reduccio; e si la dislocacio es precedent deves le dos de la ma, lahoras sia la posicio de la ma de aquel intrinicequement sobre la taula, per so que la ma del metge caja sobre aquela iminencia de la junctura.
However, it should be considered if the palm is already turned to the inside of the hand, then the patient should place the back of their hand on a table for extension and reduction; and if the dislocation is towards the back of the hand, then the position of their hand should be intrinsically on the table, so that the physician's hand falls on that prominence of the joint.

E donc si retorna tantost, bon es; e sino, lahoras strenh aquela am empastre cedant le apostema e layssa aquel; e no iteres aquo, quar sino, no soferta ni no podes sobre la reduccio de lu pus que passan a lu dias.
And if it returns immediately, it is good; if not, then tighten it with a plaster to reduce the swelling and leave it; and do not repeat this, because otherwise, it will not be tolerated nor can you attempt the reduction after days have passed.

Mays empero la junctura roman segon la sua tortuositat; e no notz al malaute alcuna causa, sino que la ma es mollificada e no pot strenher alcuna causa; lahoras sapias que les nervis son trincatz o trissatz, e lahoras no es engen en lu sino que sia strenhuda am cauteri prop le cazament de lu e fort leu aquo confereys alcuna causa.
However, the joint remains according to its distortion; and it does not harm the patient in any way, except that the hand is softened and cannot grip anything; then know that the nerves are cut or crushed, and then there is no remedy except to tighten it with cautery near its fall, and this may confer some benefit.

Donc cum malassem es retornada, lahoras pausa sobre lu empastre le qual havem recomtat, e sia layssat e strenhut per v dias; e aprop sia desliat e sia layssat e la ma de lu sia excercitada.
Therefore, when the wrist is returned, then place on it the plaster which we have described, and let it be left and tightened for 5 days; and afterwards let it be untied and left, and let the hand be exercised.

Mays si le movement de lu es ostat e accideys en lu alcuna gravitat, lahoras leniys aquela am aygua cauda e am fricacio alcunas veguadas, entro que sia alleujat.
But if its movement is impeded and some heaviness occurs in it, then soothe it with hot water and with friction sometimes, until it is relieved.

Capitol .xxix.
Chapter 29.

De la curacio de dislocacio dels ditz.
On the treatment of dislocation of the fingers.

Alcunas veguadas so dislocatz les ditz a tota partida.
Sometimes the fingers are dislocated in any direction.

E quan es dislocat alcun dit de aquels al dos de la palma o al ventre de lu, lahoras sten le dit e impelleys la dislocacio de lu am les tieus pouses, entro que retorne.
And when any of those fingers is dislocated to the back of the palm or to its inside, then extend the finger and push the dislocation with your thumbs, until it returns.

E aprop sostenta le cap del dit, e suspen aquel deves la part a la qual es dislocat, e layssa aquel per dos dias.
And afterwards support the tip of the finger, and suspend it towards the part to which it is dislocated, and leave it for two days.

E aprop suspen aquel e exten aquel entro que dreyt sia engualhat en aquel sieu dia.
And afterwards suspend it and extend it until it is straightened equally on that day.

E quan sira noyt, lia aquel segon aquela narracio, e no cesses desliar aquel en le dia e exercitar am movement, e lia aquel en la noyt; e fay aquo per alcus dias entro que sia streyt.
And when night comes, bind it according to this description, and do not cease to untie it during the day and exercise it with movement, and bind it at night; and do this for some days until it is tightened.

E fay semblant am aquo, si es dislocat al ventre de la ma, e lia aquel ad aquela partida e fay am aquo la tieua primiera operacio, entro que sia sanat.
And do similarly with this, if it is dislocated to the inside of the hand, and bind it to that part and do with this your first operation, until it is healed.

E semblantment fay am aquo quan es dislocat a las autres partidas.
And similarly do with this when it is dislocated to other parts.

Capitol .xxx.
Chapter 30

De la curacio de dislocacio dels spondils del dos.
On the treatment of dislocation of the spine vertebrae.

Quan accideys ad alcun dels spondils del dos o del col dislocacio complida, e so remaugutz motz spondils de lors locs, lahoras en aquela no es curacio, quar la mort se coyta al malaute.
When a complete dislocation occurs to any of the spine or neck vertebrae, and many vertebrae are moved from their places, then there is no cure for this, as death hastens to the patient.

E senhal de aquo es que la egestio del malaute es fora-eyssida ses voluntat, e no pot retenir aquela; e motas veguadas so mollificatz alcus membres de lu o doas cambas de lu o dos brasses de lu, o un de aquels; o es remaugut un spondil de son loc, quar motas veguadas es remaugut e motas veguadas es fayta la remocio de aquels a quatre partidas.
And a sign of this is that the patient's excretion comes out involuntarily, and they cannot retain it; and often some of their limbs are softened, or both legs, or both arms, or one of these; or a vertebra is moved from its place, for often it is moved and often the removal of these is done in four parts.

Donc aquela ja es remauguda a las partidas detras e es nompnada gelbozitat.
Therefore, this has already moved to the back parts and is called hunchback.

Mays la curacio de lu es que lahoras consideras si la gelbozitat accidey de puerissia, quar lahoras en aquela no es curacio ni de aquela no es sanacio de tot.
But its treatment is that you then consider if the hunchback occurred from childhood, for then there is no cure for it nor is there any complete healing of it.

Mays en aquela que ve per cazement o per percussio o per semblant ad aquels, ja diyssero les Antics las manieras de curacio am sermo prolixs, del qual lo mays retorna am profieyt; mays yeu ja e abreujat de aquel del qual lo pauc escusa del trop de lu, per la mieua propinquitat a la entencio mieua exposicio, am la qual he aquo expausat et format ex instrument divers de aquel am le qual mostrero aquo e espausero aquel.
But for that which comes from falling or from impact or similar to these, the Ancients have already described the methods of treatment with lengthy discourse, of which most return with benefit; but I have already abbreviated that of which little excuses too much of it, due to my proximity to my intended exposition, with which I have explained this and formed from diverse instruments with which they showed this and explained it.

E dic que en gelbosita que accideys de la partida denant en le pietz, no es engen ni sanacio de aquela; e semblantment en aquela que es fayta a dos latz.
And I say that for hunchback that occurs in the front part in the chest, there is no device nor healing for it; and similarly for that which is made on two sides.

E de aquelas no es curada sino aquela que accideys en le dos propriament am aquo que yeu recomti.
And of these, none is cured except that which occurs in the back properly with what I recount.

E es que·l malaute sia extendut sobre la sua cara sobre pug engual prop de paret, e sia extendut dejos lu esturment molh per so que no sia lidit le pietz de lu.
And it is that the patient should be extended on their face on a level hill near a wall, and a soft instrument should be extended under them so that their chest is not injured.

E aprop un fust dreyt sia pausat, ficat en la terra en la extremitat del pug entorn le cap de lu, e autra fust en aviro les pes de lu en l’autra extremitat del pueg.
And after, a straight beam should be placed, fixed in the ground at the edge of the hill around their head, and another beam around their feet at the other edge of the hill.

E·l ministre tengua le fust, e no sia fermat en fossa; e autre ministre tengua l’autre segon aquela forma.
And the minister should hold the beam, and it should not be fixed in a pit; and another minister should hold the other in the same way.

E aprop envolopa sobre le cap del malaute e dejos les titillic liamen leon ferm; e exten la extremitat del liamel al fust le qual es deves le cap de lu, e lia aquel en lu; e aprop strenh l’autre liament sobre las ancas de lu les denols de lu, e deves las cambas de lu; e aprop ajusta totz les liamentz e lia aquels en l’autre fust le qual es deves les pes de lu.
And after, wrap a firm lion binding over the patient's head and under the armpits; and extend the end of the binding to the beam which is towards their head, and tie it to it; and after tighten the other binding over their hips, their knees, and towards their legs; and after join all the bindings and tie them to the other beam which is towards their feet.

E aprop le ministre cascu extenda le liament a la partida del fust, e no sian remaugutz les dos fustz e les liamentz dels sieus locs en les quals son ficatz, mays empero no so fermatz ayssi cum havem dit.
And after, each minister should extend the binding to the part of the beam, and the two beams and the bindings should not be moved from their places in which they are fixed, but however they are not fastened as we have said.

E le metge pause las suas palmas sobre le spondil am fortaleza entro que retorne, o que pause sobre aquela una taula, e aprop que ajuste sobre la taula les sieus pes entro que retorne.
And the doctor should place his palms on the vertebra with strength until it returns, or place a board over it, and after that add his feet on the board until it returns.

Mays si no retorna per aquesta forma, lahoras pren una taula de la qual la latitut o la longitut sia en aviro de tres brassas, e cava en la paret de la qual havem dit que es prop le malaute un loc en le qual intre la extremitat de la taula.
But if it does not return by this method, then take a board of which the width or length is about three arms' length, and carve in the wall which we said is near the patient a place in which the end of the board enters.

E aprop pausa la maytat de la taula sobre le spondilh, e·l metge pause les sieus pes sobre l’autre extremitat, e estrenha be entro que le spondil sia coartat e que retorne al sieu loc.
And after, place half of the board on the vertebra, and the doctor should place his feet on the other end, and press well until the vertebra is constrained and returns to its place.

E si tu voles, obre am torn le qual es revolvut am la ma; e es que tu fiques en terra deves le cap del malaute en le derier del pug dos fustz, la longitut dels quals sia d’un bras, e deves le cap de lu en le derier del pug eyssament dos fustz; e sia la longitut que es entre quascun fust un palm, e ja es fayt en quascun fust trauc en le qual corr torn, e quascun sia mot fermat en terra per so que no sia maugut.
And if you wish, work with a lathe which is turned by hand; and it is that you fix in the ground towards the patient's head at the back of the hill two beams, the length of which should be one arm's length, and towards their head at the back of the hill likewise two beams; and let the length between each beam be one palm, and already made in each beam a hole in which the lathe runs, and each should be very firmly fixed in the ground so that it is not moved.

E sia mes un fust redon en le qual es le torn, e sia revolvut en les dos traucs dels dos fustz.
And let a round beam be placed in which is the lathe, and let it be revolved in the two holes of the two beams.

E en la extremitat de lu es un trauc en le qual es format le fust, la longueza del qual es un palm am aquo que es revolvut; e en les dos autres fustz es semblant de aquel.
And at the extremity of it is a hole in which the shaft is formed, the length of which is a palm with that which is revolved; and in the two other shafts it is similar to that one.

E aprop strenh les liamentz que has streyt en le pietz del malaute en le trau le qual es deves le cap de lu, e les liamentz que has streyts en las coyssas de lu en le torn le qual es deves les pes de lu.
And after, tighten the bindings that you have tightened on the chest of the patient in the hole which is towards the head of it, and the bindings that you have tightened on the thighs of it in the turn which is towards the feet of it.

E aprop deves quascun torn e stia un ministre que torssa le torn am la sua ma, e le metge engualhe le spondil segon que havem dit.
And after each turn, let a minister stand who twists the turn with his hand, and the doctor aligns the spine as we have said.

E aquesta es la forma del torn:
And this is the form of the turn:

E aprop pus que le spondil es retornat, e le loc es engualhat, lahoras cove que pauses empastre exciccatiu am album de huou, e aprop estopa; e aprop pause sobre le empastre astela de taula de la qual la latitut sia de tres ditz o enviro aquels, e la longitut de lu sia quantitat que prengua le loc de la gelbositat, e sobre la partida del spondil sa.
And after the spine is returned, and the place is aligned, then it is appropriate that you place a drying plaster with egg white, and after that, tow; and after place over the plaster a splint of board of which the width is three fingers or thereabouts, and the length of it is a quantity that covers the place of the hump, and over the healthy part of the spine.

E aprop sia liat am liament le qual havem dit, e uze le malaute de nutriment subtil entro que sia sanat.
And after it is bound with a binding which we have mentioned, and let the patient use subtle nourishment until he is healed.

E si roman alcuna iminencia en le loc en la fi de la sanacio, lahoras cove que sian aministradas medicinas que moilifico e liniscan am aministracio de la taula per lonc temps, la qual havem recomtada; e ja es aministrada en aquel loc lamina de plom.
And if some protrusion remains in the place at the end of the healing, then it is appropriate that medicines are administered that soften and smooth with the administration of the board for a long time, which we have recounted; and a lead plate has already been administered in that place.

E alcunas veguadas accideys imminencia en le derier dels spondils del dos, e es cujat per aquela dislocacio; e es aquel os le qual ja imineys per que no cove que sia fayta prosompcio a lu am aquesta medicina, quar fort leu fara a tu accidir mort.
And sometimes a protrusion occurs in the back of the spine, and it is thought to be a dislocation; and it is that bone which already protrudes because it is not appropriate that a presumption be made to it with this medicine, for it will very easily cause death to you.

Capitol .xxxi.
Chapter 31.

De curacio de anca dislocada.
On the cure of a dislocated hip.

Sapias que la junctura del ancha e la junctura del muscle no endeve sino dislocacio tant solament, e no accideys ad aquelas aquo que accideys a las autras juncturas de petita remocio e concavitat.
Know that the joint of the hip and the joint of the shoulder only suffer dislocation, and that which happens to the other joints of small removal and concavity does not happen to them.

E la junctura de la ancha es dislocada segon quatre manieyras, quar es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, o a las partidas defora, o a las partidas denant, o a las partidas detras.
And the joint of the hip is dislocated in four ways, for it is dislocated to the inner parts, or to the outer parts, or to the front parts, or to the back parts.

E majorment es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, e pauc a las partidas denant o a las partidas detras.
And mostly it is dislocated to the inner parts, and little to the front parts or to the back parts.

E senhal de la dislocacio de lu a las partidas de dintz es quar, quan tu ajustas la camba del malaute sana am la malaute, es pus longua e·l denolh es pus heminent que de la sana, e·l malaute no pot doblar le sieu pe deves le lenguonar, e es le loc que siec le lengonar apostemat de apostema caut, per so que·l cap de la coyssa ja es pervengut aqui.
And the sign of its dislocation to the inner parts is that, when you join the healthy leg of the patient with the sick one, it is longer and the knee is more prominent than that of the healthy one, and the patient cannot bend his foot towards the groin, and the place that follows the groin is swollen with a hot swelling, because the head of the thigh has already arrived there.

E·l senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio es a las partidas defora, es que les accidentz de lu so contraris ad aquest accident.
And the sign of one to whom dislocation occurs to the outer parts, is that his symptoms are contrary to this symptom.

E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas denant es quar expan la camba sieua segon compliment, mays empero no dobla aquela ses dolor que es en le denol, e si se perforsa ad anar e no pot sobre aquo a las partidas denant; e la urina de lu es retenguda e l’engonar de lu es apostemat, e deves la ambulacio de lu sobre le talo.
And the sign of one to whom dislocation occurs to the front parts is that he extends his leg completely, but however he does not bend it without pain that is in the knee, and if he forces himself to walk he cannot do so to the front parts; and his urine is retained and his groin is swollen, and his walking is on the heel.

E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas detras es que no expande le denol, ni no puesca doblar aquel denant que doble le engonar, e la camba de lu es pus breva que l’autra, e l’engonar es mollificat, e·l cap de la coyssa es deves aquel loc.
And the sign of one to whom dislocation occurs to the back parts is that he does not extend the knee, nor can he bend it before he bends the groin, and his leg is shorter than the other, and the groin is softened, and the head of the thigh is towards that place.

Mays reduccio de las specias de aquesta dislocacio es que tu consideras, lahoras, si la dislocacio es vetusta et antiqua, que ja es anticada am le havent aquela aprop tu aministras reduccio de lu e roman segon la sua disposicio, lahoras no es en aquela curacio de tot; e adonc no cove que en aquela sia fayta prosompcio.
But the reduction of the types of this dislocation is that you consider, then, if the dislocation is old and ancient, that it has already settled with the one having it after you administer its reduction and it remains according to its disposition, then there is no cure for it at all; and then it is not appropriate that a presumption be made in it.

Mays en aquel del qual la dislocacio es recent, e es una de las quatre specias de dislocacio, lahoras te coyta ad aquo que volvas la junctura e extendas aquela a las partidas dedintz e a las partidas defora, e mau aquela a la dextra e sinistra, quar fort leu retorna e no indigeys de autra cura.
But in one whose dislocation is recent, and is one of the four types of dislocation, then hurry to turn the joint and extend it to the inner parts and to the outer parts, and move it to the right and left, for it will very easily return and you will not need another cure.

Mays, si no retorna en aquesta manieyra, lahoras cove que tu prepares ministre fort e extendas la camba de lu de la partida pus dejos, o am las suas mas, o am liament lo qual es liat sobre la camba desus le denol; e autre ministre extenda la ma de aquel desus enayssi que meta las suas mas dejos les titillics de lu; e aprop strenha am liament leon sobre la razit de la coyssa, e tengua autre ministre ters le extremitat del liament.
But, if it does not return in this manner, then it is necessary that you prepare a strong assistant and extend the leg of the patient from the lower part, either with his hands or with a bandage which is tied above the knee; and another assistant extends the hand of that person above so that he puts his hands below the patient's armpits; and afterwards tighten with a lion bandage above the root of the thigh, and let another third assistant hold the end of the bandage.

E sia extencio de lu o de la partida dedintz a l’angonar a la partida de la furcula, o de la partida detras a la partida del dos.
And let the extension be of him or of the inner part to the groin to the part of the collarbone, or from the back part to the part of the back.

E sia la extencio de totz aquels en una veguada entro que·l malaute sia elevat am le sieu cos de terra e que romangua pendent.
And let the extension of all these be at once until the patient is raised with his body from the ground and remains suspended.

E aquesta specia de extencio es specia cominal a totas quatre.
And this kind of extension is a common kind for all four.

E donc si la dislocacio retorna am aquo que havem dit, sira bo; e sino, lahoras es necessari a tota specia aquo que dire de la propria curacio.
And then if the dislocation returns with what we have said, it will be good; and if not, then it is necessary for every kind what I will say about the proper cure.

En la reduccio de lu propria, quan es dislocada, e la dislocacio es a las partidas dedintz, cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu latz sa; e aprop pausa les liamentz sobre la razit de la coyssa en aquel loc le qual entre le cap de la coyssa e·l loc que es dejos le langonar; e aprop exten le liament en sus de la part del angonar a la pus auta partida de la furcula.
In the proper reduction of it, when it is dislocated, and the dislocation is to the inner parts, it is necessary that the patient be laid on his healthy side; and afterwards place the bandages on the root of the thigh in that place which is between the head of the thigh and the place that is below the groin; and afterwards extend the bandage upwards from the part of the groin to the highest part of the collarbone.

E aprop autre ministre fort prengua les brasses de lu, e amerme le loc gros de la coyssa malaute e extenda a las partidas deforo per extencio vehement, quar aquela retorna en le sieu loc.
And afterwards another strong assistant should take his arms, and reduce the thick place of the sick thigh and extend to the outer parts by vehement extension, for that returns to its place.

E aquesta specia es de pus leugiera curacio am la qual aquest membre es reduzit que las autres specias.
And this kind is of easier cure with which this member is reduced than the other kinds.

Mays si es excusat sobre tu e no obezeys al entrament am aquesta specia de curacio de tot, lahoras cove que sian liatz les dos pes del malaute ensemps am liament fort, leugier, sobre amdos les talos e amdos les denols.
But if it is excused upon you and does not obey the entry with this kind of cure at all, then it is necessary that the two feet of the patient be tied together with a strong, light bandage, over both ankles and both knees.

E sia la longitut de quascun de son par la quantitat de quatre ditz, e sia la camba malaute extenduda mays que l’autre per quantitat de dos ditz.
And let the length of each from its pair be the quantity of four fingers, and let the sick leg be extended more than the other by the quantity of two fingers.

E aprop le malaute sia suspendut sobre le cap del fust, e que sia en la mayso; e sia la longitut de lu de la terra la quantitat de dos brasses.
And afterwards let the patient be suspended over the head of the wood, and let it be in the house; and let the length of him from the ground be the quantity of two arms.

E aprop comanda a un jove fort que minuesca le cap de la coyssa, e sia suspendut am le malaute autre jove, e l’autre jove minuent la coysa am fortaleza empellesca, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.
And afterwards command a strong young man to decrease the head of the thigh, and let another young man be suspended with the patient, and the other young man decreasing the thigh with strength push, for the joint returns to its place with speed.

Mays en la reducio propria, quan es dislocacio a la partida defora, cove que·l malaute jaga sobre pug segon que havem recomtat en le havent gelbozitat; e sia strenhut le liament sobre la camba malauta propriament e sobre le pietz de lu.
But in the proper reduction, when the dislocation is to the outer part, it is necessary that the patient lie on a hill as we have recounted in the one having a hump; and let the bandage be tightened over the sick leg properly and over his chest.

E aprop dos fustz sian pausatz, la un als pes de lu, e l’autre al cap; e aprop sian pausatz fustz ajustatz al mieg del pueg ficat sobre·l qual draps humitz sian envolopatz, per so que·l malaute no sia dampnajat per que·l fust sia entre las coyssas de lu, per que deves la extencio a las partidas dejos no sia atirat.
And afterwards two woods should be placed, one at his feet, and the other at his head; and afterwards let joined woods be placed in the middle of the hill fixed on which wet clothes are wrapped, so that the patient is not damaged because the wood is between his thighs, so that towards the extension to the lower parts it is not attracted.

E aprop quascun ministre extenda a la sua part, e·l metge am la sua ma enguala la reduccio segon l’art.
And afterwards let each assistant extend to his part, and the doctor with his hand equalizes the reduction according to the art.

Donc, si obezeys a revercio, sira bo grandament; e sino, pausa sobre aquela diligentment e ayssi quo havem dit en gelbozitat per aquela engualment.
Then, if it obeys to reversion, it will be greatly good; and if not, place on it diligently and thus as we have said in humpback for that equally.

Mays cove que·l malaute jagua sobre les sieus latz sa quetament.
But it is necessary that the patient lie on his healthy sides quietly.

E quan la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras cove que la camba sia extenduda leugierament, e es segon aquesta meteyssa narracio sobre pueg; e le metge pause la palma de la sua ma dreyta sobre·l langonar malaute, e aprop coarte aquel am l’autra ma, e am aquela coartacio pausa aquel extendut a las partidas dejos a la partida del denol.
And when the dislocation is to the front parts, then it is necessary that the leg be extended lightly, and it is according to this same narration on a hill; and the doctor places the palm of his right hand over the sick groin, and afterwards constrains it with the other hand, and with that constraint places that extended to the lower parts to the part of the knee.

E si la dislocacio es a las partidas detras, lahoras no cove que·l malaute sia extendut a las partidas dejos, e es elevat sobre la terra; habantz cove que sia pausat sobre causa dura, ayssi cum cove le eyssament si l’ancha de lu es dislocada a las partidas defora, segon aquo que havem dit del jasement de lu sobre dos anchas; e es sobre la sua cara e les liamentz sian extendutz, segon que havem dit, no ha guayre.
And if the dislocation is to the back parts, then it is not necessary that the patient be extended to the lower parts, and is raised from the ground; rather it is necessary that he be placed on a hard thing, as it is necessary the same if his hip is dislocated to the outer parts, according to what we have said of his lying on two hips; and it is on his face and the bandages are extended, as we have said, not long ago.

E cove que sia aministrada compressio am taula sobre le loc al qual yeys la junctura.
And it is necessary that compression be administered with a board over the place where the joint protrudes.

Donc cum la reducio es complida segon que cove — e·l senhal de la reduccio de lu no es amaguat a tu, e es que tu extendas del malaute doas cambas, e quan tu vezes aquelas enguals e le malaute extrenh la sieua camba e expandeys aquela ses excusacio, lahoras sapias que·l membre segon que cove es retornat — e lahoras tu ajusta doas coyssas e pausa empastre e extrenh am benda ayssi que la ancha no sia mauguda en alcuna de las partidas; e adheresca le malaute a repaus per tres dias o per quatre.
Therefore, when the reduction is completed as it should be — and the sign of its reduction is not hidden from you, and it is that you extend the patient's two legs, and when you see them equal and the patient stretches his leg and expands it without excuse, then know that the limb has returned as it should — and then you join the two thighs and apply a plaster and tighten with a bandage so that the hip is not moved in any of the parts; and the patient should adhere to rest for three or four days.

E aprop deslia le liament e l’empastre, e compara la una camba am l’autra.
And afterward, untie the binding and the plaster, and compare one leg with the other.

Lahoras, si vezas aquelas enguals en vustament, lahoras sapias que la dislocacio ja es fermada, e adonc layssa le malaute anar.
Then, if you see them equal in appearance, then know that the dislocation is already fixed, and then let the patient go.

E si vezas alcuna causa de mollificacio, lahoras tu retorna e emplastra aquel, e extrenh aquel segon la tua primiera strectura, e layssa aquel en tres dias.
And if you see any sign of softening, then you return and plaster it, and tighten it according to your first tightening, and leave it for three days.

E aprop deslia aquel, e fay aquel tardar en ambulacio sobre quascu per alcus dias, entro que sia confortat.
And afterward untie it, and make him delay in walking on each for some days, until it is strengthened.

Capitol .xxxii.
Chapter 32.

De curacio de dislocacio del denolh.
On the cure of dislocation of the knee.

Le denolh es dislocat segon tres manieyras, quar es dislocat a las partidas defora, e a las partidas dedintz, e a las partidas dejos mays a las partidas detras; e a las partidas denant no es dislocat.
The knee is dislocated in three ways, for it is dislocated to the outer parts, and to the inner parts, and to the lower parts but to the back parts; and to the front parts it is not dislocated.

E le senhal de dislocacio de lu es que comandes al malaute que aplique la sua camba am la coyssa; lahoras sapias que·l denol es dislocat.
And the sign of its dislocation is that you command the patient to apply his leg with the thigh; then know that the knee is dislocated.

E la restauracio de totas las manieyras de lu es que fassas cezer le malaute dreyt, enayssi que ja extenda la sieua camba, si pot sobre aquo; adherir le tieu dos a la cara de lu, e pausa le pe de lu entre les tieus pes; e aprop fay adherir le denol de lu am las tuas palmas, e rete aquelas entre les tieus ditz sobre le denolh de lu am fortaleza, e autre ministre extenda le sieu pe entro que·l denol retorne a son loc.
And the restoration of all its manners is that you make the patient sit upright, so that he extends his leg, if he can do so; adhere your back to his face, and place his foot between your feet; and afterward make his knee adhere with your palms, and hold them between your fingers over his knee with strength, and another minister extends his foot until the knee returns to its place.

E senhal de reddicio de lu es que la sua camba adharesca am la coyssa am levitat no-laboroza.
And the sign of its reduction is that his leg adheres to the thigh with effortless lightness.

E aprop emplastra aquel e fay adhirir la camba am la coyssa, e aprop lia aquelas emsemps am una benda per tres dias o per quatre, e aprop deslia aquelas.
And afterward plaster it and make the leg adhere to the thigh, and afterward tie them together with a bandage for three or four days, and afterward untie them.

E no uze le malaute de ambulacio per alcus dias, entro que sia sanat e cofortat.
And the patient should not use walking for some days, until it is healed and strengthened.

Mays si la reduccio de lu a tu es excusada, lahoras aministra fort extencio am liamentz dels quals en la curacio de la hancha precedit narracio.
But if its reduction is excused to you, then administer strong extension with bindings of which in the cure of the hip preceded narration.

Capitol .xxxiii.
Chapter 33.

De la curacio de la dislocacio del talo.
On the cure of the dislocation of the ankle.
