Le talo alcunas veguadas es remaugut per petita remocio, e alcunas veguadas es dislocat segon compliment, e la dislocacio de lu es fayta o a las partidas dedintz o a las partidas deforo.
The ankle sometimes is moved by small movement, and sometimes is dislocated completely, and its dislocation is made either to the inner parts or to the outer parts.

E le senhal de la dislocacio de lu es que vezes le talo imflat procedent a la partida a la qual es dislocat.
And the sign of its dislocation is that you see the ankle swollen proceeding to the part to which it is dislocated.

Mays la curacio de la remocio de lu es de leugiera reddicio, e es que sia extendut am facilitat am las mas e sia engualhat entro que retorne.
But the cure of its removal is of easy reduction, and it is that it be extended with ease with the hands and be equalized until it returns.

Mays en la curacio de lu quan es dislocat segon compliment, cove que fasses cezer le malaute dreyt, e tengua aquel un ministre fort e valent de la partida detras del dos de aquel en le mieg loc de lu.
But in its cure when it is completely dislocated, it is necessary that you make the patient sit upright, and a strong and valiant minister holds him from the back part of his back in the middle place of it.

E aprop te tu am la tieua ma dreyta le pe de la pus sobirana part, e am la tua ma sinistra de la part pus dejos del pe en le loc de la cavilha.
And afterward you hold with your right hand the foot from the uppermost part, and with your left hand from the lower part of the foot in the place of the ankle.

E aprop atira le pe a tu am la tua ma dreyta, e aprop am la sinistra per dos veguadas, e aprop exten am la sinistra; e empelleys le pietz del pe am la dreyta deves la camba ses trebalh.
And afterward pull the foot to you with your right hand, and afterward with the left for two times, and afterward extend with the left; and push the chest of the foot with the right towards the leg without effort.

E fay aquo doas veguadas segon que havem comtat.
And do this twice as we have counted.

E aprop empelleys le pietz del pe a la camba la tersa veguada, e tu es a la cavilha.
And afterward push the chest of the foot to the leg the third time, and you are at the ankle.

Donc si retorna en una veguada o en dos segon aquesta manieyra, e si vezes le pe engualhat, es bo; e sino, lahoras sobre lu itera la operacio, quar aquel retorna.
Therefore it returns in one or two times according to this manner, and if you see the foot evened out, it is good; and if not, then repeat the operation on it, for it will return.

Mays si a tu es prohibida la reduccio de lu am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu dos sobre terra, e estrenh un paysel mot en terra fermat, e que caja entre las coyssas de lu, e tu ja has envolopat sobre lu drap per so que no ledesca le malaute.
But if the reduction is prohibited to you with what we have recounted, then make the patient lie on his back on the ground, and fasten a stake firmly in the ground, and let it fall between his thighs, and you have already wrapped a cloth over him so that it does not hurt the patient.

E aprop le ministre de lu tengua las suas coyssas, e aprop autre ministre extenda le pe am las suas mas o am liament que lie sobre le col del pe; e aprop extenda aquel quascun ministre contre extencio del sieu par, e le payssel sia extant entre las coyssas del malaute retinent aquel, per so que·l cos de lu no sia atirat a las partidas dejos deves la sua extencio.
And after, the minister of him should hold his thighs, and after another minister should extend the foot with his hands or with a binding that ties over the neck of the foot; and after extend each minister against the extension of his partner, and the stake should be standing between the thighs of the patient retaining him, so that his body is not drawn to the lower parts towards his extension.

E aprop le metge enguala la dislocacio am las sieuas mas, e autre ministre tengua la coyssa sana a las partidas dejos, quar la dislocacio retorna am la facilitat.
And after the doctor evens out the dislocation with his hands, and another minister holds the healthy thigh to the lower parts, for the dislocation returns with ease.

E donc cum retorna la dislocacio e es declarada a tu la sanetat de la reduccio de lu, lahoras pausa emplastre e extrenh aquela am liamentz fortment, e ligua le pe am liament a la camba.
And therefore when the dislocation returns and the health of its reduction is declared to you, then place a plaster and tighten it with bindings strongly, and tie the foot with a binding to the leg.

E cove que temes o te guardes dels nervis les quals so detras sobre le talo, per que le liament sobre aquel no sia vehement e leda aquel fortment.
And it is advisable that you fear or guard against the nerves which are behind on the heel, so that the binding on it is not violent and hurts it strongly.

E aprop layssa aquel per dos dias o per tres; e si le liament es mollificat, extrenh aquel.
And after leave that for two days or for three; and if the binding is softened, tighten it.

E aprop deslia aquel en le ters dia o en le quart, e prohibeys le malaute de anament per xl dias.
And after untie that on the third day or on the fourth, and prohibit the patient from walking for 40 days.

Mays si es forsat de anar denant aquel spazi, no es fayta segurtat que la dislocacio no sia sobre lu dissolvuda e corrumpuda, e aprop aquo que no recipia curacio.
But if he is forced to walk before that time, there is no assurance that the dislocation will not be dissolved and corrupted on him, and after that it will not receive healing.

E si accideys a lu apostema caut, lahoras cove que tu aministre en la cedacio de lu aquo en lo qual precedic la nostra narracio, en autre loc de curacio e de embrocacio, entro que sia remauguda.
And if a hot abscess happens to him, then it is advisable that you administer in its soothing that which preceded our narration, in another place of healing and of embrocation, until it is removed.

Capitol .xxxiiii.
Chapter 34.

De curacio de dislocacio dels ditz dels pes.
On the healing of dislocation of the toes.

Cove que aquel qu’es dislocat sia engualhat am pauca extencio ses trebal; e aquo que no es dificil, abantz es leugier.
It is advisable that that which is dislocated be evened out with little extension without trouble; and that which is not difficult, but is light.

Mays si la dislocacio es en alcus nozes del dos del pe, lahoras cove que fassas cezer le malaute le sieu pe sobre loc engual de la terra o sobre taula, e sia estant ayssi cum si anava.
But if the dislocation is in some joints of the back of the foot, then it is advisable that you make the patient sit his foot on an even place on the ground or on a table, and be standing as if he were walking.

E aprop tu sta de pes, e pausa le tieu pe sobre aquo que imineys de las juncturas, e aprop calca aquel am le tieu pe am vertut entro que retorne, e que vejas aquel ja engualhat e no aparesca en le loc eminencia.
And after you stand on foot, and place your foot on that which protrudes from the joints, and after press that with your foot with strength until it returns, and that you see that already evened out and no protrusion appears in the place.

E aprop pausa dejos le ventre del pe de lu una taula que prengua tot le pe, a la qual sian dos caps, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent e ferma per tres dias; e aprop deslia aquel e fay aquel repausar de ambulacio per motz dias, entro que sia estrenhut e de reddicio sia assegurat.
And after place under the sole of his foot a board that takes all the foot, to which are two ends, and after tighten that with decent and firm tightening for three days; and after untie that and make him rest from walking for many days, until it is tightened and assured of return.

Capitol .xxxv.
Chapter 35.

De las specias de dislocacio que sian faytas am plagua o am fractura o am quascuna ensemps.
On the types of dislocations that are made with wounds or with fractures or with both together.

Quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, e tu te perforssas en la curacio de aquela e en la restauracio de lu, motas veguadas succezeys la mort.
When any of these things happens, and you strive in the cure of it and in the restoration of it, many times death follows.

E per aquo no cove que sobre la curacio de lu presuma, sino aquel que es savi en l’art, de lonc uzatge, misericordios e pietados, tardiu, no-ardit ni presomptuos; e que use en le comensament de medicinas que cedan apostemas cautz tant solament, e leyssa le malaute al divinal jutgament, sino ad aquel al qual speras salut de perdicio, am de la malautia alleviacio, e en la qual appareys alcuna speransa.
And for this reason it is not advisable that anyone presume to cure it, except one who is wise in the art, of long experience, merciful and compassionate, cautious, not bold nor presumptuous; and who uses in the beginning medicines that only reduce hot swellings, and leaves the patient to divine judgment, except for those for whom you hope for salvation from perdition, with alleviation of the illness, and in which appears some hope.

E adonc esforsa te tantost far de lu la reduccio en le comensament de la causa, denant que endevengua apostema caut.
And then strive immediately to make the reduction of it at the beginning of the matter, before a hot swelling occurs.

E adonc si le membre retorna segon que volem, lahoras aministra regiment le qual ceda apostema caut e cura la plagua am aquo que conveneys a lu dels enguentz desiccatius.
And then if the limb returns as we want, then administer a regimen which reduces hot swelling and cure the wound with what is suitable for it from the drying ointments.

E si dislocacio es am fractura e accideys en le os satagias separadas, lahoras tu perforsa le stement de lor, e fay en aquo so que havem dit en las malautias simplas de aquo que es precedit en les locz de aquels.
And if dislocation is with fracture and occurs in the bone with separate fragments, then you strive for their alignment, and do in this what we have said in simple illnesses about what has preceded in their places.

E guarda e esquiva segon la tua vertut aquel del intrament en las vias de temor segon que a tu es precedida la mia predicacio; quar aquo es milhor a tu deves le tieu Creator, e mays permanent a la tua gloria, e mays saludos al tieu cos verays aquels en le tieu temps.
And guard and avoid according to your virtue that of entering into ways of fear according to what has preceded my preaching to you; for this is better for you towards your Creator, and more permanent to your glory, and more salutary to your body truly those in your time.

Ayssi fineysso las paraulas de Albucasim perfieytament de las quals Dieus ne sia benezeyt.
Here end the words of Albucasim perfectly of which God be blessed.

Amen.
Amen.
